text:
All the food we had was spectacularly....meh. Nothing was horrible, but nothing was even above ordinary from what you'd find at most italian chains. We had the spaghetti bolognese and chicken parm. 
Our waiter was beyond terrible though. It wasn't one specific thing, just a lot of little things that added up to a poor experience. 
The bus boy/bread deliverer/water guy was great, and that's the only thing I can say positively about the place. At these prices, we definitely won't be back.

Best Italian food I have had in a while. Rigatoni Allan vodka was very good. Good service. The only thing I didn't like was the music. On occasion the music went to 80s death love depressing ballads that kind of slowed down the vibe.
Great service, wonderful desserts. My veal osso Bucco was good, lasagna was great! Enjoyed our experience

We had our holiday luncheon there this past week. It was a hit with all of us. Bryan Forgionne,the executive chef, is incredible. My boss has not stopped talking about the good food and service.  I highly recommend checking it out.

From beginning to end, the food and service was amazing. The live band was good as well. The Caesar salad was great! The croutons were hot and soft...and so good. Definitely coming back here in the future.

Amazing meal! Went for husbands 50th bday. When I booked the reservation I asked for a table with a view. Got a fantastic table with a great view. Georgio was the best server, great personality, lots of advice. 

Will definitely go back!

Lisa
The lasagna is very good, and you must try the Italian birthday cake.  It is expensive, but service was good.

Our server was very attentive and explained the menu in detail. We ordered eggplant parm and grilled octopus. The octopus was tender and flavorful. The eggplant was just bland. Atmosphere was nice and we enjoyed our dinner there.

Well to begin with the restaurant was almost empty at lunchtime so not only was there no wait time but also we got a table with a view. 
My husband and I decided to share an antipasto and a pasta. We started with Grandma's Meatballs. I typically don't like red sauce or meatballs but this was soo soo good. 
Then came Nona's Lasagna Al Forgo. They gave it to us in 2 separate dishes which made it a lot easier to share. The portion size was extremely generous especially for lunch. But we felt that it was very similar in taste to Grandma's Meatballs. Maybe ordering similar sauce dishes wasn't the right decision.

We went to Buddy V's on our last night in Vegas recently and had a great meal and terrific service.  Our server was Melissa - she was right on with her recommendations and clarifying portion sizes (we were trying to avoid leftovers).  The two team members working with her (unfortunately, I didn't get their names) were also very attentive and friendly.  

We had the calamari appetizer and Sunday Gravy entree and both were outstanding.  Certainly enough for two to share and leave a little room for desert.  The Tiramisu has a great chocolate cake layer in the bottom which was a great surprise and very good.  We'll definitely go back.

Buddy only knows cakes and cannoli's right? Wrong! We had a great time at Buddy V's. The food was excellent and it was a really fun environment!

My wife had the egg plant parmesan for the first time and loved it! I had the Capellini shrimp scampi.

We loved it all. Even hit Carlo's Bakery on the way out. Fun night!

This place was awesome. We went about 4pm and had the sunset menu which had enough choices for us. Has the fried mozzarella appetizer which was different from normal mozzarella this had so many flavors going on. It was really good. Kids portions were big but also 12.00 a piece. Husband had chicken parm said it was good and had lots of flavors going on as well. Chicken was not dry. Had the Caesar salad was saving room for dessert. Salad was good and just the right amount. Desserts are awesome. Must have is the tiramisu the lady fingers are on the side and you dip them in the mason jar of stuff. My daughter had the apple pie it was ok not too sweet came with vanilla ice cream. Would have liked a little warmer. If your in the area would definitely try it.

BEST ITALIAN IN VEGAS!!!!
I had reservations for Friday (11/28/14) night at 6:15. They had a table for me but it was not in the main dining area. I asked to be moved to the main area but was told I would have to wait. The GM Adam came right over and asked if we could wait about 5 minutes and he personally would get find me a table. He found one for us in about 3 minutes. 

Adam spent about 5 minutes with us going over the menu with us and telling us the history of the restaurant and Buddy. After we got our drinks, Adam came buy again and was going to take our order but we told him we could wait for our server. Adam was very personable and made sure we were taken care of. Way beyond your typical GM.

Now the food, we both ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. I am Italian and am very picky about my Italian food but it was excellent!!! The best I have had in Vegas in years. We also had the awesome Buddy V's special Lobster Tail (pastry) for dessert.A MUST TRY!!!!

So sad!  We had such high hopes for this place.  We eat out a lot (in fact we are trying a new restaurant every day this winter break!)  This restaurant cannot compete with anything else nearby.  Maggiano's -fabulous, Brio - lovely, Buddy V's -meh.  We had the meatball sand and the vodka sauce pasta.  Both were bland, small and overpriced ($23 for a very small plate of pasta.). No hot bread and butter, no attentive wait staff, no one asked how are meals were, we were invisible.  Then we come to the real reason we went - the lobster tail pastry.  At $15 we were sure it would be crazy good.  It wasn't. The cream inside was luscious and the presentation was beautiful, but the pastry itself was so hard and overcooked we couldn't cut it and that made sharing difficult.  Worst of all, I left my commemorative photo of my little girl and I from  the National Geographic exhibit on the table.  When we realized this 2 hours later we rushed back to the restaurant.  They had thrown it out!  Who doesn't keep people's forgotten things for at least the rest of the day?!  A very bad $64 lunch and a sad tale to tell.
Great dinning experiene. Ask for Peter for service....great prices and value, not to mention tasty food and the best service.

This isnt SPECTACULAR Italian food but it is pretty close. We went with two 70 year olds plus a 9 & 11 yr old and everyone liked their meal. This is one of the few restaurants on the strip that actually has real windows to the outside world (no fake ceiling here) which was refreshing. A little loud in the dining room - but then is Vegas known for being quiet? 
We had:
Salumi plate- salumi was terrific, cheeses better than average, olives OK
Eggplant parm- on app menu & can be shared even though waitress said it was too small for sharing. Easily enough for 6 to share
Scallopps- not very Italian, was it bacon? too over cooked but polenta & scallopps were perfect
The lasagne was HUGE & very good.
Kids chix parm was a large sized portion and excellent. 
Chix marsala came with 3 pieces of chicken!
Ceasar Salad was tastey but way over dressed. Very soggy. Ask for less dressing.
With a bottle of wine & tip our meal for 6 was $300. Not an inexpensive night out so don't be misled by the lower $ on yelp. 

Perfect if you have a mixed crowd & need something for everyone. Can't beat the Ventitian atmosphere either.

Had reservations for 4:30 and didn't realize that they had a sunset menu, with limited choices, that was from 3pm to 5pm. With some finagling, our waiter, Michel, got us dinner entrées. We had the calamari appetizer (very good) and the garlic bread with mozzarella (very good). The fresh focaccia with olive oil and balsamic vinegar was excellent. Our entrées were rigatoni ala vodka with chicken (excellent), chicken parmigiana (excellent), and chicken marsala (excellent).  The portions were perfect. We didn't get dessert because we'd eaten at Carlo's bakery earlier in the day. Dessert menu did look good. 

I'd rate Buddy's 4.5 stars, but because of our waiter Michel, I went up to 5 stars rather than go down to 4.

I've dined at Buddy V's twice now and both times it's been consistently good for both food and service. 

My husband had the meatball sub once for lunch which was the best we've ever had and the other time he had the bone in veal parm chop which was bigger than the size of your head! The octopus and tuna caponata are also delicious and the polenta croutons on the Caesar Salad are delicious! I've never seen polenta croutons in all the Italian restaurants I've dined in. Very creative!

Dessert is also a must, I mean it is the Cake Boss' restaurant. The lobster tail is light and crispy and the tiramisu is soooo good with the chocolate cake on the bottom. 

A trip to Buddy V's is definitely a must and the food was so much better than what I had at Carnevino at a fraction of the cost!

This was my first visit to Buddy V's and it was AMAZING. The ambiance was great with really nice live music and lighting, the service was impeccable and our food was out of sight! Our server Giorgio was probably the best server I have ever had! He was so friendly and really went out of his way to take care of us and make us feel at home. We also
Got to spend some time chatting with the manager who was also excellent at his job and runs a top notch place. He even had a fabulous cake sent to our table to help us celebrate our anniversary. We had an amazing evening at Buddy V's. We would highly recommend it to anyone and we will be back soon!! Thanks Giorgio!!

Excellent service!  Food was incredible.  Location is super convenient. I had spaghetti & meatballs & hubby had meatball sandwich w parmesan fries. Everything was superb.  Highly recommend if you are in Vegas

Had chicken parm with a side of rigatoni. The chicken was dry and fair tasting. Not a great example of traditional Italian chicken parm. The rigatoni was very tasty, though could have used more sauce. Overall not a bad meal, but was expecting more from them. Pricey, but typical for Vegas.

While back in vegas I could not miss Sunday brunch at Buddy V's. Again very Impressed with everything first of all when I arrived I received a welcoming greeting by by Tiffany who does an awesome job! The food is always consistant and the QUALITY of the food amazing. The staff, EVERYONE is so HOSPITABLE and hard working. This time the GM came by to say hi and chat while I was taking photo of food.

Service, professionalism, and very rarely you find personality. Every staff and manager is the absolute  best and somehow even more. 

It all started off with an awkward menu situation, but was cleared up professionally and cheerfully by the staff and the manager going so far as to make sure we were indeed part of their family and home. 

They have effectively made our Christmas and much more. Will definitely always come back!

Horrible service. Bland food that was  ridiculously over priced for the portion size. The staff was extremely unaccommodating and unfriendly with a large group. They refused to split the check which was ridiculous. Overall it was a very disappointing experience for an establishment with Buddy's name on it. I wouldn't recommend it to friends and I will definitely not go back.

Yum! Seriously YUM! Everything including the iced tea was amazing! I have no idea what the croutons on the Cesar salad are but they are DELICIOUS! The chicken piccata, Cesar salad, and lasagna were all incredible. The prices weren't bad either.

I've been here twice now, but didn't review the first time 2 years ago.  Now 2 years on taking another family trip (2 adults, 2 kids) we wanted to try this place again as we had such a great experience the first time.  Thought this place would be a big disappointment and all hype due to him being a TV personality. But food is amazing and even better, the price is right!  Highly recommend if you want good Italian on the Strip.

First off - the food was good.  I recommend the Mac & Cheese.  It all went sideways from there.

A group of us decided to give it a try last week.  We got right in and the service was fast.  The server knew nothing about where she worked nor any details about the cake boss himself or the famous bakery across the hall.  We informed her as to who Buddy is.  Bad start for this employee we thought.

Later that night we decided to give the bakery a try and experience the famous treats we had only seen on the TV show.  We waited in the long line and ordered our treats.  After we paid, I heard some construction noise and realized that a construction person was knocking bricks off the wall some 15 feet behind us.  In fact the debris actually hit one of our guests.  In the small bakery their is a small bar to sit at, but in this case that was even closer to the construction guy.  We asked the cashier if we could sit across the hall at the Buddy V's to enjoy our treats.  She said ok but to inform the host.

We crossed the hall and asked the host if we could sit in the dining area that was in the hall, she said no that area was closed.  The restaurant was near empty and I clearly pointed out the construction mess as it was only 30 feet across the hall.  I then asked if we could sit anywhere inside to eat our already paid for treats.  She said no, I should go eat it at the bar inside the bakery.  Needless to say we left and found some tables out in the mall.  

I can not believe that the same establishment from across I the hall would treat people so negatively.  I will not return given their lack of service.  Too bad, the food was pretty good.  They really need some training as to who they work for as well as the true value of a customer.  I will never go back for that reason.

My husband & I just got back from our Vegas trip & before arriving, we had decided to go on a mission of finding the absolute best happy hour on the strip. We were staying at the Palazzo & let me tell you to not look any further!!!

The hostess enthusiastically escorted us to the sexy lounge area adjacent to the dining area.
This is not your typical "sit at the bar" experience, it's more like a "VIP club experience" with stellar views of the strip. Our super friendly waitress made our experience memorable. The food is totally authentic grandma cooking & the prosecco is a delicious brut, not sweet. The drinks were $4 & the appetizers were $5.
 Just as we couldn't drink or eat another bite, my husband was closing the tab & we quickly realized WTF are we doing turning down desert?? We are in the cake boss restaurant. As we were deciding between cannoli's or tiramisu, our adorable waitress suggested the Nutella cake with espresso ice cream. What a slice of heaven!!!!!!

As soon as the bubbly started to hit, an amazing jazz band ( The fabulous baker boys) arrived & blew us away with their great jazz/Italian hits. They were more than happy to accommodate requests. Dino, Frank, Bobby Darin, they know it!

The vibe reminded me of an old school Italian "Goodfellas" experience & because of that, 
This is my new go to spot when I am in Vegas.  : ))

We had lunch there 11/10/14 while at the Venetian for a few things before we left town. The food was 4.5 stars, but the service was 3. Our actual server was a unfriendly dud. She was not pleasant and acted as if we and the table next to us was an annoyance. The servers' assistant however, was perfect! He was very polite and friendly, he took our drink order and kept them filled as well as boxed up my leftovers. The server took our food order (Hoboken Cheesesteaks - Delish!) but a runner brought our meals from the kitchen, she stood around leaning on the servers' station while we waited for our food and ate, then she turned around as if she were offended when I declined the dessert menu, then she literally dropped our check folio on the table. Yes, I realize they are famous for desserts with Carlo's Bakery across the hall but I had 2/3 of my meal boxed up because of the generous portions, we were stuffed! I hope they split the tips with the assistants because she was awful and the young man took very good care of us the entire meal, even my hubby commented several times about her demeanor and expressed that he wished the assistant was our actual server.

Had a really good experience at Buddy V's.  Nice Italian food and truly HUGE portions.  On a Wednesday night, it was kind of like family night with a lot of kids in the room.  Speaking of kids, the kid menu portion were also huge.  As it turns out, 3 of us could have easily gotten a way with a single entree.  These were heavily cheesy meals with pasta to perfection.  

What keeps the place from being a 5 is that the actual quality wasn't that special but it's a definitely above average offering and experience

Great meal here last night. Salads were top notch, bacon Mac n Cheese excellent, and each of our three entrees was superb (the lasagna was exceptional). Not a ton of cutting edge dishes here; just classic Italian fare done right! The dessert menu is inventive and excellent- the hot Nutella cake is a winner!

Went for lunch - I would give it 3 1/2 stars.

The sauce was good, meatballs OK and service very good.

If I had to go back, I would, but I would not seek it out.
Average food, decent service. Nice setting but the grandma meatballs, chicken parmasean,  garlic bread were disappointing.

Awesome atmosphere, awesome food, awesome location. Staff was friendly but not attentive (most into gossiping with each other). 

We ordered the calamari appetiser, chicken pasta and chicken parma. Everything was delusions and the calamari is a must have, however the chicken in the pasta was quite tough as it was reheated and not freshly cooked. Pasta on the other hand was al dente. 

For dessert we got the XL Lobster tail (if you have not tried this, you are missing out on a whole new world). And the trio of donuts (good but not something I would order again).

Terrible service from the time I called the restaurant to be put on hold for 10 minutes to  make reservations to the host who answered the phone and snottingly responded, "what's this regarding?"  really? Its regarding me eating at your restaurant and paying your paycheck.  Really snotty servers and hostesses. Due to possible poor management?  Buddy V would be ashamed.  Really disappointing because the food was great....

After trying to get a table at other places, we went here. It's not that we didn't think it would be good, but didn't want to go to yet another celebrity-associated restaurant. Enough with the names and prices to go with it. We were pleasantly surprised at how much we enjoyed it. 

There was a wait at 8pm on a Sunday night, so reservations help. We were told the wait would be an hour. We made reservations on-line and only waited 25 minuets! 

The decor is nice-- the ceiling light fixtures are cool. Big whisk attachments-cool use for them. They have an open kitchen and it smells wonderful. Lots of red and dark wood, feels very comfortable. 

We ordered a Caesar salad, garlic bread and panzenella salad to start. The Caesar salad was the best I've had in a long time. Very garlicky, croutons that were warm, soft with a little crunch and a hint of fennel in the salad.  Just the perfect amount of fresh Parmesan cheese. The panzenella was delicious with the same lovely bread, fresh tomatoes and a great dressing. The garlic bread was cheesy, dense and delicious. Just like you imagine good garlic cheese bread should be. 

For dinner, we ordered the spaghetti Bolognese ( for the little one), lasagna, and the Sunday Gravy. The little one wanted lasagna instead, so I traded with him. The kids' spaghetti was plenty for an adult ( I left half of it at that) and incredible. Some of the best I've had that I can remember. The lasagna, although expensive for what it is, was equally delicious. Baked in a cast-iron pan, it was warm, gooey and delicious, with a light tomato sauce on top. The Sunday Gravy was good, but he agreed that  the Bolognese and lasagna were infinitely better. 

We didn't order dessert, but those around us who ordered got cannoli, which looked fantastic. By the way, Carlo's Bakery is across from Buddy V's if you want something for later. 

We would definitely go back and definitely recommend!

I was really surprised. I thought it would rely in its name to generate business. First thing is the service was excellent. Drinks were never empty and servers were friendly and prompt. The food was very good too. My son had Mac and cheese and said it was the best he's ever had. I had an Italian sub and Caesar Salad and both were delicious. We didn't have dessert but from what we saw that was probably a mistake. I'll definitely be back next time in Vegas.

Wasn't sure where to eat with my husband and two young teen daughters buy took a chance.  This food reminded me of my great grand mother's table.  Meatballs were authentic and loved the veal Marsala.  My girls had the kids chicken parm with was perfect.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.  We finished with cupcakes from the Carlos' Bakery for the girls.
great service, great food, great experience, great ambiance, even general manger stopped by to say hello and check on us.

Brunch was great! My friend and I did the bottomless drinks & buffet brunch. You can mix and match from a few choices of drinks for $14.99. There was a variety of food offerings and it was all pretty good! I will definitely be back! Service was great. Our server was awesome and informative. The manager Emily at the time was great too! She saw us waiting at the meat station and immediately went to help us and another server went to cut up meat and serve us. Great service great food! The entire staff was helpful and friendly. Came here just because I loved watching Cake Boss but my expectations were surpassed!  Try the mac & cheese and chicken parm... don't pass on the Canola! Thanks to our server Freddy...he was the best!
I was very impressed. Great food and good service. I ordered the Spaghetti Central, had a great flavor to it. Also the fresh bread was a great addition to the meal.

What a wonderful experience! The veal Marsala melted in my mouth and I mopped up all of the sauce with the perfectly cooked spaghetti it came with. The lobster tail for dessert was amazing! The filling was perfect and held together by a perfect, flaky pastry. Our waiter Rocco was more than accommodating with my multitude of requests and questions - always responding with a pleasant smile and great attitude. Thank you Buddy Vs! We will be back.

My husband and I had brunch on Sunday and it was one of the best brunches we have ever been to in Vegas.  The brunch price was fair $32.95 and then for $14.95 you could have unlimited mix and match drinks from a good selection of adult beverages.

The brunch had quite a few items from the menu and everything was exceptional.

Also the wait staff were really fantastic.  Everyone was friendly and ready  to help in any way.  Dirty plates were removed quickly.

We live in Henderson so we don't usually go to the strip but we will be going back to brunch in the near future.

The staff has their job down to a science and that makes for a very smooth flowing dinner; never had to wait for anything. 
Meatball app was good- perhaps too much for two people. 
Chick parm was decent- not used to baked chick parm. Substituted spaghetti for rigatoni w/ meat sauce. Good flavor.

This place is a must eat has to be the best Italian restaurant is Vegas if the not best overall. The service and environment are second to none. From the time we walked up to the hostess stand to the time we paid we felt we were the the most important customers there and they were quite busy. The food, was absolute amazing the best Italian food I have ever eat. Our waiter was the most patient caring and professional waiter ever (Giorgio) is a must ask for! I would give 12 out of 5 stars!

We ate in the bar area, and thoroughly enjoyed the happy hour food and drinks. The atmosphere was pleasant, while the food and drinks were surprisingly good. Highly recommend the meatballs. The only disappointment was the service from server Miko. He was very chatty with a few tables, while short and dismissive with others. He would take your order, but didn't return to the table to check on you, refill drinks, recommend additional food items to order, take new drink orders, etc. On the other hand, the men and women who cleared the tables, refilled water glasses, brought out new utensils, etc were efficient and pleasant. If management reads these reviews, please pass along praises to your staff who work hard and deserve recognition for a job well done, while taking note of the one employee who seriously missed the mark.

My friend Katie from Calif. chose dinner at Buddy V's to celebrate her 50th birthday, we are so glad she did! We are obliged to express our amazing experience of the service we received by our server Peter on the evening of November 14, 2015. We have always been pleased with excellent food and service we receive at Buddy V's. However, this time Peter's professionalism and attention to details (serving 5 women, each requesting something different) exceeded our expectations and he made the celebration dinner even more memorable. Such commitment to great customer service is to be commended! We highly recommend Buddy V's as a place to celebrate, and request Peter as your server if you want the 5 star dining experience.

I'm a huge fan of Buddy, Cake Boss so we tried his restaurant. Food was amazing! Portions are very small for their price. We ordered pasta, thought the serving was too small for $28. 

But you can never go wrong with their desserts. Really the best!!! Cannolis and lobster tails are scrumptious! Tried them in Vegas and New York.

Where do I begin? The food was to die for, the service was even better. Big shout out to Giorgio who educated us not only on the menu choices themselves, but on what wine to try with our meals and even dessert. He checked in frequently, as did the young gentleman who was refilling water glasses (I regret not asking his name). If you like Italian food at all, Buddy V's is a must try!
Absolutely amazing. The food here is so fresh and SO good. The restaurant itself is stunning and the service is wonderful.

I went with my family for lunch, and was not disappointed. We had the meatballs for an appetizer. They were delicious and the sauce was so tasty.  All the food was made very well and the restaurant is very nicely decorated. I loved the dessert, so much better here than across the ways at Carlo's Bakery.  Service was great too.
Great family friendly restaurant on the strip, good food and service, variety in the kids menu and an all around great meal.  Chaz was a great server, and is a dead ringer for the Rock!

This could be the first time I have ever said that a dinner on the strip was a bargain. Not only was it a bargain it was excellent. We had a family dinner with 6 people and did family style dinning. It was wonderful. Tons of food and a wonderful selection of tastes. If you go and have a chance to do the family dinning you would be crazy not too.  The only negative I can say is that it was a bit loud making conversation a tad difficult.
Service was great...went there twice during our stay :) Caesar salad was average and the macaroni carbonara was average but everything else was amazing!  Looking forward to next time!
It was well worth the wait. Incredible  food. The wait staff was incredibly friendly the food was homemade Italian like my grandmother used to make I am in heaven especially for here in Sin City

We love Italian Food, and we felt like treating ourselves. We had heard so many good things about Buddy V's, being locals, so we decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed. The service was impeccable - friendly & attentive. The server was knowledgeable and described the dishes well. We are "Wine Snobs" so we were worried about the wine selection, but to our surprise they had a great selection of Italian and Californian Wines, and the Server seemed fairly knowledgeable and recommended a suitable Italian Wine. And the food was everything we hoped it would be - classic, fresh, simple and delicious.  The restaurant was busy and vibrant.The kitchen is situated right in the middle of the restaurant, and you can watch the action. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

Came here with clients our company brought to vegas. Wanted a place with good food and low cost. Very satisfied! Good service, good food, nice view of the strip from certain parts of the restaurant, cosy family feel. Ordered the bone-in milanesa and it was AMAZING! overall great fun and good food. :)

We're there sat at 830. No one waiting. The lady ask us to wait for a bit. After 10 mins, the other girl lead us sitting outside of the restaurant. We asked if there is any table inside. She replied. Oh inside, it will be another one and half hr wait. (But clearly there have several tables open inside and it was not a busy night). Then we politely said we will go somewhere else. The lady said. Really, are you sure.       :)  There are lots of choices in Vegas..  We end up with another Italian restaurant.   Thanks but no thanks buddy.

My friend and I went here because our flight landed earlier, and we wanted to find a decent restaurant to eat in. We got there at around 4 and ordered a meatball sub and caprese salad. 

I didn't like how they didn't give us bread but instead some type of cracker. We were hungry, so we munched on until we saw our entrees.

The meatball sub was decent looking with seasoned fries. The fries were tasty, but the meatball sub wasn't worth the money. It was tiny and tasted like it had been heated in the microwave. It was still passable if it was about $10.

The caprese salad was not worth the $16 we paid. From left to right were a whole tomato, a small blob of caprese, about 12 cherry tomato halves drenched in dressing, and a spinach leaf. It was the tiniest salad I've ever eaten. Wasn't that good and definitely not worth the money.

If you're hungry and don't want to spend over $30 for two people, try somewhere else!
The food was great and the service amazing! You feel at home and very welcomed as soon you walk in the door.
Fantastic food and service. The place has a nice atmosphere and a live band. When you step out of the restaurant you can smell the fresh cakes out of Carla's bakery

Excellent food and service!  We were seated quickly, ordered promptly, food came out quickly, and the wait staff was attentive throughout our experience!  The chicken parm is excellent and the tiramisu is second to none!

Awesome....came here for Sunday brunch and could NOT have been more satisfied!!  From the doctor your own Bloody Mary bar to the many stations of different foods to try, my husband and I left extremely full and happy!!! A great way to recover from a Vegas Saturday night!

It's ok. Had lasagne and it was better than any franchise. But pieros is still the best Italian food and this didn't come close. My blend-wine was the best I've had since being on this trip out to Vegas. Service was decent. Piano player/singer was everything!!! Loved it :))

Above average scallop dinner, however surprised when I receive a bill for $16 beer. I was asked when seated if I wanted small, medium or large, I went with medium. When questioning the $16 charge, I was told this was because I can keep the glass.  I don't want a cheap glass to take home, I want a reasonably priced beer.

We went at prime time for dinner. The place was so full we had to wait 45 minutes for a table.

Once we were seated though the place was great. Service was good though a bit slow at times, the waiter was really passionate about the food and was able to recommend several options for my parents who don't normally eat Italian. 

We ordered the osso buco, the shrimp scampi, and the gravy with rigatoni. All the food came out hot, and parmesan was very quick to be offered.

The food tasted great. Like the waiter said, the osso buco literally fell off the bone, I didn't need the knife at all. It was a bit oily, but otherwise very good. The polenta it was served with was creamy and well seasoned. I felt some vegetables/salad would have gone down nicely, but it was very good overall.

The shrimp scampi tasted very good, but the pasta seemed slightly overcooked (by maybe half a minute) and the sauce a little scarce. Flavour wise it was brilliant. 

The gravy was probably the least impressive in my opinion, the sauce just needed something extra in terms of flavour to really make the meat stand out.

Portion sizes were generous, originally we were keen for dessert or a visit to the cake store just opposite, but it was a bit too much. 

Overall it was a very good meal and one of the few decent Italian places I've been to in Vegas or anywhere else and it shows in how busy they were, but it seemed slightly let down by some small details.

Wow, we loved everything we ate here! The lasagna was the perfect balance of cheeses, sausage, pork, and tomato sauce. The chopped vegetable salad was loaded with veggies and garbanzos and perfectly dressed. Don't even let me get started on the heavenly meatballs. I just kept eating even after I was full because I rarely get food this good. Thank you, Buddy!
Just went in for happy hour and sat at the bar, service was good and the small plates where not bad. They also do a all happy hour out on the patio too.

My brother claims the garlic cheese bread takes like its made by Jesus... And it does. Most amazing garlic cheese bread ever. Although, fettuccine Alfredo is not on the menu.. You can order Alfredo with other noodles and chicken. My brother rated that a 5. My mom got the chicken Parmesan and said it was a 5 star meal as well. I got the spaghetti with meatballs and I have to go with my mom and brother and say mine was 5 stars as well.

This a casual place.  Background music was 70's and 80's, which was fine by me; as I walked in, Tom Jones was playing followed by The Who.  And the beat went on.

Ordered Grilled Octopus; broth was spicy and tasted good.  The problem was the rest.  Actual octopus was fine; only thing was, there was only one bite and rest was filled by greens and potatoes!

Then ordered Shrimp Scampi for main course.  It was with angle hair pasta which was fine.  Taste was fine.  Here again, there were only 4 medium size shrimps with tails on to make them look bigger than actually they were!

I understand this is Vegas and understand this was inside of a casino; but, by no means one gets his/hers money's worth.  There are many other Italian places in the same casino that serve great Italian food and one gets close to reasonable amount for his/her money!

WOW My husband and I have been here 5 times already, Our server Rocco has been the best of the best, the food is delish and the desserts are to die for, a must is the Lobster Tail Pastry with fresh fruit, the cannoli's come in second best but all are good
Every visit we ordered something different to try and we have not been disappointed
one of my fav's is the margarita pizza, last night we had the sunday gravy pot, meatballs, pork, lamb, sausage with a bowl of rigatoni, so yummy, we had friends from NJ visit last month and this was the first place we took them, they can not wait to return
matter of fact I can't wait for our next visit, so until then I will have to patience but it won't be long,  thanks Buddy for opening on the strip
see you soon

Best pasta carbonara I have eaten to date. The rest of my family also seemed very pleased with their dishes. I'll be coming back in the future. My family has been there once before without me and said the service was incredible. I didn't necessarily get that experience but the food was wonderful. 

Tip: the garlic bread is phenomenal

Great environment and great service. There was live music and our serve was nice enough to walk us through the menu. We got the salad and the lasagna, which was both amazing. The salad was too salty for my taste, but I guess I should have asked for light dressing. Otherwise, everything was great!

I was in Vegas for a business trip and I remember a friend posting on FB what a wonderful dinner she had at Buddy V's a few months back so I checked it out on Yelp.  After viewing the pictures, I had my heart set on the lasagna but the chicken parm also looked good so I asked the waiter what he would recommend.  He said both were good but since I was by myself, I should have the chicken parm because the lasagna was large enough to serve two.  Since I was there in time for their pre-show prix-fix menu, and chicken parm was on that, I went with that selection.  The Caesar salad had a nice dressing, not overly powerful.  The chicken parm was good but not so delicious that it made me not wish that I tried to lasagna instead.  I went with the chocolate hazelnut cake (can't remember the exact name) and that was delicious.  I really wanted to try the lobster tail, but it was not one of the options on the prix fix, but unlike the entrée, I was not disappointed that I didn't have what I walked in intending to order.  Although the chicken parm was a bit disappointing, it wasn't bad, just nothing special.  I would go back to try the lasagna.

Had a fabulous evening at Buddy V's last night. Sat in the bar with my husband and enjoyed the meatballs, caprese salad, shrimp scampi pasta and lasagna. We got all the food at once so we could have a little bit of everything at once. 
Everything was cooked to perfection and OMG the mozzarella was amazing. 
Definitely worth a visit if you like Italian cooking!
Amazing food, the ravioli's were to die for!  Excellent service, very professional and friendly.  Crazy good deserts, but that is to be expected!  Wonderful atmosphere with a great price point!
This is a good place to go before you catch a show. Not to pricey for a nice meal in Vegas and the food is good. I enjoyed eating here but it wasn't anything spectacular.
Here for the Super Bowl, if you are thinking a great combination good food and football big mistake the food and waiters service along with the tv size is a big disappointment don't waste your time
Food was ok. Host sat us at the bar when she said that the dinning room was full. After us a bigger party came in and they were sat in the dinning room.

We went to Buddy V's for a late lunch around 2:30. The restaurant was less than half full, plenty of seating, no wait. There were 4 of us, with two more on the way. The not so pleasant manager said they do not sit incomplete parties...are you joking, there were so many open tables!! We said we'd like to be seated to order drinks, they refused. So we waited a few minutes, went back up to the host stand asked if they really couldn't seat us with all the open tables, it seemed a little ridiculous.  Still a very rude no. We left went to another Venetian Italian restaurant, got seated right away.  Will never go back, horrible service. I understand if your busy, but they weren't, just very rude and unaccomadating.

We went to Buddy V's on our anniversary for wine and cheese.  We were very impressed with the portions on the cheese/salumi platter.  The wine was delicious and the service we received from Pete our waiter was outstanding.  We will definitely be back.

This review is based truly on the service and not the food.  My husband and I ate here on 3/9/14 during Restaurant Week while visiting Las Vegas.  I would like to start off and say that we are lenient when it comes to services.  It is a very hard job and not everyone is cut out for the job and unfortunately Perry M. at Buddy V's is one of them.  
Our evening started out with us walking up to the hostess station around 5:15 that Sunday evening.  We asked the two ladies if we could have a window table.  They stated it was going to be about 20 to 30 minutes.  We stated no problem that we will go to the bar and have a drink to please come over and get us when the table was ready.  They stated that was fine.  We ordered two drinks at the bar and about 20 minutes later we saw two tables being cleaned at the window area.  So my husband was paying close attention and before we knew it the hostess was taking up a couple that had just arrived.  Luckily a table was being cleared up behind them so my husband had to go grab the hostess to remind her of our table.  She then remembered we were waiting and sat us down.  Point being, if my husband wasn't keeping an eye out we would have lost those window seats we were waiting on.  
Now on to our next adventure, we meet our waiter Perry M., he asked if we wanted water and we stated we did.  The assistant waiter came through and gave us bread and I stated thank you to him, but got no response back.  Perry then came back and got our food order.  The food came out as scheduled and was delivered by a young gentleman from the kitchen.  Our assistant waiter came by and gave us more bread and again I said Thank You with no response.  I come from the south and when someone says thank you, your response should be Your Welcome or My Pleasure.  To me this is plain rude.  Again, we are just holding our tongues in the whole situation.  My husband wanted another beer.  Ever since Perry ordered our food we never saw him again at the table to ask how everything was.  I told my husband to put the empty glass on the edge of the table maybe he will notice it and walla' he did.  My husband asked for another beer and he went on his way.  At this time our water glasses are now empty.  Well after 10 minutes still no beer has arrived at the table.  By this time the dessert has arrived and my husband and I are sharing a glass of water since we have not been refilled or asked if we wanted any.  Again, we are not saying anything.  We don't ask for much.  We know it is hectic sometimes doing this job.  We were going to let go not getting the beer, but we do like for our water to be filled up WITHOUT having to ask.  So we just asked for the bill and were just going to chalk it up to bad experience and not return.  Until our bill came, the first two charges are for the restaurant week special at 30.14 per person (which is correct).  Then two additional entrees where added and the kicker was he added the beer that never arrived.  Our total check should be in the range of 60+ change, but the total was 122.00.  So that is the point my husband lost it and grabbed the manager.  
The manager that night was Sean Fiori whom assisted us.  We explained everything to him expect the experience with the hostess earlier.  We explained our experience with Perry M and his assistant.  We showed him the bill and he immediately apologized and said he will fix the bill and gave us an after dinner drink to make up for not getting the beer.  We are not people to complain.  We put up with a lot from waiters/waitress, but this was awful.  We are simple people and want to be acknowledged and respected and just fill up our drinks every now and then.  Literally he orders our food and gave us the messed up bill.  That was all and wants us to tip you on this service.  Don't get me wrong.  We had no problems with the food, but the service made this experience awful.  Hopefully he gets continued training or he needs to find another profession.

Food and service were great.  We reserved ahead of time, we were accommodated quickly upon arrival and given a nice view of the strip.  Fresh baked focaccia was great.  Grilled octopus was a little spicy but good.  Best dish of the night for us was the Orecchiette & Italian Sausage.

Phenomenal Italian food, which is what you might expect from a unique restaurant owned by an Italian family. The staff was wonderful as well, from the hosts at the front all the way to the manager who greeted us and had a minute or two conversation with us. 

The menu suits itself to family style dining. My wife and I each had drinks, split garlic bread with oil and vinegar, and the pollo rigatoni alla vodka, which is one of the best dishes I've ever eaten. The polenta croutons on the Caesar salad must be tried to be believed. The salad looks so simple that you might be disappointed when it comes to the table vs. my wife's house salad with beautiful heirloom tomatoes, but both were exceptional.

Contrary to many of the reviews I read, they do bring some small bread. Thinking that we didn't, we ordered the garlic bread, which could easily be split between 4-6 people. It was a little much, and if I did it over, I'd leave off the garlic bread and order dessert. We were simply too full! 

I'd you're looking for phenomenal food that's not terribly expensive (with drinks and all we were under $80), don't even give it a second thought, and come here. You may want to reserve your table through open table or something similar to get in quickly. Our reservation was delivered exactly on time.

I don't even know how to explain how horrible service was. After being seated, we waited about 15 minutes for our server to take drink orders! He was hardly apologetic and to make matters worse, he was so rude while I asked him a few questions about the appetizers. 

After 45 minutes of ordering, we finally received our food. It was okay. Not worth the bad service. 

I have been to many restaurants and I have never felt so uncomfortable or treated so rudely from a server, ever.

Got to try Buddy V's today with some co-workers... The atmosphere is open and has a modern with a hint of old world vibe going on. I had the Chicken Parm, which was a huge portion and was a great dish I will enjoy for dinner too! The smashed meatball sub and the Salmon were ordered by the others in the party and all said they really enjoyed their dishes! We also got an order of the garlic bread which was the right amount of garlic and cheese! The service was good and nicely paced! Overall great experience, great food and I would recommend this place to others! Sadly we were too full to order dessert.

My wife and I were in Vegas from Atlanta, relaxing and enjoying her birthday weekend. 
Bobby V's was one of the eatery's I specifically wanted to visit while we were here. Upon being seated we were met with welcoming and friendly customer/guest service. 
Caleb was our server and hit a Grand Slam in doing so. He was very attentive to our request and even provided suggestions when I seemed unsure. 
I ordered the Tomato & Basil soup and my wife ordered the  Aunt Nina's Mozzarella en Carozza for appetizers. At first bite, the authenticity of the food was evident and the Riesling and Moscato wine that followed were right on time. 
Shortly after finishing the appetizers, our entrees showed up and my wife's Capellini Shrimp Scampi and my Nonna's Lasagna Al Forno  dishes pushed the experience over the top. 
All the while being treated like relatives by Adam, the Asst. General Manager. I pulled Adam to the side and mentioned that I had a confession and that was, that my wife and I eat out a lot, while home and this was the best all around experience we've had in a long time and thanked him for the wonderful experience. 
The cherry on top was when they brought out a piece of Chocolate Expresso cake, on the house, for the Mrs.'s birthday and a couple of lattes.
This customer service is what I strive to exemplify in my own business at Ambassador Barbershop, Atlanta, GA, because long term relationships are better than short term money, any day. 
Adam and Caleb, we'll see you next time we're in Vegas.
Thanks again,
K. Jones

What a treat!  I made reservations for two the day before we decided to go.  We walked up and were seated quickly.  Our server greeted us shortly thereafter.  The menu has such a great variety of classic  Italian staples. It was hard to decide what we were going to eat.  For the appetizer, we ordered Mozzarella en Carozza ("mozzarella in a carriage").  Hands down, this was the most delicious appetizer we've had in such a long time.  The crust was nice and crispy.  But the gravy (sauce) just took it over the top.  It was so full of flavor.  It was a nice balance of tomatoes and basil.
 
For the main course, my hubby ordered the Sunday Gravy.  I loved the presentation.  They served the meat in a separate metal pot.  Plenty of sausage, lamb necks, pork and meatballs.  It's served with rigatoni.  This entrée was so tasty that we immediately started looking for the recipe on the internet.  I ordered the Linguini with Clams.  It came with plenty of clams.  The portion sizes were perfect.

We were pretty stuffed by the time we were done with our meals.  However, we wanted to try a dessert while we were there.  I loved the dessert menu. It looks like a family photo album with pictures of Buddy and his family.  We selected the Italian Wedding Cake.  I didn't think I had any room for dessert.  But this little cake was so good that we knew we had to finish it all. Luckily we had a long walk ahead of us. The restaurant was at the far end of the shops in the Venetian.  We will definitely make this a must the next time we're in Las Vegas.   You should too.  We plan to try the chicken parm.  The atmosphere was what were looking for.  It was like a huge Italian farmhouse kitchen.  And you could see into the kitchen.  Loved the whole experience.

Okay, the hostess took awhile to sit us down.  On the phone but didn't even look at us to smile.  This is they reason why I gave 4 instead of 5 star.  But overall, our waiter was nice and prompt.   The order were fast.  The food is alright.  We heard about the bakery and always see a long line.   We decided to give their dessert a try.  It's not the best we've tried but it's alright.

This restaurant is a perfect experience for any Cake Boss fan. The food tastes like you stepped into Buddy's home. Very delicious! And the portions are the perfect size. The garlic bread is amazing and fresh. And you have to go for the lobster tail for dessert!

My family and I had lunch at the restaurant,  food was amazing, being from Honolulu you can't get better than Buddy V's, our busboy Ron was awesome, raspberry  iced tea great . Being a chef from Honolulu it's an eye opening experience. Good job Buddy, open one in Honolulu please . Mahalos  Robert Denis

Would have given this place five stars because my husband and I really enjoyed our dinner when we dined there on our vacation last week. But we felt our waiter although very nice was not totally truthful and sneaky. We had ordered a salad and the fried mozzarella for an appetizer, both were delicious! But our waiter casually asked if we wanted cheesy garlic bread and the way he asked it came across that it was complementary...it wasn't $9.00 :/ the other thing was that my husband and I had both ordered beers, and when I had ordered mine he pulled out the menu and pointed to two choices and asked which one I wanted...I just pointed to the smaller of the two choices. When we got our bill it turned out he had added on a souvenir glass (an extra $5.00) without informing me that was what he was doing. So we felt we got a little bit scammed into adding on all these extras. So ask questions before you just say "sure!" to something.
Kind of a disappointment, we had the chicken parm and the chicken was very dry! Everything else was very mediocre not worth the price, kinda expected more from buddy

Love this joint! Carlos - why don't you open one of these in NJ? The Sunday sauce is to die for. Also loved  the shrimp scampi & the Nutella cake.  Thank you Peter (our waiter) for making the evening! You are the best!
Outstanding from start to finish. Caprese salad was great. The gravy dish was loaded with veal, meatballs and sausage. And the best part, the desserts!

Was told it would be 30 mins and it was 50 mins while I could see seats open. Then they cram as many seats and tables together where I am less than 2 feet from someone not in my party. Could not turn my head without feeling like I was invading someone else privacy. Also some tables is right next to kitchen and with all the banging and yelling in kitchen could not hear myself think much less have a conversation. Server disappeared for 15-20 at one point. Food was average. Basically running on name alone

Terrible service! People that work there really unhelpful!! Don't recommend at all!!  We came there to get a desert and they gave us a table at lounge area, after we gave the order they asked for my ID which I didn't have with me and told us that we can't seat in that area, first of all we didn't even ask to seat there and they told us to leave and didn't even give us a different table. Why would they even give us a table make us do an order and then tell us to leave? Terrible !!! Terrible service!!
Soo excited to go to the Cake Boss restaurant and bakery! The food and atmosphere was great! service was excellent!! The chocolate mousse cake was the most amazing cake I've ever eaten!!
Service was amazing and they were very attentive. I tried the chicken parmesan and spaghetti which was delicious. There lasagna was humongous. Overall a 5 out of 5.

When arriving we had a huge joyful greeting from the hosts. We had reservations but I want a widow seat for my party.  They quickly when into action to make my request happen. They said it would be 20min but was only 10. Wow the appetizers are very flavorful we had mom's meat balls and eggplant, I recommend both. Very diverse wine and drink list. Main dish was cooked to perfection, the steak and the veal was our choices both very well prepared and delightful. Server has very good and attentive too. 2 piece music group in bar area was outstanding. This is a great pic for a good meal. Peace out!!

Stayed at the Venetian and decided to eat here. Food was great. Probably some of the best Italian I've ever had. The service was great. Our cups never went empty and when I spilled a scant amount of tomato sauce on my shirt, the waiter came out of nowhere and gave me club soda to help with the stain and it worked! I will definitely be coming back here the next time I visit Vegas.

I brought my daughter here for her birthday lunch. She has a passion for cooking and baking and Buddy is her idol. She was so excited. We made a reservation for the 6 of us. When we showed up I was automatically taken back by the lack of personality and sheer lack of respect from the hostess. I must have high standards seems how I work in a restaurant but I certainly would expect more from a restaurant of its caliber and popularity. We had no greeting, no hello, no nothing. When we were seated we were handed menus and we knew it was a bit pricy before we went so that wasn't a shocker. It's the Las vegas strip and you're paying for the name. But honestly for the price and because of the name I really pictured a warm, friendly atmosphere. Not a cold environment where we were treated like we intruded and were not welcome. I felt so sad for my daughter. She was excited to go there for the amazing experience she thought she'd have and to have my 12 year old on her birthday feel so let down and disappointed about the service is very disheartening. She felt like she was personally let down by Buddy himself. The food was good but when you feel so unwelcome, it ruins the entire experience. Such a bummer that the Bake Shop service wasn't any better either. Can't say I'll be going back and I Definately don't think this is how Buddy would want people to feel walking into his restaurant because he is such a family guy who's welcoming and makes it feel like home.
Quite possibly the best eggplant Parmesan I have ever had!!!!  Def try it as an app or a small main.

We ordered the veal marsala for 24 bucks, not sure if we got veal or pork, it was way tough than any other veal I have had. Sauce was over powered by wine sauce and that's pretty much all I tasted. Probably won't come back here again

Absolutely loved this place! It reminds me of family from the moment you walk in! Te atmosphere is remarkable. The decor blends perfectly with what Buddy stands for and who he is. The most memorable aspect would have to be the chandeliers. They had whisks handing from them as well. That shows creativity and passion. The food was amazing! The flavor profile was on point and we got to try the canolis. 

Overall  service was great,  the place was clean, the dishes were affordable, and the environment felt like home. Thanks Buddy for a great experience in Vegas!

The food was okay( something you can get at a regular Italian restaurant), the service was amazing, very friendly. Me and my husband were celebrating our one year anniversary and a day that special I would of prefer spending it some where, where they don't take your plate when your not finish. It was a Sunday and not that busy but it was like they were trying to kick you out. Not the best experience, never coming here again!

Excellent service!!!
Came here for lunch on Labor Day. There was no wait to be seated which was great.

The Food is soooo good !!!!!! We ordered the 
Aunt Nina's mozzarella en carozza for an antipasto. Let me tell you that is a definite order again next time we go back. My husband ordered the Lisa  V's linguine & white clam sauce and I ordered the chicken parm. The servings are big that I could not even finish one of the pieces of chicken parm after the app. and of course saving room for the lobster tail for dessert that we shared between the both us because it is huge. It is bigger than the ones you get at the bakery across the from restaurant. 

Everything we had was soooo good and can't wait until we go back in the future to try something different on the menu but this time it will be for dinner to have a bigger selection to choose from than the lunch menu.

Amazing!!! The wait staff was kind and attentive. Even though the place was packed, we were never unattended. I had the scallops and they were easily the best ive ever had. My mom had the turkey lasanga and it was so good. Definetely reccomend those two things.
Great food and atmosphere. My hubby and I had a delicious meal. if you go after 6 , it was crowded. We arrived at 500 so we avoided the crowd.  Service was ggreat!!!

We made an OpenTable reservation.  We arrived five minutes early and we were seated right away.  Our waiter, Charlie, was able to answer our questions about the menu with ease.  He provided the right amount of attention to us without being intrusive.  We were a party of 3.  I had the orecchiette and Italian sausage.  It was rich and flavorful, with only a hint of spice, which was exactly what I wanted.  My husband Tim and my friend Gina both ordered the linguini with clams.  They liked it a lot.  I've been friends with Gina for 25 years, and this was probably the only time I've seen her finish an entree at a restaurant!  If you're concerned, don't be; the portion size was generous.  I also had the Italian greens.  They were good and the portion size is large enough for two if you want to share.  We finished with cannoli and apple pie.  Both are worth trying and can easily be shared.
No stars..... Had Reservation at 9:15. We just walked out at 9:48 after not one person came for our order.  Worst service ever experienced. Restaurant was not busy by any means.

First time here and it was an overall great experience. Our waiter Charlie was fun, energetic and knowledgable on the menu. Tried "My dads bucatini carbonara" which was excellence. The Nutella cake was super delish! Will be going back for sure

I didn't know until just this moment that we were there only the second week they were open.  We had no idea this was there, but were at the Venetian and followed our noses.  Service was excellent, attentive, but not invasive.  We weren't that hungry, but proceeded to order the octopus appetizer which was great.  The octopus was cooked perfectly.  

My husband ordered the (I think it was called the Sunday gravy or something).  It was a pot with red sauce, sausage, veal, and meatballs.  He said it was very good.  I ordered the eggplant parmesan appetizer and the creamy polenta side.  I was too full to finish it, but it was delicious.  The eggplant had a wonderfully crisp coating and was not mushy at all.  The polenta was creamy and wonderful.

I also had a frozen Bellini that was yummy.  We are talking about going back to Vegas just to eat there again!

The chicken parm was delicious. However service was not the greatest. We waited 10 mins at our table before someone even came to our table. After ordering The waiter never came around to ask if we needed anything, we finally had to stop another waiter to ask for a refill on our water.

My husband & I dined here 11/17 to celebrate my bday. First off the place is difficult to find. They are so new the restaurant wasn't listed on the directory. We had a hard time finding it & even after asking an employee at palazzo they had no idea where it was! We called buddy v's and they directed us where to go. I was disappointed where they seated us, we had a seat facing the kitchen while the gorgeous view was behind us. I thought since we had a reservation& a bday to celebrate we should have been able to enjoy the view. The food definitely made up for the bad seat. My husband ordered the chicken Parmesan and I ordered chicken Marsala. Both were excellent, but the chicken Marsala was the best I've ever had. Service was awesome, no complaints there. Can't wait to go back!  Hopefully we'll have a better seat next time.
Had a great meal, appetizer, chicken Parmesan and dessert were all great at a good price.

Very good meal! My friend and I were satisfied with what we had while on a trip to Vegas.  After several mediocre/disappointing meals, the items we had at Buddy V's left us very pleased! 

Definitely recommend the calamari fritti (something similar to that spelling) it is the option hat is breaded and comes with green peppers and lemon aoli. It was fabulous and perfectly cooked. 

We also shared the veal Marsala.  The noodles and the actual marsala sauce on the veal were VERY good.  Thumbs up! 

Their canolis looked amazing but we were too full to get any. Next time though! :)

Buddy V's Ristorante is a lovely place to go for home-style cooked Italian food.  The menu offers a variety of appetizers, salads, pasta, chicken, veal and seafood.  Last but not least, the cakes are insanely delicious- not surprising, seeing the restaurant is owned by the Cake Boss himself.  Do whatever you have to do to save room for dessert!

My mom and I went in here tonight around 7. The hostess was very polite and seated us right away. We sat ignored at our table for over 20 minutes, we were never even offered water. We finally left and found another place to eat. Very disappointing, we were excited to eat there and the food looked delicious.

Ambience was good 
Ordered fried calamari and lasagna. 

Fried calamari: 
Portion was okay for 2 to share. 
Could have been more deep fried. 
Came out a tad bit soggy 
The breaking fell off for the most of the pieces. 
Too salty 
Size of calamari was food 

Lasagna- 
Good portion for two to share
Taste is home made- which is what they are going for.

I loved this place. It reminded me of the old Villa Penza and other old school joints where the cook or the owner mingles and sits with you for a while and makes you feel at home even though they know you are leaving.  These are the special touches that made the old school joints what they were with tile floors and checkered tablecloths and the food was nectar of the gods and 'ambience' was for people who didnt know anything about food.

These elements gave us the confidence to break some rules like 'never order spaghetti and clam sauce outside of the metropolitan area'.

The simplicity of this dish was a revelation.  The DeCecco macaroni was cooked to perfection, It was the perfect platform for the teeny tiny baby clams that are mandatory for this dish and no substitutions.  The fragrance of the baby clams, the garlic, the textures, it was just magnificent and like no other commercially prepared dish we have had in years.  Kudos!

I dont like sitting on top of the kitchen.  Its too loud and too hot.  This was neither.  It was very entertaining.  They were loving the food they were preparing and it made you that much more excited about how good it was going to be to see this.

The veal marsala was fantastic.  It was good quality veal and the marsala was not cloying and sickeningly sweet as the cheap marsalas are.  This was proper marsala.

The osso buco was great, cooked to perfection, falling off the bone resting on a pool of creamy polenta.

I highly recommend the 'birthday cake' for dessert.  Its an experience.

While many of these authentic homestyle dishes are stylized for presentation, this is the way we really eat in  NJ.  Great meatballs.  

This visit was AFTER Gordon Ramsay Steak and in no way was it a letdown, it was right up there with GR.  

Kudos to Adam Margolies and his exceptional staff.

Stopped in here with my family of five as we cruised through the Venetian for a late lunch. We were really headed to Carlos' Bakery but were hungry and went in to Buddy's.

Two kids got meatball sandwiches, one got the margherita pizza, and my wife and I split the salumi and cheese plate with a couple glasses of house red. Happily I got a few bites of the meatball sandwich and it was probably the best I've ever had. The salumi and cheese plate was a great split for a light meal, with excellent meats, cheeses, and I loved the olives. Not normally an olive fan. My daughter really liked the pizza, too.

The bill was about eighty five bucks and the service was good, not great.

Tip: If you want to hit the bakery, grab a number before or during your meal. There was a significant wait for the bakery, although perhaps the novelty will have worn off after a little time has passed.

These guys are a solid 3.5.  The service is very good, it is Vegas after all.  It is though a chain-like, more modern casual Olive Garden.  The food is a bit better than Olive Garden with some good items like the Sunday Gravy.  If you're expecting high quality Italian food this might not be the best stop. If you want some comfort food at a decent price, this is a good choice. 

Sadly they don't have much from the Carlo's bakery dessert menu though.

Positive - Nice view. Nice atmosphere. Polite staff. 

Negative - Too pricey for what you get. I felt the food quality was pretty low. The person I went with didn't care for it either and it was his second visit.

What a disappointment. Underseasoned capellini shrimp scampi with not even a hint of garlic. It had flavorless shrimp - boiled instead of sautéed?  Merely average lasagna. Bland, gummy focaccia that needed longer baking and the addition of rosemary. At these expensive prices, expected better food. 

On the plus side, service was quick and waitstaff excellent (otherwise this place would only have gotten 2 stars). The olive oil/balsamic dipping sauce was excellent (but not enough to redeem the sorry focaccia). The lemonade was great - for $10, glad it came with free refills.

A small group of us went to try this place out for dinner and overall we loved it! The food was good and so were the cocktails. I liked that the menu was kind of small because as it was I couldn't even decide what I wanted to eat, lol. I finally decided on the chicken Marsala and the sauce was yummy.. The noodles that were served with it were a little salty for my taste but I still liked the dish. We also had the pizza and spaghetti and meatballs, which they said it was good too... I recommend the calamari for a starter.

The prices were reasonable and the food was very good. The waitress was just ok, I had asked to do a  doggy bag which she forgot. She was also supposed to find out a having a cake sent to my little girl, but she never did find out. I finally just left. I would definitely go back

So this is the second time we go to Buddy V this week. We loved the Sunday Gravy but it is a lot of food, so come hungry. We went in a Thursday night so the band was planning, those guys are great, music was good and they really make an effort to play the music you want to hear. Hersh was our waitress, she's awesome. Props to her, very nice and came by to make sure we were good many times. She deserves a raise. Lastly, the location is great and it is a nice resturant so I highly recommend you try it.

By far the worst sevice i have ever had in a restaurant.  We had a party of 6 sit down for dinner and a birthday celebration.   No bread no  water for 20 minutes oue appetizers were ordered and another 30 minutes for those.  Do even get me started on how long for the entrees to arrive.   Horrible, horrible sevice.  Another couple got up and left after similar poor service.  Do yourself a favor and find somewhere else to eat in Vegas!

Wow!  What a fabulous meal we had last week. My husband and I are major foodies and have eaten at some of the best Italian places in the USA. We loved the best of course in Boston little Italy and Buddy Vs is as close as it gets.  I had the Osso Buco and my husband had the ravioli,  and both were amazing. We had to keep sharing with everybody at our table.  The only trouble we had was finding it.  It is on the second floor, but we kept asking for directions from everybody in the Venetian  and nobody could tell us.  Finally a drink server put her full tray of drinks down and went to a wall phone and got directions for us. You would think they would have training on directions in the hotel on how to get what you are looking for.  But it was definitely worth the navigating.  We will be coming back again!

Ce restaurant a tout faux ! Dès l'accueil on vous place selon votre tenue si vous n'êtes pas chemise et pantalon vous serez placé au bar en vous faisant croire que c'est pour patienter le temps qu'une table se libère. Le bar avec ses tables bancales et son chanteur qui se prend pour franck Sinatra est un endroit insupportable, impossible de tenir une conversation. Finalement on vous apporte vos plats (seul point positif car bien cuisiné). Vous payerez 24 dolls pour des pates ou des lasagnes merci ! En bref un mauvais moment

Came on a Monday night. They weren't too busy Got seated right away, server was so nice and accommodating (as we were in a hurry) and everything looked very nice and Italian. 

The food is kind of expensive. ($15-30) 
We ordered 2 appetizers (garlic bread and meatballs) BOTH taste yummy! We got six pieces of each. There were four of us and we finished everything. We also split the shrimp scampi and it was good too. (Nothing unique but it definitely hits the spot and is satisfying.) we left very happy.

Best meal in Las Vegas. Much better than Delmonico's (Emeril's place). 5 star service from Georgio.  We have eaten somewhere different for almost a week and this was the best.  Ask for the family style sampler. We didn't see it on the menu but they bring their signature appetizers, entrees and desserts. Worth the visit!

Ate here twice during our stay because it was so good. Fantastic Italian food and feel-like-family service. So many restaurants disappoint, but this one lives up to the hype. Ordered an appetizer, salad and entree each time and loved 'em all. The spaghetti and meatballs were the best evah! 
Also, be sure to order dessert!

We tried to go there last night and, if the hostesses don't change their poor customer service, this place won't be there for too much longer.
Walked up at 5:15 p to make a reservation for 8 at 6 p. The restaurant was very light with guests and, there were plenty of open tables in our sight.
One hostess told us the earliest we could be seated was 7:15 p. Then, a 2nd hostess popped up and said it wouldn't be before 7:45.
Not a problem, we went to Cannaletto in the Grand Canal Shops. We were accommodated, the food and wine was superb. It was a great dining experience.
Buddy, you better go visit soon or, you're going to regret it. Your restaurant management is killing your restaurant and, your reputation.

My husband and I were so excited to come here, we were really hungry after a long day of sightseeing and it was our last night in Vegas. Ready to indulge one last night. We were seated in the couch/lounge. I thought it looked cozy, only to sit on an extremely awkward, low, deep sunken in seat. Odd. But can be overlooked. 

Our server Christin was nice enough, not really helpful when we asked for an opinion of favorites. So I ordered the veal marsala and my husband ordered the ravioli. (How can you mess up ravioli?) Well... after a long wait for food to roll out, his ravioli was disappointing and very very salty. Same salt issue with the veal. My pasta on my plate tasted like pasta roni, and was cold. My veal, extremely hot. The ravioli portion was small and didn't even begin to fill him up even though he tried to stomach the saltiness. 

Our birthday canolli was a nice thought, but we didn't really eat it. Maybe we ordered the wrong items? But this felt like a dressed up version of the olive garden. A bit disappointed to end our trip this way. My favorite meal was at B&B downstairs.

Had heard good things and wanted to stop by before seeing a show however the hostess was on a major power trip and wouldn't even FATHOM letting us sit at the completely empty bar in the completely empty restaurant (no joke this was 5pm and there were maybe 3 people in the entire thing). All we wanted were some appetizers and drinks and they wouldn't even let us in because they were "completely booked" that night and people were coming "at any second". Since when do restaurants book spots at the bar?? We were completely incredulous and the hostess could not have been ruder. She definitely gets off on shooing people away, but honey this isn't an exclusive club it's the Cake Boss's restaurant...

Awesome, awesome, awesome.  That is how I would describe every aspect of this restaurant.  My wife is a huge cake boss fan, and we were told Buddy opened a restaurant.  Of course, she thought we should try it and I was glad she forced the issue.   We started with grandmas meatballs, and they were tender and delicious.  Followed this up with the Lasagne and I will say that I am a bit of a Lasagne snob and am very picky.  Up to this visit, I openly stated that my home made lasagne was the best I have ever had, and I now have to admit that Buddy's was a bit better.  A very healthy portion that I could not finish, and the mix of cheeses, meats, pasta, spices and sauce was a true delight.

The waiter we had was great and was extremely helpful with the menu and wine choices.  I would suggest to anyone to go here for a good hearty, filling meal.  Great job Buddy!
A bit hard to find but worth it. Good food and good value for money. I just wish the staff was a but more attentive

Great service by the service staff. Recommending all the food and wine to us. The starters Buratta salad is great, as well as the calamari. We loved our prawn pasta. Amazing. Will definitely come back again.

Had the lunch special. Chicken Parm was delicious. Also came with tomato basil soup. Prob one of the best versions I've ever had. Very tasty. Appetizer main course and dessert for under $22. Very good deal and worth the price.

First of all, very hard place to find. It's tucked in a lone hallway across from RockBar and of course Carlos Bakery. Went to Carlos to get a couple pastries and decided to poke in and see what this place has to offer.

Went for an early dinner with my wife and was seated by the window in the back next to what im guessing is a party room. View was amazing, service mediocre, food a little high priced (the strip) but overall not bad at all. I had the osso buco my wife had the carbonara and we started with a panzanella salad. Server was pretty absent for the most part, but the view made for good conversation and weren't in any hurry. Overall i wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but if i found myself stuck in the Venetian i might wonder back over.

We had an amazing time here for brunch... if I could give it six stars I would! We were lucky to get Charlie as our server... he was amazing! He knew what I wanted before I asked for it... ten stars for him! You should definitely come here... ask for Charlie!

Went for a birthday celebration and they made it nice with Happy Birthday written in chocolate on the dessert that my daughter selected. Food was fantastic--cheesy garlic bread to die for, meatballs yummy, eggplant parm and dad's bucatini great. Flatbread pizza wonderful too. Portions are very generous. Several people had chicken piccata or chicken marsala and said there was too much chicken but that's a good thing! Had cannoli and warm nutella cake for dessert--great!

Now my concerns---service left a lot to be desired starting with the bar. We arrived early and had drinks then were ready to move to dinner but the bar made a huge thing of needing to close out our tab there first (3 drinks, one of which was a happy hour drink, so not a big tab!). Okay that's fine but then it took forever to get the waitress to come so we could close out. Not good.... and then at our table the waiter was very nice (Rocko) but not very efficient nor was his helper. We had to ask for olive oil and vinegar for the bread and they brought one for the table of 6 so we asked for another and never got it. Later in the evening we asked for two decaff coffees and those never came. 

We were not in a hurry so it was fine but they need to look into these issues. Would definitely go back for the great food!

The most uncomfortable, worst dining experience I've ever had. 

We (a group of 4) were seated in the "lounge" area near the bar because they didn't have any regular tables available. It was like sitting at a coffee table to eat dinner. Between that and the giant  LED screen outside the window blinding half of our party, it was quite uncomfortable. We were there a good 20 minutes before the waiter came to take our drink orders and it went downhill from there. 

The garlic bread was disgusting, and the chicken parm tasted like a frozen TV dinner. 

And that brings us to the service... Our waiter was the rudest server I have ever had. I was on a business trip and needed to have the checks split, which took him 3 tries and about 25 minutes to get right. Then, when he didn't bring me an itemized receipt (which I need for business trip expenses), I asked for one and the reaction I received was rolled eyes and gritted teeth. He did eventually bring it, but it was served with a lot of unnecessary attitude. 

I would give 0 stars if I could.

OMG!!!! My wife is a HUGE fan of cake boss we have been to Buddy's cake shop in Hoboken and she has been to a decorating class at Lackawanna, so Buddy V's was next on her list. She made a reservation for a Sunday night lucky as they were really busy. We were seated within 5 mins of arrival at a table beside the kitchen, within 2 mins our waiter came over to offer us a quieter table in the corner near the window and had our drinks within 5 mins. I ordered caesars salad for appetiser my wife had Grandmas meatballs, both meals were amazing you could see the herbs in the meatballs and the flavour was incredible, my Caesars salad was fresh and croutons were not to crunchy but fresh. We ordered off a theatre special menu which was $38 each for a 3 course meal which we thought was pretty cheap ( being from Australia its hard to find an entree for around that price so this was cheap for us).
