My Entree was chicken parma and my wife had Buddy SNR Bucatini carbonara, dessert was Nutella cake and a cannoli which we took desserts back to hotel room as we were full from our mains. All in all this restaurant was AMAZEBALLS  we will be returning again in the future and to top it off we went to Carlos bakery  right across from the restaurant.

Beware alcohol is pricey....

BONUS our waiter looked like THE ROCK!!!!!
Awesome!  Food was some of the best Italian we've had, Krystal took great care of us, price was unexpectedly reasonable and atmosphere/music was enjoyable. Will come back.
Can't wait to come back tomorrow!   Michele, Adam and the entire staff are fantastic!
Incredible food. Amazing sauce. Our server was Mourad, and he was so knowledgeable about the restaurant and it's history.  We will be back!

Lasagna was great , caesar salad had these incredible croutons made from polenta. Service staff was really great but our waiter was pushy and a little rude. Kept trying to force us to have the family meal, when we declined dessert he kept telling us full or not we had to have it. When one of the kids asked about a dish he told them when he was young you ate what was put in front of you and explained to us how we care to much what they (children) think. Overall food and atmosphere was great ...maybe we just weren't getting the waiters spence of humor.

LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS RESTRAUNT!  Food was so delicious, and the waiters/waitresses were super nice and helpful.  Was great for lunch and dont get me started on the canoli's....  DELISH!  I will deffinately be returning!

Buddy V's was fantastic!  We had the meatballs, grilled octopus, salami and cheese plate, osso buco, veal parm chop and the "lobster" for dessert.  Great service, no wait with reservations!  Will return!  We live in Vegas and some strip restaurants are over rated.  However I do recommend Buddy's!!

My husband and I had the chicken parm and lasagna, he said it was one of the best if not the best chicken parm he'd ever had, and I absolutely loved the lasagna. And we both agree the Nutella cake and salted caramel ice cream is up there with one of the top desserts we've ever had. And our waiter Giorgio was wonderful he took care of us with a great friendly smile and personality.

Really great atmosphere, great food, service was great, a little over priced, but it is Vegas. I had the shrimp scampi and he had the lasagna, both were excellent! We decided we would definitely come back here again but maybe only once in a great while.
Best service ever. They treat you like family. And the food is to die for. It's amazing all the way from the antipastos to the main entree. So so delicious.

I had very bad experience here. The price is a little bit high?but it tastes good. The most worst things that I want to say is the poor serice. The serious woman waiter wrote the final total payment for me and asked me to sign my name. She wrote 25% tips for me and she did not even smile to me. Maybe I look like Asian and she think that I would never come here twice. After she asked me to sign my name for paying?she just left and did not give me a chance to ask her the question. Maybe I look young and Asian. I am studying in America and I just finished my final. I want to have great time in Las vegas?but this experience really made me upset. I just want to share my true experience here. I would never come here again. Thank you.

what an amazing dinner and unexpected surprise!!!  I took my wife here for her birthday thinking what else than the "Cake  Boss" can suffice for her birthday celebration.  We were seated and after a few minutes our server Georgio approached our table.  unbelievably upbeat and personable.  We were blown away by his descriptions of the menu items and took his recommendations wholeheartedly, and it was amazing.  His table service was incredible while making us laugh the WHOLE time!!  At the end he sang to my wife in Italian as she sat there ready to burst with tears of joy.  By far more memorable than her last birthday where we spent 3 times the amount and half the quality of food and service.  Thank you for the super memorable night Georgio and the Buddy V staff.....The Klausberg Family

Being a spaghetti lover, I naturally wanted to try Buddy V's. My fiance and I were able to be seated right away without a reservation, but we did go on a Monday evening so that may be why. I wish we were seated at another table because the waitress we had got on our nerves. My fiance and I do not drink, so when asked if we wanted any alcoholic drinks, we declined. Our waitress looked at us like we were from outer space and make little comments the rest of the night about us not having a drink or two. I thought it was very rude of her to do so. The food was tasteful, but slightly expensive for what you get. I've had spaghetti that's been more flavorful before, but the garlic bread was out-of-this-world good. The atmosphere is calm and the decor is very nice. Overall, I would eat at Buddy V's again, but would order something different than spaghetti.

I was pleasantly surprised tonight!  Everything about our time here truly couldn't have been any better!  We were greeted by the hostess and only waited a few min to be seated for our reservation.  Peter, our server came right over and took our drink order - he was awesome!  He helped me choose my entree, the seared scallops ... which were beyond incredible.  They were served with polenta and shrimp - it was all cooked perfectly.  Polenta was creamy and a fantastic side with the scallops and shrimp.  The sear on the scallop was just right ~ they were tender and very fresh.  For dessert I decided on the butterscotch creme brûlée - again, it was beyond perfect!  Holy cow!  Creamy, rich, just enough butterscotch flavor and the caramelized sugar on top with the pecan short bread cookies... I just couldn't stop eating-even after I was full!  The manager stopped by our table - she thanked us for being there and asked if there was anything we needed or had questions about.  Peter was attentive without being intrusive - he was well versed in all aspects of the menu from starters to drinks to desserts.  I am already excited to plan my next trip here.

FYI - this restaurant is across from Carlos' Bakery. I made a reservation for dinner beforehand. Pros... Super friendly service, great ambiance, and the food was tasteful (the cheese ravioli = yummy)! The only slight complaint: the server picked up my friend's unfinished plate too early and didn't bother to ask if she wanted to take it to-go (she's a local). Anyway, I must return for the Italian Birthday Cake!

Really good Italian food. My kids loved it especially the view of the city we got. We waited for almost an hour for our table but that's our fault for not making reservations. Waiter was very kind but didn't come as much as I'd like. I kept running out of beer and would have gotten more than two if he had came by more. Their grilled octopus was great and the Sunday gravy was pretty good.

Omg YUM. This place is so good. Perfectly cooked pasta. Fresh Cesar salads with homemade croutons. The decor is adorable and the service is wonderful. Not overly expensive either. Then you can go across the walkway and get homemade desserts from Carlos Bakery. I wish we had Buddy V's in So. Cal!
Truly the best Sunday Gravy I've had in awhile!  Would highly recommend their food to anyone.  They even beat out that 3 star Michelin chef Gordon Ramsey!

We showed up for a snack just as happy hour started. The waitress really sold us on the sangria, but it ended up tasting pretty bitter. 
The gnocchi was weird. Very bread-like, not your typical starchy pasta. The taste was forgettable. 
The wife thought the mac&cheese carbonara just tasted like bacon, but the other two at our table thought it was great (maybe they just like bacon lol).
And the sliders were pretty normal. Nothing to write home about. 
I found it weird that the happy hour specials were only available in the lounge. Maybe that's normal in Las Vegas/America but it caught us off guard.

Restaurant week provided the perfect excuse to try Buddy V's. We dined with a group of nine. Service was a bit sluggish at times, but otherwise attentive. They started us with delicious herbed focaccia which paired well with oil and vinegar. I only wish they left the bottles on the table so we could help ourselves. We didn't know upon ordering, but draft beers in the 20 oz and Liter sizes come in a souvenir glass with $9 refills (the cost of a pint). So, that was a nice surprise when ordering a second round. 

The restaurant week menu is $40.15 and it came with choice of appetizer, entree and dessert. The majority of the table ordered Grandma's Meatballs, made with beef, veal and pork. They were tender and juicy, the marinara sauce was nicely balanced and flavorful. I was quite pleased. Likely, the second best meatball in town. Those that had the Panzanella Salad seemed satisfied, the mozzarella was very fresh. 

The table tried each available entree: Pasta Bolognese, Sea Bass, Carbonara, and Chicken Parmesan. Each were beautifully prepared and damn tasty. My Sea Bass was perfectly seasoned and brightened with a spritz of lemon, the side salad was fresh and light, which was welcomed since I was already pretty full. The chicken parm came with a nice helping of pasta and two lightly breaded baked cutlets topped with mozzarella and provolone cheeses. The pasta across the board was the ideal al dente. 

And for dessert we had a choice of tiramisu or cannoli. Both were well executed and scrumptious. I loved dipping the lady fingers into the layers of the creamy tiramisu. The cannoli was filled end to end with sweet ricotta; no hollow center. 

I was a little skeptical, but dinner was delicious. Many celebrity chef restaurants fail to deliver, but that's not the case here. It has good eats and casual charm. If you have the opportunity, there's still time to check out the restaurant week menu which is an absolute steal. It's well worth navigating the labyrinth that is the Venetian. Don't park at Venetian like we did, I believe Palazzo self parking would provide better access.

Second time here for another visit to vegas, and I absolutely love this place!  The portions are huge (the first time there was just too much leftovers), so order an entree per person if you really want to stuff yourselves.  Be sure to save room for dessert.  The tiramisu is very unique and not too sweet -- perfect for me, maybe for you?

I visited Buddy V's not too Iong ago and this is what I thought...

Pros: friendly service, family friendly, big portions, great prices and live band playing while you dine...

Cons: Few items on menu and long wait...


However, Buddy V's is highly recommended and a must go to restaurant when visiting Las Vegas. Buddy V's is located in the Venetian. FYI...I always back up my reviews with pictures...the dishes in the pictures are the surf and turf and lasagna.

Everything was like eating at mommom sophie's. From the chopped salad to the garlic bread and bowls of fresh made meatballs!  Recommend it to anyone!  And im going across to carlo's bake shop for a cup cake!

This is a good plan to take the family for grub. Typical American version of Italian food, nothing special. Would have preferred bread with linguini and clams over breadsticks. Decent liguini dish but nothing to be wowed about.

As I am a big fan of Cake Boss, I was looking forward to dinner at Buddy V's Ristorante. This is a family restaurant in Venetian. So  I gave it a try.

I ordered Margarita pizza, Cesar Salad and Garlic bread. The pizza was not good for me. It was not what I expected from Italian pizza and was expensive for its size. The Cesar Salad was not bad though. It was with warm, chewy croutons, with a hint of fennel in the salad and plenty of freshly grated Parmesan cheese. The garlic bread was not bad either. 

Overall, not bad, but there are a lot of better restaurants in the town with this price range.

All the servers were excellent I believe the main servers name was Gianni but his two helpers and the hostesses were fantastic too. This is one of my new favorite restaurants. I have to drink tonic water for my leg cramps and they made sure my glass was never empty. Also the main server recommended a fantastic drink we enjoyed every moment of the evening. Great job and the service was second to none.

Absolutely amazing. Some of the best Italian food I've ever had !! from start to finish service was amazing and the food was worth every part of the 5 stars. I would definitely come back here again and recommend it to friends

Wow. I was wondering if Buddy Valastro was going to be a sell out by lending his name to restaurants and bakeries across the US. I can definitely say no. I judge Italian restaurants by their sauce and their meatballs. I know both being from the Philly/NJ/NY area. I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. I was served a very generous, steaming portion. The presentation was lovely. It was very fresh. The meatballs were outstanding. Firm, flavorful and delicious. The spaghetti was perfectly al dente, and the sauce was as if it came from an Italian grandmother's kitchen. The service was very very good. Friendly, knowledgable and attentive to any need. Bravo Buddy Valastro!

Second time going to Buddy's this year. Both times the food and service were great. Went for lunch and the menu isn't huge but the meals were great. Had their meatball sub (meatballs were great!) and their chicken sandwich and we really liked both. Finished it off with a cannoli - lets just say you can tell why he's famous for his cannolis.
Food was really good. Pasta, salads, appetizers and bread  all yummy!!! Service was so so. Bakery had a small line. But worth the wait for all the goodies.

Did enjoy my food with the exception of the chicken parmigans burnt ends. Luckily portion was a good serving that I didn't feel that I was robbed of my meal will go again likely to try another menu item.

The food was great. Had the chicken a la Vodka, Panzanella, bruschetta, carbonara Mac n cheese, and a lobster tail to finish things off. Food wasn't really bland as a prior review said. The apps needed a little salt, but all else was good. Service was great and not slow as mentioned in other reviews. Prices are reasonable and portions aren't gargantuan so you have some room for desert. Very neat place and I'd go again for sure. The wife liked it as well. I'd give it 4 1/2 stars if it was an option.

AMAZING! This place is delicious. The service is fantastic. And you have to try the CANNOLIS! I had the chicken parm for dinner and it is easily a plate for two; you will not leave there hungry. At. All. 10/10

Overall the food was good, the service was friendly, but a bit bumpy and the wine was disappointing.  
For appetizers, we shared the mac & cheese, salumi and mozzarella en carozza.  These were all solid dishes, with the mozzarella probably being my favorite.  Our entrees were brought out before we were even half way through the appetizers, but when I said something they took them away.  I was a little worried that our meals would be sitting under a heat lamp, but kudos to the staff for bringing us fresh dishes when the time came.
I thought the wine list was rather lame.  I like wine, but am not an expert, so when I recognize a bunch of the wines as the variety I can find at my local Smith's, I am a bit let down.  I finally ordered a bottle of an Italian variety I liked, but when it came time for the sample taste I was almost tempted to refuse it.  It wasn't spoiled, but sure did taste as though it had been stored at the wrong temperature.
For entrees, we tried the lasagne, Dad's Bucatini and spaghetti and meatballs.  Again, all the dishes were good.  I especially loved the Bucatini and would get it again.  Desserts were not quite as good as I expected.  The cannoli were fresh, but the filling was lighter than the ricotta I expected and overall had a strong cinnamon oil taste.  The Nutella cake was your standard lava cake that has been around since the 80s.  The coffee was nice and strong.

Our initial plan was to stop by Carlos' Bakery at Venetian, buy some cannoli and leave. However the line was kind of long and we decided just to have an early dinner at Buddy V's cross the hall and get the deserts at the restaurant.

The hostess was courteous and the waitress was very nice. We ordered Calamari appetizer, clam linguini and mac & cheese. Linguini was al dente and kids liked the mac & cheese. But the deserts were the reason we stopped by. We ordered cannoli and lobster tail. Sure they did not disappoint, the cannoli's filling was fresh and crust was crispy. The lobster tail's skin was crunch and filling goes very well with the fresh fruits. 
The price was the average Las Vegas casino meal price and the overall it was pretty good dining experience.

Food: A
Service: A
Ambiance: B
Price: A-
Layout: B+
Location: A


Sat in the bar lounge area. Host welcomed us in even with PBR tallboys in hand. Felt at home.
Ordered a pizza and calamari app.
Great calamari, excellent service.
Can't wait to try the other items on the menu.
Will definitely be back.

Gr8 restaurant hidden away in the Venetian. Went for lunch and service was fast and friendly. Ordered the chicken parm and it was awesome!! Not the biggest portion of pasta but more than enough chicken. Didn't make it to the pastry side but it was very busy over there. Def will go again.

We sat at the Bar and the 2 men Group   Nick and Howie play awesome music.  Kathy the bartender has a great attitude and a full time smile. We had tapas at the bar great calamari.      Nice ambiance. Ra ra ra

Great food, poor service.  Sunday gravy was delicious and loved the piccata.  Birthday cake, cannoli, and lobster tail were on point.  The beef tenderloin was on the rare side for a medium.  Kudos to the kitchen.

For the service, I'll keep it short. Just our luck as first time diners to get the waitress in training on a Saturday night.  It would have been tolerable if she had any personality or acted if she even cared about our experience there.  Never engaged us, we had to continually ask for refills on water,  and brought me the wrong drink.  Trainer right at her side, for what? I blame the management and trainer for this.   Servers in training should be up to speed for the weekend dinner service before being put there.  When customers leave satisfied with the food but disgruntled over the service after paying nearly three bills for a mediocre dining experience, you end up losing a repeat customer.  

You want great reviews and repeat business? Then don't use the trial by fire method with new servers and send them to charm school first.

A client lunch with great food and conversation. Give this establishment a try when in Las Vegas. 

Had the salad with shrimp. Was fresh, fast, and tasty. Great service and staff was attentive. 

Enjoy!!

The food was delicious and the service was courteous, fast, and friendly. An even better bonus: Buddy himself was there that day to film for his show! He stopped by every table to greet everyone, ask how the food was, and to take pictures. The sangria was great, as were the panzanella, meatball sub, and canolis. Not saying this because we met Buddy, as I already formed my opinion on the food before we met him. Great experience, and I would definitely recommend if you're on the strip in Vegas.

We recently visited Buddy V's before seeing a show on a Saturday. The restaurant didn't seem too busy for a Saturday night, the view was pretty nice as the sun was setting. The noise level was a little high and we weren't thrilled by the seating. A lot of the tables were up against a very long bench seat which they all shared. This created a situation where we felt like we were having dinner with the two sets of people on each side of us.

Our waitress wasn't too attentive, but our bus boy was pretty awesome! The food was really good and the potion size was huge. After eating my lasagne it looked as if I didn't even touch it. 

The most awesome part was the dessert... I love canolis! They were fabulous!! Perfect hint of cinnamon in the pastry and super yummy cream! My husband has the tiramisu which he said was also great.

Not the greatest... Back to the basics!
I was told the there was a steak/arugula salad as an option for dinner. I am not a fan of arugula, so I asked to have it on romaine (as they had a Caesar salad on the menu).  He asked the chef and the chef said no. I then said, can you just give me the Caesar salad and place a filet on it. He said sure. The entree came as follows... One plate with a filet (6oz) and one small bowl of Caesar salad. I asked what is this??? The server proceeded to tell me that the chef did not think a filet would go nicely on a Caesar. I told the server that I ordered the meal and not him. This really frustrates me. Cater to the customer, especially when this is a middle of the road restaurant. I also had (2) vodka and soda with a lime. The third one came with lemon. I asked why and where was my lemon. The server said that he did not want the drinks messed up? What?!? This place needs some flavor added to the meals, re-training of the staff and the chef to have a new attitude. I miss the First!!! The First was the restaurant prior.

Ate dinner here last night and let me say..it was perfect!. We did make reservations even on a Tuesday because we had theatre tickets and did not wanna be late. We asked to sit at a booth by the window but was informed that was for guests with a party of 6 but she did seat us at another booth that was smaller. Ok no big.
 Our waiter was excellent and very prompt! His name was Chaz according to the ticket. Great service, very knowledgeable about the menu and had great recommendations. He also never let our drinks get very low because he was bringing out a fresh one which I feel is hard for other servers to do anymore. I opted for the Margherita pizza while my mom got the Shrimp Scampi. While waiting they had fresh bread that just came out of the oven and was delicious.
 Our food was great and looked good too :) they also start live music at 530 so that was a nice touch. After we were stuffed from dinner we had to look at the dessert menu because let's face it it's Buddys! The dessert menu had pictures of Buddy and his family which was a wonderful touch! We ordered Lisa's nutella cake and holy crap it was heavenly! I highly recommend it.

All in all we had a great experience and would definitely be back!

I'm a big fan of Buddy's but not a fan of Buddy Vs... over priced for mediocre food... the highlight was the garlic bread...spaghetti was runny... pizza was a little too hard... hopefully Carlos bakery will be better... stick to what you know Buddy. ..

We had a the tomato soup which was absolutely delicious, and Aunt something's bread and cheese thing. The bread and cheese thing was good but not great. The drink were very good as well. One of us had a steak, which was cooked perfectly and absolutely delicious. The other, got a Margherita pizza which honestly kind of spoiled the whole meal. The dough was meh, and the toppings were almost non existent. Only about 20% of the pizza had cheese on it, there were 3-4 tomato slices and basil leaves spread across the 8 slices. The worst thing however was the sauce, my first impression when I tasted it was that they had used sewer water and canned tomatoes to make. The whole thing was soggy with this sauce, which was simply gross. It's a shame, because the rest of the meal was great :/

Went to happy hour and sat in the bar. The staff was nice but there was confusion about getting the happy hour menu. Ordered drinks and watched them sitting on the bar until I got up to get them. 

Finally spoke to the assistant general manager, Adam who listened to our concerns & he was kind enough to buy us a second round of cocktails. Service suddenly approved dramatically. The meatball sliders were fabulous & the drinks generous. 

No place is perfect, but I respect a place that goes out of its way to make things right. I'll definitely return.
The best chicken parm there is! And their cannolis are so delicious. You must eat here in Vegas!
HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! And the food was not great either. I would be happier grabbing some burgers and fries at In-N-Out instead of this crap.
Ate there for lunch and it was perfect. Had the mozzarella bread for starters and the chicken parm for the meal. We added some meatballs to it and it was out of this world.

The food was great. I had the cheese ravioli with chicken added. It came within 10 minutes and was amazing! Our waiter was also friendly. He made sure we had everything we needed! Great cheese bread with vinegar and oil before the meal!

All I can say is the best!!
Lasagna is bomb!!! Spaghetti is perfect no to saucy but just right!!!
Lobster tail and cannoli are sooooooo goooood!!
I wish there was in LA!!!!

I had dinner here early on a Sunday evening. Get here early enough and you can snag one of the tables overlooking the strip.

I had the "Sunday Gravy" which is a variety of things - sausage, meatballs, lamb, etc. served with pasta and red sauce. Great dish and very filling. Dining companion enjoyed her chicken parm. Pricing is reasonable for the strip, but obviously you can get cheaper Italian food in a locals restaurant. Service was good. I'll be back.

I would have given 5 stars as the food was great and service was outstanding but while eating my linguini and clams I bit into sand in my clams. Clams need to be cleaned better.
The garlic toast was awesome. Caprese salad is a must. Overall great place to eat.

Had an early dinner here last weekend. The service was outstanding and the good was good too. The Focaccia bread they serve for their bread service was moist and flavorful. I took our server's suggestion and ordered the Chicken Parm dinner. The pasta was good but not great. The chicken however was cooked perfectly. I would certainly recommend this spot to anyone looking for a new place for Italian in Vegas.

Best Italian food I've had!  The sauce tasted just like my grandmas. Almost like she was in the back making it!  The atmosphere is fun. We didn't order drinks because we're recovering from the previous night but the bread to the entree was delicious! Would definitely return when in Vegas!

First thing first - Standout dishes:

- Buddy's Caprese: I am normally not a fan of Caprese salads, but Buddy really nails this one. High quality ingredients, and finely tuned flavors make this a worthwhile starter.

- Cheese Ravioli: I know what you're thinking. "I can get cheese ravioli anywhere." Yes, you can. The great thing about the ravioli at Buddy V's, however, is that it is a perfect companion to Buddy's outstanding roasted tomato sauce. It's bright, tangy, smooth, and well rounded all at the same time. Definitely memorable fare.

- Cannoli: I am normally not what you would call a "fan" of cannoli, but, once again, Buddy has proved me wrong. Most cannoli, in my experience, are disappointing in their grainy, and under-sweetened filling. Not so with these cannoli. Perfectly sweetened, incredibly smooth filling paired with just the right amount of cinnamon in the pastry make these cannoli worth writing home about. (Added perk: After eating at Buddy V's, you can walk right across the hall, and buy a whole box of cannoli from Carlo's Bakery to eat back at the hotel if you are so inclined.)

Now, to business. There is definitely no shortage of Italian food on the Las Vegas Strip, but Buddy V's is definitely a major standout. Even among all of the other celebrity chef restaurants to be found in Vegas, the Cake Boss is definitely holding his own.

My wife and I stopped by for lunch one afternoon, and had a great time. Our experience was so good, though, that we went back for dinner two days later. For lunch we just stopped by, but for dinner we made reservations through OpenTable. Neither time was the place so busy one would need reservations in order to avoid a wait, however.

Here are some highlights of Buddy V's worth noting:

- The service at Buddy V's is excellent. They are easily on par with restaurants with much higher price points.

- Having worked in food service, I am hyper-sensitive about cleanliness. I had absolutely no complaints here, however. The entire restaurant is very clean, comfortable, and inviting.

- The pricing of most menu items is very reasonable in comparison with many similar Vegas eateries.

- The whiskey/scotch selection at Buddy V's bar is truly impressive. It's not hard to find a bar that serves Johnnie Walker Black anywhere, but one that serves Johnnie Walker Green, Gold, and Blue is tough to find at any price point.

- Unlike most restaurants in the Venetian, Buddy V's is right near an entrance making it an easy place to duck in for a meal without having to stray too far from the strip.

Final pro tip: Be sure to note on your reservation that you are celebrating a birthday, if that is the case. They have some fun, no-loud-obnoxious-singing-involved surprises for birthday-folk. I would imagine the same is true for most other celebrations as well.

My wife and I were dying to go to Buddy's new place in Vegas. So I made reservations ahead of time and couldn't wait. We went earlier in the day just so we could know where in the mall it was located. I'm glad we did since it was off a corridor from the main forum shops. We liked how the place looked. Well set up and inviting. They had a long row of outside tables in front of the restaurant. 

So we go to the place and they found our reservation and went to seat us. They brought us into the bar and sat us in the corner with a view of the strip. I didn't mind the view but if I made reservations why was I sitting at the bar? Kinda of set the mode already. It was not to crowded for a Friday night which we were very surprised when most restaurants are hopping. There were bread stick on the table already but they were prepackaged ones and not from Italy, they were made in New Jersey. 

We wanted the best from Buddy so my wife ordered his wife's linguine and clam sauce. While I had Buddy's chicken rigatoni "ALLA VODKA". My wife's meal was plain and not worth the $26 that they charged for it. It tasted like my wife made it herself nothing fancy or fantastic taste. Mine had maybe 6 pieces of chicken in it and the pasta was kind of chewy. It was like my wife made it also. Not saying I wouldn't eat it but not real fine dining. We have been to several restaurants in Vegas since we go 4-6 times a year. So I'm no newbie. 

Oh I missed the garlic bread we ordered before the meal. Which consisted of three pieces for 9. Nothing special and little over priced again. My wife and I agreed Buddy should of opened a café type restaurant and not fine dining. The food is more family food but over priced for Vegas. It would be totally packed everyday if the prices were lower and family orientated. 

But not to jam on Buddy over his place. We had the Italian birthday cake and let me tell you it was no disappointment. We loved it and that what Buddy is famous for Cakes. I wish he had a bakery with the restaurant because that would go no stop. Hope this helps you guys out. thanks

Average food, terrible staff. 
Las Vegas caters to numerous business travelers, yet the staff at Buddy V's couldn't figure out how to provide me with an itemized receipt and seemed bothered by the fact that I even asked for one. They also screwed up a simple request to help me celebrate a team member's birthday. 
Whoever manages that restaurant should find something else to do. Because he or she isn't very good at managing restaurants.

4 stars for food

I had the Chicken Parm/Garlic Bread/Caesar salad

2 stars for service

20 minute wait so we sat at the bar...big mistake, I think they forgot about us or didn't have enough staff

Needless to say, worth stopping in!

Loved the pasta (tried the ravioli,  carbonara,  and spaghetti).  The bread with olive oil and vinegar was tasty too.  There were tiny sticks on the table too.  I have had better chicken parmesan at Maggianos.  The caeser salad was probably the best I have ever had.  By the time our desert came I was already bursting at the seams.....

More like 3.5 stars. Stopped by for restaurant week $20.18 lunch. Service was great and you can't beat the price for a 3 course meal. Caesar salad was unremarkable but the polenta croutons it was topped with were fantastic! They had a hint of lemon that really made them stand out. The tomato basil soup was also a hit. For entrees we had chicken parm & spaghetti meatballs. The chicken was moist and flavorful as were the meatballs. The pasta was cooked perfect but the sauce was just average. Not something I would want again. We were too full for dessert & got it go. Totally enjoyed it later!! 

I might return for happy hour. I heard they have the croutons as an appetizer on the menu.
Came here on our last night in Vegas and had a great time! The food was soooo good. You won't leave hungry I promise! I'd come back again.
The best Italian food I've ever had in my life. The environment and service is amazing. This is a dinner night my family and I will remember

Happy hour 4.30-6.30pm 7 days/week offers $5 small plates and $4 prosecco/wine/sangria. 

Recommend: 
- granny meatballs flavorful, smooth, hearty
- calamari crispy yet juicy
- ricotta cheese light, goes well with grilled bread

Ok: 
- sausage pepper sliders

Since we were in Las Vegas to celebrate my husband's birthday I was in search for a great Italian restaurant, either on The Strip or not far from it. Most of the Italian restaurants we've picked thus far have been quite good.  Buddy V's received great reviews from various sites so we made reservations there and gave it a try.  It exceeded our expectations!

First timers or those not familiar with the location of restaurants in the Grand Canal Shoppes should allow time to navigate.  Buddy V's can be a bit hard to find but worth the search!  Upon entering the restaurant we found the ambiance handsome and comfortable...neither too elegant or casual.  Views of The Strip were an added bonus.   The staff was courteous and efficient.

Being Italian food aficionados, we look for entrees that'd are a flavor-packed indulgence when dining out. We asked to split the Caesar Salad, which was kindly plated on two plates, and very good.  The fresh warm cubes of polenta in place of regular croutons were a tasty option.   The warm bread that came with our meal was also very good. I ordered "My Dad's Bucatini Carbonara" and my husband ordered "Valastro Sunday Gravy" which includes meatballs, sausage, lamb, pork and a bowl of rigatoni in a delicious red sauce.  Both pasta dishes fulfilled our culinary wishes -- generous portions that were delicious!  (reasonably priced for on the Las Vegas Strip)

One of the reviews I read suggested letting them know if it's your birthday, which we did, and were treated with a delicious dessert with "Happy Birthday" drizzled on the plate.  Our meal was excellent from start to finish!

Just went there and WOW was it good and I mean really good. Me daughter and myself had dinner there. Simple meals but explosive flavor. She had the cheese ravioli and I had the chicken Parmesan with spaghetti. The flavor that burst inside your mouth never stopped. We were pretty much smiling throughout the entire meal. Me beer was cold. Both beers. And the garlic bread appetizer with marinara was the perfect prelude to the entire meal. The service was really nice. We felt comfortably serviced. The environment with the background music selection made you feel like you were at home eating your grandmamas cooking. And they were staffed properly. All very important things to look for. I would put the pricing star to a level three though. Won't be back for awhile but let me say that if you are in Vegas and are looking for some killer fare Buddy V's is a must have. By yourself or with somebody else. DO IT

Awesome choice for brunch. For buffet brunch and unlimited drinks (beer, mimosa, sangria, bellinis, wine) $50. Doesn't get much better than that. Went for a bachelorette brunch and our service was incredible. Our drinks never got less than half full and he started leaving pitchers on the table for us--truly bottomless. Our server even made us to go cups of our drink of choice!! The brunch itself was excellent, the Mac and cheese was to die for and so was the dessert table. I'll be including Buddy V's for brunch on all my Vegas trips from now on!
BEST. FOOD. EVER. and the red bull drink is absolutely addicting. I will return to vegas JUST for buddy v's.

Good food, nice presentation, great service even though it was crowded. But truthfully, for what we spent, I expected it to be a little better than it was. Fun to go once, but probably would not go there again!

What can I say about Buddy V's except that it was absolutely amazing.  My wife and I dined here with my mom and her partner durning a recent trip to Vegas.  We were greeted by a smiling Italian server who explained to us that we could enjoy the food one of two ways.  The first way being just ordering our own thing off the menu and enjoying it like that or secondly we could close our menus sit back and let the restaurant take us on a culinary experience.  We had to go with a culinary experience.  We were amazed.  The firsts course had meatball, calamari a meat and cheese board and a great salad.  Entree was sea bass, chicken and pasta, lasagna and filet and for dessert a Italian cake and their signature lobster tail.  Everything was so good good and service.  Didn't expect a pastry guy to have such good dinner food

Super disappointed in our recent visit to our once beloved Buddy V's. With so many excellent choices in the Vegas culinary field, it's critical to place the upmost importance on customer service if your intention is to remain relevant, not just a mere tourist destination. As always, the food was delicious, atmosphere beautiful and location perfect. However, the customer service has significantly declined. Our waiter was inattentive, bothered by our request to split the check for a party of eight, less than fourth coming with the cost of a birthday treat for our daughter's 16th celebration, incorrectly calculated our ticket (hopefully in error) and expressed his exasperation in an evident and unappreciated fashion. Sadly, I think we will be forced to expand our Italian palate.....

My little sister watches a lot of Cake Boss, so we decided to come here and try Buddy's restaurant as a treat to her. The place is very family-friendly with a relaxed and cozy ambiance. Food is good, but I wouldn't say it was memorable. My family ordered different dishes (chicken parm, caesar salad, buddy's favorite pizza), and I got to try each of them. They were all good and the portion sizes are great, but they weren't rave-worthy.

The service, however, was fantastic. Our waiter was so friendly and helpful, and we really felt like the restaurant was a cozy, family-oriented establishment. The service really made the whole experience more enjoyable - probably enough to come back a second time when I'm in Vegas again with friends or family.

Great food! This might sound funny but, the croutons on the Caesar salad are to die for. I had the sea bass and it was perfectly not a bone in the fish. My husband had the lasagna and it was a very generous portion and delicious.

Came here this past Sunday night to celebrate my sister's bachelorette event in Vegas. There was 10 of us ladies. I must say the ambiance was relaxing, semi formal-casual. Our server Peter was very attentive to our needs. They gave us this fresh rosemary garlic bread with balsamic vinegar and olive oil and it was amazing. We ordered the chicken picatta and added mushrooms and it was quite tasty, chicken marsala, lasagna, linguine with clams, mac and cheese, chicken rigatoni alla vodka, the caprese salad,  caesar salad, and veal marsala. Everything was pleasing to the palate. I also ordered the salted caramel ice cream to go and it was delicious. I would definitely come back here again to get my Italian fix the next time I'm in town.

If you know what authentic Italian food is... Don't go to Buddy V's. For $22 each, (lunch special) you can get an appetizer, main, and desert. While the portions are appropriate, the food itself was not. My meatballs ("grandma's meatballs" appetizer) were great, they tasted homemade! The "Spaghetti Bolognese" was incredibly basic, the sauce tasted like it came from a can, and the spaghetti noodles were simply basic. The biggest disappointment was the cannoli. Obviously I had high expectations not only because of the price, but because of the insane hype that surrounds this restaurant, because of the fact that it is owned by Buddy Valastro and family, from the show Cake Boss, which regularly features and highlights their cannolis as a staple item. It was so incredibly stale on the outside, I had to literally smack it with my knife to knock a chunk off of it to eat, which would have been okay if it wasn't just a greasy, dried up piece of crust. The filling was sub-par as well, I'd have rather had some cool whip inside there, at least it would be somewhat pleasant. Overall, the food was poor.

Our service was phenomenal, both of our waiters/ servers were very kind, fun, and knowledgeable. 

If you're looking for good food, go somewhere else.

I teetered between a 3 and 4... the four because the portion size was good (my linguine with calms had clams in the shell AND chopped inside the pasta,) not huge 5 pound plates of pasta; however, spending $26 for a plate of pasta may turn off a lot of customers - but you're in Vegas. A four because my Drago Rosso cocktail was very good, a touch of spice and the mango garnish was delish. Also enjoyed a regular Caesar salad, but the "croutons" were actually yummy, warm, cubes of polenta, right on! Now for the "eh..." Sunday gravy plate - loved meat variety, but couldn't look over salty sauce. Service was okay, couldn't find her half the time, but when she was there she was attentive and kind, without being over the top. Lastly, I made a reservation, confirmed the next day, and when I showed up at five 'till then said they couldn't find it. A 4 because they said they'd sit us anyway, and we did within 5 minutes, but how do you lose my reservation? Doesn't make me feel like my time was worth it to you if you can't even find my name in your records. Will come back, because that was my second visit and I craved to go back last night. But I will be more open to try a new restaurant next time.
Great food an great service.  Had the meatball sub  and ny friend had the bolognese pasta.  And Danielle was great!

Delicious Sunday Brunch! Be sure to try the meatballs and Italian Sausage. Decor is simple, but well done and the food is home style, simple, but perfectly executed. ONLY because it has the CAKE BOSS name attached to it - dessert could have been a wider selection.

We stopped in and found out they had a Happy Hour Menu with small bites for $5. Must have is the Mac and Cheese. Very very flavorful, creamy and oh so DELISH!!! The peas were perfect and POPPED in your mouth. The panchetta was a perfect contrast to the silky smooth sauce and the crunchy bread crumb top provided a great texture to the top. The meatballs were fantastic and the bread with ricotta cheese was fantastic. Ask for Olive Oil and Balsamic Vinegar on the side. I ordered a melon martini off the drink menu. It was light, bright and strong! Had a wonderful bit of mint and citrus zest throughout. Lastly we rounded out the dinner with the Nutella Cake!! Oh my GOSH!!! I am not a BIG fan on Nutella and ate around the dollop in the center. The cake was extremely moist! The Salted Carmel ice cream that is made in house at their other restaurant was SUPERB!!! Loved the peanut brittle on the bottom. Try each one seperate and after all together you will NOT be disappointed! We sat in the bar by the window and the view was great. Loved the decor with the rolling pins hanging throughout and HUGE beaters mixed in with the lights. We had a great night! Enjoy!

So this is going to be a bit of a longer review covering so much. 

Ambiance:
This restaurant has an incredible energy! I love the display kitchen. So you will see everything being made and exiting the kitchen, if you are near the kitchen. 

Food:
Honestly this menu is one of the best menus. It offers everything from pasta, pizzas, burgers, and everything in between. The quality is incredible too! The chefs have an incredible sense of what flavors go together. 

Service: 
The initial welcome from the host was incredible! She greeted me and inquired about anything that I am celebrating. She then very politely showed us to the table. Now my waitress was a different story. She greeted us nicely at the beginning. However she made us feel very rushed! Like the restaurant was not busy, why are you rushing us? Like her first question wasn't for drinks but rather food we want. Then when we ordered drinks we never got refills on our water until our food came out. Once we finished the main entree, she was quick to try to give us the check until she remembered we are celebrating a birthday. Overall I'm disappointed in the service. 

I still give this 4 stars because it was a great restaurant but had a few bad staff members. Overall I would return but I hope I receive better service next time.
Excellent food. Slow bar service to table. Slow service for check to table.

We ate dinner last night before the George Strait concert, the restaurant is very well decorated and has a nice ambience.  

The service was outstanding, my wife had the ravioli and she did the marinara was very good.  I had the carbonara and it was excellent.  

I would definitely recommend this place for anyone wanting a great dinner for a decent price.

After reading the positive reviews and liking the proximity to our room at the Venetian, I made a dinner reservation here.  We were a little late because we kept getting lost in the maze of the canal shops, but they accommodated us without any problems.  We were seated by the window in the bar area.  Nice view of the strip below, but it was so loud.  Music was already playing at a loud volume, and then it seemed as if they turned it up even more.  So no dinner conversation for us.  We only like to yell at each other when we're angry.  

Lots of choices on the menu, and I almost got meatballs, but I decided to try something else.  The menu had a prix fixed dinner that included a starter, an entree, and a dessert.  So we went with that.  Our starters were the Panzanella salad, and we were served a warm piece of focaccia style bread.  The salad was different than we expected--it contained a lot of greens--but it was still very delicious with fresh buffalo mozzarella and excellent croutons.  My entree was the orecchiette with sausage.  It also contained broccolini and roasted tomatoes.  It was tasty and super satisfying.  My husband's entree was the steak pizzaiolo and it was served with a side of polenta.  It looked good, but my husband was not happy with it.  Difficult to get a steak cooked to his liking outside a steak house.  For dessert, we both chose cannoli.  Very pretty and extremely sweet.  Served with warm chocolate sauce--this part was pretty amazing!  I really enjoyed my food, but it's way too loud inside.

My husband and I come to Vegas often and have been wanting to try this restaurant. Walking towards this place you could smell the aroma of garlic! 
We were seated within minutes and had a great waiter. Wish I could remember his name. He was very friendly and accommodating. He recommended great dishes. We ordered a variety of different foods which were all delicious. 
We sat in a comfortable booth overlooking the whole restaurant and enjoyed watching the chefs cook while we ate. Overall, a great place to eat. Great service, great food. We'll definitely be back!

Make reservations if you want to sit at a real table. We had to sit in the lounge at a high top - not ideal for dinner due to the lack of space. I had the Mac n Cheese Carbonara - delicious, creamy, smoky flavor. Despite sitting in the lounge, they served the full menu and the food was out almost instantly. Great prices for Vegas. Fun eclectic modern decor. Try to get there from 4:30-6:30 for happy hour on appetizers and drinks! I enjoyed a $4 Sangria.

We are back!!! Express lunch was delish as usual. We shared meatballs and caesar salad (love polenta croutons!) Carbonara hands down....they kill it here! Just wish they served bread or soft breadsticks instead if crunchy packaged sticks...Buddy V is a "baker" after all. Need to wipe the sauce off the plate. A tiramasu and canoli to hold us over until next time.
CIAO!

Took the family for lunch as a Christmas treat. Service was good, especially friendly even with three small children including accommodating special requests. We tried the calamari, meatballs, Hoboken chopped salad, carbonara, kids Mac and Cheese and pizza. For dessert we had cannoli, nutella chocolate cake and Cheese & Cake. First, the Nutella Cake is insanely amazing! Everything else was very good as well. Honestly their kids Mac and Cheese was one of all our favorites! It should be available for adults. The meatballs were prefect. Loved the flavor combination of the chopped salad but my 19 year old daughter who likes things simple, thought it was too much. The cheese & Cake, a take on cheesecake was good not super sweet but definitely not the top choice of the three we got.

Good buffet. There wasn't a lot of food but the dishes there were above expectations for a buffet. It is worth the price and especially bottomless drinks, alcohol (almost said alcoholic which is how I'm feeling after 4 days in Vegas lol) is worth the $16.99 price.

Very good Italian restaurant. Great ambience. I got the shrimp pasta and shrimp really big.  It is a little pricey but to be expected for the Venetian. Very romantic setting with fresh food.  House made focaccia bread is a must. Highly recommend!!

Attempted to come here once and couldn't get a reservation.

Second time around was able to get one. 

Place  is very nice and clean. Menu is pretty extensive and you can find most something for everyone, however is a little pricey. I had the eggplant appetizer (for an entree) and was very pleased. The bread they bring your table is addictive it's so good! Service was great. 

Deserts were kind of a let down. I tried the Nutella cake and was kind of let down for the $10 you pay for it. Seemed kind of small and didnt really taste much like Nutella. I was disappointed as buddy is known for his amazing over the top deserts.

The garlic bread appetizer is the best garlic bread ever, hands down. I had the rigatoni alla vodka and my fiancé had the lasagna. Both very good. We also shared the Nutella chocolate cake which was every bite as amazing as it sounds. 
The service was wonderful. As silly as this sounds, my glass was never empty. It drives me nuts when I have to ask for a refill so to have someone always on top of it was wonderful. The waitress did a few weird things like take the drink menu away as soon as we order the first round but otherwise she was wonderful.

Buddy V's place , after watching cake boss I had to try this place on my visit to Vegas and I am glad I did :)

We ordered :
Ice tea : refreshing
Vegetarian Pasta: one of the best I have had till date 
Eggplant parmigiana :  super yum ! 

Service : 5/5
Food : 5/5

Only regret I have is I didn't try the dessert , will have to come back for that :)
Hands down the best Italian food I've ever had! Makes me curious about the bakery now, the lasagna is a must have.

Absolutely love this place! Came here on a Sunday with a girlfriend and we both loved the food.

We were running a bit late so we called the restaurant and they were so nice and had no issues pushing our reservation back by about 15 minutes.

Once seated we ordered some wine and sparkling water. I know this is something very minor but I loved that the sparkling water was nice and cold -- you'd be surprised how many restaurants give it at room temperature. We immediately ordered entrees and I ordered the Chicken Rigatoni Alla Vodka and my friend ordered the Bucatini Carbonara. Both of them were so so good. My Rigatoni had just the right amount of sauce and it was incredibly flavorful and they gave Parmesan cheese and red chili flakes on top and that just added the perfect touch. I had a few bites of my friends Bucatini and it was so delicious -- usually restaurants use spaghetti to make Carbonara but using Bucatini was such a great touch. I love that the egg was mixed perfectly in without scrambling it. My only regret is that I wish we had been more hungry to eat more!

I've tried A LOT of restaurants in Vegas but this is one where I will definitely return!!

My wife loves Creme Brulee.  She has it at any restaurant that serves it.  I like Creme Brulee.  My wife likes butterscotch.  For me is butterscotch is just ok.   Who would have ever thought we would both love the Buddy V's Butterscotch Creme Brulee so much we have it every time we are in Vegas.  Multiple times!   Now Creme Brulee at other restaurants just doesn't quite measure up.  The Grandma's Meatballs are also the best I have ever had.  The Mediterranean Sea Bass was good.  Service was excellent.
Poor service, mediocre food. With so many options in Vegas, there are many better choices

Surprisingly fantastic.  I was skeptical since Buddy is not only a TV chef, but one known for cakes and pastries.  I'm glad I gave this place a try though.  It was fantastic.  The food was well above average, and greatly helped by more than reasonable pricing.  Generous portions too.  The staff was friendly and very helpful.  I'm hard-pressed to think of a better meal on the strip that's in at-all the same price range (dinner for two came to under $100)

Casual place. Smells are fantastic. We sat at a window and had a nice view of the strip. Eats okay. Had the veal marsala. I hate to say it, but it is true, this doesnt hold a candle to the same dish at Caraba's.
My favorite Italian restaurant on the strip so far-the orecchiette pasta with Italian sausage was great

great service! - we told our waiter we were running late for the blue man group show and she was able to get our food out very quickly! 
the my mother in laws shrimp scampi was great. DEFINITELY get the garlic bread! so delicious. and the meatballs were nice too. these 3 items were plenty for 4 girls. awesome food!

Ordered their cannoli dessert since on Buddy's "Cake Boss" T.V. show, it's the best thing ever. Tried it, but it was very stale. I'll give it another try next time to taste their main dish to see if they're any good but the real reason why I'll be returning is their phenomenal service.

We came here for dinner on a Sunday without a reservation; they were busy but we only waited for about 20 mins. Our waiter brought us the drinks and dinner menu and took our orders right away. I ordered the creamy tomato chicken pasta (forgot the exact name), my hubby ordered a meat source pasta and we ordered a Mac and cheese for our toodler. Before the meal, they gave us a piece of freshly baked bread to start with. Our meals came fast and it looked and tasted very good. We finished everything fast. Our waiter was very attentive and the restaurant was nice with live music. 

oyster bar at harrah's, this restaurant only charged me 9 dollars for the kid meal with a much better service and food. And you charged us 11 bucks for a plain white rice and a piece of dry chicken breast.

I attended Buddy V's brunch in mid April after out-of-town friends asked some Strip brunch suggestions. I was really pleased with their choice and so were they. The selection was smaller than a typical strip Buffet, but everything I ate was high quality and tasty, unlike a lot of dishes on a typical Buffet. The shrimp cocktail we're huge and plentiful, the meat and cheese selection was awesome and the crepes with berries were excellent. The dessert table allows you to try many versions of Buddy's pastries, my favorites were  zeppole(zonuts), the cannoli and the Italian cookies. I was so impressed with this brunch, that the following month when my mother and Aunt came to town, I brought them there as a treat. On my second visit I did the Bloody Mary bar, which was excellent and I was pleased to learn that I could choose from other alcoholic drinks as part of my $15 all you can drink price. I also tried the Bellini and the sangria and both were excellent. I will be bringing many people to this brunch when they come to town. $35 for a Strip brunch of this quality is very reasonable.

Experience was good. Food was good. Food took a little longer than expected to come out? 

Service was stellar and our server was funny and informative. They always made sure we had what we needed.

What a great restaurant.  I went there recently for dinner and sat at a table in the bar area.  To start they will bring a basket of bread/breadsticks and olive oil.  You know how sometimes you want to get an appetizer but it might be too big for 2 people so you don't get it?  No problem!  We were lucky enough to have gone during happy hour and didn't realize that they had specials during that time.  Because of happy hour we were able to try several appetizers in smaller portions so we could enjoy and taste a few things.  We had the calamari, Grandma's meatballs.  For salads were tried the cesar and mozzarella caprese.  They have homemade croutons in their salads that are unbelievable.  All were delicious.  In addition we had Italian sangria for $4 a glass.  Try and top that in Vegas folks!  For dinner we had the shrimp scampi and cheese ravioli.  Everything was excellent.  We were saying how we wish Buddy would open one of these restaurants in our area because we would be regular customers.  We'll be back Buddy -- thanks again!!!

Buddy V's bottomless brunch was perfect! I feel like a brunch buffet can tend to disappoint, this one did not. The Mac and cheese carbonara and carving station were my favorite. But the bottomless drinks is where it's AT! Our waiter was the best, he kept the bottomless drinks coming, no need to ask. And the drinks weren't 80% juice either like you can find with a lot of the bottomless drink offers, they were legit good drinks. I'm so happy we made it over here - would absolutely come back, worth every penny!

We stumbled upon Buddy V's looking on Yelp for an Italian dinner while in Vegas.  We lucked out that it was restaurant week too, so we were able to try quite the variety of options.

The restaurant is located in the front of the Venetian, so overlooks the strip making for a nice view at night.

We started out with the cheesy garlic bread, which was huge and quite good.  We also had the meatballs, which were very flavorful and the red sauce was delicious.  For dinner, the other half had the chicken parmesan, which he loved. I had the linguini vongole, which is my go to usually, and I thought it was fresh and well flavored, and not overly oily (my sometimes complaint).

We finished with a plate of all of their desserts, and every single one was good.  I think the cannoli may have been my favorite.

I did not realize until know that this is the Cake Boss' restaurant, but now that I know that, I think he should be the Boss of an Italian dinner too.

First off... Buddy V's food...  Always amazing!  Service usually amazing as well.  However, this review is for the waiter Kaleb.  Who wasn't even our waiter.  We made a reservation and were seated at one of the two chef's tables.  After giving us the details on the family style meal not on the menu our waiter filled our drinks.  Then we met Kaleb... Nope not our waiter.  He informed us we were being moved because they wanted to use our table for a 12 top.  There were six of us.  He didn't ask he told us we needed to get up and move and leave our drinks on the table.   We asked what was going on.  He just kept saying we had to move.  So as we were being basically pushed to another table at the back of the place he was being a jerk through the process.  Then he tried to switch us from the lunch menu to he dinner menu without explaining what the difference was.  Also telling us he would get a free desert for one of us.  Apparently the menu change is basically a higher price and more items.  Luckily he wasn't going to be our waiter at the new table.  As most should do we called the manager over.  He apologizes and asks us if we want a different table.   Which we didn't care about the table.  He was missing the point Kaleb was being a jerk.  He offered at least free desert to all of us.  We even confirmed it was all of us and not one of us.   Our waitress Kristy... Was amazing!!! So again take note this 1 star rating is not the norm... we generally would give it 5.  Kaleb should get a 0.  Even a few of the staff agreed and confirmed Kaleb was a jerk.  The manager was subpar.  When ordering the apparently free desert we were told it was for 4 of us.   Our waitress went and made sure it was adjusted to what was promised.  Again, We would request Kristy because her service was amazing and she dealt with the situation better than the manager.  When we left 2 hours in... The 12 top never showed up.  We were going to order the family dinner.  So they lost out on probably twice bill and still would have been able to seat the 12 top.  When we told the manager on the way out that that party never showed he said they had to save the reservation and we should be happy because he bought us over $100 worth of desert.  We reminded him that 6 people x $9 doesn't quite equal that.  He says ... "Well I tried." We didn't care about the free desert.  It was how the restaurant handled it.  The point is how this situation was handled.  In our opinion ... It was terrible.

I love Italian food in general, but this place is NEXT LEVEL AMAZING!!!! Everything is delicious. Plenty of sauce on the pasta, homemade croutons on the salads that were still hot (!), and mouth wateringly rich desserts. 

You will not be disappointed with your meal, no way.
Food was good and the service was excellent. Classic Italian place with a nice happy hour. Good for a quick bite and a couple drinks.

We have been to Buddy V's many times and the food is delicious!  My favorite is the eggplant parmesan...delicious and tender!! Their bread is always served warm and fresh and you just want more.  My only complaint is that I never have enough room in my stomach to have dessert!

We were SO happy with our meals. There were 8 of us and we all walked away raving. The service is fantastic. The food is amazing. I had a plate of the best spaghetti pomodoro i've ever had--that sauce was unreal. We're from NJ and NY so good italian food is what we are used to but we were really, really impressed here. Its casual too which is great and convenient. No white tablecloth. The portions were perfect. I hate when you get a huge overwhelming plate of pasta and you can't finish it or you overeat. Take my advice and get the warm chocolate cake filled with nutella served with salted caramel ice cream for dessert. It was out of this world!

I was at the Venetian/Palazzo Shops when I saw a sign that said "Carlos Cupcakes" and "Buddy V's Ristorante". We went to Carlos and had an amazing eclair and I saw that across the way there was this restaurant which I found out was owned by the same person who owns Carlos. Anyways let me tell you why this place is amazing.

Service:

It was lunch, so we got in really quickly. We asked to be seated at a window and they did just that! The servers were all really nice and were happy to be doing their job. One plus is that I was really thirsty at the time and they were on top of refilling my water. (5 out of 5 stars)

Ambiance:

It's really beautiful in here. When you sit inside it feels nothing like the craziness of Vegas. It's so nicely decorated in here, and it's huge so you get seated quickly as well as you don't feel crammed or packed! (5 out of 5 stars)

Food:

So we were sinners and had dessert before lunch (to be fair we didn't have breakfast). I said to my family, "if the eclair is this amazing, then I'd love to see what the restaurant is like." My dad wanted to go elsewhere, but I made him come here and all of us were drawn by the selection on the menu. We all ended up ordering Philly Cheesesteaks. Let me tell you, that was probably one of the best Philly Cheesesteaks I've ever had in my life! So flavorful! There were other things on the menu too, like chicken parmesan, pastas, and lasagnas that I saw people eating nearby which all looked amazing! (5 out of 5 stars)

I am for sure coming back! This is our new favorite place. It blew away all our expectations and I am dying to have more of that Philly Cheesesteak!

The $20.18 lunch for Restaurant Week drew us in on a Sunday morning. We got seated right away and was pleasantly surprised to hear live music (Sinatra songs) and a wide variety of appetizing brunch stuff . I ordered off of the restaurant week menu : Caesar salad, tasty and good size chicken parmigiana with spaghetti and cannoli. My husband made a mad dash to the wonderful brunch spread ($34.95). Picture of brunch selections is attached to this review. It was a perfect Sunday morning for us: live, relaxing music, wonderful brunch and service by Freddy and busser Christian was excellent! Mac and cheese carbonara, sausages and bread selection was top notch and lastly the tiramisu is amazing. We highly recommend and give 5 Stars all the way !

The food was amazing! Staff was friendly and helpful! Only reason they didn't get 5 stars is the weird menu and times. There are too many different times and menus. It got pretty confusing. We went during brunch and didn't realize it was actually a buffet until we sat down. We ended up eating off the A La Carte menu. Chicken Parm was the best I've had. While chicken fingers were included in the brunch buffet, you couldn't order them off kids menu. Ended up getting plain & dry chicken parm & son ate it up. Food is great, just be sure to look at menu & times ahead of time so you aren't disappointed.

For Strip dining this is VERY good and very good price point too!
    They offer a lunch special menu with Gr8 selections 3 courses $22.00 soup/salad, main & dessert, not including drinks 
    Started with the Caesar salad, which is killer~ the croutons are deep fried corn meal & the creamy dressing is not over whelmed by anchovies . My gf had a spinach salad beautifully presented w/ red cherry tomatoes, red onions, grated parmesan. 
    Main courses ~ mine was the spaghetti Bolognese, flipping fantastic!!!!! The sauce or gravy depending where your from is "Outta Site!" My gf had the salmon generous portion (cooked to perfection) over sautéed veggies, again both were beautiful to look at and tasted equally DEEEELISH!!!!!!
   Dessert ~ I had tiramisu, excellent with a cappuccino & my gf has the raspberry sorbet with coffee .
   All in all just a great stop and quite good for the kiddos too!!!
Slow service ( we were super hungry and wait about 35 minutes) bread is burned, bad experience!
Best Italian I have had.  The Sunday pasta dish was incredible and I would fly to Vegas to have it again.

great meal, and great service.  authentic Italian food.
go and enjoy the wonderful dishes, and grab a canoli for dessert
Amazing!! The food and the service were fantastic. The Italian Birthday cake was to die for!

Just average.  We had reservations, but still waited for 20 minutes.  Once seated it took 20 minutes for our waitress to show up.  Meatballs were average.  Veal was tender and pretty good.  Won't come back:

I made reservations through open table and was seated immediately upon arrival. Our waiter was excellent, always checking in on us and he had a great attitude. You get fresh bread with olive oil & vinegar once you order. We all ordered the $40 price fix dinner menu. Caesar salad to start (this comes with polenta croutons, it was an unexpected surprise!), chicken parm and the cannoli for dessert. All were delicious! The entree is large enough to split.

Eat here!   Food is fantastic.  Service is top notch.  A don't miss in Vegas.  The carbonara was excellent.  The cheesy garlic bread is a great appetizer.  Meatballs are fantastic. Chicken Parm is more than one person can eat.

So I love the food! Food is fantastic. Service was subpar. Our server Deanna seemed irked by our presence. If this is suppose to be a family friendly restaurant I definitely didn't get that feel. Half our party arrived and sat down and began eating. Then the rest of us joined them about 15 minutes later. We stood there waiting to be seated with our group for about another 10 by that time some of our group had finished eating stood up and left so we could sit. No one came to ask if we needed help as we stood next the table. Like I said food Amazing service Subpar at best.

Not a fan of Buddy Valastro as a tv chef personality; however, his restaurant did offer some delicious and memorable appetizers. 

Pros

Macaroni & Cheese Carbonara: One of the most decadent and rich mac & cheese I've had. Although the pancetta was lacking, the cheese sauce was pure heaven and the penne pasta was cooked just right. 

Aunt Nina's Mozzarella Corozza: It's pretty much a delicious version of the grilled cheese sandwich filled with plenty of mozzarella and pesto that is placed on a chunky bed of ragu. The only dislike I had about this appetizer was that the sandwich was drench in too much olive oil for grilling. 

Margherita Pizza: A simple pie that was baked to perfection with a perfect ratio of mozzarella, tomato, and basil. 

Overall great dining experience with delicious food to start off the day. I definitely will return and also will be saving room for dessert to try out his popular bakery, Carlo's Bakery that is located across the restaurant.

The menu had an insert for restaurant week that got you three courses for around $40. I had a salad, the spaghetti bolognese, and the pictured cannoli. My wife had the Cesar salad, the chicken parm, and a Nutella cake. Everything was really great. The service was very attentive. 

The restaurant is tucked away at the far end of the Venetian shops, and even though we're staying at this hotel, we'd have never found it. It's a relaxed atmosphere, and right across from it is Buddy V's bakery that had a line out the door. Looked fantastic, too!

I'm a huge fan of Cake Boss, so I just had to visit the bakery and try the restaurant. I was impressed with the food. Everyone in my group ordered something different: spaghetti, pizza, and chicken parm. The chicken parm was my favorite. Also, the inside of the restaurant looked really neat. It's a fun place to eat at, and it is definitely a place you need to visit if you're a fan of Cake Boss! Also, I recommend the cannoli's! They are to die for! The cannoli cream was delicious and sweet! In fact, even if you're not hungry for a full meal, I recommend stopping by for a cannoli as a snack or dessert.

We had reservations for dinner at Buddy V's on our second evening in Vegas. However, after indulging in a tall, alcoholic slushy sold on the Strip, we were not up for dinner and canceled our reservation. Throughout our stay, we dined at several high end establishments, but none were as good as we found Buddy V's to be when we popped in for lunch on our last day!  The staff greeted us warmly, suggested we take a window seat with a great view of the strip and were responsive and attentive during our meal.  My husband and I ordered the three course express lunch, which was an incredible value at $22 by Vegas standards. I had the panzanella salad and found it to be superb. My husband had the Caesar salad served with polenta croutons, which was pure deliciousness. For our entrees, we both had the chicken Parmesan, again delicious . The lunch portion was so generous, that we could have easy shared one order. We looked forward to the dessert, as that is what Buddy V is known for. We were not disappointed: the cannoli was heavenly on its own, but the dark chocolate sauce put it over the top. Hubby had the salted caramel gelato served with biscotti. Good, but no competition with the cannoli.
We were so glad we were able to finally dine at Buddy V's! It was the best meal, value and service of our vacation.
Ordered pasta, italian birthday cake and meatballs. Bartended was attentive. Price is ok with the food and its in Vegas so a lil bit pricey.

Best food I've ever eaten in my life.  We tried beef medallion, carbonara, Mac and cheese, shrimp linguini, Italian birthday cake, warm Nutella cake, creme brûlée, homemade lemonade. Wow wow wow, best food and drink I've ever had. Even the coffee was good. Everything was authentic. Staff were friendly and good looking. I absolutely love this place. Kudos to the chef. Thank you to our servers Caleb and Angelo for a wonderful night at your restaurant.

My family and I had an amazing experience here on Saturday night. They accommodated our large group and the service was exceptional. The food is delicious and the ambiance is very lively and fun. The views of the strip are great as well. I frequent the Palazzo and we will definitely be back!

It was delicious!! We were here twice and all the time the food was perfect! Pasta and chicken are deliciously good! In my opinion, this is the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas...and in San Francisco! Highly recommend to try it!

We went to Buddy's on our first night in Vegas.  The atmosphere was great and I really liked the decor.  Our waiter looked just like Buddy's cousin and had a great personality.  I started with a Caesar salad that had more dressing than lettuce.  the best part was the soft croutons on top.  A bowl of those would have been awesome.  Salad, not very good.
I then just wanted meatballs and the waiter talked me into pasta and meatballs.  The balls were small and not very flavorful.  My wife had chicken marsala.  there were 4 full breasts in the order.  it was a huge portion.  She liked it.
We passed on dessert in order to gamble sooner.  Overall, the food was ok but the price for what we got was too expensive.  
The next night we went to Lavo in Palazzo and spent $20 more per person and had a way better eating experience.  Do yourself a favor, and stick to Buddy's Bakery across the hallway and skip the restaurant. Too many better options in and around the Venetian.

One of the best restaurants in Las Vegas!

Excellent happy hour, large amount of seating, welcoming environment and totally tasty! This joint is delish, the hubs and I have been twice and I highly recommend it. Service is great, cocktails are fabulous and food is fantastic. The price is a little high for my usual, but is on point for a quality spot in this city!

The service is also great, the bartender to the hostess are all friendly and on top of it. Our recent experience even had a fab server (Christine?) who said she constantly checks the yelp reviews to ensure quality experiences! She also recommended the creme brulee, but we were so stuffed from garlic bread and pasta that there was simply no room. But, I might have to give it a try next time!

They also have a fantastic happy hour, and supposedly a great brunch. I say yes!

Much better than I expected.  Went on a Sunday morning so it was a brunch buffet that I did not partake in, so I only ordered Tomato Basil soup.  The soup was good, though serving size was small for the price and it didn't come with bread.  My wife got the buffet and really liked it and she snuck me some bread for my soup and that bread was also good.  

All in all, for a place founded based on a TV show, it's really pretty decent.  However, it's overpriced.  As a bonus, the Carlo's Bakery is across the hall.

We came here for the brunch buffet and it was honestly the most amazing food I've ever had. Everything was so delicious and fresh. A lot of buffets have an overwhelming amount of food and you don't get to try it all. Buddy V's had the perfect amount of food. I was able to try everything that I wanted! I would highly recommend the brunch buffet. It was amazing!

Not as pleased as I thought I would be!

Came here for a birthday celebration while in Vegas and was let down.

Got here on a Saturday evening ready to feast and was seated promptly after waiting for the rest of my party to arrive. The hostess lead my group to a table by the window and we were seated and given menus.

The items on the menu seemed really good. I knew I wanted something with sausage while the rest of group went with the steaks and spaghetti. The first issue came when everyone had decided on what they wanted and they server took 20 minutes to come back to the table to take our order. That was somewhat odd especially since when the drink was taken he overlooked my order, seriously!!!! I had to ask another waiter who was helping another table to grab my drink, that's not good.

Next, when the waiter did eventually come over to take our orders he insisted on orders rather than giving recommendations, hmmmm, not smooth! The issue with the orders was that everyone's order was taken except for one but that member of my party could not order because the waiter has walked away after getting the 5th order. Why would you do that when there is another person at the table!!! Once again, we had to get another waiter to add another steak to our order because our waiter was unable to do that the first time!!

As for the food, my meal was great. Everyone that ordered a steak loved their food. However, the spaghetti, I was informed, was a bit sour! I did not try it but I told by another member of my dinner party. 

Once finished with our food. We had to wait another 20 minutes before we could get the check. Getting the check went like this. In finally getting the attention of the waiter I got two words out asking for the check and then he interrupted and didn't let me finish to offer dessert. Seriously, usually there is a back and forth in communication but this guy had to speak over me, confusing to me! Again, he was insistent about getting a dessert rather than suggesting or recommending. 

Once I finally got the check everyone was ready to go because this waiter was just no helpful in explaining anything or being attentive to our party. Not a memorable birthday dinner for the birthday girl after talking with her about her dinner. She liked the food but the service a bit aggressive. I guess working here causes the workers to be impatient and overbearing. I don't think so because the other waiters that I talked to were very gracious about assisting my table. I think the gentleman that helped us that evening was just trying way to hard and no making a good impression. 

The food was fine but the service was below what I expected based the reviewed I have heard about Buddy V's. I wanted to 5 star this place but the service killed that potential rating. I hope this situation does not happen to anyone else. But, kudos to the chefs in the kitchen who worked hard to prepare the food.

#buddyvhelpmeout

This place is always good. Eveytime we come to vegas we have to stopped for dinner here or lunch. The chicken parm is delicious and the service is always good. I also get the buddy vs specialty pozza yumm and the cesar sals with the calamari is on point
