Excellent top to bottom.  The service at the bar was great.  There were two gentlemen who played music in the bar area and they were talented.  Extensive wine list.  Caesar salad had a nice surprise-and-delight element of warm polenta croutons.  Yum.  Grandma's meatballs...excellent.  I am a tough critic of restaurant meatballs and those balls delivered!  Beef, pork and veal is always the right combination of flavor.  Red sauce great.  And the chicken with rigatoni in vodka sauce with pancetta...delish.  Rich, big flavor.  Huge portions.  The hubs and I split everything so don't be shy about sharing!  Great experience.

I've always been a huge fan of Buddy so my friend and I decided to try it out. Service was exceptional, and we were suprised at how fast we got our food. The chicken marsala was good, but nothing more special than the others I have tried. The real reason we came was for the lobster tail and cannoli. It was amazing and even better then we imagined.  A definite must try when visiting this restaurant.

This is one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas. I think about this place and my mouth still waters. Yes, I agree it is a bit pricey, but what my fiancé and I ended up doing is splitting the food. We went for dinner. We got the "My Wife's Eggplant Parm" for the appetizer and it was AMAZING. It is pretty filling. For the entrée, we got Chicken Rigatoni "Alla Vodka" and it's just WOW. The food was filling and tasty. I will definitely go back to it. The food is rich and creamy. You don't get food like this anymore.

Was really looking forward to have dinner here. My partners Spaghetti was nice but we both agreed that my Lasagna wasn't. I didn't even eat half of it and when I told the waitress that I didn't like it that much she didn't even reply. It was okay, but severely overpriced, felt like a let down overall.
The service was bad and slow and the food was mediocre. They were trying to have a home cooking vibe and it was a fail. I wouldn't go again
One of my favorite restaurants in Venetian. Service is good food is even better!! If you watch the show or are a fan of Italian food you need to try it!
Excellent meatball sub - it's huge and good to share so you have room for the super fabulous cannoli! The food is amazing and the service is amazing as well! This is a must in Vegas!

I'm a cake boss fan and I keep it real! I have visit the Hoboken bakery, New York, and now Vegas! In my honest opinion majority of the desserts are very good but price wise they are overpriced! I remember going the first time and spending over $50 on a couple treats! Now let's talk about the brunch! It is totally worth $34.95! ALL YOU CAN EAT for a reasonable price! I rather go eat for brunch than spend that money on a few desserts! Think about it! You can eat as many tiramisu, red velvet cake and so on for one price! Not to mention the delicious grandma meatballs, mac and cheese, chicken, french toast, Italian sausage, and so much more!! The service is a PLUS everyone was awesome and I will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas!

Nice restaurant convieniently located within Grand Canal Shoppes.

Food: Chicken Parm comes with two big pieces of chicken smothered in cheese and a side of spaghetti, which is perfect for sharing.  Buddy's favourite pizza was good too but could have more toppings.
Chocolate nutella cake with ice-cream was delicious and only $9.

Place: nice ambience, liked the Cake Boss display of cakes at the front of the restaurant and the his family themed decor and menue was a nice touch.  Get a booth seat or seat by the window.

Service: very good, friendly, and prompt

Overall would recommend for a moderately priced Italian meal.  Also try a treat at his pastry shop across the aisle.

We love everything in Buddy V's Sunday brunch! Just the right amount of choices for a buffet. Not overwhelming; Nothing goes to waste  Service was great too!  and there was live feel-good music while we enjoy family time and our scrumptious meal  Thank you for the great experience!
If you come here, ask for Peter!  He was an AMAZING server!!  And hands down, eat the linguine and clams!  Warning: There was a lot of garlic!!
My wife and I had dinner at buddy vs this weekend and it was pretty good. Except my chicken Parmesan had VERY salty cheese on it. Calamari was pretty good and they give pretty good portions.

Lunch leaves a lot to be desired. Service was very slow and not friendly.  Lunch menu has nothing really on it. My chicken was cold and salad was drowned in dressing. I couldn't even eat it. I was very disappointed and out seventy five dollars.
My family and I really enjoyed everything we ate. The macaroni and cheese was super creamy and the meat and cheese plate was excellent.
Great service. Did get our order mixed, however let us keep the dish we didn't order free of charged. Food was very good.

Amazing dinner, great atmosphere and exceptional service! We came here for my moms 60th bday. Our server, Peter, was so incredibly friendly and was joking around with us the whole time. He definitely made the experience an unforgettable one! The surf and turf was SO good, my steak was cooked perfectly medium-rare and that lobster! Yum! We order the garlic bread and mozzarella appetizers and they were both just delicious. The creme brûlée was INCREDIBLE. As was the lobster tail dessert and the Nutella chocolate lava cake thing. We will definitely be coming back! Thanks, Peter for the great service! Oh, and the prices are so reasonable! Between $30-$50 per plate but it has the atmosphere more like a fine dining setting.

Had a yummy dinner here with hubby and a friend during a work conference. We started off with an order of fries and a caprese salad. The fries were excellent, and our waitress had the kitchen made a larger caprese salad for us so we could share it. It turned out it was burrata cheese, which was awesome. Hubby had the enormous veal parmesan chop and it was the size of a dinner plate. Our friend had the lasagna, and I had the scallops. All the entrees were excellent. They miss the mark a little on dessert. Although I had a molten nutella cake which was delish, hubby had the Italian birthday cake which was extremely bland and very disappointing. Our friend had the lemon cheesecake, which had a nice bright lemony flavor, but I'm just not a fan of cheesecake, so I can't impartially rate that. Overall, a great dining experience, although the place is extremely loud and I was hoarse by the end of the meal from trying to be heard over the din! Oh, and Buddy was actually there that night making the rounds saying hello to people. That was kind of fun too!

Overall probably 3 is fair. The space has gorgeous views and is worth the short walk from venetian or palazzo. The food is above average Italian, but not spectacular. The focaccia should've been warm, and why do we need to ask for olive oil? That's not authentic . We had chicken parm and pasta. We said we were sharing but plates were just dumped. Had a very nice bus boy but the waiter was creepy and a little scary. The chicken parm was good, pasta was a little on the creamy side. Overall pretty mediocre for the Boss, hope the cakes are better and they hire some pleasant waiters
Amazing food!! Some of the best Italian that I have ever had. Went there for a birthday dinner and was very happy and full when I left.

Absolutely enjoyed it. We went with reservations (pardon the pun) expecting the food to rest on the tv show. We were happily surprised. Our waitress found out we were from Virginia as she was too. The personal touch was very nice. Food was great, served at the right time, tasted great, and ample portions. The price was very reasonable as well.

Not easy to find, but no big deal.  Had the Meatball Sub (Hero) and the problem I had was that it came on a toasted roll?!  It does not say that in the description on the menu and to me, changes the whole delicious simplicity your watering mouth is expecting. Taste of the Meatballs were good and I ended up just eating them.  Now YOU know.

Cake was average. Nothing special. Looked delicious but lacked in flavour and was honestly too sweet. 

I ordered the rainbow cake which was visually appealling but lacked any flavour. It tasted like sugar imbalanced with more sugar. At $8 a peice it was hardly worth the price and it took me almost 8 sittings to finish because i couldnt handle more than 3 bites at a time due to overwhelming and overpowering flavour of sugar. I love desserts but it wasnt balanced at all and honestly most church bakers or even school bake sales make better cake. 

Only upside was the short line and the great single serve packaging for the cakes to go. Otherwise skip it and head ANYWHERE else. Its a fad place from tv and the desserts are extremely lacking in quality.

We were in Vegas for a wedding and stopped in here for dinner after the wedding rehearsal. There was 12 of us and we did not make ressies. However they were able to sit two tables of six next to each other which was nice.

We all ordered drinks and food and the time was pretty good. The drinks were a bit slow but that's probs a good thing because it slowed down my dranking pace. There were  two servers helping us, one for each table and they asked that we all order at the same time. We all got our foods which was delicious. I felt that the serving sizes for the prices were a bit off. $12 for a side salad seemed a bit high, even for Vegas. The server at my table did a good job upselling a bunch of items, like shrimp with the scallops and scallops with the steak but she did not mention that there would be a price increase or the amount. Which is fine, we were hungry but a courtesy would have been nice.

They also brought out a birthday cake for the group in honor of the new couple. That was a very nice touch.

Overall this place was pretty good Italian. It is also across from Buddy's Baker which was genius. I got dessert at the restaurant and also at the baker across the street. I regret nothing.
Great place to go. Had some awesome hh specials food is great and the bar staff was super friendly. Not too expensive. Second visit and both times it was great

Place was phenomenal,
We even saw Buddy walking around with his wife, such a great experience.
We went for the Brunch Buffet, I really cant find anything that I didn't like, all around a great package meal, plus we did the bottomless Drinks, from Mimosas to Bellinis and great beer. Awesome views and the service was excellent.
Emily the Bartender/Server was on point, we broke two glasses and no one made a fit or said anything, they only care about your satisfaction. Ill most definitely be back for any meal on my next Vegas visit.

If you are in Vegas you HAVE to come here. The food here can not be beat. The best meatballs in the world as an appetizer!! The chicken Marsala is to die for, and the Nutella chocolate cake made me speechless. The prices are reasonable as well.

I have eaten here recently a couple times. One time the service was shitty and the other it was great. The food gets 5 stars easily. You get what you pay for here. 

Grandma's Meatballs: beef, veal, and pork. Good flavor and easily shared but you wont want to. 

Free Bread: dude came around once with bread and that was it. I wanted more bread! He poured some oil and vinegar for us (a lot of it) and gave us 1 piece of bread for it. That's ok I made up for it by eating all the bread stick thingys that are in the cups on the table. 

Buddy's Salumi and Cheese Board: damn yo this was real good. I didn't care for the olives but I'm not a fan of them anyway. The meats and cheeses I could have ate all day.

Orecchiette and Italian Sausage: This dish had sausage in its name so I ordered it. It was not as heavy as a spaghetti with sauce which was nice. I ate every bite and would order it again. 

Spaghetti Bolognese: I was very surprised to like this. When it came out I expected some sort of red sauce on it but that wasn't the case. My wife took a bite and really liked the taste too. Winner winner bolognese dinner!

Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake: Came with salted caramel ice cream. This was hot and good and everyone should order it. 

Zeppole: I guess a spiced sugar is outside of these but I didn't taste anything but fried dough. I didn't like this.

Went here yesterday and I was so excited to find a place with bottomless mimosas, sangria, and bloody Mary's.  It is a great brunch spot with a great ambience.  The meatballs were delicious and the build your own crepe was cool. Definitely will be coming back!

What a nice place to eat! Not too fancy. Not too cheap. Great for families! It wasn't the best in flavor since most everything was on the bland side but it was still good. 

Chicken parmigiana- a bit bland chicken. Needs a bit more spices. Still good to eat though! Spaghetti was yummy! Some Italian places make this dish too salty so I preferred it more bland and adding a bit of salt. 

Prime rib- yes, at an Italian restaurant. Not the best to order but it was a prix fixe meal so we tried it. Prime rib was also a bit bland, but again, better than salty, which I've gotten too. 

Lou's gravy- meat lovers would love this one! All kinds of meats- sausage, meatballs, lamb, I forgot the others. Husband loved it! He said it was actually too much meat. That's not often heard of. 

Clam spaghetti- seasoned on the bland side again but clams were juicy and not chewy. 

Garlic cheese bread- now that was delicious!! I could have more of that!! We're ordering more of that next time. 

Customer service- 5 star rating!! The young gentleman was very accommodating. He was so patient with my son too. When asked why there was no star on the Xmas tree, he said he wasn't sure but he would look into getting one next year. He then took my son to see a bigger tree at the back of the restaurant to check for a star. He said he'd tell the manager that that tree needed one too after confirming with my son. The extra help in getting out dishes and filling our cups were so "johnny on the spot" too!!! Loved every bit of the wait staff!!!!!

This was  very unexpectedly good! Good service and good food! Spaghetti and meatball was great and good amount. I always went to Allegro at Encore but I found a new love now! Great place to try especially with familyz

I had the panzanella salad, and it was delicious!!!! I was looking for something light to eat but with substance since I was going out to drink later that night (vegas, go figure). Perfect amount of veggies to cheese. Yum!!!

For dessert, we ordered the lobster tail! So good. We came for my bachelorette dinner so they even decorated it for me!! Although the "flaky pastry" was a little too crunchy for me, the custard cream and fresh fruits were perfection!! 

Definitely get the lobster tail next time you're here!!

Holy crap! Coming from a "enlarged family" through a recent wedding, I am part of an Italian family and we eat a lot of italian food. We were on a Girls Trip to Vegas, each celebrating something different but together and wanted to dress up for a ladies night out. We were able to get a reservation same day, the wait was so short once we got there and we were able to get some great group shots thanks to some other guests. We got an amazing window booth that over looked the strip and could see the gondolas below - it was not too loud and had a great vibe. 

Our waiter Chaz - was amazing! Quick and efficient, he recommended his favorites and we took his advice - food was perfect and portions were definitely Italian Style!
Share plates so you can try a little of everything! and still have room for Buddy V's award winning desserts.

This review is for the bar only

While my loving, wonderful husband waited in line at Carlo's Bakery, I thought I'd pop over to Buddy V's across the way and try a libation.  Since I had no clue what I wanted, I asked the bartender to "make something up with amarone", and she did.  I like surprises!  

Open space with a nice view - and it's right across from the bakery.  Check! Check!

As a NJ expat, I can say one of the few things I miss most living in Hawaii is exceptional Italian food. Luckily, my boyfriend comes from a line of Italian chefs and isn't afraid to be super critical when it comes to Italian, and I can say he would have approved and I can't wait to take him here. The eggplant Parmesan was mouth watering my delicious, and caprese salad had the freshest ingredients. The four sides we ordered (polenta, asparagus, kale, and mashed potatoes) were a bit too over seasoned or cheesy, but the main dishes were phenomenal. Highly recommend the cheese/cured meat board. Friendly atmosphere with a great view of the strip.

We were super excited to go to Buddy's and were definitely not disappointed! Portion sizes were great and everything was presented beautifully. Our server, Georgio, claimed to be Buddy's godson and produced a picture of Buddy holding him as a baby, but I'm a natural born skeptic and wonder if it's true :) Nonetheless, Georgio was very attentive and knowledgable about the entire menu. He even told my friend that what she was planning to order was too boring and she would probably prefer something else! He made a recommendation and she ended up loving it! My dish was nothing short of fantastic and next time I'm in Vegas will definitely be going back! The bread before dinner was served warm with traditional oil and tasted soooooo good. 

My only suggestion is definitely talk to them ahead of time about how the checks are going to work. We felt bad making him split it a couple ways because it took a while in the system.

I ordered from the lunch specials and chose the tomato bisque, chicken parmesan and tiramisu. All dishes were phenomenal and the service was fast. The chicken parm dish was really filling so I took some to go and ate it as a later lunch.

Sunday brunch is overpriced at $34.95 per person.  Food that was provided was good quality as was the service.  Would be improved by including a drink, smoked salmon, omelette station.
Recommended gratuity is calculated including sales tax which is inappropriate.

My friends and I decided to stop in buddy v's for our last night in Vegas to get some homemade Italian food. 11/4/16. We had made reservations for 8pm for 7 and by the time that came around we still had to wait half an hour for them to clear the table and what not. After being seated we were giving menu and drink menu. Everything sounded really good and look delicious! I order the madiline penne and my friends all ordered something different. The food came out fairly quick, but it seemed like our waiter kept on forgetting what we had. The service was okay, but it was as they were almost rude. The food was also okay it wasn't as expected. I've actually had better! So overall buddy v is just hype because of the TV show. At this point it was an experience and that it's really up to you if you'd like to try it out. Give it a try and see what you think.

Great service. Great food. Great atmosphere. My husband and I were looking for a place for lunch and stumbled upon this place. While I know of his show I can't honestly say I've ever watched it. The capresse salad was delicious! I had the penne alla vodka and it was too die for! And my husband had the meatball sub, which he also loved. We shared the Nutella cake for dessert and it was also good, but the salted carmel ice cream was the true star! I would highly recommend stopping in here for a meal!

Brunch Review: fresh, delicious, attentive staff.. Even the strawberry lemonade was freshly made by the bar and taste amazing, not too sweet -added perk it comes in a keepsake glass.. HIGHLIGHT OF THE DAY!! Buddy Valastro walks in mid brunch and says hello to everyone, and takes pictures with us.. Very sweet and humble!

The restaurant's web site shows that it opens at 11:00 a.m. That is incorrect. We arrived a bit after 11, and that, in and of itself, was a trial. Then, we waited...and waited. Finally, a bit after 11:30, the gate was rolled back. Second in line, we asked for a table by the windows (remember: empty restaurant). The er, um, "hostest" told us that THOSE seats were only for groups of 6 or more. By the time we left, 3 of those tables were occupied (out of about 10), all with parties of 4 or less.  Our waitstaff was attentive, as was the person who filled the water glasses and actually brought out the food. Both orders had been left under a heat lamp too long, and the one order, a pizza, was less than warm. The other order had much to be improved. We will not be returning, nor will we suggest it to out of town guests.

True Italian breadsticks: thin, crunchy, and dry just like I remember from NY and New Jersey. Calamari: crispy but not chewy, came with some thin sliced grilled lemon, green pepper; an interesting combo.  The fried mozzarella could have been an entree: more like a massive stuffed grilled cheese sandwich with a light marinara sauce. Caesar salads came with fried Parmesan cheese polenta cubes.  What a flavor accent! Carbonara (oh to die for): just enough bits of ham, a good dose of cream and tons of cheese with al dente pasta that tasted homemade. A large enough portion that I got a dogie bag and enjoyed it again the next day. The lobster roll: a flaky layered pastry with a cream filling and surrounded by berries.  Who could not like it?
We came as part of a romantic promotion through our timeshare. Both hubby and I agreed, it was a shame we waited until our last day to eat there. Or we would have returned to try other dishes.  The wait team kept us filled with ice tea and water without apparent effort; we never sat with used dishes on the table (one of my pet peeves). All in all, I felt like I was back in the hood, eating Nona's good food with familia.

Excellent food. The waiter was really good as well. He took real interest in our food preferences and suggested food/wine. During booking the reservation, I had told them it was my girlfriend's birthday, which they remembered and surprised her (and me) with a cake and candle. The ambience is really good as well.
Food is pretty good. Good service. By hard to find. Not many signs to find restaurant. The bakery across from the restaurant does extremely well.

My mother and I came here for the Sunday Brunch Buffet. Everything was amazing! From the fresh made crossants, to the chicken Parmesan and all the yummy desserts! We will definately be coming here again.

Great meal at Buddy V's! The Grilled Octopus app was the most tender I've ever had. The Chicken Marsala was savory, the way it should be. Too many restaurants use sweet Marsala wine and ruin the dish. Buddy V's was right on, and a good portion size too. My wife's Capellini Shrimp Scampi was terrific. Very nice wine selection by the glass. By the way, the Caesar Salad with polenta croutons is a must have as well.

1) The linguini & clams was too salty. 
2) Manager took it back and told me yes chef agreed it was too salty.    
3) they replaced the plain pasta without the clams.
4) the second time complained it was not my order the linguini without clams and the manager attitudes changed so unpleasant and took the dish back to replace the 3rd.
5). The final bill, buddy v's charged me two orders on linguini & clams.    
6).  I will not go back and wont recommend on the services either.

Awesome experience. The spaghetti was great. Best garlic bread I've ever had! The Nutella cake dessert is an awesome choice. Our waiter was super friendly. He was Buddy's cousin and he was a lot of fun (taking pictures and joking with my 9 year old daughter). Food was stellar and he made it very memorable.

This was a wonderful brunch. The food is fresh and authentic. If you love Italian food this is the place. We opted for the all-you-can-drink Bloody Mary's, Bellini's, mimosas. The service was awesome and they were on top of the drinks and the refills. Although we didn't have children with us, there was a specific section for children's Foods like chicken fingers, Etc and desserts. This is our second time humor and we will be back.

Food was very good.   Service was very attentive,  perhaps too much so at times.  Very nice atmosphere.   If you are at Venetian or Palazzo give yourself some time because I found it tough to find.  Overall very nice experience and very good value.  Oh yeah, very good portions
So happy I stopped by for lunch! The chicken Parmesan is AMAZING! Came in after a client told me how good the food was, hands down will be back. Probably after we found that client her dream house!

Amazing service & food.
We were served by charles and he was the best server ive ever had. He really knows whats hes doing . Buddy should be greatful he has him representing his business!! 

Charles gave us advice about vegas attractions, and gave us advice about the menu... boy was he right. Get the bolanase speghitti amazing!!!!
Pizza was not good at all. Service had to be reminded to bring drinks and spoons returned because they were dirty. Recommend you skip and find another place to eat.   Highlight was the spaghetti.

My experience with BuddyV was terrible. I ordered house salad and the house special of shrimps with fettuccine. I told the waiter that I cannot have any bacon or pork products (due to religious reason); he understood but didn't care to mention that the salad has bruschetta on it. Well when the salad came I raised concerns and was told another salad is coming without meat.. but after ten minutes and rest of my party already had their salad finished; my salad never came. Later the manager came asking the same questions and promising another salad; to which I told him no since I didn't want start on salad while my party is on their main entrée'. I was hoping the food would be good, but no.. The pasta was not fully cooked, hard to chew, dry and only 3 shrimps!!! For a $30 entrée' I was expecting some good.  But no! This place is over rated; like many other things in Vegas.

Great service! Cool bar with nice views of strip. A little bit of a walk to find the place. But once you do find the place it's very inviting. Chicken parmesan was good. Linguine clams was delicious and had enough to fill you up with a little bit of spice 
The deserts are AMAZING!!! The apple and the lobster things whatever you call them they were soooo good!!!

AMAZING Restaurant with an AMAZING crew! Joy, Thank you for being amazing! You gave the best service i have seen ever. My friends and I came to this restaurant not too long ago and Joy gave us the best service I have got ever. I highly recommend this place to everyone. The whole team was incredible.

I had the linguini with clams, my husband had the parm and my son had the spaghetti with meatballs.  It was all delicious!! The service was great and very family friendly not like some restaurants in Las Vegas that could be intimidating.  We also
had the hazel nut dessert with the salted Carmel ice cream and it was just the best!  Love this place.

Great Italian food and great value!

I found Buddy's on Yelp and was so happy that I gave the restaurant a try. We got there during happy hour and there was a variety of small plate appetizers for $5 each and a full menu as well. 

I ordered the fried calamari happy hour small bite for $5 and the sea bass for $29 as entree. The calamari was crispy and flavorful and for $5, it was a steal. 

The sea bass entree came with an arugula salad on the side and the fish came deboned and was crispy outside and perfectly tender inside. 

The ambiance is casual and the wait staff was very friendly. The restaurant was right across from Carlos Bakery and it is a great stop after dinner. 

Highly recommend!

Went there for a friends birthday last night. Atmosphere is really comfortable and welcoming. Good crowd and energy. The food 100% delivered. My challenge was with the service. They're new so I'm sure they're working out kinks. But the waiter was so spotty - wouldn't see him for 15-20 minutes at a time. Forgot requests, didnt bring any pens for the checks. Overall great experience and ill be back.

Service was terrible. Hostesses were not accommodating and acted like they were the ones running the place. Manager is clearly not on the side of the customer and inexperienced. With all of the choices available at the Venetian, I would think they would be more customer focused.

Been here for dinner before and loved it, so when I read about the Sunday brunch, I just had to come back and indulge.
I'm here to share with everyone that this brunch for under 35 dollars is a steal!
Fantastic fresh foods to meet everyone's needs. Charcuterie, cheeses, garlic breads, 5 carving station meats, panetone French toast, eggs, pastas, chicken parm, meatballs, killer tiramisu and other desserts. It's kid friendly too with a kids station even an adult would enjoy.
The staff is on top of things and Asst. GM Adam Margolies is visible and easy to talk to.
Sean was great to us last time for dinner, so from top to bottom, Buddy's has it all!
Very good food! Service was very attentive! We ordered the smashed meatball sandwich and it was very good.

Classic Italian food with a cozy, yet contemporary atmosphere ~

I have to admit that I wasn't a fan of TLC's "Cake Boss" and didn't follow it but I knew of the show and appreciated that it was a family affair. When the restaurant opened in Vegas I didn't really have any desire to try it out until my man had a business lunch there and told me I had to try it. 

We've been here twice now and I'm happy to say that the food is just delicious! My favorite dish is Buddy's mother in law's capellini shrimp scampi. Packed with flavor I can't stop eating it and it never comes home with me for a late night snack. There's tons of garlic, roasted tomatoes, spinach and white wine! My man has enjoyed everything he's tried from the meatball sandwich, chicken parmigiana  and his favorite dish which happens to be the super cheesy lasagna. 

The warm, complimentary focaccia bread is always a hit and we've had the calamari and caesar salad which were great.

Don't forget to tell them if you're celebrating anything special as they'll bring out a mini cannoli on the house. 

Located across from the restaurant is Buddy's bakery which serves the best chocolate dipped strawberries in case you want something for later!

The Tiramisu is the best I've ever had in my whole life. I order it every time I am here.   Beware that there is always a line if you come with a big party.  Make reservations in advance or take a chance with the bar area, which can give you a great view of the strip.  When I was previously here, there was live music with people dancing next to the bar area, but they didn't have a band this time. Not sure if this was due to a slow season in December.  Overall a very lovely atmosphere with great food.

So I went here with my family and everyone ordered different dishes. I tried a little bit everyone's dishes because I just love sharing food, and I must admit this place is amazing. I ordered salmon and it was cooked to perfection. My nephew had macaroni and cheese and it was the best I've ever had. Service was even better. The view is just incredible of the strip and I loved the big windows with natural sunlight coming in. It perfect and I cannot wait to go back!

I was not a fan. The food was ok. Our food came out soon after we ordered it but that was the only positive. It took a long time before our order was taken and a very long time before getting the check! Will not be returning ever!

I ate at the bar for happy hour. We really weren't planning on eating there but after going to Carlos bakery right before we thought we might get a snack here. Our bartender was cool at first and then became a bit pushy. The drinks were good. I got the sangria, my friend had a Bellini. 
So we each ordered a caprese salad and gnocchi to share. We received our caprese salads. It was a pretty good portion. We both agreed our salad needed some more vinegar and a bit of salt. It just tasted so bland. I love caprese salads so this was a real disappointment. We then receive ricotta cheese and bread. Neither of us touch it since we didn't order it. Then we figure out the gnocchi isn't coming. We eat the ricotta and both think the cheese is bland too!
I won't be coming back. But food was a huge disappointment!

The last two times in Vegas I've eaten at Buddy V's. Both times I've had the smashed meatball sandwich. Big thumbs up! Meatball subs are, in my opinion, generally too dry, but the two I've had at Buddy's have been pretty moist. The parmesan fries are hot and crispy, they were very good. Sevice has been good, no problems in that area. My one complaint was the first time I went I got breadsticks, second time none. I am not a fan of Cake Boss so I was really just there for the food, next time I might try something different like chicken parm. Both times I was there it was a weekday afternoon right when they opened so it was not crowded. There was a lot of people at Buddy's bakery across the hall though.

We arrived around 11 to get some desserts at the bakery next door. The line was LONG so we decided on lunch here instead. You can get a Lobster Tail (for $15) and a few other things that you can only get at the restaurant. Prices are decent for a strip meal. The place was pretty empty so we were seated quick. They had a lunch deal which included a salad, entree and dessert for $22. They had enough options to choose from and everything was pretty tasty. I got the salad panzanella, margherita pizza and cannoli. Everything was great. I would have liked more fresh mozzarella on the salad because it was so good. The pizza could have used more sauce but those are my likes when I make that salad and pizza. I would go again for sure and maybe next time get the $15 Lobster Tail.

Excellent well worth the price! Went for desert but ended up having salad, dinner and desert.  We split the Lobster Tail and great coffee for desert.  The portions were perfect to split. We live in Las Vegas and can't wait to return and share with friends and family.
Excellent customer service, excellent food, I love this place. will revisit when I am back in vegas.

I am a fan of Cake Boss, so when we visited Las Vegas, I have to eat at Buddy's restaurant.  The location is nice. Price is on the higher range. The serving size is good for one person, definitely not for sharing especially if you are hungry.  The pasta which we ordered Linguini with clams and lasagna are on the salty side. Actually it is salty. My son who ordered chicken blt like it a lot.  For desert, we ordered creme brulee and canoli. Of course, the canoli is to die for!!! Love it!!! But the creme brulee, i wanted it to be more like a flan but their version is more cream version.

Buddy V's restaurant was good but not great, which was disappointing. The service and setting was excellent and notable. I found everyone from the hostess to waitstaff to be courteous and helpful. The restaurant specializes in classic Italian-American fare like lasagna, chicken parm, and cannolis. 

The lasagna, Caesar salad, house salad, and cannoli were all delicious and a highlight of our visit. The chicken parm, unfortunately, was disappointing. There was barely any marinara sauce present and the chicken was not soft and succulent like I've come to expect from excellent Italian-American joints in the New York area. 

Overall there is clearly a strong vision coming from Buddy Valastro's family home cooking, but I assume there is some miss in the execution. The restaurant is good and I would recommend if in the area, but it was not a standout.

Outstanding food in great desserts sat at the bar two times when I was here this week Tawny Was a great bartender great server and a pleasure to talk with, comingback again which I do at least a few times a year.
Very good food! Some of the best bolognese I've found. Chicken rigatoni with vodka sauce was lovely. Good ceasar salad. No room for dessert, unfortunately. Eat here and you won't be disappointed!

The design of the place is awesome and cozy..so many cool details. Service is on point...very friendly and attentive staff. Food isn't anything you haven't had before but simple and good, nonetheless. I wouldn't come here for a special occasion..more of a casual lunch spot in my opinion. Tomato soup is excellent and so was the pasta with vodka sauce..worth a visit. Enjoy!
the pre fixed meal between 5-7 is a GREAT deal... appetizer meal and desert for $38... great views of strip and meatballs that melt in your mouth!!!!  excellent service and wonderful food...
This is a great family style restaurant!  The food is extremely tasty and is set in a relaxed atmosphere. I definitely recommend you stop here while in Vegas .

We were so excited about eating here, and the food was excellent.  I can't give it a higher rating because the service was absolutely terrible.  We were seated in about 10 minutes during lunch hour (1240ish).  We were seated at a table overlooking the strip (great) in the bar area (no problem).  The problem was that our waitress was the bartender, and despite only having one or two people at the bar the whole time we were there, it took ages to get anything done, including ordering drinks, our meal, dessert, etc.  It took almost 2 hours to have an app, a split meal, and a dessert.  The hardest working person in there was the busier, who was busting his butt the entire time!  He deserves a raise. :)

Amazing !! Our waitress was so awesome. We told her we had a show to make and she said she would tell the back we were in a hurry. Our food came out in 10 mins and was so good. She was attentive and vey friendly could not have asked for better service. Completely impressed.

The service was totally awesome, our waiter Randy was very knowledgeable about the menu and the wine selection, and the buss boy Jamal was super attentive and very helpful. I didn't feel rushed, even though our order was complicated and had a few special requests. The food was the best Italian food I have had in a long time. We had 3 dishes with a range of steak, seafood, and pasta, and it was all amazing. I am very impressed with the whole experience, and I think Buddy V should be proud of this place. The management is obviously doing a great job here!
Here for a quick lunch and I swear I wish...and I might come back for more. I had the lasagna and it was hands down the best I have ever had.

We got to experience this place randomly for happy our and are so lucky! This is a great happy hour stop! The sangria is to die for, great flavor and punch! We enjoyed their meatball HH app, delicious! Definitely put this place on your list of things to do!

Fun environment based off of Cake Boss. Food was very good, and the service was decent. We had a nice seat by the window with a view of the strip which was neat. It seemed a little loud inside and our service seemed slightly rushed. The presentation and flavor of our dishes were wonderful.

We paid more and less in Vegas, but Buddy's was the best.  The "Parm" was a cheesy dream, The grilled salmon was cooked perfectly.  I guess it is the simple combination of the best ingredients with the presentation skills and technical excellence of a master baker that makes it so good.  This was the only restaurant we visited on or near the strip that didn't seem to be charging a location premium.  It was not inexpensive, but it was reasonable.  Oh-ya, save room for desert OMG!!!!

My husband and I come to Vegas frequently so of course when Buddy's opened we had to try it.  We experienced the best service of our lives, and we've eaten at 99% of the restaurants on the strip.  Our server Deanna was very attentive and friendly.  I will definitely request her table during my next visit.  The food was top notch quality food.  The caprese had amazingly fresh mozzarella, and the chicken parm was tender and delicious.  The cannolis are to die for....melt in your mouth amazing.  I can't wait to come back!

I have to say it was so much better than I was expecting! We found the restaurant pretty easily by following the maps around the shops but I can see how it can be difficult to find. The red and white checkered tablecloths on the tables in front of the restaurant made it obvious we had arrived. 

Buddy's is very spacious inside. I loved the decor of lights made with whisks from large mixers. Also, the rolling pins hanging and bundt pans were so creative. It felt very cozy and welcoming. 

On to the food! There were breadsticks waiting on the table. We were pleasantly surprised when they brought out olive oil and balsamic with warm focaccia bread...melted in your mouth. The bread was so soft, yet crunchy at the same time! We ordered the meatball sub with Tuscan fries, the Margherita pizza and kids spaghetti with tomato sauce. The Margherita pizza wasn't exactly as thin as most that I've had but very good! The crust was soft and a little thicker with chunks of tomatoes and fresh basil. My daughter ate so much spaghetti she couldn't believe how good it was. 

On to dessert! I loved how the dessert menu had pictures of Buddy's family, so sweet! We opted for the warm Nutella chocolate melting cake with salted Carmel ice cream. Words cannot even describe...we fought over it with our forks...it almost got ugly. There was not a crumb left. 

The service was great. I wanna come back for dinner now!

Con: the only thing negative which was quickly fixed, my daughter ordered a Shirley temple. It had no taste, tasted like colored water. No idea what the problem was but they brought another out and it was perfect.

The service was FANTASTIC!  We were a table of five and shared our entrees to have a variety of tastes.  Some of us loved the calamari, the other half thought it was too tough.  The eggplant parm was actually hard, so I'm glad it was a shared appetizer instead of a meal. I had read great things about the lasagna...but I must say, I was slightly disappointed.  The portions were huge but if nothing about the dish makes you want to  eat more then who cares?  The chicken parm was GREAT!  But the pasta it came with was OVERLY salty!!!  The Osso Bucco and Polenta were OUTSTANDING as was the Veal in bone parm....although another party at the table complained there was too much cheese on that.  The XL Lobster Tail for dessert is to die for :) ...and I really loved the cannoli.  The ambiance was great....and like I said, the service was stellar!  The portions were great, ... I just have a few complaints....and a few disappointments.  Would still give it another try to taste a few more things before discounting it.

Stayed at The Venetian and made a reservation for 5:15pm on Saturday night.  When we were to be seated, the hostess tried to sit us right opposite the open kitchen, which is brightly lit, noisy, steamy and certainly not where we wanted to be. She then went back to see where else we sit and we got a table for 2 in the bar. The food was good. Foccacia was warm and they offered oil and vinegar as well as butter. We found the service was fast, maybe a bit too fast.  Maybe Saturday night is a busy one,and they try to move their diners along. We had the beef medallion, $38, cooked a little too rare for medium, but it was tasty. The mashed potatoes and sauteed spinach that it was placed on, could have been a bit more generous. Very skimpy on those portions. We also had the price fixed dinner for $38, which gave you choices. We had: Grandma's meatballs, chicken parm with spaghetti and they were tasty but they skimped on the sauce so although it was good, it could have been better. The chicken parm was very crispy and tender but the spaghetti was a bit dry. The meatballs had a nice portion of sauce served with them, so we should have kept that dish, just for the leftover sauce. The desserts you could choose was a cannoli or a Nutella cake with salted carmel ice cream.  Nah...didn't appeal to us, but we were told you couldn't substitute from that menu.  Really?  I can understand the entrees but the desserts? We were told that they had a 'full dessert menu' but our waitress never offered to show it to us. Carlo's Bakery is right across the hall from the restaurant, but by the time our meal was done, so were we. There was quite a long line waiting to get into the bakery, and it wasn't moving very quickly.  What we did notice, was that when you go to sit at the bar, there are 2 steps up, and there is no handrail in the middle of this wide expanse. We saw two patrons stumble, and one of the waiters actually took a flat out fall. We may go back to give Buddy V's another try and since we now know the lay of the land, so to speak, we will be specific about where we want to be seated, and will order with a request for "additional sauce on the side". I'm from Jersey City NJ originally, so come on, Buddy, take a little constructive criticism to heart, from a neighbor who loves ya'!  :-)

Yum yum yum!

Great food and great dessert!
You must try the carbonara pasta!

and their molten cake and Italian bday cake dessert are to die for, I swear!

I took my mom here for a Mother's Day lunch and we were not disappointed! I almost didn't give this place a shot because we did not like Carlo's bakery very much, but this place turned out to be so great! We were seated within 10 minutes and got a great table next to a window with a view of the strip and right next to the live music. Our waiter provided great service and my mom even got a flower for Mother's Day. We ordered the Salmon, Chicken Parm and Garlic Bread. All of it was so delicious! The salmon was cooked perfectly and the chicken was tender and juicy. The spaghetti had great flavor, I definitely recommend getting the extra Parmesan on top and adding some crushed red pepper! I also love that they offer unsweetened tea and come around to provide refills regularly. There are so many restaurants to choose from in Vegas, but I would probably go back here next time and try some other items off the menu. (The spaghetti in my picture looked prettier when it came out,  I messed it up)

They gave me a rotten panzanella salad! They cheese was not fresh at all, and I was afraid to eat it. The rest of the salad was a flavorless bland combo of bread, cherry tomatoes, rotten romas and rotten cucumbers. It was disgusting. I tried to pick around the rotten produce and just eat the cherry tomatoes accidentally getting a rotten one in my mouth before spitting it out , not wanting to cause a scene... the waiter never came by for me to even tell them it was a health hazard!  

Also, I didn't even have bread to eat because they give you these tacky bread sticks in a plastic bag. Overall the worst experience at a restaurant I have ever had in Las Vegas, which is rare because there are a lot of amazing restaurants on the strip. I have never been served rotten food before. My husband's dish was bland small, flavorless and overpriced. 

Don't waste your money because Buddy is on TV (Cake Boss), his bakery is great, but his restaurant is terrible.

Buddy V's has always been great for us.  The food is very good and the brunch might be my favorite in Vegas.  The carbonara mac n cheese (I think is what it was) will have you battling your Nonna for the last bit in the bottom of the tray. 

It's great for the holidays too. We came here for Xmas and thanksgiving and they always do a special spread.

The wait staff is always incredibly friendly and fast, even if they can be a bit quirky.  One of them accidentally gave my girlfriend a backhanded compliment, realized his misstep, and then saved himself.  It was actually kinda funny.  The attitude of the wait staff we've had has been to make sure you have a fun experience along with excellent service.  And we haven't been disappointed.

A must try when coming to Vegas! I tried the chicken Parmesan it was perfect, as well as the chicken piccata which was the best I've had so far. Meatballs were tender & flavorful as well as the polenta which tasted like butter. Waiter paired our wine to our meals & you have to try the Bombolinis!!!!! Amazing!

I would have given this place a 5, but no vegan options- not even sides on the dinner menu. Anyways, we had just ordered 3 orders (husband, daughter, and I) of spaghetti pomodoro, and our waitress asks if we are vegan, which we reply yes (she also mentioned she was vegan ). She immediately makes a suggestion which was AMAZING! It had veggies, pasta and they switched the pesto sauce with a tomato sauce! For dessert, she reminded us that the only vegan option was the sorbet! What amazing service and the foods was also astounding!

The atmosphere is casual. Not too busy (Thursday afternoon). Perfect to bring your kids!

Came here with high expectations and they fell flat fast! Service slow and the food nothing like what I expected after reading positive reviews? The caprese salad was $16.00 and literally was 2 ounces of buffalo cheese with some wilted basil and a small spoonful of cherry tomatoes no seasoning big disappointment! The chicken parm that everyone raved  about tasted like something from Olive Garden but no seasoning and the Spaghetti on the side came cold no flavor .    Did not order dessert since everything was a big let down went to Bouchon for dessert! The bakery across the way looked very busy maybe should try that next time.

I am really surprised to read about poor service here. Our experience was completely opposite of that. This was quite possibly THE BEST service we've had in LV in the 4 days we've been here. Our waiter, Mourad, was beyond awesome!  Super attentive and responsive. We never had to ask for refills on drinks - plates were cleared magically-staff was friendly.  

The food: meatballs. Best I've had - even better than Mom's... shhh don't tell. 

Salmon: I'm from the PNW where the fish is amazing....this place rivals great seafood restaurants near Seattle. 

Chicken Parm:  Fork tender, sauce was perfect, pasta was fresh and cooked perfectly 

Cannolis:  fan-dam-tastic. 

If you like your meal, check out the bakery across the corridor!

O. M. G. 
The food is so amazing and the service is great. Everything we ordered was served family style. I'm not sure if that's the norm, because I was there with my husband and a company dinner. We had some of everything. Lasagna, calamari, filets, scallops...and several more items. EVERYTHING was good. The lasagna and calamari were my favorite. So flavorful and presented beautifully. 

I am in Vegas a few more days and I will definitely be back for round two.

Awesome Restaurant! You must get the Caesar Salad with the polenta croutons then get the appetizer of the polenta croutons to go. The service is always good and you cannot go wrong with anything on the menu.

So the wife and I went to Buddy V's last night and here are my thoughts.  Overall it was a good dining experience, but not a great one.  I wasn't bowled over by either the service or the food, (except for the desert).  It was just kind of okay and most likely won't go back.
First off, the restaurant is tucked away in a spot that has a fantastic view of the Strip, but the internal design was emotionally cold.  I want an Italian-American restaurant to be warm and inviting and this place was trying too hard to be fancy, (which is most likely a result of its being in the Venetian). 
We didn't order any appetizers but for entrees my wife had the Veal Marsala and I had the Chicken Parm.  My wife and I both loved the taste of our meals.  They were both well prepared but both were a bit on the small side for the money they are charging. The Chicken Parm had only two cutlets and the side of spaghetti was only about a half a cup's worth.  Same with the wife's dish.  Like I said both tasted real good, but not really any better than any other Italian joint in town. Also, they give you fancy Focaccia bread with dinner.  Sadly they offer no butter or Olive oil to go with it and really, the bread had a distinctive taste to it, which made it non-optimal for dipping.  I'd rather have warm, fresh, and plain Italian bread over the fancy stuff. 
For desert we shared a Tiramisu and that was fantastic.  The quality and taste of it was spot on.  
As far as the service, the wait staff was very attentive.  Our waiter was professional but a bit stoic.  
We probably won't go back because I can get just as good Italian food from a local spot 10 minutes from my house but the desert was great so maybe it's worth it to try lunch there instead of dinner paired with desert.

We went here for brunch last week. Cost was about $50/pp with bottomless cocktails (included Bellinis, mimosas, Bloody Mary bar, and a few other choices I can't remember). I thought there could've been more food choices in the buffet. They had a crepe station but only offered two fillings, they had a decent mix of sweet and savory dishes to choose from though. We went up three times to refill our plates, and I enjoyed everything I ate. We loved the Bloody Mary bar! Such a cool addition! They also had live music which added a nice touch. I would recommend to anyone who loves a good brunch.

We didn't make a reservation on the night we stumbled upon Buddy V's inside the Venetian Hotel. It was a pleasant surprise as we have watched his family on tv for years. Adjacent to the Cake Boss bakery you will find the restaurant. The decor makes you feel like you are in Buddy's family kitchen with a trendy twist. First off, we were impressed with our servers knowledge of the restaurant, the beginning including how it all started, how it's grown, and Buddy's role in all of it. He seemed to really love working there and his passion for the company was inspiring. The menu is full of Italian comfort food dishes. A surprising twist to the evening was the lemon croutons on the salads, we ordered a side of them to indulge ourselves throughout dinner. The dessert menu is adorable, it looks like an old family photo album complete with pictures and the history of each recipe used. The personal touches Buddy and his family have put into this restaurant truly make you feel as if you were invited into his personal home. We are so thankful we stumbled upon this gem, and look forward to visiting again on our next trip to Vegas.  If you are a Buddy fan, this place is a MUST!

We went to Buddy's on a Thursday for dinner there was a group of about 10 of us the wait was about an hour and a half(which I understand with a large group) to be seated and another hour just to get our food out. I understand it's Vegas and all but the experience was not great especially when all we ordered was pasta it shouldn't have taken that long to get our food out. We overall spent 3 hours to be seated, get our food, and eat.  The restaurant wasn't very busy to have waited that long either. The food was fine but I didn't think it was worth it for the price.

Unexpectedly, one of the best meals I have had in Vegas.  The focaccia brought out first was delicious with oil and balsamic vinegar.  Grilled octopus as a starter was to die for.  So tender and flavorful, with a slice of grilled bread to soak up the sauce.  Followed by sea bass simply prepared with a super fresh salad alongside.  He had the veal Marsala and ate it all up.  The big downside was the live music, it was so freaking loud even though we were 2 rooms away, it really detracted from the dining experience.  The singer wasn't bad, just way too loud!

My family owned an Italian deli/bakery for 26 years (9 of which I worked) so I know what homemade sauce, meatballs, sausage, etc tastes like.
 
With that being said, my girlfriend and I were very happy with our meals and exceptional service. Walked in around 5PM on a Tuesday night. We were quickly seated. We each ordered a sangria which shockingly were only $4 each since it was happy hour. They were delicious. Lots of good fruit in them. They were not cheapened because of HR.
 
We each ordered the same dinner, the rigatoni with lamb, pork, meatballs. and sausage. At a $26 price tag, I was very happy. Most Strip Italian places will charge $18+ just a plate of spaghetti alone. We meats were tender and delicious as was the sauce. The pasta, cook perfectly. Freshly baked bread was served before dinner as well. Again, delicious.
 
I look forward to returning. The service was as stellar as the food.

I love Cake Boss & Buddy so we went to his restaurant on our recent trip to Vegas. We were a group of 5 vegetarians. We ordered a couple antipastos & pastas. The service was good but the food was ok. Nothing was spectacular. We went with high expectations but were not impressed at all. For dessert we ordered Lisa's Nutella cake which was good. I will add that I liked the decor of the restaurant but that won't bring us back.

Excellent location with great service. The food was delicious and I enjoyed every bit of it. The tomato & basil soup was really great way to start off things and make sure you end it with their popular canoli. No complaints and honestly one of the better friendly services.

Celebrity chefs have let me down before in Vegas, but I was pleasantly surprised by Buddy V's. For a man known for his cake, he can dream up some good Italian food. 
You may be shocked by the prices at first (well probably not it is Vegas), but the dishes are served family style. Yes, you can realistically share a dish with someone else. (My exception to this would be the spaghetti.) The Cesar salad was crisp and coated in dressing and could easily be split between two or three. There are very few options for vegan's or people who don't want dairy, but you can opt for the Spaghetti Pomodoro. Usually, I do not like spaghetti at restaurants because most of the time I can DIY. However, the flavors of the sauce were fantastic. Super tasty my only gripe is that in comparison to everything else the portions were tiny. Luckily you can load up on the deliciously garlicky, buttery, and cheesy bread.
This place seems to stay pretty busy, so get there early. In a world of lackluster name driven Chef restaurants don't be affraid to take a chace on Buddy V's Ristorante.

Came in with my boyfriend for my birthday on January 19th. We had reservations at 7:00 and even though we were about 10 minutes early we were seated right away. I really liked our table as it was right next to the window overlooking the Strip. The restaurant was busy but not overly packed. 

This is where it started to go downhill. We sat for almost 15 minutes before my boyfriend had to flag down a busser to ask him to call our server. We hadn't even been poured water or given bread at all. The busser was nice enough to bring us both, telling us that our server would be right with us. 20 minutes goes by before our server even acknowledged our presence. What was really disturbing was that she was the waitress for the table directly next to us and had been walking right past us and using the register right next to us the whole time! I would not expect service like that from this type of establishment. Especially when it wasn't even very busy. 

We ordered the mac 'n' cheese carbonara for an appetizer and it did not disappoint. It was very tasty and just the right portion size for the two of us. I decided on the chicken parmesan while my boyfriend got the spaghetti and meatballs. The food came out quickly and was delicious. 

The only complaint was of the service and lack of attention from our server. Every time my boyfriend tried to get her attention to let her know it was my birthday she would ignore him. She seemed very preoccupied with a table of older men. I understand she saw a big tip but it kills the restaurant's reputation as there are many different groups of people who come in to dine. 

It was good but there are other Italian restaurants in LV that have better food and prices with much better service. I have to say it really bummed me out that this experience wasn't what we had hoped for as it was a special occasion that we had been looking forward to for some time.

Words cannot express how AMAZING our meal tasted! Dreams came true this day as we tasted Buddy's very own recipe. The ambiance was that of classy comfort, gorgeous staff, attentive service and PHENOMENAL food!!! I can't wait to go back to try more!

The Cake Boss is everywhere these days and I am glad to see a place in Vegas. 

I made a reservation which you can do on line so getting a table was a snap. 

The chicken Parm was amazing, perfect breading and plenty of food. They give you spaghetti also. The food is absolutely fantastic. 

The lasagna is amazing also, perfect. The portions can be large however. 

Tried the garlic toast also and it was a perfect match. 

The staff are absolutely amazing, the waiter made a perfect recommendation for a wine to pair with the chicken Parm and knew the menu and food. There was also a couple assistants that kept everything flowing. This made everything work like a well oiled machine. The Cake Boss did an excellent job and I will be back if in Vegas again.

First of all, this place is super hard to find in the Venetian Grand Canal Shoppes area. Locate Tao, then use the exterior door to get the covered balcony, hang a right and it's past Rock House. I'm usually good at navigating casinos but this place was hidden! Worth seeking out though.

Came in for Restaurant Week lunch menu with Lauren C- $20, 3 courses, $4 donation to Three Square food bank, so a win all around. As expected, they are spectacularly good at carbs here, from the house focaccia you are served upon seating to the polenta croutons in the Caesar. We shared the spaghetti and meatball and chicken parm entrees, both with more than ample pasta for a lunch portion with a great robust sauce and well-seasoned protein. I'm not much of a dessert person, but the NJ style cheesecake was well made and nicely accented by strawberry compote and chocolate almonds. 

Service was attentive and I really love the ambiance of the dining room. While this spot is hard to find, I'd come back to try more. As a local, RW is great for giving a discounted opportunity to try a place I otherwise wouldn't seek out (who voluntarily goes to the Strip these days?!), while giving back at the same time!

Picked up 3 things during our stay in Vegas and took it back to our room. (Cant comment on service). 1. The Margarita pizza was the bomb! Very delicious. Decent size for the price.  2. The spaghetti central was so freakin good!!! Second best spaghetti Ive ever had. (First is Mama Depandis at RPM Italian in Chicago.) 3. The parm polenta is the best polenta Ive ever had hands down! Definitely will be coming back to this place on return trips to LV.

Holy cow. If you're not down to read this long review, the gist of it is: best buffet in Vegas hands down.

I came here for a comp'd Sunday Brunch buffet, which is normally priced at about $35 per person-- already pretty reasonable for the strip. But you're getting SUCH BETTER FOOD than you're finding at the standard all you can eat buffets in hotels. Everything was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The food is constantly being swapped out for fresh batches, and everything just TASTES homemade. The meats were the biggest surprise-- I don't think I've had meat that tasted that good and UNprocessed since visiting Europe... I'm not joking. The pastries were also fluffy and clearly created by an expert. 

There was a lot of variety though I did feel that the brunch leaned more lunch than breakfast... so know that coming in. The breakfast food was limited to regular scrambled eggs, "Sunday Style" eggs (with cheese and veggies mixed in), bacon and sausage options. Other food available was cheeses, meats, shrimp, pastas and a SLEW of desserts.  I tried getting a small taste of everything and there wasn't one thing I didn't like. I often have trouble with buffets where I grab a bunch of stuff on my plate but it doesn't necessarily taste great TOGETHER-- but that didn't happen here. Everything was very cohesive and worked well together no matter what you piled on your plate.

I highly recommend the Orichette pasta, the Carbonara Mac & Cheese, the sausages, and the croissants. You won't go wrong with any of the desserts-- but be sure you grab one of their famous cannolis!!

Food = 5 stars
Overall = 3 stars

We had a very uneven experience at Buddy V's. The room was nice, but you really want a booth, as the tables had very uncomfortable-looking, unpadded chairs. Service was scattered and disorganized. Our server, Kacie, while very nice, seemed to be kinda all over the place, we had just sat down when she asked us if we were ready to order (??) and the bread service didn't arrive til after the entrees were served -- disappointing, as the restaurant had been open for long enough to smooth out those kinds of issues.

On the bright side, the food was excellent, we started with the meatballs, which were surprisingly light and tasty, with a nicely seasoned red sauce. I had the whole wheat penne pasta with pesto and veggies, delicious with a lot of flavor but still light. Hubby had the shrimp scampi with perfectly cooked shrimp and angel hair pasta and a light and flavorful sauce. 

The prices were pretty good for Vegas so we felt we had a good value, but it was really too bad that the overall experience didn't match the quality of the food. With so many options in Vegas, I doubt we would be back.

Made a reservation and when we get there the hostess said we will be right there and then was joined by 4 other coworkers and just continued to talk and have a private conversation instead of getting us seated ( I thought you were at work but clearly we are on your time) 
Happy hour is good but the staffing in the bar area was slow! Poor girl was all by herself in the lounge area and you could tell she needed back up. Food was good though, smaller portions.

This place surprised us with how good it was. We just shared a ton of appetizers between 4 of us-salumi & cheese board,  mozzarella carozza and meatballs. The sauce was out of this world and the mozzarella carozza was all around amazing, to the point that even as full as we were I couldn't let any be left over. I hear they have a great happy hour which unfortunately timing wise we missed. This was definitely a winner and would be interested to try some of the actual entrees and pizza/pasta.

One of my Italian Food places ever! First of all, the best dessert I've ever tasted in my life....Italian Birthday Cake is the bomb and a must have! I just wish Buddy would open a place in LA, so us Southern Californian's could partake in the flavors of his families recipes ! His Chicken Parmigiana is outstanding, (order extra sauce!) and the Chicken PIccata is my husband's favorite. We love the feel of the restaurant, the view is beautiful, (although we hate that it's in Sheldon Adelson's place), and we try to make sure we stop there every time we're in Vegas. We even ordered meals to go last time we were there....and the restaurant packaged everything up beautifully for our drive. Order your desserts when you're dining at the restaurant, and you can skip the line across the way at the Bakery.

We had a nice and delicious dinner earlier tonight. We had the spaghetti with clams and prawns, fried scallops, spaghetti carbonara, and a cannoli for dessert, all to share among 3 of us. The only thing that I don't like was the ambience. It's a noisy restaurant. Service was good and helpful.

We checked out Buddy V's for their weekend brunch buffet.  I love Italian food so this buffet was perfect IMO.  It is not overwhelming big, but has just enough to have a bit of everything.  There is also an option to add on endless wine, beer or mimosas.  The stations include an antipasto bar with cheeses, charcuterie, salads and veggies.  The carving station cooked up Italian sausages and breakfast meats.  The hot food station included Italian style scrambled eggs, pancakes and of course pasta!  My favorite part was the dessert spread with favorites like tiramisu and mini cannoli. I left feeling satisfied, not overly full, and felt I tried everything without having to waste.  The decor and ambiance is also really cool with and open kitchen.

Came here for the great happy hour menu. $4 sangria was excellent! Ordered the cheese and charcuterie board (not on the happy hour menu), and it came with a good portion of three different meats and cheeses, olives, and delicious grilled bread slices. We devoured the bread, and they immediately brought us more! There was live music, and they took requests, which provided a great atmosphere. We already had dinner plans elsewhere, but we had to try their desserts. We shared the lobster tail pastry and the warm Nutella cake with salted caramel ice cream. The lobster tail was amazing, with perfectly flaky layers and a sweet creamy filling, served with berries on the side. The Nutella cake didn't have as much Nutella flavor as we were hoping, but delicious nonetheless. The real star was the salted caramel ice cream! Would love to come back again and stay for dinner, as everything looked delicious.

We were quickly seated for lunch. Prices were average for Vegas, but the food was so delicious I would have paid more. Eggplant parm amazing! Salad and carbonara what dreams are made of. The waitstaff was very attentive, great meal

I had my heart set on Chicken Parm for lunch. I was extra excited to find the best lunch deal i've seen on the Strip here at Buddy's included chicken parmigiana. Boss' Express Lunch for $22 got us an antipasto, main entree and dessert. For a starter, Grandma's meatballs were tender and sat in a bed of tomato ragu. The much anticipated chicken parm was a little on the dry side but nothing a little more sauce could've helped with. It was just the right amount of food. My heavy lunch was offset by the refreshing lemon sorbet with biscotti. Very strong lemon flavor, it was good! I would also suggest the Panzanella - i tried a few bites and it was a really great salad if you're looking for something lighter to start your meal with.

Fun touches related to baking and family incorporated into the decor. Ceiling lightbulbs encased in mixer whisks, rolling pin structures and at home pictures on the brick walls. Big restaurant and comfortable, family vibe. Huge fan of Buddy's show Cake Boss. Was hoping to catch him but maybe next time!

Had a delicious dinner with my husband. The Venetian Hotel is a sight to see and the food at Buddy Vs was incredible- possibly the best I've ever had. I had the Bronzino and my husband had the chicken parm- Wow. My martini was incredibly good. No dessert- we were super satisfied from our dinner.

Went to Buddy V's for my birthday dinner and it was the best decision I could've made!!! Dinner was amazing and service top notch!  Our waiter was very attentive and made us feel like home.

We tried the garlic bread, chicken Marsala and the lasagna and they exceeded our expectations, big portions and delicious taste! 

Also, they have the best tiramisu I've ever tried and I can't wait to go back to have some!!

We went back this morning for Sunday brunch and it was good. Not great but good. It was lacking in variety. The Mac and Cheese was yummy, as was the hot pasta salad. There was a small selection of cut meats and cheeses and some tasty meatballs and my husband was thrilled with the carving area. But the crepes weren't very good (no matter how much Nutella I loaded on) and the blueberry muffins and chocolate croissant were dry and tasteless.
Had the Philly sandwich for lunch and it was amazing..  Service was great.. Diffently want to come back for lunch again..

My wife and kids love watching "Cake Boss" and I usually always stay at Venetian/Palazzo so when I heard Buddy opened up a restaurant there I knew I had to go.  They had only been open about 10 days or so when my friends and I went so I did take that into consideration when writing this review.  Upon entering the restaurant I felt that the decor was quite nice.  They have framed family photos all around the walls which gives it a "homey" feel.  Even though some of the prices may be creeping close to fine dining prices the cuisine is not fine dining (which I like btw).  The whole table had the Jersey City style fried Mozzarella, margarita pizza, chicken parm, warm nutella cake, and XL lobster tail dessert.  I really enjoyed the fried mozzarella as it was not breaded like traditional fried mozzarella but rather sandwiched between two prices of bread.  The pizza is nothing special to me and did not stand out compared to the same style of pizza at other restaurants.  The chicken parm was a good portion which came with pasta that really did taste homemade.  My friends thought the Lisa's warm nutella cake was the best dessert they have had in their lives!  The service was spoty and our waiter would be gone for long periods of time but the busboy always made sure we had what we needed.  I chalk that up just to being a new restaurant.

Peter was the best server! So attentive, knowledgeable of wine and menu... and awesome service! He knew I was a teacher and comped us a free dessert for Teacher Appreciation month! So thoughtful! Food was delicious as well! Can't wait to come back!

The food here is delicious and the service is 5 star. Very friendly and enjoyable atmosphere. Christian was the best server. We will be back on our next trip to Vegas.  Great location across from Carlo's Bakery.

A really great Italian restaurant here at the Venetian.  We were very pleasantly surprised.  Terrific food & even better service.  When they offer three types of olives for a martini, that's top-drawer.

The food was wonderful, but the service was terrible.This restaurant would have had five stars if it were not for the poor service. It took 20 minutes for a waiter to come to our table, Then the waiter asked us if we wanted bread, because they brought bread to everyone's table, but our's was different it was a garlic cheese bread that we did not order and he charged us for it.  So the food was great, service terrible!

My wife and I went to Buddy v's (in Las Vegas) because we knew we were going to have a great cannoli but we ended up having such a great time. The staff was so warm and friendly we decide to go there the next day for dinner; so we canceled our other reservations and it was five stars across the board. I would recommend this restaurant to any person.

Als ich in Las Vegas reise, war ich den ganzen Nachmittag bei Venezianischen. Zum Nachmittagskaffee war ich hier in Buddy V's. Die Leute hier sind sehr nett. Ich sitze neben dem Fenster und habe Tiramisu bestellt. Es war sehr speziell und bisschen anders als ich in Italien probierte. Aber es ist super lecker und lohnt sich zu probieren.

I just returned home from a trip to Las Vegas with a girlfriend of mine. One of the highlights of our trip was to go to the Carlo's Bakery and Buddy Restaurant. Although the treats at the bakery were amazing we were extremely disappointed by how we were treated by one of the male wait staff at the restaurant. We are in our mid twenties and I feel like he didn't respect us as customers. We ordered a few cocktails as well as the cheeseboard. It was not a pleasant experience and I don't know if you will see this but I think everyone should be treated fairly dining at the restaurant (also the opening time on the website is wrong). That part of our trip was ruined. I love the show and am a huge fan.
Best place ever! We tried the express menu, from the soup to the dessert, everything was awesome. Definitely worth trying if you are on the strip.

Ordered calamari (4), lasagna(3), egg plant parm (3), cheese bread (4),cannolis (2), and the bread pudding (5) which was the best thing we ate on our visit! I would definitely recommend coming to this place for that bread pudding but the food itself is just okay, nothing out of this world. Service was great and fast on a Tuesday afternoon (about 1pm) where we did not have to wait to be seated.

Glorified Olive Garden....the dishes resemble that of a similar American knock off. This is the place for all those pasta loving eaters; however, for the prices, the dishes are no different than something you might find elsewhere for a lower price. The service seemed to be quite busy which made getting the check at the end of dinner seem endless.

My husband and I are really picky about our spaghetti sauce and Buddy V's nailed it! It was like eating at your Italian grandmother's house. The meatballs tasted homemade along with the bolognese sauce. Calamari batter was crispy and light, not to mention the delicious pizza (I recommend Buddy's Favorite). Don't forget the famous Carlo's Bakery cannolis. Everything was so amazing including the service. I highly recommend!

Wow!!  I am so happy we decided to try Buddy's.  I had a feeling it would be good but it was way better then expected!  My hubby and I both got the early special for $38.  You choose a starter, entree, and dessert.  Hubby got the meatballs and I got the Caesar salad.  The meatballs we so freaking moist! And the sauce was perfect!  The salad...probably some of the best dressing I have ever had and the polenta croutons! OMG!  Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, so yummy!

Then for our entree hubby got the carbonara and I got the chicken parm.  Both were amazing!  Pasta was cooked perfectly, the carbonara was creamy and rich, the chicken was moist and crispy, just...yes!  And then there was dessert.  I couldn't even finish my meal so we got the warm Nutella cake there and the cannoli to go.   The Nutella cake with ice cream was like heaven on a plate!  And we are still so full so we haven't tried it yet but I'm dreaming about it haha!  This is a must try!

Best place to spend your birthday ! Staff is really friendly and food is delicious we cleaned every plate ~ not something I usually do. Italian birthday cake was amazing as well and it was nice that they brought it out with a candle .. thank you so much!

We decided to try this new LV restaurant because we are huge Cake Boss fans. We should have asked for the dessert menu first because the appetizers and entrees were just okay. I'd recommend just coming for the desserts! Sorry Buddy. The food was fair. Location is very nice- can't beat the Venetian. Nice atmosphere. A tad pricey for our family's budget, but expected for a LV strip restaurant.

We came here because we saw it when we went to the bakery ro get a canoli. Best experience ever at this restaurant. The calamari is delicious here the chicken parm with the side of spaghetti is delicious. The drinks here were amazing shout out to danny our bartender. Im glad i came here. Will be back before we go back home.

I was excited to try this place, especially bc the owner is the star of TLC's reality show 'Cake Boss.' I had high expectations, but unfortunately, they were not met. 

I took the safe route and ordered Chicken Parmesan. This dish is pretty difficult to mess up since it's so common and every Italian restaurant has it. But to my surprise, it was just....Bleh. Nothing spectacular about it. Tasted better everywhere else. 

I was with 7 other girls, who ordered a variety of dishes. All didn't seem wow'ed at all, too. Two girls ordered the same thing (forgot what they ordered), but one girl's dish was way more salty than the other. We all had a taste of both girls' dish and agreed. 

Service was also just.... Bleh. Whenever we asked our waiter for something, he had a lame excuse why it couldn't be done or if it can be done, he would take forever to do so.
