One thing I don't like is how they can't split up checks. Even very small restaurants don't have problems with splitting checks now a days. I also don't like paying a lot for food that's less than mediocre. 

I must add though that their dessert menu looked amazing. Too bad none of us were in a mood to try anything. I MIGHT be back to try out a dessert or two when I make it out here again to L.V.

Nothing touches this food. Nothing. This is the one restaurant I recommend in Vegas over everything. You'd be doing yourself a disservice if you're in Vegas & looking to eat Italian & don't come here. Don't break the bank at Rao's or Carmine's or some other fine dining Italian restaurant. Eat at the place that feels like home but has the quality of food that can compete with the more expensive places. At those places you're going to pay extra for noodles with your parm. At Buddy V's it's all included for a lower base price. 

I'm not going to give a review based on a specific experience because each time I've gone it's been nothing but the best. Girlfriend and I love it. We start with the meatballs that will blow your mind; I order the chicken parm & she orders something new every time. While you wait, piping hot, fresh bread is delivered to you with classic oils for dipping; however, I'm a much bigger fan of dipping it in the meat sauce that comes with the meatballs. Red wine to wash it all down & I am a very happy man. 

Aesthetically, the restaurant feels like someone's home; classic oldies & doo wop are played throughout the restaurant. Seating has never been an issue for me even when I go at 6 or 7 PM on a Friday or Saturday. Restaurant may be packed, but there's plenty of bar seating. 

Two entrees, an appetizer & a glass of wine runs you roughly $70. Kinda pricey, but well worth it. Servings are huge. Most restaurants in Vegas will run you close to that amount anyways. You came to the wrong city if you're looking to pinch pennies and be frugal.

This restaurant was absolutely spectacular in every sense and I highly recommend anyone visiting Vegas to pay Buddy a visit! I made a reservation after reading the great reviews on yelp. The restaurant is classy yet casual. The ambiance is welcoming and doesn't make you feel like you are entering a "yuppie" restaurant. We were seated very quickly with my reservation. The kitchen is open so you can see the workers cooking and it is super clean. Smells delicious! I ordered a wine which was good. We had the mozzarella pesto bread as an appetizer. So good!!! Ok let's get to the meal. I had the rigatoni a la vodka. It was to die for! My partner ordered the chicken parm. It was so good too! We ate so much we couldn't get dessert. I'm sure those are delicious as well. Our waitress Kacie was very friendly and fast with service. I highly highly recommend this place. Buddy, great job!!

3 words: Creekstone Farms Burger. Amazing. Cooked to perfection, flavorful, and delicious. I seek out Creekstone Farms meat because it's open range, organic, and also happens to be Halal. I called and was told quickly that they do indeed serve Creekstone Farms Beef burgers. 

Locating the restaurant was a little tricky but a couple directions later we made it. Inside is beautifully laid out, while not overly fancy, it is classy. 

We were seated in a clean red booth immediately and drinks brought right away. The burger was $16. I asked to have the meat cooked away from pork and the server kindly let me know that the only pork they cook is in the meatballs in a pot. The grill only cooks shellfish and steak. Super nice. 

Burgers came out with Parmesan fries. Asked for pickles and had them right away. Drinks filled automatically. No breadsticks or other food while you wait. There are some really thin straw like bread sticks on the table that are average. 

But all in all, a fantastic experience for lunch. Will definitely be returning on my next trip to Vegas.
Jolie déco et bon service, mais c'est tout : garniture annoncée non présente dans le plat, cher pour la qualité et la quantité, se dit italien mais ne sait pas faire de carbonara italienne.
Had a great dinner at Buddy's V's. Food was great staff the same would highly recommend if you are in Las Vegas!!!

I'll describe Buddy V's in 1 word...perfect. From the Caesar salad, the broccoli rabe / sausage rigatoni, the Bronzino to the Tiramisu, everything was bursting in flavor, perfectly cooked and beautifully presented. A most enjoyable experience.  I rarely give a restaurant 5 stars on Yelp, but Buddy V's is well deserving. Don't hesitate making reservations. Incredible!

1st visits to Buddy V and I'm thinking of making it a regular spot on my quarterly visits to Vegas, service was good, food great and drinks on point. So happy I made a reservation because it seems as waiting it unpleasant.

My husband and myself researched this place before we came on our trip. This place looked like it would be delicious. Since I liked watching buddy v's show I expected big things. Well I was soarly mistaken. We ordered the carving board. The cold cuts at my local Kroger's are way better. All of the food we ordered was terrible.
Authentic Italian done family style. Love this place food is always great. Must try the calamari and mamas meatballs

I ordered the chicken parm and the bf had lasagna.  We also ordered the fries. Chicken parm was very good. Nice and crispy and the inside was juicy.  My bf said the lasagna was the 2nd best he's had,  his Italian moms is number 1. From hostess to waitress to server everyone was very nice and attentive.  Everyone seemed happy to be there making our visit much more pleasant.

I wanted to rave about this place, but it was middle of the road Italian food for me, nothing special or memorable and not really worth a second visit due to the service and prices. I had to ask for ice cubes in my water, asked for bread twice, lemons for my water twice, ranch for my son twice. It just wasn't the wow factor I expected for pricey Italian food.
Very casual place. The food was delicious, we had Caesar salad, eggplant parmigan and chicken parmessan. The food took awhile to come out, but the wait staff were very attentive and friendly.

Very good Italian food. Comfy interiors and friendly servers. We had a good bottle of wine that our server recommended, and even though it wasn't one we originally wanted, it was fabulous! We shared a salad and pizza, along with a dessert, and we were full.

Nice Italian restaurant with many homage's to Buddy's family. I love his show, so I wanted to try his food- got the prix fixe meal with the Cesar salad, chicken parm, and cannolli. The ceasar salad was super good and had polenta croutons. Our attendant (not the waiter) was AWESOME! He kept our waters full, and came by with more bread. Our waiter, was just okay. He was super chatty with other tables, and he tried to up-sell everything. Kind of felt a little pushy at times. Overall, we had a great time. Just had a horrible view of the Trump tower when we went but a cool view of the Strip. Ain't nobody wants to look at that tower while they're dining. But that's just my opinion.

Wow this place was really good. I had the carbonara and it was one of the best carbonara's I've had which says a lot since it's usually my go to at Italian restaurants. We order Buddy's favorite pizza for the kids to share and it was excellent as well.  Finished with Lisa's chocolate cake and the cake was good but the salted ice cream that came with it was amazing. Service was good too. They got us seated at our reservation time and didn't rush us out which was nice since we were dining with extended family.

The express lunch menu was a great value for the quality and quantity of food. Choice of appetizer/salad, entree and dessert.  Chicken Parmesan and spaghetti with Bolognese sauce was excellent. Service was fantastic. Beautiful and yummy deserts.

When here for my mom's 60th birthday and was pleasantly delighted. The service was fantastic and the food was delicious. 

I ordered the lasagna, while pricy, is the best I've had in town and the portion was huge. So, it was well worth it. In fact, I could have and should have saved half as a leftover; however, I couldn't stop eating.

I was so excited to see this restaurant listed in RESTAURANT WEEK!! I've been wanting to come here anyway & this was the perfect opportunity. A 3 course dinner for only $30.14!! I had Grandma's Meatballs for my app & Chicken Parm as my entree. Restaurant week's portion came with 4 meatballs. 2 pieces of chicken & a small but good size spaghetti. Both were just amazing. So much flavor in the meatballs & you can see the herbs when you cut into it. The breading on the chicken parm was perfect. Not too thick so it's not filling. The spaghetti sauce was simple & delicious. Mini donuts as the dessert with a chocolate & raspberry I think it was sauce to dip. 5 small pieces I believe. Spiced sugar coating the outside of the donut. 

The specialty cocktail list was awesome! Everything looked good! I ordered the DRAGO ROSSO-absolut ruby red, pomegranate, jalapeño & mango. A spicy treat! I've always wanted to try a spicy cocktail & this one was amazing. I had to take small sips cause my throat burned a little! The jalapeño seeds were floating at the top too. I think I should have asked the bartender to not make it that spicy. But it was good! Priced at $14. 

The restaurant is beautiful! It's huge. The kitchen was open so you can watch them cook (love that). Brick walls & floor to ceiling windows with great views of the Strip. There are old pictures everywhere & cool decor. Unique chandeliers & a great wine shelf! We had a great table next to the window :) 

Service was great! Everyone was so nice. I even got a birthday dessert from them with a sparkler attached! I will be coming back!

Very solid food and service. Not the best, not the worst, but also better than "okay".  When you think Italian food this could definitely come to mind. They serve fairly decent sized portions. I ordered the chicken parmigiana, which was very good. I sort have expected when I ordered garlic bread that it would be knots and not just bread covered in cheese, garlic and herbs. It was served with the main course, which was kind of pointless, I would have liked to get the garlic bread before the main course. Anyway, the place was definitely solid, decent price, I would recommend it and I would return if I want good Italian food next time I'm in Vegas.

Buddy V's Ristorante has a variety of great tasting Italian food. 

I loved the atmosphere, it was welcoming and personal. While waiting to get a table, I hung out in the bar area which was very spacious and had great waitresses. I had a Moscow mule, it was pretty decent. 

They got us a table in 35 minutes, which was exactly what they estimated. I got a Caesar side salad, which was decent. I wasn't super fond of the croutons. We also got garlic cheese bread, which was very tasty. 

My main dish was eggplant parmesan, with a side of spaghetti. I really enjoyed the eggplant, it was presented very nice as well. I also liked the spaghetti sauce. Since it was my birthday, they brought me a delicious birthday dessert. I must say, it was probably one of the best desserts I have ever had!

Delicious. The food was delicious. I had the Sunday sauce and it was amazing. Probably enough for two, so I had food waste guilt. The caesar was good, weird croutons, not really croutons but slightly crisped focaccia pieces... not so good. But the salad and dressing were great. But that sunday sauce......  yum.

Stopped in for a couple appetizers. Loved his famous meatballs - not to heavy - lots of flavor! We were offered a pitcher of sangria, drank the whole delicious thing! They then offered to clean and box the pitcher as a souvenir! Nice!! Their Birthday cake was a wonderful way to top off a great appetizer snack! Worth every penny! Go - enjoy!

Calamari is mediocre, like many other places in Vegas it is overhyped. They are not flexible. Bread is very tasty with oil and vinegar. The main attraction is the desserts. The Caesar salad has delicious cornbread croutons that are soft. Chicken Parmesan is well made not anything special. The chicken piccata is excellent and very flavorful. Tomato Basil soup is well but not anything special. The lasagna is on par with several franchise locations nothing extravagant. The Nutella cake taste like any other chocolate cake I could faintly taste the Nutella. The salted carmel Ice cream and raspberry sherbet is excellent and has a unique flavor. The cannoli is very good as well and is a must to order if you come here
I will say the service is excellent. Waiters are very attentive and are aware of their customers desires and level of drinks. The service is very friendly and insightful on the menu.      
In conclusion many of the dishes are very normal tasting. The desserts are very good overall. It is overpriced for what you get in respect to food but I say it's good to try once. If you are in for the deserts the bakery across has the same ones but will have a long wait.

Delicious food and superb service. Our waiter Peter provided us with excellent and impressive service.  We ordered the grilled salmon, shrimp scampi, clams with linguini, and the cheese ravioli. Would definitely recommend!!!!
One of best restaurants in Vegas!!!!

The hubs and I RARELY go out for Italian food. Why? Well, because we can make most of the dishes at home with high quality ingredients. Well, when I had some family in town, I suggested all of us going to Buddy V's only because :1. Pit stop at Carlo's Bakery; 2. It's easy for me to get back on the I-15 to head back to suburbia. 3. Italian food is always safe when entertaining guests.
Well, my cousins decided to day drink while waiting for me to get off of work, so by dinner time, they were fighting off a massive hangover. And it wasn't even 5 PM. Then they blew us off. 
The hubs and I decided to take advantage of our time together with our diva because we both had lobster tails from Carlo's Bakery on our mind. We figured, dinner was going to be a bonus, so I don't have to cook and clean, and we made the trek from suburbia to the Strip. 
We checked in for our reservation and was seated within a couple of minutes. When I made the reservation, I requested a table along the windows for the view. I noticed all the tables along the windows were designed for larger parties and I was prepared for them to seat us at a smaller table since our party decreased from 6 to 3. But no, they get a high five for seating our party of 3 at the  primo table that had a view of the Strip as well as a view of Carlo's Bakery so we can keep an eye on our number. 
Our server, was personable, just a tad slow. I'll take 'a tad slow' over crappy personality any day.
We ordered:
Kids Margharita Pizza
Grandma's meatballs
Caesar salad
Chicken Parmesan
Agnolotti

I enjoyed  everything that we ordered. I thought the pizza crust was outstanding; thin, crunch AND chewy, perfect amount of sauce and cheese. The meatballs were heavenly. The Caesar salad took us by surprise. When it arrived at the table, we thought the salad looked dry. But when we took our first bite, we understood why it looked like it was dry. It was one of the best Caesar salads I've ever had. It didn't need all that dressing because each bite had the perfect amount of acid, garlic, cheese and saltiness from the anchovies. The croutons were unique; I forgot to ask but I think it was made out of polenta. The croutons were perfect to dip with the meatballs. I had the Chicken Parmesan; it was good not great. MY hub's agnolottis were divine. Hand made, they were filled with veal shank, sausage and pork with a creamy, sage brown butter. The one complaint I had was I thought the agnolotti pastry was a tad thick but the flavors were very good. 
All together, we spend $113 with tip for 2 adults and a princess. A tad high for a family dinner, but overall, it was a great experience for us. Too bad my cousins were too drunk. But that's what you do in Vegas.

A little disappointed as I had expected great food! Do not order grilled cheese pesto sandwich! Awful ! Meatballs were average ! 
The orange sponge cake on the other hand was awesome! One of the best cake I've e ever had!

Stopped in for a small dinner and was blown away by the food and the service. The Eggplant Parmesan was absolutely amazing and the Garlic Bread was just fantastic. The service was wonderful and very attentive, and the live music was a wonderful bonus.  I highly recommend this restaurant!

Going against my diet was so worth it! Lol. I went here with coworkers with the idea that I would eat healthy but saw the menu and that all went out the window. I couldn't visit an Italian restaurant and not have pasta! 

I shared some calamari for my appetizer and skipped a salad to save room for the main dish. I ordered the chicken rigatoni with a tomato based cream sauce. Omg it was delicious. I tried not to eat it all and failed miserably. The sauce really makes the dish. You probably won't have room for dessert but try to chicken rigatoni and you will leave happy!

Restaurant week lunch menu 2015 review 

The Skinny: maybe I just don't get it but the food is okay,  not great... Surprisingly their dessert was the worst course and cannot recommend. (3) service is good and prompt (3) value: it was okay for Restaurant week special but I would skip this place at regular prices. 

We came in to try their restaurant week lunch menu which serves a 3 course lunch for $20.15. 

I got her Caesar salad,  grilled salmon over a cucumber/chickpea/artichoke salad while the hubs got the tomato basil soup and spaghetti and meatballs.  Both came with a dessert course of cannoli and cookie selection. 

The tomato basil soup was a little too bland and needed more basil. The texture was good.

I liked the Caesar salad better albeit it was a little heavy on the dressing and needed more acidity. The hubs thought there was a little too much anchovy in the dressing but I kind of like that. The polenta croutons were a great addition textural and flavorful. 

Spaghetti and meatballs was really nothing special and the sauce was too bland -  there really wasn't enough tomato flavour to really make this dish stand out. The meatballs were under seasoned. The spaghetti itself was cooked a bit beyond al dente which in a dish like this,  makes it disappointing. 

My salmon dish fared better. The grilled salmon was done perfectly. However the salad of cucumber,  arugula,  chickpea and artichokes was a bit underwhelming and needed more acidity/brightness to bring the flavors together. 

The worst course was dessert. It each came with a cannoli and 3 cookies -  oatmeal, chocolate chip and sugar cookie. The cinnamon cannoli was okay albeit rich...there wasn't enough cinnamon in there to really distinguish itself. The cookies were really bad -  they did not have that rich buttery taste to them. The sugar cookie especially tasted more like shortening and artificial flavors. I think they also skimp out and use cheap artificial vanilla extract.

After we finished lunch I was watching the bakers at Carlos bakery. Guess what I saw? A half used package of pre-made manufactured Rice Krispies treats with the shiny blue foil packaging and Kelloggs branded elves (see the pic). Seriously. As a bakery,  you cannot make rice krispie treats yourselves? (Just FYI, all you need is a microwave,  marshmallows,  butter,  rice krispie cereal, a bowl,  a spatula and 10 minutes to make this dessert). To me,  that is just bad form. 

At the end of the day, I give the dining experience a 3 star -  it's okay but nothing I would return for. As for Carlos bakery -  just the cookies and the aforementioned shortcut I saw are enough for me to stay far away.

So I can't say I love the fact that Buddy's feels very much like its part of a mall. I think it's due to the fact that the entranceway is huge. The open floor plan just makes the restaurants main Dining area feel like it's right in the middle of the mall. However despite this minor flaw the food here is authentic. Our waiter was from Naples and had a true passion for the food he was serving. Our apps were delicious including the Caesar salad and calamari. The meatballs were top notch. For dinner I ordered the mixed meats with pasta. The dish had a name but I can't remember for the life of me what it was called. The lamb was fatty though which is why I can't go to five stars. Plus the dish was missing a component in my opinion. Like maybe some cheese or vegetables. My friends dishes all looked good. No one seemed   blown away but we were definitely satisfied and impressed by the cleanliness and authentic Italian cuisine we were served.

Solid Italian dining option at the Venetian. The staff is all top notch and the food was pretty good. We had sangria to drink which was good and then a really fresh and delicious salad for an appetizer. My entree was the chicken rigatoni alla vodka - I thought this was ok although I have had better vodka pasta elsewhere. My two friends rated their entrees highly. Overall, a solid option that probably won't dissapoint but it did not blow me away.

Amazing place! In terms or prices, its on the more affordable side of Italian food in Vegas (but still runs about $20-$30 a plate), and is worth every single penny! Our waiter was the most amazing person, he was very attentive, personable, and charming, and made the experience here the amazing experience it was. The style of the restaurant is very charming and cute as well, and the environment was perfect for a night now while still being relaxing and comfortable. The proportions on the food were well worth the money too, I ordered chicken parmesan, which came with two huge pieces of chicken. The three other people in my party ordered other chicken, and every single one of us had to take home more than half our meal. Would highoy recommend to anyone looking for a good meal, this was the best we had on our Vegas trip!

Excellent dining experience! We reserved a table through Open Table and we didn't have to wait at all. We had a nice booth near the open kitchen. The wait staff was attentive and nice. Both of our dishes, chicken piccata and chicken Marsala were both amazing, film of flavor and perfect portions. Definitely recommend.
Service was A+. The food we ordered was good, but not "great", though we wouldn't mind returning and trying some of their other dishes.

This place is amazing! The food was delicious, the creme brulee is to die for!  Service was fast and courteous.  Atmosphere was a little loud for me, but it's pretty good for a restaurant on the strip

Went to the Venetian to find a good place for dinner and I am extremely happy this was the lucky spot we decided on. Drinks were perfect and our meals were delicious. This place can be as casual or formal as you want it to be. Would recommend this to anyone looking for a nice italian meal that won't break your wallet, still in a trendy setting!

Plainly speaking, this restaurant looks nice, the food is fairly good and the service is above par, but you pay a very high price for eating here.

So, if you are okay with or need to impress someone by spending about double what you would normally pay for a good, but rather run-of-the-mill and somewhat small portioned Italian meal, then you will likely be satisfied with your experience here.

Otherwise, you'll probably feel like what I felt afterwards. No longer hungry, but not particularly impressed.

We had the panzanella, turkey dinner, linguine and clams, cannolis and apple crostata. The panzanella was good, but we wished there was more than the four small slices of cheese on it. The turkey dinner was good. Was it $24 good? Not so sure. The linguine and clams was somewhat overpowering with the spices. Is linguine and clams supposed to make you sweat? Apple crostata was pretty darn tasty. Easily the highlight of our meal. The cannolis? Seeing as how the cannolis are seemingly a signature type thing, you'd think they would wow. They didn't wow us. They're good cannolis for a Hoboken bakery. But for a $$$ restaurant in the Venetian? For $$$ it needs to be BETTER than "home cooking".

My boyfriend and I were so looking forward to the food and the experience.  I will say it was very busy and we got right in to our table.  The wait staff is amazing!!! they were so attentive and they were never missing in action.  The lasagna was to die for and the portion was enough for 4 people.  If anyone is going there get the lasagna you will think you have died and gone to heaven.   For dessert we had the lobster claw with cream and berries again outstanding and enough for two people to share.  They also let you reserve on line. 

I would suggest that you take full advantage of that.  Some days are harder to get into the restaurant than others.  And online reservation makes it more convenient.    I would also suggest that you don't go home with out visiting Carlos Bakery which is located just across from the restaurant   I am going there again very soon and they also have a Happy Hour menu with lots of specials especially for all the locals.
Great food. Great service. Excellence at its best. The Assistant General Manager Adam Margolies was very professional and made my daughter's 12th birthday a very special occasion. Highly recommended

Decided on Buddy V's after looking into all the great restaurants on the Strip. Prices are reasonable for a "famous person's'" restaurant. Sat at a table with a view of the open kitchen.  Thin breadsticks individually wrapped at each table.  Great calamari fritters appetizer. Crispy and nice marinara sauce on the side. Ordered Clams and linguini.  They were ok.. chewy clams, very light on garlic, but substantial portion. Friend ordered vodka sauce rigatoni with chicken.  Good sauce, chicken breast a little tough but all around not bad. We opted not to have dessert with our meal since we were full and instead went 'across the street' to Carlo's Bake Shop. I've never been to the original one in New York, but I'm guessing they serve many of the same items in Vegas. It was just as crowded as the restaurant if not more.  There is a large window to view the pastry chefs/bakers decorating the cakes - a great way to pass the time while you are waiting to get your desserts.
Delicious food and drinks! We had the meatballs and the eggplant Parmesan. The staff members were all friendly and efficient. We hope to go back before we leave Vegas.

Nothing special - it's like Maggiano's or Carmine's but not as good

Best parts are the service and the desserts

Restaurant is huge, doesn't give you the warm feeling that an Italian restaurant should have in my opinion.

Food and drinks took forever, server was very polite but could make up the fact that everything took a very long time to get to the table.

We had the caprese and the panzanela salad, both were ok, nothing out of the ordinary.

For an entree I had the veal Marsala, comes with a side of linguine which was flavorless. Veal itself was decent but nothing that would impress.

Desserts was the only salvageable items that we had, cannoli and lobster tail made me give them 2 stars.

Would not return to this place, there's other Italian places that are much better.

There food was delicious! There sauce was soooo good, but the the portion sizes are extremely small, very pricey for the size but other than that this place is perfect, great atmosphere, great food, what more could you want.
Very hard to find such a friendly place, even the chef came out to greet us! Shoutout to Chef Forgione. Great view and tasty food. The garlic bread and meatballs are a must!
The best meatballs I have ever had. Food was good and the service was excellent. The portion sizes are great and the prices a very good for being on the strip. I come here every time.

Two stars because the service was horrible. We waited for over 20 minutes when we were first seated to have a waitress come over. Food was good. Trying to pay bill was a nightmare. 20 minutes and still waiting!

We amazing got a order to go chicken piccata and it was amazing. I also went over to Carlos's bakery and took baked items to go and chocolate strawberries they were awesome thank you so much service was great and the bartender was very friendly.

Amazing place to eat at if you want authentic tasting Italian food while you are visiting Las Vegas. The service was amazing & the food was even better. And on top of that the drinks are strong. My group had the garlic bread & calamari for an appetizer which was nothing short of extraordinary!! For the main course I had the Mama's gravy which came with pasta on one dish and pork,chicken,& beef on the other plate. It was a combination of a lot of food and great taste all wrapped in one. I highly recommend this place while in the area. Will definitely be coming back!!

Maybe I expected a lot more because of the name behind it. I Have to admit I was pretty excited to try this place out and not that I was disappointed but more so I wasn't wowed or left with a "can't wait to come back" feeling. A couple friends were in town and like any vegas visitor wanted to try something new. We came for Sunday brunch and instead of ordering off the regular menu they offer a Sunday brunch buffet. Though the selection was more than enough to fill me up, don't expect a lot of food (the idea most might get when thinking of a vegas buffet).  The food was ok. Nothing spectacular but very well presented. First time ever seeing dragonfruit and lychees (served in original shell and "hair") in a restaurant so that was new for me. Disappointment #1 for the price you are kind of better off checking out one of the other casino buffets.

The restaurant itself was cute, family like and had a really open feeling. Love the concept of the open kitchen! 

As for service, this would be disappointment #2. Our server sold us the idea of unlimited drinks for an upgrade (of course) but the fact we only saw him 2 times our entire visit, limited the drinks we could order. We had to ask our busser on 3 different occasions for more water. Plus side though the bloody mary bar was pretty neat, lots of hot sauce options, vegetables and additions to choose from...good touch! We could tell they were a bit short handed since we only saw 3 servers (from what we could tell) covering the entire floor and they were fairly busy.  So we cut him some slack because he was very nice. 

Hostess staff was a little rude and not very personable but our interaction with them was short enough to make it tolerable. 

We wanted to visit the bakery but the line was so long we decided against it. I'm a local so not sure I would visit again unless visitors from out of town really want to go, but even then I might suggest another spot.

Yum!!! It's insane how many restaurants there are in Vegas but my friends and I decided on this one because the menu looked good and it was in our hotel. The service was really good. Our waiter took the time to suggest us some appetizers and gave us his opinions on his favorite entrees and pastas. For appetizers, we got the fried calamari and a margherita pizza. The pizza was good and the calamari was really great. The calamari also had fried green peppers which was a little strange and I would have preferred those peppers to just have been more calamari but whatever. It also had really thin lemon slices that were somehow cooked to the point that they were crunchy and they tasted so good with the calamari.

For my meal I decided on the chicken and rigatoni a la vodka because I love pasta with vodka sauce and I don't have the chance to get it a lot. It did not disappoint at all. I loved the pieces of pancetta in it and the pasta was cooked perfectly. Sure it wasn't the healthiest dish (I definitely felt like I needed some vegetables after my meal) but it was delicious so I have no regrets. A couple of my friends got the sea bass and both loved it. Others got the chicken parm and carbonara and everyone enjoyed their dishes.

On to price, is it worth the price? Yes, the food was good, but $24 still is a lot for a pasta dish with sauce and chicken. If it wasn't on the Strip, I would say the prices were ridiculous. However, I think this is one of the more reasonably priced restaurants considering some of the other restaurants nearby. Its good for groups of friends or for families, and I'd definitely recommend it.

Grand Openings are not always grand.  I get it.  Staff is nervous.  Owners are stressed, etc.  Today was the opening of Buddy V's in the Venetian.  My fellow event planners and I wanted to escape the 3200 person conference we were working on and go somewhere without strobe lights and bass, so we came here.

I will start with the good:  
The decor here is great.  It takes up a corner spot on the Canal Shoppes level and you have a view of TI, the Trump and the strip.  It's rustic and familiar.  Red checkered napkins and rustic wood tables with interesting lighting fixtures.  My favorite was the children's artwork on the walls and the family photos everywhere (especially the dessert menu).

The food was GREAT.  I had the Orechiette with Italian Sausage.  It was flavorful and satisfying.  It had a perfect balance of al dente pasta, savory sausage and broccoli and tomatoes.  I wasn't starving, but I ate ALL of it. My team had the spaghetti and meatballs, the Burratta Salad and the meatballs.  They ALL raved without exception.  If it only depended on food and decor, i would have been more generous with my rating.   However, for me, service trumps it ALL. 

The not so good:
Service was odd.  We arrived for our noon reservation and the restaurant was probably 1/4 full.  There were PLENTY of open booths that would have accommodated us perfectly, but the hostess decided on putting us at a table in the back.  Once seated we waited a bit to be greeted by our server, but he eventually showed and took our order.  Once orders arrived, we all seemed to receive what belonged to someone else.  Then we had an unfortunate situation that involved our waiter spilling ice cold lemonade all over someone in our party.  It was a mistake and I felt terrible for him.  But the problem was he didn't seem prepared for the situation.  He remedied it as best he could by getting help, some towels and eventually a staff tshirt for our young group member (which lucky for him was not someone in an expensive business suit).  At the end of our lunch he announced his apologies and included that his manager was so sorry about the situation that he would be sending over a dessert for the table.  Now I don't know about you, but once I was at BJ's restaurant and there was a spill at our table that hit a few of our shoes and the manager raced over, paid for our dinner AND offered to pay for our shoes and dry cleaning!  and that was at a chain pizza place!  I'm going to take a wild guess and say that if someone spilled ice cold anything all over one of Buddy V's kids, he wouldn't be so keen on getting a hard puff pastry filled with custard as an apology.  While the spill was the waiter's mistake, management could have comped her lunch or at least her drink -- which he still charged us for!   

Unfortuantely, this is what I will remember most about my time at Buddy V's.

After speaking with the GM & Owner, learning of their concern for our health and desire to retain us as customers, really showed great customer service us. We appreciate their effort to provide support anyway they could. #GottaLoveGoodCustomerService
My family and i went for brunch. The services and drinks were great, but the brunch menu was limited. There wasn't much of a variety.

Where to start...

Location is awkward (end of a mostly deserted hallway) and was certainly of no help to former occupant FIRST Food and Bar.

Ambiance inside the restaurant itself is quite nice, although tables thrown in the hallway seem strange.  Outdoor seating is laughable and ill-conceived.  It's essentially at the top of an escalator leading up from Walgreens/down to the Strip so plenty of foot traffic will get to check-out your food.  The outdoor view is obstructed by a wall.  This area was never intended for restaurant seating and has emerged as a hot spot for Grand Canal Shoppes' employees to congregate and smoke.  Enjoy!

Service is slow and uninterested, perhaps even worse than FIRST.  Maybe the same staff?  A friend of mine said he and his date waited 15 minutes at an empty bar to be acknowledged, let alone served.  He was so aggravated they left without eating.  He's a bartender in the Venetian and understands the importance of timely service.  My experience wasn't much better.

My food was bland, we're talking CPK bland.  A penne dish was swimming in flavorless oil and assorted vegetables that looked to be left-over from some other dish and the chicken parm was just as bland.  Skipped dessert which was probably my mistake given that's the namesake's claim to fame.  Speaking of, who thought naming an Italian restaurant after a well-known PASTRY chef was a good idea?

I've already spent too much energy on this place.  Maybe it will improve and it seems others have had better experiences, but I won't give it a second go.

I've been in Vegas 4 days and have eaten here 3 times and will be back for lunch tomorrow. My husband doesn't like Italian food, so I don't get my fill, but this place changed that. Twice I've been here alone and the service and food has just been fantastic.  I've gotten the pizza, lasagna, tomato basil soup and caesar salad and liked the salad least of all. Both desserts - the cheesecake and creme brulee- were fantastic.  I wish we had one of these in Austin!!!!

Kickass Italian food. This is one of the best Italian meals I've ever had. I have my favorite places in Chicago and San Francisco's Little Italy, but Buddy V's is every bit as good as they are.
The grilled octopus was one of the most delicious dishes I've ever had in my mouth. My entree was the "Sunday Gravy" and I can't imagine ordering anything else. It was Fan-freakin-tastic!
Service is top notch.
Go. Here. Now!

Ate here for lunch with the Wife. We shared the smashed meatball sandwich. I started with a caesar salad and I do not know what they do to those croutons, but damn they are good. Head up on the salad, they are heavy with the anchovies. I did not mind it and almost licked my salad plate clean. 

Then the meatball sub came out. The meatballs were awesome, the bread nice and crunchy, and the right amount of cheese(more mozzarella than ricotta). 

We both enjoyed the meal and left full. 

The waiter seemed like he was in pain, the way he was moving around, almost like he through he back out of something. So maybe that was why we did not seem to be in that great of a mood. 

All and all a great meal and will try it again on another trip.

The food was great, must try the garlic bread, calamari and can't skip out on dessert, the cannoli is absolutely delicious. Service was a little slow but they were great which made up for it. They have a $22 lunch special which offers an appetizer, main entree and dessert.

Made a reservation here for a bachelorette dinner. The host was nice enough to see if we can have our happy hour bites at our dinner table and luckily we were able to. The one thing that dampened everyone's meal was the server. She was haste and not very amicable. I feel like I saw her at most 3 times during our entire meal. 

Nonetheless, the meal itself was pretty delicious. We order a variety of the happy hour bites such as the meatballs, sliders and Mac and cheese to share. I ordered the chicken and pasta which I actually felt like it was large enough to share. I would also recommend taking advantage of the happy hour drinks to go along with your meal. Overall experience was a little more than average but definitely could have been better. Hoping to make another visit to give this place another try.
Amazing!  Loved everything! The Sunday Gravy is the best....Service Amazing and our Hostess Marissa was beautiful and classy!

This was probably some of the best authentic Italian I've ever had. The Chicken Rigatoni Ala Vodka pasta was phenomenal. I've been dreaming about it since I left Vegas! It's going to be a place we definitely visit again next time we come back! I love the fresh baked bread we got once we ordered and the Moscato de asi we ordered with ate dinner was also wonderful. Love this place! We had great service and a wonderful environment.

I got spaghetti with meatballs, and my friend got Lisa V pasta. Dayummmm portions are small but after finishing my dish, I'm perfectly full. Flavor is just right, noodles are not soft but a bit chewy. I can seriously eat another one in a few minutes. It's that good!! My hot server was on top of her game, checking on us every 5-8 minutes to make sure we're okay. Food and service was perfect!

I normally don't order spaghetti and meatballs, but it was included in the Prix Fix meal, and I wanted a salad.  So,  I reluctantly ordered it.   Man oh man, am I ever glad  I did.  It was just like my aunts, if not better.  The most succulent meatballs ever!! The sauce was so good too.  I almost ate the whole bowl.  I left  a few bites because I was so stuffed.  I thought about it he next day, that's how I know it was good!!!
The food and staff here are fantastic! Some of the best Italian my wife and I have ever ate!
Always great to come back here. Cheese board is always great. Very fun atmosphere and servers are always great. I recommend coming here for the authentic Italian.
2nd visit to Vegas and again we go to Buddy V's and have an awesome meal and reasonably priced for Vegas. The cannolis are the best ever. This is a definite keeper on our next visit.

Casual family friendly restaurant in the Venetian. My husband is a huge fan of Cake Boss, so we had to stop here and Carlos's bakery when in town.

No reservations were needed for lunch and there are many tables. Casual Italian fare of sandwiches, pastas, and some meat dishes. We shared the eggplant starter and each had one of the sandwiches for lunch. The eggplant was okay - presentation was on the sloppy side though. My BLT was nicely presented with grill marks on the bread. Service seemed a bit forced and over cheerful. Food was a little slow to arrive given that it wasn't particularly busy when we arrived.

Overall a-ok but there are much better spots in town for mid-range pricing. The main plus is that it's family friendly if you have kids in tow.

Some of the best Italian I've had!! Got the lasagna and chicken parm, unbelievable!! Was worried, Italian can be done REALLY wrong, this is old school basic Italian perfected! Will definitely be back!

Awesome restaurant. Everything was delicious. The busser was awesome and made sure the drinks were never empty. He is definitely a hard worker and I appreciated it. The waiter was great also. Affordable prices with decent portions. I'll be back

Service:  Wonderful.  For the first week of a new operation, the waitstaff was friendly, helpful and efficient.  The servers had issues figuring our who ordered what, but this was probably because we were four sitting at a booth that could seat six.  Extremely accommodating.

Decor: Great views of the strip from the window booth. Nicely laid out with not too many tables and not too close together.  However, the cold air was blowing on us the entire time and I didn't go to Vegas for the cold weather.  Please fix this.

Food: Turkey meatballs were wonderful.  Chicken Parm was chewy and probably overcooked.  We came for the desserts and were disappointed that there isn't a more traditional cake.  I realize you have to spice things up, but if you are going to have funky desserts, you should also have at least one boring chocolate cake.

Was expecting more from this dining experience. Had a charcuterie plate and they went with boring, everyday cheeses. Poor garnishments. Not what you'd expect for $19. My son had the Hoboken Cheesesteak and the meat was excessively greasy. He couldn't finish it without fear of gastrointestinal issues. I had the spaghetti with meatballs. It was good. Not great. Certainly not what I expected from a celebrity chef.

Absolutely awful customer service by the manager here. He treated me very poorly when I spoke with him about our server (who was wonderful). He accused me of taking a bribe from the server to give him a compliment. I'm highly disappointed.

We were excited to see that Buddy Valastro had a restaurant in Las Vegas & had to try it out. Definitely were not disappointed! 

Both of our servers were excellent. Went with the recommendation for the Caesar salad as it included polenta croutons that were out of this world good! Salad was crisp, bright & fresh. Hubby greatly enjoyed the mac & cheese, while my eggplant parm was fantastic! Will definitely come back on our next trip West!

Place is actually better than I expected.  Classic Italian food with huge portions and prices. Carbonara like spaghetti was awesome.

Squid was excellent also.  Desert here was good. Had some kind of chocolate hazel nut cake with coffee ice cream. So creamy and fulfillling.

Then We Walk Over To Carlos bakery.  :)

I made a reservation for this gem without much background info on it. We were immediately greeted and welcomed into a cutely decorated restaurant. 

I had the chicken parm, husband had the cheeseburger and soup, we also got the cheesy garlic bread. My husband enjoyed his burger but was very disappointed because he didn't get he chicken parm. This is the best chicken parm I've ever had.... chicken was so moist and juicy. It melted in my mouth and left me wanting to finish off this large potion. Thankfully, my husband ended up eating some of mine and saved me from devouring the caloric bomb. Everything we had was tasty and we will definitely be returning. 

I encourage you to stop in here and give this place a try. It's well worth it!
Great Italian restaurant I love the Children Parmesan it is a very good choice. The atmosphere is also very nice. My family and I will definitely return.

Our first trip to Vegas and we selected this as our finale meal. We had good food at a variety of places in Vegas, but this was certainly the best. As a table of four (or more) we had the family style option, a fixed price, multi course meal. It was spectacular. Our server, Georgio, was the perfect combination of attentive and conversational, while knowing when to allow us time to chat and digest between courses. Family style dishes are determined by the chef. First course was panzanella (Italian bread salad), fried calamari (accented with thin sliced fried lemon!), grandma's meatballs, and a charcuterie board. Each item was prepared perfectly. We had a very nice Chardonnay with this course. If the meal had ended there we all would have been wonderfully satisfied with our meal. After letting that settle a bit, out came the entrees: a perfectly cooked beef tenderloin on a bed of mashed potatoes, a gargantuan portion of lasagna, tender chicken medallions in Marsala sauce, and a beautifully prepared sea bass. With the entrees we had Pinot noir. There was no room in our bodies for another morsel of food, but we cheered each other on to eat a bit of each of the desserts: a miniature Italian wedding cake (in honor of our brother and sister in law that were celebrating their 25th anniversary), chocolate cake with coffe gelato, and a conical, cream filled pastry called a lobster tail. 
A meal of a lifetime, with impeccable service. If your budget allows, definitely make Buddy Vs a priority stop in Vegas.
The staff is very good at up selling a rather mediocre menu at best. The restaurant counts on the fame of Buddy and really not geared to a true foodie.

I was a little worried about dining at Buddy's since he's know for his pastries, but my experience was superb.

My friends treated me to Buddy V's for my birthday. We went in on a Sunday around 5pm with no wait. 
We ordered from the prix fixe menu which I believe was $39 for three courses, and we also order the highly recommended lasagna. We ordered meatballs and Caesar salad our starters, chicken parm for our main and ended with Lisa's Nutella cake for dessert. We were also given complementary bread.

In one word, go! Everything was unbelievably amazing. Even the croutons on the salad, which are made to order with a crunchy exterior and warm, soft interior. I always seem to go to Italian restaurants for my birthday, and this is by far the best that I've been to. It's a little pricey, but so worth it.

Real NY/NJ Italian. Chicken Parm was one of the best I've ever had. Panzanella was good, a little overdressed and hence soggy. Caprese good but wished there was more tomato. Focaccia (complimentary) was amazing. Margarita pizza was small and just ok. Tiramisu was small and pretty good. Service quick and on point.

This was the best food we had in Las Vegas the whole 8 days we were there!  My husband got the lasagna and I got the spaghetti with marinara sauce.  It was all awesome and we ate it all.  Sweet tea was great!  Serving staff left a carafe of it at the table for us.  We will definitely be back next time we're in town.
Delicious and promising authentic Italian food.  Expensive though.   Make this a one trip dining during your stay in Vegas.  Food reminds you of Grandmas.

We stopped by Buddy's this week to get cannoll's to go.  We were told to go to the bar.  After being ignored for at least ten minutes the rude female bartender finally got our order.  She does not need to work in the service industry!  The cannoli made up for it though!  Excellent.  Went back the next day for more.  Again Buddy would be appalled at how rude the waitstaff in his bar area is - even if you are busy you tell someone you will be with them in a minute.  But once again the cannoli was fantastic!

Can't for the life in me figure out how this place has eeked out 4 stars. I give it 1. 

Ate here for lunch. Very limited menu at lunch. We ordered the carbonara bucatini for $23 a plate. Next to no sauce and only a few chunks of pancetta. Had to flag down the waiter and order more sauce. "Garlic" bread appetizer came as 3 slices of dried out cheese bread with I swear not an ounce of garlic taste to it. The next table to us ordered garlic bread also and got 4 slices; not that I WANTED more but really.....


Place looks nice and clean however.

our waiter was fine.  very polite and attentive.  that was the best part of the meal!!!  
that's sad!

so disappointed in the food here!  absolutely horrible lasagna.  might be the worst i've ever had (maybe chef boyardee is worse - MAYBE!!!)

do not go here to eat.  so many better places in LV!  

absolutely bland and boring food.  calamari was just meh.  the meatballs were ok but kind of bland.

DO NOT EAT HERE! cannot stress that enough.  unless you want to overpay for bad food. 

VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!

Service was great. They really made sure my  anaphylaxis child was safe and able to eat his meal. I'm so thankful. Service and atmosphere were amazing. Having my son eat and feel safe beats the taste of the food.  As for the food, well it was eh, ok. Nothing to write home about but service was great!
Amazing service and even better food.  Went there with a large wedding party.  If you like Italian, and even if you don't, this is the best restaurant in town.

The dessert was delicious! My chicken rigatoni was raw. The chicken was chewy so I cut all the pieces and sure enough it was pink! Super disappointed. The pasta wasn't bad at all...a little salty for my taste. The chicken Piccata was cooked nicely. The cannoli was very good. The cheesecake was amazing!!! The manager took care of us...free dessert. We will go back for dessert and a no-chicken dish :)

My husband and I had dinner here earlier this year and I can say the service is truly amazing. We dined on a late Sunday evening and our waiter was very attentive throughout the time. 

Food: I wasn't super impressed with the food based on all the reviews. No complaints, just didn't live up to the hype I saw in the other reviews. We had the fried mozzarella, lasagna, and garlic bread (huge portions). I felt like Maggianos has tastier sauces for everything we tried, and similar pricing. Would I come here again?? Sure, why not as service was great!

From appetizer to desert Buddy V's was a great Italian dinner. The mozzarella en carrozza was delightful, the scallops were seared to perfection and served on the creamiest polenta I've ever had. My wife enjoyed her ravioli and my kids had the pizzas. All delicious. 

Desert: we had the lobster tail and Nutella cake. Both were decadent. The lobster tail was smaller than I had anticipated; but it was flaky and the cream filling wasn't heavy.

Well, i just have to say that this is the best italian restaurant I have been in , service, food and place was just amazing!
Eggplant parmigana 10/10
Lasgna 9/10
Chicken parmigana 1000
Pasta a la vodka 1000000
Tiramisu blow minded

Looking back at this experience, I'm actually angry. Maybe it deserves a 2, but this is the worst experience I've had on strip, I expected much better. I feel used, dirty. We had a party of 8, 4 couples. I brought 2 bottles of wine (tempranillo and a cab/syrah) intending to pay the corkage fee, which turned out to be $35 (highest I've ever encountered). The waiter said that since we were Seahawks fans and he was too (night before the super bowl) he would waive one of the fees if we tipped him more, more or less, even though he'd rather see us enjoy an Italian wine with dinner.  After examining the wine list we opted for the ones I brought. The waiter also informed us that since we were a big party we should take advantage of an "appetizer platter" for us all to share, meats, cheeses and salad, sold to us as a family style Italian sharing experience. We talked it over and all agreed it sounded good. Then we ordered our entrees, 1 couple opted to split the ravioli, my boyfriend ordered the lasagna and I planned on ordering the small margherita pizza so we could share. When I tried to order my margherita the waiter told me it was really small, just an appetizer, I told him I wanted small because I wasn't terribly hungry and didn't want leftovers, he insisted I should get the chicken alla vodka because they had just won an award for it, I asked if it was small, he said "oh yes, very small" and gestured with his hands. I caved, and ordered it, after all, I do love pasta and vodka sauce.  Appetizers came shortly after, 2 different salads, 2 meat/cheese/bread platters, calamari, and the meatballs (6). It was all ok, nothing spectacular, but one of the salads was pretty good (it had arugula, yum), and the meatballs were pretty good (nothing compared to Casa di Amore's off-strip though). The entrees came and my pasta was huge (bigger than he implied at least, average dish size for most restaurants though). My noodles were undercooked and the chicken was incredibly dry, sauce was decent, but not enough to make the chicken palatable.  I gave away most of my dish to the couple who split the ravioli, as they were pretty underwhelmed with theirs too, and thought mine was a slight improvement. I took one ravioli in exchange and nibbled my boyfriend's lasagna which was actually pretty amazing (in comparison), meanwhile kicking myself that I didn't just stick with the pizza.  The check came, north of $400, turns out the appetizers were all billed separately, so we should have just ordered what we wanted to begin with.  Looking back I'm convinced that the waiter only wanted me to have the more expensive entree, not the one I'd be happy with, and it angers me that he wouldn't just take my order as I intended. I suppose I've learned my lesson, stay away from gimmicky strip restaurants, stick to your guns, and recognize the upselling. What a swindle, this waiter put used car salesmen to shame, I've never felt more used after a dining experience, and the food was mediocre at best. I'm pretty sure he wasn't really a Seahawks fan either. Buyer beware. We'll stick with Casa in the future.

I was actually stupid-impressed by this place. I didn't have much in terms of expectations, but things went incredibly well here from the food perspective. Our waiter was also incredibly cool, and we definitely enjoyed the overall experience. The food was American-Italian as all get out, and among some of the best for that style you can expect to get. 

However; the things that drop the rating down are more about the overall experience. The starters were okay (meatballs), and the whole place/atmosphere overall was a bit iffy. The chairs are your standard fare for restaurants like this, and seemed really flimsy and were uncomfortable. The drink list felt a little lacking, and I feel like the suggested drinks were more a marketing speech more than a genuine recommendation. 

Negatives aside; dat veal parm was just fantastic. Hardly can think of another that I like more, it definitely stands there near the top of some of the best I've had of that particular dish. Want more....

Food and service were on point. Servers worked as a team. Someone was checking in every 10-15 minutes, to make sure I was ok.

I had the tomato soup which was very rich and a nice start, their lasagna was filling but could not stop me from their Nutella dessert and salted caramel ice cream. Delicious!

Oh my goodness we had the best salad (Buddy's Caprese) to start and were smart enough to share the salad and meatball sandwich.  The salad had the most unbelievable croutons in it.  I almost filled up on those alone.  Oh and the cheese in it... stop it.  So delicious.  We then shared the meatball sandwich and fries.  The sandwich is a bit messy just as any good Italian should be.  I thought the meatballs were very good and authentic.  I am surprised by the low reviews from various people because my experience could not have been better.  I also went to the bakery across the way and bought a cookie and brownie and both tasted homemade.  I really dislike "bakery" tasting cookies and to my surprise these were as if I had baked them in my own kitchen.  I'd highly suggest this place.  Also, I noticed a great room for big parties which I might use when in town again on business down the road.  The bar has a cool ambiance although I was there during the day on a Monday so it wasn't crowded.  I'll go back for sure!
Special thanks to Bethany our fantastic waitress for recommending the Beef Tenderloin with sauteed spinach, mashed potatoes, chianti sauce! It was delicious!

We decided to give this place a try based on the yelp reviews they received, and boy were they spot on. It had a great atmosphere and a friendly staff. 

Our server (Peter maybe?) was super helpful with great suggestions. When we couldn't decide on a dish he assisted us in building another dish to combined the best of both worlds. When we were unsure of wine, he made a suggestion based on our dish. 

The food was great, the wine was delicious, and we had an overall great experience. We were very please with the customer service and recommend you give it a try.

A little hard to find if you're in the casino but a great place to eat. Service was good but not polished. The meatballs were perfect. Very flavorful. Sea scallops were delicious. Ambience is nice but it's more bustling than relaxing. Italian birthday cake is something I'd highly recommend if you're in the mood for dessert. Skip the drinks, they looked overpriced and sugary.

The appetizers were good but the sea bass was a disappointment as it was dry and over cooked. At the $29 price I would expect more. The manager did not seem to care about our complaint and was rude.  There are by far better places to eat in Vegas.

Told us we had to wait 45 mins for a table for 3 people, when the 45 mins was up they offered us a table in a hallway outside the restaurant and never mentioned that's where the table would be. When we asked how long the wait would be for a table inside the restaurant we were told it would be a 30 Mom wait due to "private events".

My wife and I wanted to see if Buddy V's cooking lived up to its hype, so instead of taking a trip to Jersey, we decided to stop in to his Vegas location. We went on a Sunday morning (the morning of the Route 91) massacre.  

We ordered the brunch buffet (about $35 per person, all you can eat, including pastries), which gave us a large variety of meats, salads, veggies, appetizers, pastas, soups, and of course, pastries. I can't say that this was the best Italian food I've ever had, nor can I say the pastries were phenomenal, but everything was authentic and tasted good. The meatballs definitely lived up to the hyped up reviews. I even enjoyed the "peel your own" shrimp. 

Price was decent, considering it was owned by the world famous Buddy V. There was also a live band that played in the bar area, creating a really nice atmosphere.

Not bad for on the Strip, but far from the best Italian you can get within the Strip, let alone the Venetian/Palazzo - where Buddy V's can be found.  

It's in a great spot on the Strip with some killer views of Las Vegas Blvd.  At night though prepare to be blinded by video screens that are within close proximity of the restaurant.  As far as food goes...We went fairly straightforward with our dining choices. 

Grilled Garlic Bread - We did this because you are not served complimentary bread,  
Bucatini Carbonara - Probably the best thing we had to eat out of our 3 dishes.  Pretty good flavor and the pasta was al dente.  
Chicken Marsala - This was just very meh.  Not much flavor going on, but at least they give you a decent sized portion.  

Buddy V's fits a 3 star rating perfectly.  It's not the cheapest place, but it's also not the most expensive.  It's not the best, but it's not the worst.  As long as you know this going in, you will have a pleasant dining experience.

I went to Buddy V's with some out of town guests who love Italian.  The location is good, the ambiance nice, the service was decent. The food was just OK; Not great by any means. Maybe I had high expectations, but I was seriously disappointed and so were my guests. I had the carbonara, it was super salty. My husband had the clams. He was not impressed.  The ceasar salad was excellent. For the price, not a great value.

Great service, good food.  Definitely worth a try.
Fave: chicken Parm with Spaghetti 
Least Fave: Margherita Pizza

Was there with family last night, the food was even better than the 1st time we were there.  I booked a reservation on open table & requested a view for my visiting cousins; they gave us a beautiful booth with an amazing view of the Spring Mtn corner.
I can't speak highly enough of the server & buser...so on the ball that we never had to ask for ANYTHING! 
My cousins LOVED the experience; not just the food...it was a great night:)

Dinner last night with 3 very close clients. Overall very good, excellent spin on Italian with references to Buddy V's heritage. We shared a variety of appetizers, the signature dried meats and cheese board was excellent. For entree's a couple of us opted for pasta, cooked perfectly, flavorful. We also shared a couple of desserts of which the Canoli was very creative and extraordinary. The Canoli is kind of deconstructed which makes it fun to eat. Overall highly recommended!

Overall a great experience and wonderful food! We were early for our reservation, so we started with drinks in the bar. Sangria was good, it's a blend of white and red wine which was different. Only complaint was service was slow.

When we moved into the restaurant area, our experience just got better from there. Service was fabulous! All of the wait staff were very attentive. We ordered grandma's meatballs, lasagna and the chicken parm. The meatballs were absolutely delicious! Best restaurant meatballs I've ever had. My husband raved about the lasagna and talked about it the rest of the night. We would definitely go back just to have that. Chicken parm was good, but not the best in LV. The sauce on all the food had great flavor and consistency. Being Italian and growing up in NY, this restaurant exceeded my expectations. We will definitely be back!
Normal, fama devido ao programa de tv. A sobremesa foi o melhor. Pratos individuais mas bem servidos

Excellent service. We were seated quickly not know that the were closing. All staff members were accommodating and friendly. A member of our party had a gluten allergy and the staff went out of their way to make sure she found something on the menu despite all the Italian carb/wheat options. They do apparently have a gluten free penne pasta option. The food came out quickly and was delicious! I would recommend and come back. Oh... And prices very reasonable. #winning

The RJ did a review on this restaurant and I had no desire to visit until I read it.

We came for a late dinner on a Monday night. I didn't think we would need reservations. Walking down the hall, we were met with a huge line and I hoped it wasn't a dinner rush. I suddenly second guessed my decision to gamble on a walk in. We got closer and realized the crowd was for the bake shop located directly across the hall from the restaurant. Still, there was a good amount of people in front of the host stand. Turns out, Buddy and some of the guys were there! He was near the bar that was sectioned off for a private party, but it was still pretty cool to see them there none the less!

We were seated right away and really liked the decor and vibe of the place. Caleb was our server and he pretty much made our night. He offered bottled, sparkling, or tap water to start while we looked over the menu.

We started with Aunt Nina's Mozzarella en Carrozza as suggested by the RJ review and also by Caleb. Be sure to order this when you come! Think fried mozzarella, but done the way it should be. The outside provided a perfect crunch and the inside had all the ooey-gooey-ness you hope to find when you get fried mozzarella. It comes dressed with a tomato sauce and pesto sauce drizzle. After our first bite, we immediately contemplated ordering another. We held off as we planned on saving room for dessert.

My fiancée ordered one of the specialty cocktails as well. I don't remember which one..it had good flavor, but the alcohol was a little strong for her liking. Caleb was attentive enough to notice she wasn't drinking it and asked a couple times if she would like him to get her something else. Being in the service industry herself and not wanting to create more hassle, she declined and figured she would drink it with her entree. Caleb came over once more and took the glass and said he wanted to get her a glass of his favorite drink on the menu. He brought back a cocktail the was tequila based and had a sprig of rosemary. My fiancée doesn't care for tequila but I enjoyed the drink very much. We were very appreciative of Caleb's initiative to make our experience the best it could be.

My fiancée was torn between the chicken parm and the chicken rigatoni "alla vodka". Based on the descriptions and recommendations of our server, she went with the latter. I ordered the Agnolotti. The rigatoni was perfectly al dente and the sauce was very well prepared. The Agnolotti was so hearty from the flavorful meat filling and the brown butter sauce was a perfect compliment. 

We somehow managed to save some room for dessert. My fiancée has a weakness for cannolis so her decision was made fairly quickly. I came in with the intention of ordering the XL lobster tail pastry. After the meal I just had, the "XL" part turned me off of that idea. I was torn between the birthday cake and the Nutella cake. I turned once more to Caleb for advice trusting he would once again deliver and not turn us astray. I ended up with the Nutella cake.

The cannoli was very flavorful and had a nice touch of cinnamon. It was served with a side of chocolate sauce. The Nutella cake was actually a lava cake. It was very moist which is often lost on such a dessert. It was served with a scoop of salted caramel ice cream which perfectly balanced the sweetness of the cake.

All in all it was a great experience. The dinner menu is a little bit smaller compared to other Italian restaurants, but if every item is executed well, who cares?? Be sure to ask for Caleb and be sure to order Aunt Nina's mozzarella. I am convinced that everything on the menu is delicious and we will definitely be returning to test that theory.

First off, the food is not bad here, not great but would give it B+.

The problem is the noise level; it is horrific.  We sat in banquets by the kitchen and heard every order 3 times and every pan bang.  As if this is not enough noise, they play cheesy music soooo loud.
This place has amazing food and excellent service! We were seated right away at our reservation time and had a great visit. I would definitely come back!
Everything was delicious and service was great. I most enjoyed Mama's Meatballs but not the polenta croutons that came with the caeser salad. Do not get the polenta croutons unless you like polenta.

Absolutely LOVED everything here! We asked for a table by the window and had a nice view. The drinks are all really great. Highly recommend the chicken parm. We ended the night with a cannoli which was PERFECT!!

thankfully it was right where we entered the hotel (from the pedestrian walkway/bridge), so we didn't have to walk far into the venetian lol... there's a lil tables w/ chairs and umbrellas section by the windows near the entrance of the pedestrian walkway/bridge (it's right by huge open windows, no screens so birds literally flew in and ate crumbs off the tables!! idk if u like birds w/ ur meals but i sure wouldn't.. idk y they don't have screens on the windows! but yeah this is their version of an outdoor patio i guess) and also  there's even more extra seating outside the restaurant if u wanna be in the venetian hotel corridor and do people watching (but this section was roped off when we were there). anyway so we find out we didn't have to wait either :))) we got a nice table by the window so we got a nice view of the strip. our waiter was very nice and informative all around. the bread provided was errr different lol but VERY soft which i appreciated, but def do NOT use the oil concoction provided, OMGOSH it has a horrible taste!!! it only lasts a couple secs but man i was tempted to spit it out lol and my husband actually did.. i dunno, maybe the waiter did the concoction wrong? anyone else get bad flavor w/ it?? i really don't see the appeal of that stuff *shrugs.. anyway, i ordered the 'valastro sunday gravy' which is rigatoni pasta w/ various meats: meatballs, sausage, pork, and lamb.. everything was really soft and tender! however, the meatballs didn't taste like i like em (oh well) and the pasta sauce looked a bit orange rather than red, i don't wanna be insulting but my husband did say 'chef boyardee' when he tried my rigatoni lol.. it was still good tho and great portions. also, the server who brought it actually took the meats out of the lil pot they come in and placed em on my plate of rigatoni for me, i thought that was a nice touch :)...
  
i also got 2 desserts which the waiter suggested i do cuz i asked him if it was better to get desserts in the restaurant or across in the bakery (price-wise, etc). he suggested the restaurant for the lisa's warm nutella cake (i love nutella so this was a must and tasted very good when i had it later that nite). the lil cake has a filling of peanut butter (if i remember right) in the middle, it was thick lol, i wish i had eaten it when i was in the restaurant still... also, it comes w/ salted caramel ice cream which i wasn't a fan of the taste.. i like my ice cream sweet lol, not salty so that was an adjustment for my taste buds but i ate most of it nonetheless.. the crunchy bits that came w/ it were tasty tho IMO... and of course i had to get the tiramisu (i LOVE tiramisu so i was having high expectations w/ this!) it came in this lil jar deal w/ a few lady finger cookies on the side. i was pretty satisfied w/ the tiramisu but i do wish it was more traditionally plated (a square freely on the plate.. idk what it is about vegas strip restaurants putting desserts in jars lol). a nice lil touch is, they give u an italiany postcard saying thank u on it w/ the check which i appreciated and brought home as a souvenir! :) overall, the food wasn't to die for IMO, w/ buddy's shows and cooking/baking being his forte, u'd think his restaurant would be amazing food-wise, but idk maybe the chefs were having an off day or it should've been cooked by buddy himself lol... either way, i still adore the guy and will continue to watch his TLC shows happily as i have been since day 1!
The brunch was so much fun and delicious!! Come hungry! A little expensive but I didn't regret it.
Good food and good service! Pretty traditional Italian fare. The layout is a little wonky. But the focaccia bread was so good !!! A wonderful dinner out!

My husband and I, are locals, celebrated our anniversary there tonight and it was fantastic. It's a little piece of the Italian family we have back east, complete with Sunday Gravy---highly recommended!! Also they make their own mozzarella & ricotta (you'll want to make a meal out of those alone).

This restaurant was okay. There weren't a ton of people and it took FOREVER to get served. Also,there is no bathroom in the restaurant so you have to schlep out into the hotel which is a pain. 
The food was fine, not really memorable. The decor was odd, it was like old home comfort mixed with a modern feel? Either go old home comfort to match your food or go modern? The server was nice and personable.

Pretty decent little restaurant and we will be back. That being said I think this place is entirely overhyped due to its celebrity association. We came here at a weird time and only had a choice of like 5 real food items. A bit oddd. I am sure my review will be better if I eat during a different time.

We went to eat at Buddy V's Ristorante, not knowing what to expect, neither my husband or I really follow his show. However, we were starving and figured since it was newer to Vegas it was worth a try...

Absolutely delicious!!!! Everything we ordered was really good. The brick oven pizza was the best I ever had! We could tell that only the freshest and best ingredients were used. 

I liked the interior as well, it was modern looking but felt also had an old world Italian feel to it!
This place is excellent!  Great service, great food, great atmosphere!  A must try whenever you are in Vegas!

Went to buddy v's on another recommendation from my fellow yelpers. Good solid food. Great service. 

My sister got the lasagna and said yes it tasted like home and I got the chicken parm which was also delicious. Both were good and I think next time I'm in Vegas I will stop in.

The prices were pretty reasonable as well as we both got wine and I think our bill was only about $80.

Was extremely looking forward trying the Buddy V's, however, the food was extremely salty.
I tried the fried calamari and was very awful and salty, the garlic bread was the best among all of my orders.

Waiters were friendly and professional but still we came for the food and it was not good.

Being the owner is a cake boss and I'm from Delaware only 1 hr from the original location. I was spectacle about coming here for good Italian food but we were in Vegas and hungry so we gave it a shoot. First we didn't have a reservation but they sat us in only 15 min wait time. So while at the bar I seen they have a signature The Cake Boss Martini and let me tell you it was best martini I have had in a long time! The garlic bread was awesome, portions are huge and the desert is wonderful. We even talked to the manager Stewart and expressed what a great place this was to visit!

We were very surprised the food was very tasty.
The portions are big enough to share, we ordered the 3 course menu and one appetizer extra, this was more at enough.
Very nice waiters, good service. 
We will come back!
Great service and great food!!  The caprese salad was fresh, light and the burrata cheese was delicious.   The meatball sub had a great creamy cheese on it.

Had the $22 three-course prix fixe, "express lunch." Started with the panzanella, and it was amazing. This place probably has the best croutons in the world. Next time I go, I might just ask for a side of croutons with my salad because WOW. Because I split our main courses with someone else, I got to try both the Bucatini Carbonara and the Spaghetti Bolognese. I personally preferred the Carbonara, because I thought the sauce had struck the perfect balance and the noodles were great, but the other person slightly preferred the Bolognese. Moral of the story: both were excellent. We finished with cannoli and tiramisu. Both were, as you could have guessed, fantastic. Moreover, the servers were very friendly and we felt that they paced the meal perfectly. I can't wait to go back.  However, before you do, make sure to call and ask if the prixe fixe is on the menu that day because, when we first arrived, even though it was a Thursday at noon, the waiter said that he had to check.

UPDATE: I came back, and learned that we are not limited to their packaged breadsticks for lunch. Instead, they have (free) focaccia bread. All you have to do is ask for it, and then someone will come around with a big pan of focaccia bread. Make sure to ask for the olive oil and vinegar too!!

AMAZING!  Went for Mother's Day brunch.  Every bite of everything was delish!  I even loved the sauce and meatballs and I don't eat those out EVER!  I'm Italian!  The food and desserts were to die for.  Service was excellent.  If you are in Vegas you NEED to go there!
Read the reviews n had to try it,...this is the best Italian restaurant in las vegas. I had chicken marsala very good, caprese salad excellent n calamari a must.

We had dinner here last night. The food was excellent and the service was out of this world. Our server was prompt, courteous, and funny. Our drinks, appetizers and entrees were out quick and piping hot. Lots of attention to detail. Overall a great experience!

Wow. This place is always great. The service is great , food is great. We met the Cake Boss himself, Buddy V was in the restaurant and was super nice.  Nice to have this place around the corner from where we live.

WHO: I know all of you are TLC Cake Boss fans like I am, who wouldn't be?! So, for everyone in the world who LOVES Buddy V as much as I do, be a NERD and come eat here (Don't forget the pictures, lol!)

WHERE: Located inside of the Grand Canal Shoppes of the Venetian and or Palazzo.

WHEN: Monday through Sunday from 11:30am-10pm; Friday & Saturday from 11:30am-11pm. & most importantly, Happy Hour from 4:30-6:30pm! =D

WHY: BECAUSE EVERYONE'S DOING IT! Lol, just kidding. Wouldn't you like to take part in a sit-down lunch or dinner with your friends and or family in Buddy V's first restaurant in Las Vegas?! & also because Carlo's Bakery is going to open in a few weeks to months just right across the restaurant! SO PERFECT!

WHAT: The first time I came here, my family and I did dinner. As I walked into the restaurant and to the table, I noticed the perfectly dim ambiance that filled the entire room. I love ROMANTICKLE restaurant settings! It makes me HAPPY!
