Random Tangent: Sometimes I make words up so don't dictionary.com them because it most likely won't be in there. Haha

So as my family and I were seated, we were handed the menus and ordered. I love dinner with family because we purposely order something different so that we can try each other's food! Too good!

FOOD:
Chicken Parm- I personally got the chicken parm, and it was excellent! I wish there could have been a tad bit more spaghetti with it, but overall Yummy!
Margherita pizza- My younger cousin chose this pizza, and I'm glad he did because there were slices for every single one of us! SHARING IS CARING!
Nonna's Lasagna al Forno- My older cousin ordered the lasagna. From the bite I took, I remember wishing I ordered it! It was definitely a hearty meal because there were leftovers! Thumbs up!

DESSERT:
Buddy's XL Lobster Tail- As I was scanning the dessert menu, my eyes suddenly zoomed into this dessert! I absolutely love the flaky pastry shell that enclosed the yummy, creamy, and PERFECT custard cream! (Everytime I go to NY, I search for Lobster Tails!!)
Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake- My cousin is addicted to chocolate, as this made his eyes light up! I loved the hazelnut praline crunch, good touch to the chocolatey goodness!

I still want to try the rest of what's on the dessert menu!!! GIMME GIMME GIMME!

HAPPY HOUR: My cousin and I just made it in time for HH the other day, and we went HAM!
Grandma's Meatballs- The perfect tasty, softy GOODNESS! I love these meatballs!
Macaroni & Cheese Carbonara- I am a mac&cheese fiend! This mac was pretty good. I've never had it with peas, but it actually gave it a sweet taste, GOOD COMBO!
Calamari Fritti- Loved the grilled lemon pinwheels, banana peppers, and the tomato aioli! AIOLI!!
Meatball sliders- We couldn't get enough of the meatballs, so we had to order it in bread!

Lastly, try the "CAKE BOSS" chocolate martini! If you love chocolate & alcohol, it was a really good mix! Tasted exactly like a chocolate cupcake... the only difference is it is in LIQUID FORM, and you may not be able to walk straight after! Lol

Before I continue typing, I am going to STOP and leave you with one thing... ENJOY!! & LET ME KNOW WHEN CARLO'S BAKERY OPENS! HOLLER! =D

The atmosphere was nice and the decore is beautiful.  I love the way the kitchen is open so you're able to see the food being prepared.  The surf & turf was good the steak was very tender. The olive oil  mashed potatoes were to die for! The staff was super friendly and made sure that our glasses stayed full and all of our needs were met. Excellent experience.

Really really wanted to give more stars because I am such a fan of the Cake Boss, but our meal was mediocre at best for the amount we paid for it.  The spaghetti and meatballs were extremely salty with little flavor otherwise.  

We did not have any dessert, but the cute pictures in the dessert menu we so wonderful!

The service was acceptable and friendly, but I'm not sure we will return.  Sorry Buddy

PS... Okay I decided to go back  2 nights later to give it a second chance. We heard the tiramisu was wonderful so we asked to get some to go, and they said they were unable to do so...... What a disappointment.  Two strikes and your out!

A wonderful meal!  We chose to go with the family style and allowed them to bring us the selection.  Worth it.  I would go back just to have more of the marinara sauce.  Everything was amazing.  Great experience.

Peter made out night! What a great fun evening. The lasagna was AWESOME and I had 1/3 and shared the rest with the group. Grandma meatballs were way SALTY! My guess is that they sit in a bath of constantly evaporating liquid that just gets more and more salty.  We wanted to try famous desserts but were carb'd out after bowls of tasty pasta. Easy OpenTable reservation and to note is was Valentines day but we ate at 5pm.

SERVICE 
+  Excellent Service. Super friendly staffs.

AMBIANCE 
+ Fun and loud. 

FOOD
+ Aunt Ninas Mozerella en Carozza $12 // Good
+ Tomato Bique $9 // Good
+ Bucatini Carbonara $24 // Okay 
+ Bone in Veal Parm Chop $42 // Good

DRINK
+ Drago Rosso $14 // Good
+ Sicilian Tea $16 // Skip 

DESSERT 
+ Lobster Tail $9 // Okay 

NOTE
+ Cake Boss!
+ Takes reservation. 
+ Good price.
+ Would like to come back for Sunday Brunch Buffie.

I was here a couple of months ago, dining solo, and had a 5 Star experience.  
I brought my family last night and was truly disappointed.  As soon as we got our drink order in, our server was difficult to call.  Our dinners were extremely salty and only 1 out of the 4, did we enjoy our food.  At one point, we had the manager come over to help us.

The ambiance was very nice.The restaurant seemed kind of dead for a Saturday night.I ordered the Lasagna and a glass of Moscato.The lasagna was very delicious and they gave a pretty nice portion.The bread they served with the food was ok but not great.But overall it was a pretty good eatting experience.

Due to the amazing spaghetti and meatballs, we had to come back! Again, the food was amazing! We did try the chicken parm and the caprese this time and were impressed with those as well. Definitely put this place on your list when in Vegas!  The service was great, we were well taken care of and left very happy! Just make sure to get spaghetti and meatballs!

It was our last night in Vegas and my husband wanted Italian. Being from New York (and having an Italian husband!) my expectations were high. The restaurant had a nice, homey atmosphere with an open kitchen. It was fun to see the meals being prepped and watching them come out. We started with the caprese salad and fried calamari. The burrata was delicious. The calamari was crisp and light and very tender. For our main diss, we shared the Valestro family gravy. What a hit! We both loved the "gravy" ! Very authentic, homemade sauce..Italian husband said one of the best he's ever tasted. Portions were nicely sized. Sever was on point but not very attentive. One HUGE complaint..a bread basket was not provided!! A great Italian restaurant with no bread so sop up all of that saucy goodness??! Come on Buddy! Breadsticks in a bag! You can do a lot better than that! Lost a star on the bread issue...We will return on our next visit..with our own loaf of Italian bread!

Came in for the happy hour specials and a drink or two... Loved the grandma'a meatballs!!! And would go back just for that.. We got Mac & cheese, ricotta cheese, and the calamari.. Also a cannoli... The food was great and the service was awesome..

We chose this location on our last night in Vegas, which was a bad decision because we didn't have a chance to go back.  Our waiter was one of the best I've ever had!  The mozzarella appetizer was fantastic!  The lasagna is really the best I've ever had and the butterscotch creek brûlée is an event all on its own!  This is a must experience in my opinion!
Food is great, atmosphere is comfy but it is pretty loud and if you're at a big table conversation is very difficult.  Service is very quick and friendly.

Great if you like pasta and Italian food. 

I think this would be a great fine dining experience if you like cheese and carbs.  I would have given this place 5 stars when I was a teenager. So take your kids here and buy them a cupcake at Carlos after.

While I still think dinner is a solid three, their Sunday brunch buffet is five stars all the way! 

I really don't like traditional breakfast food, and Buddy V's Sunday brunch had two egg dishes and one French toast dish at the buffet. Perfect! 

The buffet is divided into five stations: starters (charcuterie, shrimp, antipasto, soup, Caesar salad); carving station (props to the bacon and the spicy Italian sausage); Kids corner (Mac n cheese, pizza, candy); entrees (loved the meatballs, chicken Parmesan, carbonara Mac n cheese) and DESSERTS! Delicious tiramisu in mason jars, cannoli, and zonuts were my favorite. 

The buffet is $34.95. I opted for the extra all-you-can-drink mimosa deal for $14.95 and you can choose from mimosa, Bellini, sangria, beer or wine. The Bellini was tasty but that sangria tho! I'm embarrassed to say how many glasses I had. 

My fiancé got the Bloody Mary deal for $18.95 in which they bring the vodka and you craft your own Bloody Mary from a different station. He had fun doing that (and adding shrimp from the appetizer station) and he also got to choose from all my drinks. He ended up switching to the sangria as well and drank as much as I did. He got to keep his glass as a souvenir. 

We got seated right away with no wait (even during March Madness weekend) and I can't wait to come back. Wish it was served every day!

Meh, Buddy V's is a 3.5 stars for me but rounding down because of slow service and complicated bill -_-

I made a reservation at Buddy V's for my birthday. We were a large party of 15 that seated us pretty quickly once our whole party arrived. I know that we were a large party but I just felt like the overall service was very slooow.....The older man (maybe the manager) walked us very s l o w l y....to the table and as we were seated, it just took a long time to get our utensils or menus. It was around 4:45 when we arrived and the restaurant didn't look too crowded at the time.

I am a huuuge fan of moscow mules and I make it a point to try a restaurant's signature mule. Buddy V's has a "Jalapeno Mule" on their cocktail menu and I was instantly intrigued and pleasantly surprised upon tasting it. It was bright and zesty, but the subtle kick of jalapenos would kick in afterwards. It's not a really overwhelming spice, but rather quite refreshing. Highly recommend trying this!

And for my meal, I ordered the linguini and clams and shared with my friend who ordered the sea scallops. Much to my disappointment, the linguini was super salty and extra garlicly. I didn't mind the garlic but the salt was just too much for me and found myself taking gulps of water in between bites. The sea scallops on the other hand were quite enjoyable. The creamy bed of polenta beneath the beautifully seared scallops complemented it well.

The dessert was probably the highlight of the meal. The Italian birthday cake was soo delicious. I'm not a big fan of desserts because I don't have much of a sweet tooth but the sweetness of all the different layers was not very overpowering in this. I loved the chocolate mouse layer. So dreamy....

It was time for the check and here's where things got unnecessarily complicated. Again, service was slow and we seemed to be waiting for forever for the check to come out. Prior to even ordering I had asked if we could split the check into separate bills, by tables, since we were a large party. They had forgotten, but no big deal, I asked them if they could fix it and they said they would. We wanted to split the bill to put it on two separate cards. When they brought back the check and I took a look at it, I was so confused. Our server had literally split everything on the check in half (see my photos), which made it 39247038x more difficult for my party to figure out who we needed to pay back. I clarified with our waiter what I wanted and off he went to fix our check. What could possibly go wrong? So instead of just ringing up another two new bills, he took a looong time trying to move halves from the two checks around. So instead of "linguini and clams" on the bill it said "1/2 linguini and clams" twice. He spent a long time trying to move things around but didn't move everything properly. I think it would've taken equally as long to just create two new bills where each meal was not a half.

So yeah, that was frustrating to deal with. Everyone was getting grumpy because we had been in the restaurant for so long because of the slow service and we were ready to leave after two hours of being there. But our waiter did try...and he was nice...just not efficient. Overall, good food and a nice interior! However, I was expecting a little more from the service since it wasn't too crowded but hey, they tried.

I came here Wednesday night for dinner with my mom, dad, and brother. The decor is very nice just like an Italian restaurant. Our server was very nice. For an appetizer, we started off with fried calamari, it was very crispy and delicious. For my entree, I had the classic cheese pizza and it was good. I also like their margherita pizza but I can't remember the last time I had it because I've been going to Vegas for the past 3 years. Can't wait to return for my next vacation!

Buddy Vs is actually right outside the Palazzo parking garage. If you park in the Venetian parking garage you have a LONG way to walk. 
Excellent service and the food is just amazing--best Caesar Salad ever--however the noise level is off the charts---is extremely loud in the restaurant - we were there at 9pm and wasn't even full but seated across from someone you had to yell to be heard.  Overall great restaurant.
Great food!! Chicken Marsala is a must try. The rest of my group enjoyed their food as well. The spaghetti was also very good. Check this place out.

The food was amazing. Served in a timely manner and with extremely fresh ingredients. HOWEVER, the staff is extremely unpleasant. The hostess had an intimidating face and seemed like she didn't like her job. The waiter was polite but not friendly. I would not come here unless I was dying for the food.

The service was fantastic! They were very fast and courteous. I love the atmosphere of the restaurant and the view of the strip. However, I wasn't a fan of the food. It's mediocre at best. My boyfriend's food tasted a lot better, but it wasn't enough to rate this place any higher.

I'm a big fan of his bakeries, so I had high expectations and this place definitely delivered. Nice, swanky look to the place, GREAT view of the strip and even a giant billboard against the backdrop of the Wynn and Encore that was pretty cool to have there. I actually don't really like Italian food, but I thought the food was great. Great service too. The clientele was nice and above-casual. The desserts were amazing. Would definitely come here again. Best part is, when you leave, Buddy's famous Carlo's Bakery is right there!

Took my 13 year old daughter there for her birthday dinner. She loves cake boss. We however brought our own cake and they were nice enough to store it in back.  Our server Perry was top notch and went above and beyond to please my entire family including finding candles for me because I forgot them. From beginning to end perfect service that complimented the tasty food.  You will not be disappointed.  Get a seat by the window so you can see the strip.  We will eat here again!

What a wonderful surprise!  I made a reservation for a coworker and I to have dinner here before seeing BAZ last night.  We were warmly welcomed by the hostess as well as our server 
- he was so enthusiastic and a pleasure to have help us.  I started with a glass of sauvignon blanc and we shared an absolutely delicious caprese salad - a little different than the norm...in a good way!  I thoroughly enjoyed the chicken rigatoni alla vodka as my entree and could have licked the rest of the sauce out of the bowl...it was that good.  Fun, lively atmosphere...especially after the piano player/singer started.  The restaurant was packed early, so that is always a good sign.

I went here last month with my parents because my mom is a fan of their TV show. I love Italian but I wasn't sure how well I'd like this place. It turned out to be be the best meal my whole trip. The spaghetti with bolognese sauce was fantastic. Even better I did not have to ask for extra sauce on the side. I can't remember the last time I didn't do that.

The wait staff was extremely polite and helpful. Our food was out to us in almost no time at all. The waiter even told my mom about a location opening in the city my parents live in. Thedecor was nice without being stuffy. There were old family photos on the wall as well as the dessert menu. It was a great value. I would definitely come back.

Sorry, I couldn't tell you about the food since we didn't get that far....

 Buddy might make this food for his family, but not allowing them to sit until the entire party is present is rude!!  I fully understand when it is busy, but there were so many open tables it was almost alarming.    We asked both the hostess and the manager (both rude and short) if we could sit and have a drink and we were told no, but you can go to the bar and get a drink.  Since a few of us worked in the industry, we understand the policy when it is busy, but when it is not I would think a good manager would make the right decision.  We felt like Greg Focker in Meet the Parents when he wanted to board the plane. 

That's OK, Canaletto happily sat us (they were slammed btw) and enjoyed taking our $250 lunch tab along with the 2 additional friends who came when we were finished of our referral.

One of the newer restaurant that opened here at The Palazzo, it is located on the second level of The Grand Canal Shoppes, next to Barney's New York.

Came here on a date and yes, I do agree with a fellow Yelper that it IS a big spacious restaurant so it doe not give you the intimate, romantic/family style a Italian restaurant should be. But hey...it's located in a 5 diamond hotel right ON THE STRIP...what else can you expect?

To sum it up, everything we ordered was delicious. The service was great, our waiter was attentive the entire time keeping our drinks filled, napkins/utensils were delivered quick. 
We got an order of their famous meatballs as an appetizer. I believe it came with six. Perfect to start off with. The meatballs were very flavorful and they weren't puny little meatballs either.
For our entrees, I ordered chicken Parmesan and my date ordered a pasta dish. Let me tell you, like most restaurants here on the strip, portions were pretty big. I definitely had leftovers for the next day. My chicken Parmesan wasn't dried and they put the perfect amount of melted cheese on top. 
We also ordered dessert. Not a big fan of sweets to begin with and I was already full from dinner. But my date suggested we share something soooo....sure, why not? We ordered the canoli and it was wayyy toooo sweet for my liking. The cream filling....bleh....over powering. I much prefer a gelato or something if I ever get a chance to come back here.

Overall, this is a really good restaurant and I can see it thriving here at The Palazzo. Prices aren't as expensive as say, Dal Toro or Bouchon. If you're in the mood for Italian and kind of on a budget.....I definitely recommend Buddy V's.

(P.S.) Heard Buddy V is going to open up a bakery shop at the Venetian sometime in March 2014. Stay tuned!

We were a party of seven with reservations and were seated promptly. We started with their yummy bread with olive oil. Calamari, cheese bread and the mozzarella with pesto. All were delicious. Everyone loved their entrees. They were delicious and large portions. I couldn't finish half of my lasagna which made our son happy as he ate the rest. Highly recommend this restaurant if you love Italian food. Great decor and service.

Authentic In every way! The chicken parmesan is the absolute greatest ive ever tried. took one bite and my eyes watered from its perfection.  chicken was seasoned to perfection and cooked perfectly as for the spaghetti it was paired with was nothing short of immaculate. 
Service was fantastic not once did we feel pressured to order as the waitress was very polite. I will say this place was one of the highlights of my vacating and I will be visiting again for seconds!

Went for a late afternoon meal and cake for hubby's birthday. Great octopus very tender and salad dressing was superb. Also got charcuterie plate, very well done toasted bread cheese olives and 3 cured meats. BUT THE HIT OF THE EVENING WAS THE BIRTHDAY CAKE A CYLINDER OF HEAVEN the stuff dreams are made of. WILL GO BACK ON NEXT VISIT

The atmosphere is cool and view of the strip is nice. The bolognese was very good but the meatball sub was so-so at best with bread so hard the stuff in the middle spilled out everywhere. The house salad was nothing more than romain and the lemon vinaigrette was incredibly salty...like bathed in salt. Not sure I'd come back, so many other good options that are in the same general are.

Great service and good food.

My husband and I came her w/ my sister in law and we sat at the bar. Our bartender was very attentive and polite. She always checked up on us and made sure our drinks were topped off. Overall, service was great. The food was good, but it wasn't spectacular. I got the spaghetti and calamari for an app to share, my husband got the chicken parm, and my sister in law got the shrimp scampi. The price was fair for being in Vegas but the flavor of the food was subpar.

This is an outstanding brunch , everything was fresh, and appealing. Good coffee.  The best dessert table.  There was also a children's table which was nice.  Worth every dollar we paid. There were 3 of us and we all agreed. We compared it to Bellagio, and Wynn and Buddy V's took first place in our review.

Food was amazing! Great flavor for your taste buds! Service was good. Staff made sure you had everything to enjoy your meal. Friendly waiter and fast service during lunch. Great experience! Didn't get a chance to have dessert because we were so full from apps and entree. Would recommend!

Buddy V's has absolutely become the Italian restaurant gold standard on the strip. Not only is it an affordable meal but the food is exquisite. It's "real" Italian food that tastes homemade but is served in a Strip-type location and atmosphere. I especially love the ravioli. We've tried the Sunday gravy, the lasagna, the spaghetti, the Veal parmesan, the kale (which is amazing) and my favorite the parmesan polenta (delicious). Really I have never had anything that wasn't good at Buddy V's. The tiramisu is excellent (although I admit I was very disappointed when they went away from the traditional large portion down to the small mason jar). They used to have an amazing portion tiramisu  with surprisingly moist chocolate cake at the bottom. I have eaten a LOT of tiramisu all over the country and this is hands down the best. Even better than the great restaurants I enjoyed in NYC. If you'er a local or are in Vegas for a vacation, go to Buddy V's.

Eaten here a half dozen times now.

Straight up Italian food like I grew up on back home. All the favorite dishes like chicken parm and grandmas meatballs are killer. Great pricing and huge room. Great place for Happy hour in their massive bar area.

If you are in The Venetian or near by this is a no brainer if you are looking for a place to eat and drink at with friends.

Yes, yes, yes!
This guy does more than cakes, and he does it well!
We came here for Sunday Brunch and we were not disappointed! Everything was outstanding, and well prepared. My wife raved about the tomato soup, and she was right -- it was awesome!
Oh, and the waitstaff was amazing! Dirty plates didn't linger on our table, and our beverages were never empty. Great job!
Spend the money and indulge in this great experience!

This was just bad. Charged us for meals we sent back and for a slice of birthday cake that we didn't want but they insisted we should get. $300 for a meal where only one dish was actually good (the chicken vodka). Went to Tao for nearly the same price and had the best sushi of my life... Buddy V's was just a waste of money.

Soooo I was mostly disappointed with my dinner last night.... I liked the ambiance of the restaurant and the Grilled garlic bread was really good but the salad, pasta, and dessert left something to be desired! My salad was pretty boring but I longed for another salad once I got the completely unseasoned pasta. I had to add wayyyy to much salt and pepper to give it some flavor. My friends pasta was also really really bland. Together our check was like $125 which is a bit expensive for a meal that you left feeling kinda blahhh about! At least in my opinion.

This was the answer to a several month long search for a simple but ass kicking great tasting Italian meal. It was a busy Tuesday night, so we took a bar seat and enjoyed the great bartending by Mike. We asked him about a wine, he said it was good. When he brought the bottle it was a screw top... I was a bit concerned with the screw top. We had the wine with dinner and enjoyed a great meal. We met some nice peeps next to us and had some great conversation and a most enjoyable evening. Thank you Mike and Buddy V"s for a most enjoyable time and meal. We'll be back. Highly recommend for great tasting authentic style Italian food, with a classy twist.

This place is legit. Great space with tons of seating and a nice lounge area where you can wait for a table. The service is impeccable and the food is absolutely amazing. Fine dining is what it's about here. They have tons of tables with a great strip view. If you're in town and need a place to have a wonderful dinner, Buddy V's is where it's at!
Really fantastic food! We ordered the cutting board, Burrata, Charred Octopus salad, eggplant parm, Nutella cake and washed it all down with a bottle of Far Niente Chard!! What a day!!!

Classic Italian dishes. The benefit of this Italian restaurant is that in Vegas everything is expensive and this spot is reasonably prices.  They do not serve oversized portions so when you order do not prepare to get a giant plate that you can split.  Each person will need their own dish, but you won't really take leftovers with you unless you are staying at the Venetian anyways so it is perfect.  Priced and portioned well.

The weekend brunch was SPECTACULAR! Some of the most authentic and delicious traditional Italian dishes paired with incredible brunch staples(seafood, charcuterie, etc.)! 

The service was superior and definitely measured above board - friendly and attentive but didn't hover. I can not recommend a brunch spot anymore highly than Buddy V's! Whether it's a party of 2 or 20, this places delivers!
Good southern Italian style cooking.  good meatballs which is key!  bone in veal parm was great.  reasonable prices and one of the few restaurants in large hotels with a window view of the strip

I went here for Valentines Day and it was the best Italian food I've had in Vegas! Great service and pretty fast. A nice view no matter where you sit and pretty atmosphere/good music. I had the Chicken Parm and it was soo good. The Chicken Marsala was so tender too. And the fried mozzarella appetizer was delicious. Highly recommend!
I give it a three only because they took forever to bring our food. It did not feel like how Buddy describes it. Very slow service. Did not exceed my expectations for the first time visit.

Just went tonight with my husband for our anniversary. We were both nervous trying such a new restaurant but we were impressed. We had a great server, Daniel, who was very knowledgable about the wine and food. We bought a bottle of wine that turned out being amazing. My husband had
the chicken Parmesan and I had the chicken rigatoni with vodka sauce. Everything was so good and the only thing we could say is it didn't taste like restaurant food, it tasted homemade. We also had to order the lobster tail. Even after a bottle of wine and our dinner it was so light and airy. Amazing. When Daniel found out it was our anniversary he brought out a plate of Italian cookies and bottle of sparkling dessert champagne. It was such a great experience all around and next time we come to Vegas we will be coming back to Buddy V's!

Nice place, but the crowd is a bit too casual and the food a bit lacking for a restaurant that costs two people $150 total, including two drinks each. 
$22 ravioli - nothing to write home about. 
Empty plates and glasses collected on our table before anyone finally decided to pick them up toward the very end of our meal. 
Kids leaving their table and running around the place -- not the fault of the establishment, but not the way I prefer to dine. 
I'm sure there are a lot better places to spend $150 for a meal in Vegas. If it were less expensive I would have given it three stars.

Cake Boss? Where's the cake? They barely serve cake. The ravioli with tomato sauce on kids menu -which they were not serving until 5p and we were there at 4p. My Margarita Pizza was to thick and tasted like something I could make in the oven out of a box. We ordered a $9 apple pie for desert and Sara Lee does better.

I'm a local and when friends came into town to attend a wedding (officiated by Elvis, no less) I suggested Buddy V's for a late lunch, even though I'd never been there before. 

3pm is a perfect time to visit! It's slow in the restaurant, but the service is top-notch. They even had a specific menu for 3-5pm which was a-little-lunch-a-little-dinner. Here's what we chose and the consensus on each.

1. Meatball Sub and Fries: Good! large meatballs, delicious marinara and cheese, crusty bread, tasty fries that seemed almost batter dipped. I ate half so I'd have room for dessert.

2. Chicken Avocado Club Thingy: Good! The Caesar salad that came with it had what looked like croutons on top, but really they were a fried cube of something - we thought polenta - with a mildly lemony taste. Really added to the salad and surprised in a good way.

3. Margherita Pizza: Good! The person who ordered this enjoyed it a lot. I had a bite and thought it was good. One other person at our table thought it was horrible. Whatever. I'd still give it a solid B+.

4. The Meat and Cheese Board: Excellent! Our difficult-to-please patron got this and enjoyed it immensely. It had 4 kinds of Italian cold cuts, very fresh and very good, sliced thin. A few hunks of cheese (the Parmesan was to die for!) and some olives and other pickled veggies rounded it out. There was also some toasted bread.

Nobody finished any of their meal, and it was boxed and given back to us in a pretty bag with utensils and napkins for later.

We'd saved room for dessert and got the XL Lobster tail with fresh fruit, lemon sorbet, and the caramel creme brulee.

All of them were very, very good, but I've got to say that hands-down, that was the BEST creme brulee I've ever had. EVER. And I love creme brulee. And it wasn't even my dessert!

I'm not ashamed to say, I used my finger to get the last of the creme brulee out of the bowl. Well, maybe I'm a little ashamed. 

The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is that, while everything was good and fresh tasting; it lacked something. Very good, but not indistinguishable from other good Italian meals that I've had. I'd love to say "there's nothing out there like Buddy V's" but I can't. Yet.

I think I'll have to try again, just to make sure.

Wow wow wow, is all I can say! This place is heaven on earth! Ask for the express lunch menu if available, best bang for your buck. For $22, you get a three course meal. For dessert I recommend the cannoli or the tiramisu.

Great food...wonderful service.  Had the opportunity to take a picture with Buddy.  Thrilled to hear that he may be opening up in Chicago.  What a nice change from some of the chef owned restaurants...they are very accommodating and strive to please the customer.

Great food!

We dined at Buddy V's for our anniversary.  The service was fantastic and the food was amazing.  They serve the best warm focaccia bread with olive oil & balsamic while you wait.  

We both had the linguine & clams with sides of polenta and broccolini.  Usually when you order linguine & clams you get very few fresh clams in the shell.  It's typically just enough to add some theatrical value.  But this place piles them on.  We both were given a lot of fresh clams in the shell.  The white wine sauce was excellent and the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente.

There was no room for desert so we didn't get to try any of Buddy's famous confections.  Next time.

Only complaint... When you're coming from the valet parking garage the place is sooo hard to find.  The signage in the Venetian isn't very good and every person you ask sends you a different way.  We walked around that enormous hotel for more than 20 minutes looking for this place and almost gave up.  The staff acknowledged that it happens frequently.

Wasn't sure what to expect in terms of fanciness or price. My husband and I came here to celebrate our 1 year anniversary and we were very pleased with our service, the food, and the ambience. 

We've watched Cake Boss before but we didn't know this was THE Buddy from Cake Boss. The bakery was right across the way but we were so engrossed in our conversation and the yummy food we didn't have time to get any sweets for the way home. 

We each orders from the Prix Fixe menu....I got the Tomato/Basil soup, Chicken Parmigiana and the Tiramisu. Everything was perfect!!! I'm always on the hunt for good tomato soup and it was delicious!!!!! My husband ordered the meatballs, carbonara, and canoli and he said everything was yummy as well! 

Our server was great and attentive...she was training another server but it was never awkward or intrusive. The manager came over also to check on us and wish us a Happy Anniversary. The restaurant was very busy, even for a Wednesday night, but we never felt neglected....we always had people checking on us. We had a great experience!!

Went here with my wife during our anniversary trip to Vegas. I have nothing bad to say about this place. It's not necessarily a romantic atmosphere but that's just Vegas in general. Doesn't matter where you go, there's always someone in shorts and a crappy t-shirt and flip-flops. Having said that, we still managed to have enjoy a nice romantic evening. The waiter was great. The chicken parm was great, the corozza was great, the lobster tails and Italian birthday cake were of course great. And just because I needed to try the tiramisu, we came back a few days later. And of course, that was great too. Nice touch with a little bit of chocolate cake in the bottom. I liked that the place wasn't overly crowded and we could go and sit down pretty much whenever. It was certainly one of the highpoints of our trip and I very much look forward to going back. And next time, I'll look forward to stopping into the Carlos Bakery shop opening up just next door. I know some complained about the pricing. I would argue that once again, that's just Vegas. Cocktails cost pretty much $14 wherever you go, unless you're sitting at the slots, and restaurant food is pretty much always $20+ for entrees. That's just the way it is.
Our waiter, Georgio was amazing, he made our experience soooo memorable and made some incredible Menu recommendations.  Our entrees were great, wines selection was extensive.  Xoxo

I will say this, it is nice to see service return to Veags in a big way. From the minute we walked in we felt like family. Awesome, awesome, awesome friendly folks and they really care. Food is fabulous.

You only want to read one line?, "So good, at least gotta try it"...

Got there around 9:50pm (they close at 10pm) and the service was great, our server was super nice and really willing to help us make decision and stuff. On a side note: her recommendations were upstanding. We were not planning to have a full meal there, just desserts and coffee (at least I wanted coffee, 10pm? Yes, but it's Vegas). 

Everything was amazing! The coffee, the Nutella Volcano (or something like that), the tiramisu and the cocktails, the bella regazza wow, tbh we had 2 and it was not for the ladies at the table. 
The place is "hard to find" have to really look for it inside the Venetian but I'll be worth it. I don't feel that there's the need to say this but, the place is kinda pricey (obviously).

Had a Chicken Parm that was off the charts amazing!  A friend that was eating with us ordered the Veal parm, I had never seen a piece of veal that big, I thought they had brought out a small breaded pizza.  The veal was also amazing. 

The atmosphere was casual but the view of the strip was incredible.   We had a great waitress that not only had great recommendations and fast service but also gave us directions on the quickest way to get a cab for our next adventure of the night.
Food was great.  For the quality you cannot beat the price.  Wait staff was excellent.  Would highly recommend

We came by earlier on a Friday night after we got off our flight. We thought this was just going to be a touristy spot with mediocre food off the Vegas strip... and we were delightfully mistaken. The food was actually great. The calamari was fantastic, and the Salmon was terrific. Our server and bus boy were all super friendly and very fast accommodating us. The prices weren't terribly expensive either, so overall it was a surprisingly great experience! Others have mentioned to make a reservation, and I'd recommend that! I think we got lucky to be able to walk in. Either way, great place to eat if you're nearby!
This place was amazing the food was so good! Sunday gravy was the best Italian dish I've ever had and I'm from Chicago we are known for the best food! I recommend coming here . Grazie

I was so looking forward to trying this place bc I love watching cake boss when I saw that he had a restaurant here in Vegas I had to try it. The hostess was nice and sat us down quick but overall look of this place I wasn't impressed at all, waitress was slow and took forever and when our food came out I wasn't falling in my chair in love with it. Taste like every other Italian restaurant every where, nothing special or wow factor about it. It was really disappointing to come here and think that the food would be over the top to die for yummy and turns out it was nothing to recommend to friends. Probably my first and last time here, also it is pretty price for the quality of food.

Peter is amazing! The service was great and Peter, our server, was so accommodating and sweet! He made a recommendation for the linguini with clams which was delicious! We had a blast and Peter even gave us canolis to go! Thank you Peter for making our first visit to Buddy V's so great! We'll be back!

One of my favorite restaurant. I ate the shrimp scampi and it was amazing. The portions are very big so make sure you're hungry. For dessert the nutella cake is super delicious the cake super moist and soft.

Another outstanding meal at Buddy V's.  The cheesey garlic bread is to die for.  I have never had garlic bread with that much flavour.

I had the free range chicken breast with fingerling potatoes and spinach.  Juicy chicken with outstanding flavour and an amazing presentation.

This restaurant hits it out of the park every time we eat here.

We hope to be back in Vegas in 2018 and will definitely be back.

Thanks for making our Vegas experience that much better.

Before we get to food or ambiance, first you have to find the place - which is buried in the maze of the Venetian / Palazzo Canal Shops.  I have been to the real Venice many times and I swear it is easier to find your way around there than it is around the Canal Shops.  At least the real Venice has guidebooks with maps.  It would be helpful if Buddy V's website would at least give a clue, like saying "We are on the second floor, about 30 yards down a hallway from Barney's New York, and overlooking the porte cochère facing the Strip."  Would that be so hard?

So, anyway, after a few wrong turns and roaming around for 10 minutes I'm a little grumpy but we find the restaurant.  My first impression is that someone crossed a mob restaurant from Jersey with a Chuck-E-Cheese.  Very bright.  Very loud.  Very crowded.  Lots of kids.  Hard chairs at the tables, although the booths looked comfortable.  (The booths were all full at 6:00 p.m. on a Wednesday.  Whatever criticisms I have about this place, they sure don't seem to be keeping the customers away.)

The wait staff was attentive.  Drinks came quickly (I needed one), along with a piece of foccacia bread and some olive oil and vinegar for dipping.  We were here for restaurant week, which meant ordering off of the prix fixe menu.  I started with Grandma's Meatballs; they were not the best I've had.  They had a kind of a light, mousse consistency and not much (if any?) sauce.  Well, I've never understood the iconography of "Grandma" as the pinnacle of  the culinary arts anyway.  Personally, I'm more impressed by training at the Culinary Institute of America and a few years working in a Michellin starred restaurant, but hey - maybe your Grandma was a better cook than mine.

My entree was the roasted sea bass, and that was a very nice piece of fish.  I also had a side of Mac & Cheese Carbonara, which was excellent,  My wife had a Cesar Salad and a pasta entree, and she enjoyed them both very much.  For dessert we each tried the cannoli, which was kind of mediocre.  That surprised me, since Buddy V is known, first and foremost, as  baker.

The $40 prix fixe menu was a good bargain, although the prices on the main menu were definitely creeping into the "fine dining" range.  Oh, it's not Sinatra or Giada's by a couple of hundred dollars, but it wasn't priced as a family restaurant either, even though it felt more like a family restaurant.

So, time for the trek back to the parking lot.  At least we didn't get lost this time, and the Venetian is one of the few Strip hotels that still provides free parking - hat tip to Sheldon Adelson for that.

The best meatballs. We always order it. We also get the garlic cheese bread. We also ordered the Tiramisu~~~amazing !!!!!!
We always come here when we come to Vegas.

This place is FANTASTIC! I HIGHLY recommend!!! We had the meatballs and cheese garlic bread, chicken parm, and lasagna. This was hands down our best meal yet! WARNING the portions very large! One of the meals could have filled my husband and I but we were piggies and had to try more LOL! First my husband is Italian and VERY picky about his sauce and this fit his criteria for good sauce. The chicken was fresh and the breading was light but crisp. The the lasagna was outstanding I can't say enough about it. The filling was cheesy, there was meat but not too much, and the sauce was fantastic. We ended the meal with a cannoli that was very well done. Usually the ricotta is too gritty for my taste and this was creamy with just enough sweetness. We seriously can't say enough good things about this meal! If you get the chance to come it is a must. Our only regret is that we couldn't eat more! 

My husband would like to add that his ONLY complaint is that the chairs felt cheep.

Another fabulous meal with superior service from Randy! Each dish was delicious....we ate the Pasta E Fagioli, Sea Scallops, Veal Parm Chop, Chicken Parm, & My Mother-in-Law's Capellini Shrimp Scampi.
The Italian Birthday Cake was tasty & so cute!

I was slightly skeptical thinking it would not be good. The apps are average. The pastas...exceptional! Pomodoro was perfect, the lasagna is super huge and delish and the pasta alla vodka was amazing! All of the pasta is perfectly cooked. Oh, and make sure you leave room for dessert. The tiramisu had a chocolate cake surprise at the bottom. I hate the word moist but that's exactly what it was...MOIST. I couldn't stop eating it. Nice views so ask for a table by the window. The restaurant is not easy to find so just ask for directions...don't wander around.

We were seated quickly. The staff are great. Friendly, professional and attentive but not overbearing. 

The food is outstanding. My daughter is a very picky pasta enthusiast and she said it was the best pasta she has ever had.

Best happy hour on the strip! My friends and I were staying at the venetian so we decided to try this place as it was right in the hotel. Luckily, we made it in time for happy hour - drinks were $4 and food was $5! The regular dinner menu itself is a little pricey so the happy hour is definitely a steal. 

We all got a round of sangria - perfect amount to get you a little tipsy at dinner! For $4, the drinks are the best deal because you can't get a $4 cocktail anywhere in Vegas. We ordered some of the $5 appetizers from the happy hour menu for dinner. We all got an order of the meatball sliders which is their famous Grandma's meatballs in small burger buns. I would highly recommend ordering these! The flavor was delicious and it was a good size. We also ordered calamari to share, and tried the mac and cheese carbonara. The calamari was nice and crispy, and came with fried jalepenos. The mac and cheese was okay...super creamy and the noodles were a bit overcooked. 

Service was a little slow as there was only one waitress for the outside happy hour patio. But would highly recommend coming here for happy hour for some drinks and snacks especially before going out!

Came here for a bachelorette dinner and I have to say I was pretty impressed. It was a pre-fixed menu so everything came out pretty quickly. The bridal party selected the items before arriving and I thought they made great choices. We had the following items:

Starter: Margherita pizza 
Appetizers: Grandma's Meatballs
Mains: Chicken Rigatoni and Spaghetti Bolognese
Desserts: Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake and Cannoli 

It came with huge portions so even though we were all sharing, we had tons of leftovers. My favorites were the meatballs and the nutella cake. I would highly recommend this place and I would definitely like to come back and try to rest of their menu

Great service, great food!  Chicken parm, spaghetti with meatballs, chicken marsala, and Caesar salad all very good!  You will probably need a reservation as this place typically has a long wait.  Request a table by the windows overlooking the strip!

Service was excellent!! The meatball appetizer a must!! It was just like my aunt made. The orecchiette pasta with sausage was delicious. The lemon drop martini was very good. I wouldn't order the brocollini appetizer again. The focaccia bread was delicious.

Awesome experience! We were beyond impressed with the food and service. William did a fantastic job checking on us and answering questions. The food was incredibly delicious and the staff is very efficient. I would highly recommend checking out Buddy V's if you are looking for somewhere new as a local or are visiting Las Vegas. Buddy V is also known as Cake Boss. Across the way you'll see his other store, which always has a long line. We made a reservation because we went at 5pm. I would recommend making a reservation to ensure you are seated quickly. Within minutes the place was packed for dinner. They also have  great happy hours specials I would recommend checking out.

Very good food and service. It taste like good homemade Italian food. Huge portions 2 people could split a dinner.  
I only gave 4 stars because. We were trying to have a nice dinner of just us 2. 
And the hostess puts a party of 8 right next to us when there were available tables not right on top of us. Plus they were extremely loud. It really took away from our celebratory dinner!

What a treat this place was. We arrived without a reservation around 6 pm and were able to get seated right away. The hostess asked if we wanted to sit in their patio and we agreed but once there we quickly changed our minds. We found ourselves sitting out in the pathways of those coming in and out of the Venetian Canal Shoppes. We asked if we could be moved over to the bar and this was no problem. There was plenty of seating in the bar area and this is were we stayed and made it just in time for happy hour. They have some food items as well as alcoholic beverages for $5 and ends around 630 pm. I ordered a Caesar salad and the Eggplant Parmesan and my friend ordered chicken Parmesan and carbonara from the menu. Our app was calamari. It was all delicious and plentiful. So filling in fact that we had enough to take home. The true delight was in the tiramisu which came in a little mason jar. That alone would make me return. The bartenders were wonderful and definitely sold us on our meals. We really enjoyed the service as well as the food.

Pass...  We love Cake Boss, so this place was a no brainer, despite bad reviews on Trip Advisor and some here.  The service was wholly underwhelming, except for the thin older gentlemen who filled our water and brought us bread, he was the only good part of the evening!!!!  The server was courteous but rushed she paid us little attention and it took forever to place an order, to get a dessert menu, and get the bill.  We definitely did not feel like Famiglia:(  Sorry, Buddy, this place needs LOTS of customer service training.

Food: Meh, the lasagne was forgettable, my wife liked the Sunday Gravy OK...  Portions were HUGE, Italian Birthday cake was AMAZING!!!

Hearing so much about Buddy V's cake boss, I was eager to try out his restaurant as well and it was so perfectly placed right across from the cake boss.  It was perfect timingly as there was absolutely no wait time when we went and we were seated right away.  So my husband and I both decided to try his pasta, but we first started off with his meatballs as an appetizer.  They were decently sized but to our disappointment, there was not much flavor to it.  We were expecting a burst of flavor but there wasn't much to it except for ground meat.  Not much seasoning to it at all and it was honestly, something that I make better at home.  For the main course, I ordered the chicken regatoni "alla vodka," which I always have to try at all italien restaurants.  It was pretty good except a bit on the salty side.  My husband ordered the "my dad's bucatini carbonara" which he thought was just ok.  Our waiter was very helpful and did suggest the meatballs for us to try.  Everything else about the restaurant was great.

I am not an Italian food snob or claim to know how, "good Italian food should taste."

The not so good - Calimari. It was very chewy and may have been a little undercooked. The sipping sauce was pretty good, had a bit of chipotle/spicey flavor to it.

The good - my wife and I split a plate of Chicken Rigatone A La Vodka. This meal was very flavorful. The noodles were large and had chunks of chicken mixed in with it. The vodka cream sauce was very tasty, I would order this again.

They are a little cheap with the bread but it is great and quite frankly I dont need to eat it anyway.

The service - friendly but a little slow.

I would go back!

The Restaurant Is Nice. Food Is Ok Lasagna and Grilled Cheese Bread Were Stars Of Show But I Was Disappointed With Chicken Parmigiana. So Many Positive Comments But It Was Honestly Bland Besides The Cheese Being A Good Quality.
The food really just isn't good. Bland, dry, and not cooked well. The reviews made it sound like traditional Italian cooking, but it tastes like a tourist trap. Very disappointing

We wanted to try dessert from Carlo's Bakery, but the line was extremely long.  Instead we decided to come to the restaurant which is across from the bakery. We sat in the lounge/bar area.  The desserts we had were the Buddy V's XL Lobster Tail (custard cream, flaky pastry shell, and seasonal fruit), and the Cannoli (cinnamon pastry, sweet ricotta cream, cocoa drops, pistachios).  LOVED the lobster tail!  If you're dining here, save room and share this incredible dessert!  I will come back for dinner the next time I'm in town.
Tomato soup was delicious, caesar salad had lots of chicken.

We had the opportunity to visit the new Buddy V's at the Venetian Las Vegas. We found the outside menu to be very interesting and the offer of happy hour irresistible!  unfortunatly, the man we met at the front desk did not share our excitement.  He acted irritated with our presence, but when asked, directed us to the upper level of the restaurant as the appropriate area for happy hour values.  after selecting a place to sit, we were accosted and told not to sit "there" as "that" isn't happy hour seating, "this" is happy hour seating.  (beware the hi top tables as they angle your drinks to the floor). Our poor waitress (April) seemed very unhappy to see us. She described a few of the beverages when asked, but after ordering "bellinis", she told us the Bellini machine was broken. When asked if the drink could be served on the rocks, she acted shocked and said it was impossible as it was made from a mix. We heard the bartender say the machine wasn't quite ready. When quizzed, the waitress said it wouldn't be ready for "hours!". We settled for the house red, and let me tell you, i do mean settled.  the transparency of the liquid lent itself more to watery cool-aid, with legs and bouquet to match. We did sample a pasta appetizer, which might have lead us to believe the food was worth putting up with the service, but a smart phone app lead us to better Venetian opportunities. Our party was met with a hostile glare as we were fleeing the establishment, and i was forced to resort to mad dogging the man(ager?) to make good our escape. 
greeting cold, directions sketchy, service irritated, food potential but unknown, farewell hostile.  1/2 star....

We came in for a early dinner around 4 pm. Excellent service today from our server Brittney.  She knew the menu and gave us good recommendations. All our orders were excellent. We had the Lisa warm Nutella cake for desert that was awesome!!

I loved the atmosphere, the decor, everything. Server's are extremely nice and the food is beyond phenomenal. However, they lost a star because I asked for the dessert menu for more than 4 times, that's about it from my experience. GOOD JOB BUDDY
Went a few weeks ago.  Just had an appetizer:  the Mac and cheese.  Made with fontina cheese, it was very rich and delicious.  Enjoyed it better than Yardhouse Mac & cheese.

Omg...I was caught off guard here. Being Italian and a pretty good cook myself I was surprised by how delicious, flavorful and well prepared everything was. Had the meatball appetizers which were like my grandma used to make and a little better shh don't tell. ;-) next I had the shrimp scampi....it was perfection for me, jumbo shrimp with spinach, tomatoes in a divine sauce. Buddy you hit this one out of the park for me. On side note, atmosphere is great, comfortable restaurant, excellent service. Will be returning, perhaps once more before I head home.
Beautiful Mediterranean sea bass, crispy, moist and great service! Had the "lobster" desert oh myyyyyy.

This is my second time around at Buddy V's......
Very good food, going-rate prices for the strip, and the ladies working the tables and hostesses are as stunning as they are efficient.

Visited Buddy's restaurant 5 nights ago. My friend and I sat at the bar and were taken care of by a wonderful bartender Miko. He was pleasant, funny, and totally on his game as far as drink orders (ask him to make you something - he's got a few awesome drinks up his sleeve!). He definitely steered me in the right direction for dinner - the cheese raviolis are out of this world! We also had a few appetizers that ended up being a meal - grandmas meatballs were heaven, the mozzarella cheese appetizer was not like anything I've had before (in all the right ways), and the antipasti plate was this awesome combo of cheeses and meats and olives that I was swooning over. The only bad part? No room for dessert! Guess I'll just have to go back next time I'm in town!!

Very good meal, timely reservation and service!  My only complaint would have my balsamic salad dressing was below standard although the ingredients of the salad were good quality.  The Lasagna is a mega-meal onto itself.  The Tomato Basil soup was good and my wife loved her Spaghetti Bologanese.  The Raspberry Sorbet was excellent!

Excellent staff and food. Only gripe would be please put bread on table not the bread sticks. Especially if crowded. We had chicken parm and veal marsala. Both very good. They serve whole wheat pasta which is nice.
Loved it. Great atmosphere, and amazing food. The cannoli was to die for!  The do a brunch on Sunday's or we would have gone back a second time. It's a little hard to locate, but make sure you do!

Mouard was our server and was excellent in attitude and service throughout our dinner. My brother is a huge fan of the show Cake Boss and was start struck to eat there, but the manager Kristina Poole really tipped the cake off with a signed Buddy V Carlo's bakery flier, a coffee cup and water bottle. Thank you for making his experience that much better and definitely deserve a rare review from me here. Keep up the great service!

I just had the best chicken parmesan ever. The service was attentive, every time I looked someone was filling my drinks, asking how I was doing and bringing me food. I ordered off of the lunch express menu. For $22 I received 3 large meatballs, a full sized chicken Parmesan and a cannoli. I highly recommend this place.

I have been wanting to try this place and finally glad we did! Their happy hour from 4:30-6:30pm everyday is by far my favorite in Las Vegas right now. They have $4 drink specials including sangria and bloody Mary's that were delicious. They're appetizers were $5 plates and everything we have was amazing. What made my mouth drool was the meatball sliders with ricotta cheese. I don't usually like ricotta cheese but it totally made these sliders out of this world. The calamari was also a favorite with having deep fried banana peppers mixed in as well. If you are looking for a good happy hour, this is your place to go!
Just had a brunch buffet at this place.  Live music and great foods.  It's one the best in Vegas!

This Place Is SHADY!!! Our server was the biggest swindler of them all. We ordered a Stella and he said "medium or large" we go with the smallest being the medium. When the bill comes the Stella Beer was $16. I inquired on why so much and they said because you keep the glass. I said we wanted the beer with no glass and they said that's the only option. The bus boy came around to clear off the table and he said they do have a smaller 12oz version without the stupid souvenir glass for which we weren't given the option.

Then for dinner my daughter asked for a white pasta instead of the kids spaghetti. Waiter said he could do a kids Alfredo. Come the bill was a charge for a $20 Alfredo when the other kids entrees were $12. We had to ask the manager which quickly took care of the problem.

I personally ordered a Caesar salad and as the waiter walked away he said he would being enough to share. Bill comes and were being billed for a huge family portion for which 2 people ate and more than half was left.

The cocktail we ordered was too sweet and liquor. We could have got a better value and experience and mastros for the cost paid. We dine out 3-4 times a week and know the routine of value, quality, service and overall customer appreciation. This place provided NONE!
 
The overall experience sucked, service sucked and we were left feeling like we were takin advantage of.

Steer clear of this over priced and over rated restaurant.
Best tomato basil soup I have ever had! I also had the margarita pizza, it was not the best pizza I was disappointed. My wife had the Chicken Parmesan it was fabulous.
Lasagna is amazing, Sunday Gravy is also awesome! Will return soon to try other dishes!! Deserts amazing also!

Staied at Vegas for 3 days with my wife and randomly walked in to this place after check out the pictures of their food. People who gave less than 4 stars probably had better Italian food than we do. This is the best one so far we have ever tasted.

We vacation in Las Vegas several times a year and plan our dinners in advance.... Buddy V's is ALWAYS on our list. We love everything about this establishment! Not only is the food some of the BEST Italian we've ever had, the staff makes the experience. Thank you Emily, Nichol and Joy for another wonderful evening!
The food here is so good! The service is great and so is the ambiance I will be dreaming about the food for months, it's that good

Loved us some Buddy V's!

So, full disclosure...I've never seen Cake Boss. I ate here because they had great reviews and sounded like the homey kind of Italian restaurant I prefer.

Bestie and I were in a major hurry to catch our flight but had a hankering (and a reservation!) for Italian before we left Vegas.The hostesses were incredibly accommodating and let our server know we had a tight timeline.

As a result, we sat, ordered and ate - including dessert to go - and drinks in a mere 30 minutes! Clearly a dining world record.

Our server Kristin had impeccable recommendations. We started off with the caprese salad and then had lasagna and spaghetti and meatballs for our entrees. The pasta was cooked al dente as it should be. Everything was piping hot, fresh and flavorful. After the complimentary bread and breadsticks, there was no way we could eat all that food. Portions are this side of ginormous.

The manager Adam came by to check on us and chatted about other Vegas restaurants we had been to even offering future menu suggestions for a steakhouse we had been to the night before. He clearly runs a tight ship while making sure guests are well taken care of and well fed.

Will definitely be adding Buddy V's to my list of Vegas faves!

Gosh, I hate to do this but honestly Buddy, you need to know. First, we went for lunch...ok, so its lunch. The bread was dry and stale. We mentioned to the server and she explained to us
we are here at lunch and bread is make in AM so it is older. The "FRESH BREAD" IS FOR DINNER". Yikes~ We understood we have to ask for it at lunch but honestly, dry/stale bread?
ok, so even gets better. I ordered a Stella, took 15 minutes to reach me. ONLY ASKED AFTER desert arrived is I'd like another Stella? WHAT???? keep the alcohol coming. Its Vegas. 12 minutes for desert. They had to make it fresh...We were laughing that perhaps the staff was in the long bakery line outside the restaurant. Food was good/fair, SERVICE HORRIBLE. Your staff is going to kill your business and should not be tolerated. Our bill was wrong. you name it. and....the best of all--our friend ordered spaghetti/meatballs. He opted for sausage instead. So, he was $6 for CRUMBLED SAUSAGE? WHAT? We discussed with waitress and she was defensive telling him "i distinctly told you it was crumbles" Well, she did not tell him $6 for crumbles. Whole sausage are only available at DINNER? Not cool at all. His family needs to get over there and educated their staff or this place will FALL! I will NOT be back. We ate appx 3pm so not too off for dinner. Very disappointing experience :(

I love it when a place holds up to expectations. Not that I had anything to compare it to, other than fancy, but family style strip Italian places. I can't wait to return. I will take the long annoying walk from valet for it, it's that good. 
My sister and I took my dad here for his 60'th birthday. We didn't want to be too fancy, but still wanted authentic Italian food. I am so glad we went out on a limb and tried Buddy V's! 
They have a selection of appetizers, most named after a family member. Then for entrees they offer pasta, meatballs, veal, chicken, tons of Italian classics! As a family of 6 Italians at the table, I can tell you we were very satisfied. My dad wanted a veal picatta. They have chicken picatta, and veal angelo, so they didn't hesitate to make him the dish he wanted. 
I went with a Sunday gravy dish, and it exceeded expectations. The appetizer platter of select meats and cheeses was phenomenal! Literally the best prosciutto and blue cheese I ever tasted. 
We skipped on dessert because of course we went across the hall to Carlo's! I am sure it was the same cannolis, but it's the point! 
This will be an Italian place I continue to come to over the years. It hit the spot!

Went to dinner at Buddy V's last night for a friend's birthday dinner. I had been there before, she had not but i raved about it. 

We had a 7:30 reservation and showed up a few minutes early. We were seated right away which is always nice. We had a great table with a view of the open kitchen. 

Our server came over to bring our drinks but it seemed to take him a rather long time. This would be indicative of the rest of the meal.  As we watched our server he seemed to have tables all over the restaurant so every thing we asked for took a long time. 

Come to find out the server did have a servers assistant but it would have been nice if he introduced this gentleman to us so we knew who to ask for what. 

The food was good but I would not go back again any time soon.

Could only be better if it were a little quieter but I can't fault the restaurant for the acts of rude tourists that were not taught how civilized people dine out in public. 

The service was excellent and attentive, the food was perfect. The veal marsala is possibly the best I've had and I order it frequently. Great italian restaurant ambiance. We enjoyed totally, will be back.

Let me start off by saying that I did not know that Buddy can cook.  My overall satisfaction is definitely five stars I love his salad I would have never imagined that a Salad could taste so delicious; especially with the croutons and fresh mozzarella I even tasted the ground peppers on that salad.  I'm so glad that I went to his restaurant at Las Vegas it was once in a life time experience and the first time is always the best.
Service was exceptional. Went there for dinner with friends Ina recommendation from our lunch server. The pasta was amazing and desserts were delicious. Definitely recommend this restaurant.

The wife and the children enjoyed this place. The ambience is chill with an open kitchen. Right across from it is Buddy V's bakery but didn't get a chance to try their pastries. The food was good. We ordered the calamari which is a very generous portion. It was fresh and tasty. The kids enjoyed their pizza and we ate the spaghetti bolognese. The sauce was to die for. For desert the Nutella cake with caramel salted ice cream was the finisher and we were in heaven. We went twice in 4 days. That should say something considering the options in Vegas.

You tawkin' to me? You tawkin' to me? Fahget about it! Buddy Valastro's Italian accent makes my heart skip a beat, and the delicious dishes he's serving up at his self-named restaurant in Vegas will do the very same!

Work trip.  Boooo.  But in Vegas? Hell yeah.  I stayed at the monumental Venetian hotel and had the most luxurious suite of suites.  It was late.  I was tired.  I was hungry, and to make matters worse, I was indecisive of what to eat. (Don't you hate that feeling?)  One of my suppliers suggested grabbing a bite at a place called Buddy V's.  "Oh like Eddie V's brother?" I asked.  "Nooo.  Buddy V's as in Buddy Valastro.  The Cake Boss," she replied. Ahhh.  How did I not know this?  

We grabbed a table towards the back, and I acquired the perfect view.  It was about 10PM and I was facing the Las Vegas Strip--the beaming lights shining down on the commotion of pedestrians as they scurried towards the various hotels and casinos.  For my first time in Vegas, this, ladies and gentlemen, was a sight!  

I gulped down the most delicious glass of cab, and ordered the spaghetti carbonara and added Italian sausage, per the waiter's suggestion.  It used to frustrate me watching Diners, Drive Ins and Dives because every other episode, Guy Fieri exclaims "this is the best ________ I've ever had!"  When you say that about every dish, what makes one different from the other? Driving my point home, the Spaghetti Carbonara at Buddy V's Ristorante was THE BEST PASTA DISH I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!!! And I'm not Guy Fieri-ing you.  The pasta is obviously made in-house, and that sauce is ridiculously rich and creamy.  The Italian sausage just drove the dish right on home for me.

Buddy V's is... Simply put? OUT OF BOUNDS, and I can't wait to get back to Vegas and eat there again and again!

Came here for Sunday Brunch. Expectations were low.The last brunch I had was at Yardbird, and if you read my review on that, you may understand why. 

Buddy V's offers about 25 food items, and 10 dessert items for a $35 price tag. They also offer a selection of unlimited alcoholic beverages for another $15. 
They also have a limited al la carte menu that offers pretty much everything that is already on the buffet, but why would you pay $23 for just chicken parm?

Here we go...

As we walked in, the aroma of GARLIC just punches you in the face! 

My! How quickly expectations can change. 

We were warmly greeted buy 2 pretty hostesses, and immediately sat at a table. I couldn't wait to look around. Our server greeted us, and went over the workings of the Sunday Brunch. We also got the unlimited alcoholic beverage option.

My lovely wife got sangria, I started with a domestic beer, then went a red wine. Sangria was great, and so was the vino. We stuck with that for most of the meal. 

As a foodie, I have to say ALL the food offered was FANTASTIC. If you like Italian comfort food, this brunch will satisfy all your needs, and make you eat way too much. 

I ate so much, I did not eat again till the following day. 

The italian sausage on the carving station (see pic) was luscious. The fritatta delish, orecchiette pasta amazing, the french toast unlike anything I've had before. Chicken parm was tasty. They put fried polenta croutons in that amazing fresh, cold, caesar salad. Meatballs were nice. My wife loved the ham on the carving station. 

EVERYTHING was so good, so good, so good. 

I visited the dessert station and discovered a totally different Tiramisu than what  I'm used to. This one was done with love. It was light, wet, and beautiful. The bread pudding and red velvet cake changed my mind about not liking bread pudding and red velvet cake. Hey, the cake boss apparently ain't no joke. These desserts were great. I can't wait to go back to try the Italian wedding cake.

I thought I was done after dessert, but went back to get more of that sausage and meatballs. With a little garlic bread of course. Also had a bloody caesar that was very good also. 

Did I mention how good everything was? Man! this place is my new Sunday after church brunch spot!

I've been to buffets on the strip that offer 3 times as much of a selection for about the same price. You know what though? No one could possibly try that much food. Even if you could, not EVERYTHING would be fantastic. The other thing I dislike about buffets is that the food is almost NEVER hot. 

Buddy V's Sunday brunch offers a smaller selection of fantastic HOT, FRESH food in a buffet style setting. 

The food is so good, that when you float out of there on a euphoric foodie coma trip the last thing you think about is the price. A total value experience.

Bone in parm chop baby - that's where Vegas life starts to get really good.

Had dinner with a group of friends last Vegas trip - I was impressed! Solid classic Italian. Very good food - prices aren't bad for the Strip.

Dessert - I have been avoiding them lately but the Lobster Tail Thingy (really, I think that's what it's called) was awesome.  No lobster in it (not a bad thing) just simple, buttery shreds of puff pastry filled with a slightly sweetened pastry cream.  Simple, but very good.  Totally rocked in fact!

This was not just a dinner this was an EXPERIENCE!!! Food was incredible especially veal parmigiana! Omg I don't even eat veal GLAD WE TRIED IT! Big enough for left overs that are just as good later THE SAUCE IS AMAZING. I'm more impressed each time we go eat there! The eggplant appetizer amd calamari are like nothing I have ever experienced- anywhere! Butterscotch creme brûlée (even though I was stuffed) I could not stop eating! Fantastico!!!!!well done Peter Nick the manager and especially chef Bryan Forgione and entire kitchen crew! Love this place more and more

The service and the food here were PHENOMENAL! Came here for my Aunt's 21st Birthday. I had the Carbonara, my aunt had the salmon and mash potatoes, and my two friends had the chicken parmigiana; EVERYTHING was tasty. The mashed potatoes were creamy and buttery, the carbonara had great flavor and was filling, and the chicken parm was sooooooooo good. 

I never had to look for my waiter or ask for a refill. There was always more person to help and meet my needs. I would definitely go back here. If you are looking for affordable (on average $40 for a appetizer and entree) meal while in Vegas, please go here.

Poor service, small portions, and the red sauce they use was wayyy too salty. Prices are in the higher range. The bread  was good. That's about all that was... Basically your just paying for the name. Never going back.
Delicious! We did Happy hour! Pam, bill, Dan an Lynn sat out side on there terrace enjoyed small plates an wine! Really good an service with a smile! Thank You

Great Italian food. Relaxed, kid friendly atmosphere. Set up very similar to Olive Garden or Maggianos. Tons of servers and busers keep things moving quickly. Water refilled fast. Courses come out timely. They offer a fixed price menu - $40 for 3 courses. All the food was delicious. Portions are huge.
Excellent quick service with delicious food! Everything was cooked perfectly from soup to ente We had a wonderful time in a pleasent atmosphere with an attentive waitress!

Very good food, pasta, lasagna, and appetizers. Nice views, cool atmosphere. Waitress a little impatient with dishes and order, and it was a little expensive for the money. But overall it's a safe option to eat great Italian food.

Do not bother...... simple simon way over priced.  All dried pasta, no fetucini alfredo, meat balls had bone chips. It was a tourist trap joke. 
  There are far better choices at venetian

Note to Buddy, rethink it bro, dried pasta, at least cook it perfect.  It cod not be simpler to make your own pasta.

I
Got spaghetti and meat balls 30.00

Updating to add a star. Dinner experience was much better than brunch. Chicken parm was excellent and the cheesy bread as an appetizer was delicious! We had a reservation and was seated immediately.
*******

Pretty pricy for what you get. $35 each for brunch. $10 for bottled water at the table. Very little at the carving station. Chicken parm was out, but they did replenish it eventually. It was pretty good. I didn't see much else that I liked. Got some pizza from the kids section to try to fill up. Dessert was the highlight, but it didn't blow me away. Service was very good.

Can we talk about that chicken parm?! Can we talk about it?! G'DAMN!

This was the best chicken parm I've EVER had. Period. I wanna book a flight back to Vegas rynah just to have that dish one more time. They give you two huge chicken breasts covered in sauce and cheese along with perfectly proportioned pasta coated in just the right amount of marinara. I am drooling just reminiscing. 

Take me back, please! Someone take me back!

If you're gonna eat anything in Vegas, eat that. Do it for yourself, but more so... for me. Cause I miss that parm, man.

Much better than expected...thought it was another gimmick restaurant.  Very happy with all our dishes, we ordered 3 different appetizers and 5 entrees and 2 kids plates.  Would be 5 stars but hostess made me wait in front of her for over a minute before acknowledging me...not cool....just raise your head up and say I'll be with you in a second.

Solid Italian food!  I took my boyfriend to Buddy V's Italian restaurant at The Venetian, because he loves watching shows such as Cake Boss.  It didn't disappoint!  

We came around 5 pm in the evening, and I was pleased to find that the wait was only a few minutes, and that we were promptly seated.  The service was quick and respectable, as well. 

The food here is a bit upscale, but still not too bad.  We got two different carbonara dishes - one of them a macaroni carbonara!  I really loved the macaroni dish, although my boyfriend said he liked the pasta a lot more.  I thought they were both very creamy and rich with flavor, and tasted delicious.  They were also very filling, and we were full by the time we finished!  

They provide little packs with sticks of bread in them on the table, but I didn't care for them too much.  I kind of was wishing that they would provide some complimentary bread and olive oil like a lot of Italian restaurants, but they didn't offer any.  

All in all, a solid Italian restaurant at The Strip.  Very good, solid Italian pasta dishes, and efficient service.  A bit pricey, but reasonable for the type of restaurant that it is, and I feel I thoroughly enjoyed my experience.

The bread! The pasta! The desserts!! I don't know where to start, but I do know that Italian food is one of my favorite genre of food (other than Thai or sushi) and I can be a picky one when it comes to taste. I must say the service at this restaurant was impeccable, and the food was all sorts of delicious. Their wine selection was pretty impressive so that is another plus. I recommend the Calamari for an appetizer or the mozzarella en Carozza, which is basically fried mozzarella. I have only been here once so the dish I had was the lasagna. I make lasagna from scratch at home so I know good lasagna, and it was delicious.

Wow...
Had mozzarella and meatballs for appetizers that was good had a bottle of pinot noir.
Main meal: chicken parmigiano. ..ok
Scallops. ..boooo...this was terrible. ..fish taste like on verg of going bad, bacon tasted like old grease, the sauce don't even know what that was supposed to be, and for 32 bucks...booooooo. 
Lasagna was good..
Service was good 
I make better itialian at home

I must admit I was a bit reluctant to try this place. After all, this guy is a baker not a restaurant chef and every celebrity food person has a place in Vegas and most aren't anything to write home about.  This place is outstanding. Their Cesar salad is a must. They serve it with warm polenta croutons. Talk about a bowl of heaven. Crispy on the outside and full of warm polenta goodness. Yes, I wrote 3 sentences about croutons. They are that good. After that I moved onto the scallops. Sweet, briney with the perfect sear on the outside. Delicious. This has become our must eat at place every time we pass through town. Great wine list, fair prices, excellent service. Worth a visit.

We made a stop for lunch and found the treat of a 3 course meal for $22. I got the Cesar salad, chicken parm with salted caramel gelato. The chicken itself was okay but the pasta was delicious. The gelato was worth a stop in itself.

First off the menu is not very impressive, kind of reminds me of Quick stop Italian joint, not a sit down restaurant. Your better of going to the polazzo and eating at carnivore. 

We started off with the mozzarella sandwich in marinara sauce which was pretty good. Very hearty and pleasantly seasoned. Then my wife ordered the chicken parm which she enjoyed. I ordered the meatball sub, I know what your thinking "meatball sub how can you judge off of that" well the waitress told me it was a signature and it sounded good for lunch. Well my take on the sub was the bread was great, a little butter action with the melted mozzarella, but the meatballs were not so good. The texture was not there for me, it was like the microwaveable meatballs, honestly if you blind folded me and but a subway sub in comparison I would probably pick the subway sub.

Bad experience for a celebrity restaurant.  My wife loved the cake boss show and she wanted to try buddies restaurant.
