There was HAIR in my food (gross) and the manager gave me some stupid excuse about the company that services the napkins "whatever".  Waiter was nice, manager was not pleasant in-fact dismissive about hair in my food.  

Buddy V "Cake Boss" well-known household name, good reputation in the food/restaurant industry and positioned  as high profile fine dining restaurant at The Venetian in Las Vegas. The experience was all but excellent: HAIR discovered in my food (GROSS!) and poor presentation of product (plates were extremely worn).
Food and server were amazing. I got the shrimp scampi which was full of flavor. First time here and we will be back.

Best Eggplant Parmigiana I have ever had. My sisters (shared the steak) also loved their meal. The host was absolutely fabulous - didn't get his name but he is Buddy's cousin. He had an eye on everything and was always dropping in to all the tables to make sure everyone was having a good time and if anything was needed. Always managing to take away a stray glass or refill an empty one as he chatted. I asked for the appy Eggplant Parmigiana as I wasn't too hungry. When he brought it out he said "don't get upset now but I upgraded you to the entree size, no charge, but it is just too delicious to eat just a small bit". He was right - best ever and since my sisters took a fair bit off my plate, it worked out well. For dessert we ordered one cannoli to split. We were so full! Anyway what does he do but come out with 3 (no charge) because it would be "terrible" if we couldn't pick them up with our hands and  eat one each to ourselves. He was right again and they were incredibly delicious! Best host ever! Great dining experience!!!!!!

Ate at this restaurant with a group 9 last Wednesday night. I had heard great things about this restaurant & being a foodie I was excited! First problem was they pushed 2 tables together resulting in them being uneven with each other = disaster when putting wine glasses down. Unacceptable .. Not even an apology or offer to correct the problem. 

Service was extremely slow and the restaurant was NOT full. We got our wine & beverages &'appetizers approx. 10 min before our meal came!! We couldn't even get a waiters attention to bring us wine! 

The food was average. Nothing I couldn't cook as well in my own kitchen. The dessert was a treat.. I will say the Cake Boss knows his desserts. That was about it. Sad to say I won't be returning to Busdy V's

Our experience at Buddy V's from start to finish was easy breezy. Buddy V was able to accommodate a part of 15 girls for a Bachelorette Dinner. Prior to our dine in, the manager provided us with different menu options that would best fit our party. We eventually went with a pre-fixed course that included these options for about $64pp (including 8.25% tax and 21% service fees):

Under Starters- select 1
Appetizers-select 1
Mains-select 2
Desserts-select 2.

We selected the items below:
Starter: Margherita - 
Appetizers: Grandma's Meatballs
Mains: Chicken Rigatoni and Spaghetti Bolognese
Desserts: Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake and Cannoli 

Overall, all the dishes were delicious, a bit on the saltier side FYI. And of course we left with shameful amounts of leftovers (because that's what happens with girls in Vegas, we tryna look good in our night swim bikins, don't hate). The winner goes to Lisa's Warn Nutella Cake... this is a MUST order. As soon as the soft chocolate molten cake with warm gooey nutella inside hits your tongue, it will make you......mmhmm. Yes. Exactly THAT thought :)

I have nothing bad to say about this place. Service is wonderful!! I came with my family in thanksgiving and everyone treated us like family. Talked to my kids and food was amazing. Just come and eat here!!!

Today I ordered the Sunday gravy. Truthfully if my mother had made this type of food for my father it would've been Monday divorce. I started with a Caesar salad. Croutons on the Caesar salad were warm polenta croutons. Yuk! The rigatoni was overcooked bag rigatoni. The meat was over done. The sauce had zero flavor. Notably the pasta and the meat had two different sauces. That seems kind of strange since typically you would use the meat sauce on top of the pasta. I didn't stay for dessert got my check and went home.

My second time dining at this restaurant and I must say I'm a fan. I had the Chicken Parmesan and it was amazing. Two generous cuts with a decent portion of spaghetti cooked perfectly al dente. The dessert was wonderful as well, a unique take on Tiramisu inside a small mason jar with four ladyfingers set next them. All in all I would definitely recommend to everyone and I can't wait to go back and try other dishes on menu. Special thanks to the staff which were attentive and worked very well to ensure a pleasant dining experience.

This place was amazing! My father and I went for my 21st birthday and had brunch! We met the assistant manager and he was the most down to earth guy. Remembered us when he saw us the next day in the grand canal shops as well. The food... well it was the absolute best I have ever had. Must go for anyone in vegas!!

A friend and I went here after a show -- we were pretty much just starving and wanted pasta and this was the first place we saw. The wait was about 20 minutes so we just grabbed a seat at the bar easily which was great, however we were pretty much ignored for 15 minutes until the bartender finally came over. My friend asked for the wine list and the way she rolled her eyes you would think that's a dumb question (is that a dumb question?). When she finally came back another 10 minutes later to get drinks I asked for a food menu and that was also apparently really labor-intensive for her because she seemed crazy annoyed. The place wasn't that busy but I could tell she was the only one behind the bar which I can sympathize -- I'm a pretty patient person so if I have to wait it's not usually a big deal as long as you're pleasant when you do get to me. So that whole exchange was sort of a bummer. 

All that said the food was pretty good. Not the best Italian food I've ever had but it was straightforward pasta and good sauce. I had the rigatoni and my friend had the orecchiette and both were good enough that we finished them. 

Will I go back? Meh. But I am pretty excited the bakery is opening across the hall!
This place is amazing!! I asked for best tasting dessert and they delivered. Mouthwatering!!

Had visit as soon as I saw the ad walking through the canal shoppes..this place did not disappoint!!! The salad is out of this word good and fresh. Buddy's signature pizza is great.. And the cannoli is what we came for especially. It was way better than expected..can't wait for Carlo's to open across the way...so coming back!!

I was at the Sands Expo for ISC West and waited way too long for lunch.  Every place I went to had a super long wait so I was happy when I got into Buddy V's with a 5 minute wait.  
   The service was very good with the waiter being perfectly attentive.  The restaurant has a nice interior and despite  a busy lunch service was very clean.  
   I ordered the Veal Marsala which was priced at $26.  It came with garlic butter spaghetti noodles.  The garlic butter noodles were the highlight of the plate.  The veal was not even lightly salted and had no flavor.  The Marsala sauce was overly sweet.  It was ok but I have had much better.  I was starved so it filled the void.  
   I wasn't impressed so this was my last and only visit to Buddy V's.

I wish there was 0 star bc this place deserves it. We went here to order cannolis for Xmas tomorrow. We ordered 8 and had them put the cream separate. They charged us then 15 min later while we were waiting charged us an extra 33.00 bc we asked for the cream separate! They never told us this when we ordered or we would of told them just to leave the cream inside. On top of this the staff Jacqueline was so rude. Then we came home and realized they only gave us 6. We called them they never called back. I plan on calling my Amex. It's the principle on this. Bad business and bad ethics

Wow! We wanted a place for Sunday Brunch that also offered bottomless drinks besides the standard champagne or mimosa. For an extra $15 each we had our choice of sangria, mimosas or pomegranate bellinis. Our waitress was wonderful and we certainly got our money's worth as our glasses were never empty.

The Buffet food ($35) was delicious too! There were several stations located throughout the main dining area. They included salads/appetizers, a carving station, kid's station and the dessert table. Entrees were lined up right next to the open kitchen and included Chicken Parm, meatballs, French Toast, scrambled eggs and a carbonara mac & cheese. Be sure not to miss the traditional mac & cheese at the kid's table which was the best we've ever tasted!! Also, get your protein fix with the delicious carved ham and chicken sausage. 

The dessert table is, of course, not to be missed! We saw a line a mile long across the way at Carlos' Bakery on our way in and were looking forward to being able to sample some of those offerings. The cannolis and the bread pudding with fresh whipped cream and caramel sauce were the highlights at the Buffet. They also had big jars of bite-sized wrapped candy which made for a nice little treat later in our room at The Palazzo. Parking was a pain since Venetian/Palazzo are two of the last on the Strip who do not charge but Buddy's Sunday Brunch will definitely be on our repeat list for our next trip!
Amazing food!!! I ordered off the kids menu, Alfredo and mushrooms with chicken parm. OMG I didn't even eat half, SO RICH.

Best meal we have had in Vegas! Everything was amazing! The meatballs were incredible and oh that sauce. We loved the manager Stuart! He really made sure we were taken care of the whole evening. I would highly recommend! Great food and even better service. Thanks Stuart for making us feel like family!

Food was great! Our server, Chaz was spot on. The water and bread guys were always there. Oh and the decor is fabulous. Split your meal. The portions are way too big. We ate off our veal chop for 2 days once we brought it home.
Great food and the staff is always helpful in feeding to your tastes. Can't wait to come back.

One of the best restaurant experiences in Vegas. The food, drinks, service & atmosphere was amazing! I'm recommending this place to everyone! We arrived 10mins before closing and were beyond pleased with the service & accommodations. I'm coming back every time! And won't stop raving about this place!

I was craving Italian food and stumbled upon this place when walking around in The Venetian.  This is Buddy Valastro's (celebrity chef from Cake Boss) restaurant, so I figured it has to be good and it did live up to my expectations.  I ordered the Chicken parmesan and spaghetti. It's oven-baked, provolone, and mozzarella.  It was crispy and with the perfect amount of cheese.  The spaghetti was with marinara sauce-$22
             
My wife ordered Lasagna Al Forno, which apparently is what they're known for.  The lasagna contains italian sausage, beef, pork ricotta and baked cheese on top. My wife was a fan.  It was $22.

The portion was big enough to share, which we should have done, since we had food coma shortly after. The customer service was great and our server was attentive.  I just think the food is pricey for Italian food and it didn't even contain any seafood, but then again anytime you have a celebrity chef attached to the restaurant's name then expect to pay more, so excuse my rant.

One word. AMAZINGGGG!!!! Definitely a 5 star restaurant. I came here because I love Cake Boss. I knew it wouldn't be a disappointment at all. My friends and I ordered: chicken parm, mother in law shrimp scampi, salmon, orecchiette & Italian sausage and a margarita pizza. All were on point! I'm def coming here again

Nice looking place, nice staff, but the food.....the food was tasteless. Meatball sub had no seasoning and the fries were just....fries. my wife had the pizza and it was just bland and subpar. I asked for a Coke and the waiter brought me a cherry coke. I asked him for a Coke again  and he brought me what tasted like a mix between Dr Pepper and cherry coke. My went on to try the canoles, and they tasted like chalk.  We were really disappointed. We were rooting for the "cake boss", but he just didn't deliver.

The food was pretty good! Their birthday cake was totally awesome. The busboy Victor M was more helpful than our waiter! The hostesses are rude, nasty & lazy! They were so busy talking about what they were going to do that night that they actually got upset with the people in my party for interrupting their plan making! Put these girls in the kitchen to wash dishes where they belong! Get some one better out front please!

Wonderful service!!  The food was excellent. My daughter even asked for something not on the menu and hers was amazing. The wine options were excellent. Would liked to see a gnocchi option on the menu. We skipped the dessert because we were too full.

I didn't have my phone with me last night. Forgot to check-in. Bf & I wanted to go to Trattoria but it was closed because they were expanding. So we ended coming here. And it turns out that it was Buddy's place! Cake boss!!! Awesome!! Wait time was an hour, we put our name down and went shopping around to kill time. We got sitted in front of the kitchen. It was awesome to see the cooks say "yes chef!" Decoration had whisk, bundt pans, and rolling pins hanging off the ceilings. Cool! Yelpers said the portions are big so bf and I decided to share. No splitting fee. We got the calamari and chicken Parm. The focaccia bread was warm, soft, and perfect. The dipping was olive oil & balsamic vinegar. It was well balanced. Our order was taking soo long. Then our waiter came back with the wrong order for our appetizer. He was so confused. We were confused. He goes back to the kitchen and we hear the head chef get angry and started to yell at the waiter. The manager comes to our table apologize and pays for our appetizer. Great service!! Finally our appetizer arrived! Our calamari was perfect. Lightly battered, soft, and the sauce was great! It wasn't chewy! I hate chewy calamari! Our entree chicken parm was perfect as well. Well seasoned, lightly battered, juicy, thin, and huge!! No room for dessert this time.Next time we will come back and try the dessert too!

Great experience and amazing service...

Here's a legit spot to get Italian food on the strip of Vegas. Had a plentiful selection of dishes ranging from pasta to pizza to seafood/meat. Overall cost for the dishes were sorta pricey... However, we're in Vegas so the whole situation is justified 

Here's we're we got:

Focaccia Bread 5/5- So bomb ! I wanted to eat the four or five more rolls but we had so much food. Dipped this in oil/balsamic and it's like heaven.

Calamari Fritti 5/5 - so delicious! The breading was perfection. Not too dense and not too salty. The perfect blend. I would highly recommend it!

Grandma's Meatballs 3/5 - they aight. Personally, didn't think it was anything special.  I feel like I make better balls myself . 

Dad's Bucatini Carbonara 4/5 - This dish was very rich and creamy. I was in the mood for something like this so I knew what to expect.  I was very pleased with the taste and how it turned out. There was a nice crunch from the pancetta. But beware, this might be the creamiest dish on the menu. The sauce was so nice and think that I felt like my stomach was putting on a warm blanket to keep my belly warm.

Mother and Law's Shrimp Scampi with Linguine 4/5  - here's a nice size plate with good size shrimp. Scampi sauce was buttery and rich and worked with the pasta.

Veal Marsala 4/5 - Strong plate with a very nice protein.  Marsala sauce was very good with a strong red wine taste. Veal was super tender and tasty.

Caramelized Sea Scallop 4/5 - Very good dish. 6 small sea scallops and everything was very tasty. Crispy prosciutto and parmesan polenta was on point. Only negative was that the dish might be good for someone with a smaller appetite. You definitely get more bang for the buck on a pasta dish.

Lisa V's Linguine and Clams 4/5 - Another great dish. Sauce was tasty, clams were fresh, good size. Can't really screw up a clam linguine unless you really try.

Overall, solid place to eat and great service. Great for taking a date. Didn't get any dessert because we were so full. But I'll be getting that next time!

AC

While we waited 30 minutes for a table (we did not have a reservation) it was well worth the wait. The two of us split everything - meatball appetizer (to die for), ice cold crisp Caesar salad, and Chicken Penne a la Vodka, and Buddy's Lobster Tail for dessert. Our waitress pointed us in the right direction from start to finish. Oh! And they served this warm cheesy bread - awesome!

This place is so good, prices are very reasonable if your not looking to spend a lot of money, and the food is spectacular. My wife and I got the ravioli, I took a few bites Bc I'm not a huge ravioli person but it tasted very fresh, and my wife loved it. I got the classic cheese pizza but added spinach and mushroom to it, it was the best pizza I have ever had, my mouth is currently watering thinking about it. Also the calamari here is a must, it's the second best calamari (behind Mastro's I have ever had). If you go between 3-5 u can get the pizza and the calamari off the happy hour menu for 20 bucks. Best 20 bucks you'll ever spend, unless ofcorse you put 20 bucks on a number in roulette and you hit .
Loved the food. The portion sizes are very large. We had to split. The staff were super friendly. I could eat here again

Food was ok nothing to write home about. We sat down and drink order was taken right away. Two min later a different person gave us the drink list and tried to take our drink order. Two min after that a 3rd person did the same thing. Portions were VERY small but taste was good. Service was terrible! They seriously took our plates away as we were still eating--like fork in hand headed toward the mouth and they take the plate away. We went for lunch and the restaurant was very empty so this type of rushed service was unnecessary! Probably will never go back.

Great dinner. We ordered Panzanella Salad, Chicken Piccata and Tiramisu.

This is the best pasta I have had in terms of flavor. It was just perfect. The salad was a bit on the salty side for us, but it got compensated by the Tiramisu.

Do recommend and make reservations. We didn't and had to side outside, which isn't too bad, but sitting in would definitely have been much much better!

It is on the pricey side as expected from a restaurant located in Venetian.
Spur of the moment choice but well worth it. Entertainment was good & food was excellent. Nice happy hour special & the garlic bread was terrific

I must say, I ate one of the best Italian dishes in my life at bobby's V last night. From the moment you walk in service is great. Had a great view of the last Vegas strip. One good thing was that they didn't have any dress code which was important because i sure didn't feel like dressing up and walk a casino with heels on. 
 
There was live music performed by 2 incredible guys. The singer song need amazing and very classy.  Now back to the food. To start of I had grilled octopus and cheesy garlic bread. I was a bit skeptical about the octopus but it was really good. After that I had the mamas linguine and shrimp pasta. I ate a lot more that I'm reviewing. All I must say is if you come to Vegas and your in the mood for some home made Italian food come to this place.

The lasagna is simply delicious, chicken parm as well.  Chicken Caesar is ok. Some stuff is overpriced overall kids had good experience and enjoyed their food. Service is great they are on top of things

This place was ok, but nothing out of this world.  We wanted to try his pastries and have a drink. The line was super long so we sat at the cake boss restaurant to save time since they sell the same pastries in both. We had two pastries and a drink and water and the bill was $41dll I don't mind the price if it's good, but this was just ok, average. if you ask me its terribly over priced :( maybe my expectations were to high and that's why I seem harsh Lol. Save your self some money and just make the huge line for his bakery and don't waste your time and money at the restaurant. Line is about 20 minutes long. Service was terrible,  the waiter took forever to take our order and after he did  he took even longer to bring the drinks out, we just paid for the bells and whistles, which soumded more like beeps and toots, Lol

Mike was our busser...nuff said...that's how good the service was, we remembered his name!

Ah yes...the chicken parm was off the chain!!!

We had dinner reservations and arrived 30 minutes early. We requested a window table and were immediately seated. The table had a great view overlooking Las Vegas Blvd. 
Service was prompt and friendly. 
The meal started with a basket of bread along with Olive Oil and Balsamic. 
In support of Restaurant Week we ordered off the special menu.

The Caprese Salad was perfect. Nice variety of heirloom tomatoes, silky burrata, and the green beans was an interesting addition

The entrée of Spaghetti Bolognese was just the right size. The meat was very tasty and the sauce flavorful.

Dessert was Zeppole coated with spiced sugar and served with a raspberry dipping sauce. A great finish

Thanks Buddy V for your support of Restaurant Week.

I can't say anything bad about the delicious restaurant. You smell the del ious home cooking as soon as you get close to this restaurant . My husband ordered a ceasar salad and the croutons were crisp but baked soft on the inside. I swear those croutons changed his life! I had to try one for myself and it was different and delicious. I ordered the lasagna and grammas meatballs. The meatballs and tomato basil soup was so good. I could barely get started on my lasagna but the few bites I did take were Devine. I had to get a go go bowl. X since I didn't have a microwave to eat it later, I put it in my room fridge until it was time for me to go then I carefully wrapped and packed it and brought it home to Houston. I enjoyed it at home.

A more casual spot with a fun atmosphere that had some pretty good Italian food. I ordered the linguine with clams and sort of wished I would have gone with the shrimp scampi after I did it. My pasta was good, but the sauce was really brothy and most of it sat at the bottom of my dish, leaving less flavor to the pasta than I would have liked. The wait staff here is nice and attentive and the prices are reasonable, given the location.

So disappointed. Not what I was hoping for. This was my very first experience at a celebrity chef restaurant. I had high hopes. The atmosphere was nice, homey touches here and there, nicely decorated, and cute touches like whisks for the light figures. My disappointment was with the food. I ordered the chicken Marsala on the advice of our server.  Unfortunately, my chicken was not properly trimmed, and had a large strip of fat on both pieces. In addition, the chicken was overcooked and chewy. (A patron at the next table had chicken rigatoni, and felt his chicken was overcooked as well). It seemed like the chicken breasts had been cooked earlier in the day and then reheated. The Marsala sauce did not have the sweet flavor you usually taste with Marsala, and tasted more like a simple brown sauce with very little flavor. The side pasta that came with the Marsala was well cooked, well seasoned, and quite tasty. My husband ordered the lasagne, as it was a "specialty" according to the server. The lasagne was fine, although not really any better than other Italian restaurants I have tried. It is heavy on the veal, and heavily seasoned with anise.  If you really like anise, it's definitely the lasagne for you. We ordered the famous lobster tail for dessert.  It was a very small portion for the price ($9 for a piece the size of a very small pear) and did not taste fresh. The cream filling was very good, but the pastry was very chewy and even hard to cut through.  On the plus side, the service was very good, and the focaccia before dinner was also very good.  I was just disappointed that the food was not better quality for the price.

We had a reservation there a few weeks ago and were seated right away.  Service was attentive -at first. We got our drinks, went straight to the entrée. After that, our server wasn't very present. The chicken Marsala was pretty good; however, the pasta carbonara was very rich. My friend ordered it and I felt overwhelmed after two bites. Dessert was wonderful -we got the lobster tail and it was decadent. Great flavor and texture. The pit of night was when our waitress, Kacey, dropped the bill and told us the gratuity was already added so all we had to do was pay the total noted at the bottom. 
  The problem there was that we were a party of 3. We looked at the bill and printed directly on there was something along the lines of:
"No gratuity has been added to your bill. For your convenience, here are some preset gratuity amounts, just circle the one you'd like to apply.
- 15%
- 18%
- 20%
- 22%"

Kacey had circled the 20% option and wrote the new total at the bottom because I guess she thought that that was what she deserved. After she dropped the bill, we noticed she was constantly circling our table, waiting for us to provide a method of payment. We were a party of 3 and even though we are young (early 20s) we know how to tip. It was pretty insulting. I get it, you work in the heart of Vegas where many international visitors aren't aware of the customs. But that doesn't mean assume everybody is like that. After talking it over amongst ourselves, I got her attention and pointed out what the receipt stated and said that if it says that, then the gratuity amount should really be up to our discretion. She tried to cover it all up by saying something like, "Oh, that was just a suggested amount, if it's that big of a deal I can just take it off." And she ripped off the bottom of the check. 
  I've worked in the restaurant industry and servers face heavy disciplinary action for that type of behavior. We still left a tip but the whole ordeal really just left a bad taste in our mouths.

This was our second time visiting Buddy V's.  The first time I came was about a year ago with several other couples on an adult trip.  We celebrated a friend's birthday and we had the most amazing experience and an extremely attentive waiter.  Our waiter completely took care of us with a flat rate per person and an unending amount of food, all of which was incredible.  We enjoyed it so much that we've been planning for the past year to come back and bring our children so they could experience it for themselves.

On Friday evening, April 7, 2017, we had the opportunity to bring our children, however the experience fell short of what we'd been long anticipating.  In town for a volleyball tournament, our first Vegas dinner was at Buddy V's.  We had a party of 8 and were celebrating birthdays for two of the girls in the group.  Upon initially sitting down at the table, I placed my purse on the back of the chair, as I do in every restaurant.  I pulled the chair out to sit down and as I sat, I fell completely on the floor as the chair had tipped over.  My purse is not THAT heavy, but rather the chairs are incredibly lightweight and not durable.  The waiter attempted to help me up but made no offer to get me ice or to notify management.  He did ask if I was okay, but due to the embarrassment and humiliation of falling down in front of other patrons, I quickly said yes, even though my elbow was hurting.  Leaving the restaurant that night my right elbow hurt.  Saturday morning I noticed my right elbow was bruised in addition to another bruise on the back of my left arm.

With regard to the meal, my daughters ordered off the Dinner Prix Fixe menu where you get a salad, an entree, and a dessert for $40.  The girls split their meal.  When the bill came, our girls had been charged for each item they ordered according to the a la carte menu pricing, instead of the Dinner Prix Fixe menu and it was added to the other party's ticket instead of our own.  The waiter also expressed displeasure with having to split the bill for the table into two separate tickets, which should not have been shared with us.

We asked the waiter toward the end of the meal if they could sing to the girls for their birthdays and he notified us that they don't sing.  He offered instead to bring each of the girls a birthday cannoli.  What he failed to mention, however is that there would be an additional charge.  I would not have minded had he mentioned that before bringing the desserts out but rather I discovered the additional charge when I got my bill.

Feeling dissatisfied with our overall experience, I decided on Saturday evening to write this Yelp review but wanted in all fairness to first call the restaurant and speak with the General Manager to let her know of our experience.  I called at approximately 6:30--not the most ideal time to call, which I acknowledged but I felt it needed to be addressed before anymore time had passed.  She told me that anytime a customer falls in the restaurant, she is to be notified.  She mentioned she was there on Friday evening when I fell and no one made mention of my fall to her.  She asked for my email address and told me that the next time we were in Vegas just to email her and she would take care of everything.  It is now Sunday at 11:15 a.m. and I've not received an email or phone call from her.

Incredibly disappointing, especially with all the hype I've given to Buddy V's in anticipation of this trip.  We will be looking for a new location for Italian cuisine on future visits to Vegas.

Stopped in for some dessert and an after dinner drink with a large group. I liked what I had but take issue with the fact that he has an Italian spot in Vegas. I mean, come on, you are known for a crappy TV show that has an emphasis on desserts and you "film" in Hoboken. I dont care if your grandmother cooked Italian...mine did too.

This place features fo-talian food with a of Carabbas feel. Hmmmm, I wonder where you got the idea? 

In their defence though, their lobster tail pastry was delicious. Everything else was underwhelming. 

Will I be back? NO. Im tired of all these wannabe TV culinarians.

Best Italian food I have had, we order the grilled garlic bread that we so moist and cheesy makes me want more just thinking about, the shrimp scampi that was awesome as well, the chicken parm was probably the best could not taste the fried taste which is great, and the carbonara that was great as well. We also tried there itailian beer is was smooth and had a great taste we also got to keep the cup another plus.

Came here after watching a show expecting something wonderful considering the prices.
Came on a Wednesday night expecting a wonderful experience considering this is Buddy's rest. Who we have loved for many years on TV. The service was slow and not up to what we usually get at a good resturant. As far as the food. It was good not great. SORRY BUDDY.
But we won't be coming back to your resturant.

We visited the  restaurant during brunch buffet. This was s great way to sample what a variety of the menu without ordering everything at once. It's fair to say the food was good but the desserts were amazing. I ate 3 cannolis. 
After getting extremely full we walked across the way to the bakery called Carlos Bakery. This is just the retail bakery side of the Buddy V. I am not sure what the deal is but there is always a line down the hallway with stantions. The wait was 45 minutes. You get up to the pastries and wait another 15 minutes to get your name called to pay. It a bit insane to have only 2 cashiers that can ring you up and keep this line control thing going. The people who put the pastries into a box and out your name on it then stand around to get rung up is inefficient.

Our experience at Buddy V's is always fantastic.  I had brunch there this past weekend and had such a great time.  The buffet style brunch has everything from eggs to chicken parmesan and it is all delicious.  They also have a bottomless drink package that includes beer, wine, mimosas, bellinis, sangria, and bloody marys for $16 which is such a steal.  

Our server was Charlie and we couldn't have asked for a better person.  He was funny, attentive, knowledgeable, and helpful.  In the few times that I have been to Buddy V's I have not had better service than I did with Charlie.  We will definitely be asking to sit in his section next time we come back.

You were so looking forward to a celebration meal at this restaurant. This was our destination restaurant for our special trip. When I made the reservation they asked if we were celebrating a special occasion. I stated we were celebrating a birthday and a graduation. When we arrived they acknowledged the celebration at the hostess stand. That was the last time it was mentioned. Not one of our servers recognized the occasion. It was less than impressive. The food was good. We had meatballs and spaghetti, chicken parmesan, and Mediterranean Sea Bass. My sea bass was tasty and came with a nice side salad. The food was all good but I wouldn't consider it excellent. A huge disappointment was being charged $10 for a glass of tea. The food prices were reasonable and what I would expect but I could have had a glass of wine for that price and it wasn't listed on the menu. Being gouged for iced tea is insulting. Next time I would pick a different restaurant in Las Vegas for a celebration.

I went here on our last trip to Vegas. It was convenient because we were staying at the Venetian. The food was amazing!! So yum. I got the ravioli and it was amazing! I was trying to save some for later that night but ended up eating it all! I definitely want to go back and try the other meals. The only downside was the waiter wasn't as nice, a little rude.

Finally made it to my 200th review!!  I decided to use this special spot for a review on one of the best plates of spaghetti I've ever had, EVER! Hubby and I had been excited to visit Buddy V's since the construction announcement. We are big fans of Buddy's so we were curious to see what his restaurant would have to offer. 

This restaurant is located in the Grand Canal Shops. I'll give you a shortcut - if you enter from the side Walgreens is on, just go upstairs and you'll see the signage. Go in through the glass doors for the shops area and you're there. No need to go through the entire casino. His bakery is right across the hall. 

Hubby and I decided beforehand that we were going to split the Chicken Parmesan and split a Lobster Tail for dessert. We got a great seat over by the window in the main dining area. The entire restaurant is decorated really cute, and I loved the family photos. Service was attentive but only by our waiter's helper - our waiter took our order then went missing until time for the check. The assistant was great, he deserved all of the tip but I doubt it ended up that way. 

Chicken Parmesan was huge, definitely big enough to share. We each got a chicken breast and a large portion of spaghetti so I'm glad we split it. The spaghetti sauce was amazing, I'm still dreaming about it. Noodles were cooked perfectly. Chicken was cooked nicely, no complaints about the meal at all. Our Lobster Tail was a little hard though, like it was either over cooked or a few days old. Not flakey in a good way, more like shards of hard bread. And the pastry cream tasted like whipped cream, not what I was expecting for the price. We'll definitely be back but only for the Chicken Parm. Might try a different dessert next time.

The service are terrible, I ask a bigger table because I wanna more space and the restaurant are almost empty at Monday 15:40 P.M and the attendant say no because it's for big families. The margherita pizza it's the opposite of the real one, the waiter dropped water on the table, water I don't ask for. They bring the tap before I ask a desert, totally rude, bad bad service.

We had dinner at Buddy Vs with a group of 8 and it was amazing!!!!! We did the Imperial family style tasting... I think that's what it was called. They brought out a tasting of all their specialty items from start to "sweet" finish and it was unbelievable!!!!! Now to the best part which is hard to almost impossible to find in Vegas.. SERVICE!!!!!! Our waiter Giorgio was probably the most incredible waiter I have EVER encountered in all my 40 years of dining 3 to 5 times a week. Astounding and personable, funny stories were shared between him and all my clients and he single handedly made the night... one of my potential clients enjoyed the evening so much he whispered on the way out that anybody that has great taste in dining establishments like Buddy Vs is someone he can see himself in business with.. THANKS GIORGIO!!!!!!!! See you next time in Vegas for sure!! A must visit!

Delicious. Casual restaurant that's great for family or date night. Quick service with a friendly smile and small talk. Had the lasagna it was huge and delicious. The shrimp scampi has large fresh shrimp. Sauce was just right and not too heavy. Also tried the scallops they were delicious except they were small. But the dish was overall filling.

Love this place! Their chicken parmesan is unbelievable!  It is a great environment and fun place to go.  For desert the lobster tail pastry is a must and is definetly enough for a few people.  So good!!

As good as American Italian type food as you can get. Spaghetti and meatballs were home-made tasting, in my book that means you can taste the true tomato flavor and it is not overwhelmed by the many spices normally found in spaghetti sauces. 5 medium size meatballs complement the pasta in a heavenly smelling and tasting treat. Garlic bread was buttery, crispy, garlicky, and substantial. Calamari crispy, peppery, with lots of tentacles. This is how calamari should be.

Wait staff amazing, in my book. I had technical questions about the tomato sauce, as in how their Bolognese is prepared. Suffice it to say, it tasted great...not too infused with basil and oregano. Polite and courteous, all staff were pleasant and kind.

The breadsticks were wrapped in separate packages. Just ask for more if you want more. Real grissini torinesi, as they are long and thin, with a hint of olive oil taste.

As good as it gets now...if you've read my reviews, I only give 5 stars to any place only after it has consistently shown, after many visits, that their quality and commitment never wavers.

The orzo, the chicken Parm and the cheesecake. Enough said! 

I brought a large party here, and it was rave reviews all around. The atmosphere is causal, but delivers on home cooked style goodness that pleases the masses. 

I would definitely go back, and I would definitely bring people here again!

Buddy designed a restaurant that made you feel like you were having a meal in his family kitchen.  Service was incredible and the meal didn't disappoint.  Chicken parm, meatballs, and meat/cheese board were all awesome! Atmosphere and attention to decorative detail was impressive.  Will be back!

I am a Las Vegas local who is originally from New Jersey and boy was I impressed. I did not even care for any of the pastries at Carlo's Bakery back in Hoboken, but we wanted to try a little taste of Jersey in Sin City. 

The Sunday Gravy (have no fear, you can get this every day) reminded me of those many Sunday dinners back in NY/NJ that started at 2 and ended around midnight. It almost brought a tear to my eye eating that food because it tasted so much like what my grandparents would make for us. Those grand meals are unfortunately a thing of the past, but Buddy V's brought it back to life. The meats in the Sunday Gravy were perfect, the pork was so tender, and you can taste the flavor in every bite of the sausage and meatballs. It was quite a feast and a pretty good value considering that you are right on the Strip. My wife had the lasagne and it was massive. The service was excellent, attentive, but not overly. 

Buddy, your pastry shop may not be great, but your Italian restaurant is. Great job! Thank you for bringing a taste of New Jersey to Nevada. The location is tricky, it is on the side of the Venetian between the Palazzo, but once you make it there, you will be back.

So glad we were able to experience this restaurant! I ordered the carbonara with wheat pasta, and my fiancé ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. Both were delicious. Spaghetti sauce was very fresh with ripe tomatoes. My dish was flavorful and not too heavy for a cream-based sauce. The complimentary bread was also tasty. We did not try the dessert here, but wish we had because Carlo's Bakery across the way was a disappointment compared to this restaurant. Next time, we will order dessert here and see if it's better than the quick stop place.

My mother and I came here the evening of 12-12-2017.  The one star is not for the food - the food is wonderful and worth the trip.  The one star is for the service.  Although at first 'Caleb H' (from the receipt) was pleasant, his follow-up service and care was horrible.  I watched him as he checked on the other tables - he did not come back to us after taking our orders at all.  Although dinner was around 8:00 PM, it was not too busy (considering it was a weekday too).  He even passed by us twice without saying a word.  When I looked at the other servers around us, they checked up on their customers at least three times.  I wonder if it was because I mentioned we had a coupon from booking a stay at The Palazzo?  Did he treat us differently thinking we were cheap?  I wonder if it could be something else?  I mean, we spoke English, so it could not have been because we were Asian.  I wonder at times though.  Every other restaurant I have been to in Las Vegas had servers who were attentive enough to check back with me/us at least once.  

At least Mourad was kind enough to make sure my mother and I had everything we needed during our meal there.  He apologized, but there was no need.  I also voiced my concerns with the on-duty manager.  If the server does not want to serve me/us, at least send us someone who will.  Mourad and the on-duty manager were kind and listened to my complaint about the service.  Hopefully, 'Caleb H' will not disregard other patrons as he did us this evening - it was insulting.

Come here for the food - not the service by 'Caleb H.'  I should contact The Venetian/Palazzo to stop considering giving hotel guests a coupon to this restaurant.

Place is my go to when I'm out in Vegas. Their bottomless mimosas, bellinis, &  sangria are so delicious food is good. I wish they'd keep it hot. The food is like room temp to cool. But other then that I'd definitely recommend it to people

Simply fantastic Happy Hour.  We tried a bunch of the small bites and got the Buddy V's pizza as well to truly experience the restaurant.  If you're coming for the Happy Hour you have to sit in the bar area but there's plenty of seats and it's very comfortable.  Great view of the strip can be seen from most seats, as well as TVs for watching the game.  

I began with a $4 house red wine and then ordered the sausage and pepper sliders, veggies and olives, calamari, gnocchi, and meatballs.   I would specifically say the calamari has a very nice texture to it and isn't too crispy.  In addition, the meatballs are simply outstanding.  The gnocchi is a bit weird as it's not the typical pasta variety, but instead a cubed pasta variety.  Still tasty, but not what I imagined when ordering.  The sliders were great and come 2 to an order.  And the olives and vegetables were a nice addition to any meal with crispy, tasty bread to add.  The pizza was actually very good as well with sausage and fresh cheese.  I had to get a pinot noir by the glass added to my order off the main menu to compliment the meal.  In total, I got out of a Las Vegas strip restaurant with all of that food and 2 drinks fro $60.  What an incredible deal.  This place is a must for Happy Hour (until 6:30pm) and I imagine their main dishes are just as good.  I had high hopes coming into Buddy V's given their association with the Honey Salt and Andiron team, but this Happy Hour and my experience overall was just phenomenal.

We made reservations for 9pm we ran a bit late but ended up nabbing a great booth facing the main street. The servers are prompt and polite, we had very delish bloody mary's (mine was virgin) really flavourful. My date had the chicken parm, he described it as cooked perfectly. I had mama's chicken holy smokes! Juicy and bursting with a medley of flavours. Loved the restaurant, a definite highlight. I look forward to the next trip.

Ordered the Cheese Ravioli and a side Caesar Salad. WOW! Definitely one of the best Caesar Salads I've ever had and the Cheese Ravioli was ridiculously amazing! My friend got a Salumi & Cheese board that was also amazing. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Vegas who wants a nice sit down meal at an upscale restaurant for average prices!

I recently ate here when I was in town for my birthday, and I'm glad I did. From the start to the end, service was great. 
The food was delicious. I remember before arriving looking at all the pictures and how cheesy everything was, which our plates did not disappoint with the amount of cheese. The garlic bread we orders came with three large slices, more than enough to share. I ordered the shrimp scampi. The shrimp were large and juicy, yum! My fiancé ordered the chicken Parmesan and he really enjoyed it. 
Atmosphere and food were great, the price was fair for the amount of food you get.

Our service was excellent and the waiter was very nice. I ordered the calamari and the caprese. The calamari was good but also very salty. The caprese had great flavor and I loved how the bread was so perfectly cooked that it had a nice crunch, combined with the flavor of the cheese etc. it made a perfect flavor leaving you to eat all the others.

I would give more stars if I could... my family and I were in town for my cousins 21st b-day and we decided to eat here for dinner on night one. We had just arrived and hadn't eaten all day, so we were starving. They have skinny bread sticks in a cup on the middle of the table and we were so starving that we all shared them, I thought to myself I hope this isn't one of those restaurants that gives you tiny portions and these skinny bread sticks and charges an arm and a leg lol and than the bread came out. OMG!!! I was wrong and in complete heaven. I had the Lasagna (best I have ever tried) trust me I am a Lasagna expert! My fiance had the Chicken Parm (Best he and I have ever had) this place will NOT disappoint you. The service was excellent as well!!

Buddy V's is one of, if not the closest you'll ever get to legitimate New Jersey dining. You get the plaid napkins, Torino breadsticks, a wide variety of Italian entrees and desserts. The desserts are from none other than Carlo's bake shop so you'll be in for a fine treat. I personally ordered the Sunday Gravy entree and it was one of the best Italian dishes I've had in awhile. It's tomato stew served with tender veal, homemade Italian sausage and meatballs served with rigatoni. Think of it as spaghetti with meatballs but more variety of meat for you meat lovers. A great experience overall!

We were only here for the night.  We were staying on the strip, walking, and looking for something different to eat.  I've watched Buddy on T.V. and have been impressed with his portrayed personality anyways.  So when we saw the restaurant we decided to try it.  All of the tables with the view of the strip were taken so we decided to sit at the bar where my husband could watch the hockey game that was about to start.  Christian was our bartender.  She greeted us promptly, set us up with waters, offered suggestions, had a vast knowledge of the foods and drinks and patiently waited for us to make up our minds. They offer a decent selection of bourbons and whiskeys.  My husband loves a good old fashion.  Not only was Christian accomplished in making one she recommended the Elijah Craig and took it to another level.  She muddled the fruit and then strained it off which he always appreciates. Comes over square ice, nice presentation with orange rind and not one, not two, but 3 luxardo cherries.  We got there in time for happy hour, which ends at 6:30 or 7 p.m.   I had the sangria for $5.  You can't beat it.  Probably 1/2 cup of fresh fruit at the bottom.  It was refreshing and the wine was actually a decent one, which isn't always the case for sangrias.  There was another bartender working, Matthew.  They worked flawlessly together.  No one's drink without ice or is left with an unfilled glass.  Usually  you get the attention of 'your' server but here, they are attentive and make you feel like family.  Speaking of which, Matthew recently became the proud Pappa of a preemie which he is still visiting daily at the hospital.  Prayers for speedy growth and discharge home.  Thanks to these two our stay was wonderful and the food was completely overshadowed.  But allow me to address it.  We had the meatball sliders.  I found good.  My husband found wonderful.  The macaroni and cheese was very good.  And we had the lobster tail dessert.  Crispy croissant cooked perfectly with a french creme in the middle.  This is wonderful!  Don't forget afterwards to walk across to Carlo's and get some of their ..

Amazing food and amazing service!!! Our food came out very quickly, and there was always a staff around to refill drinks and get other things for the table. Had the chicken parm and cannolis for dessert. Could not complain at all!

Came here for their brunch buffet. The food is much better when it is ordered off the menu instead of a buffet. It's still good but it's not as good. For example, I love their chicken parm but it's soggy at the buffet. The croutons in their panzanella isn't warm and crispy like they usually are. However, it's a good way to try a lot of the items off their regular menu. Service is still good and $35 for a brunch buffet is super reasonable.

We had Thanksgiving dinner for four at Buddy V's Ristorante.  According to our internet search for top Las Vegas restaurants for Thanksgiving dinner 2015, Buddy V's was showing a delicious menu including a squash soup to start and a main plate, all for $28/person.  When we arrived, it was $10 for soup and $29 for the main plate.  They explained that somehow, it was the 2014 menu and pricing showing online.  The soup arrived and it was way too sweet.  It should have been served as dessert, not an appetizer.  I barely had three spoonfuls and when  they took it away, they didn't even ask if it was ok.  The main course arrived and it was tasty, but cold.  We sent it back and asked for it to be hot.  When the second plate arrived 10 minutes or so later, it was still cold.  We hoped that the third time would be a charm, but it wasn't.  Half the plate was hot, half was cold.  I'm sure they must have microwaved it.  The really scary thing was that half the turkey and sausage was gone, so I'm still wondering if they served me my plate or someone else's plate.  We spent over $250 for four with a $40 bottle of wine, before tip, and were tremendously disappointed with the service, and the fact that they're incapable of serving hot food, despite several attempts.  The flavor was good, but that is not sufficient to give them our business a second time.

We celebrated our daughter Victoria's  21st Birthday with family last night at Buddy's  and we loved it. We had a great server by the name of Peter who recommended family style dishes ( veal parm, chicken marsala, lasagna  & more that were just  amazing !  In addition , Peter and his team of helpers made sure everything was taken care and everyone was comfortable.  It was an amazing experience and I highly recommend Buddy's for your next special occasion . Ps- I ordered my daughters birthday cake from Carlo's Bakery across the hall from the restaurant and it was so delicious!

Had chicken parmesan with garlic cheese toast. Both we good with generous portions. It's a good family Italian meal, at a 5 star price.  Great Italian restaurants that for the price maybe better choices.
We went for lunch without a reservation and sat at the bar. The chicken Parmesan was outstanding. Very fresh ingredients and fantastic iced tea. We really enjoyed it and had a view out to the strip.

Great for lunch. Hubby had meatball sandwich and diet Pepsi, I had the Hoboken cheesesteak sandwich and a Brooklyn summer ale. Both sandwiches came with fries, which they top with a little bit of shredded cheese. Hubby didn't want cheese on the sandwich or fries.... Orders came out perfect. Sandwiches are large enough to share. Service was a good. Water refilled often, free refills on soda. Cute decor. Would definitely return when visiting Vegas again. Thanks Buddy V for the real homemade Italian food!!!

We decided to come because we heard this place was great for families with kids. That is an understatement! The restaurant is loud (due to awesome music playing) enough to drown out our very vocal toddler. 

But let's talk about the food I had the beef tenderloin and the wife had the grilled salmon. Both were close to perfect as can be. Meanwhile our son had the cheese pizza which was so good...I stole a slice. It's enough for two kids so I didn't feel bad. 

To cap off the amazing dinner we had the Nutella Cake...which was heavenly and we ate ever last bite. 

You got to come check this place out!

Only place in The Venetian that disappointed . Felt like the Olive Garden.  Bread had no taste. Very stingy with the pasta. The waiters were nice and desserts were good. Loud and overpriced.  Even the $12 bloody Mary was bland.
Came here for happy hour, it was great! Service was frendly! Will come back to try their dinner! We tried everything at the happy hour menu!!! They were all good!!

Total waste of time and money.

They get a star for service - our waiter was quite personable and competent and the bartender made some tasty drinks. But that's where the praise ends. I ordered something simple: spaghetti and meatballs. It was very...ordinary. As in "I've had better at my junior high school cafeteria." Absolutely nothing to praise about the dish. I make better at home. So does the wife. So does Chef Boyardee, for that matter.

The wife ordered the veal parmesan. It was a huge hunk of meat, on the bone, pounded way too thin and then burnt under the cheese. The cook obviously put it on too high a heat and forgot it for a bit. Totally inedible.

For a place opened by a "cake boss," you'd think the desserts would be exemplary. Guess again. The rum birthday cake was so-so, and the cannelloni were stale and flavorless. Again, worthless food served in a nice room with good service.

Save your money and taste buds and go anywhere else for dinner. Maggiano's is just down the block and light years better tasting. Heck, go to Battista's. It's a dive that's over-rated and still better than Buddy V's. Or just stay home, heat a can of Chef Boyardee and eat it while tearing up $20 bills. In the end it's the same experience.

Everything about this place is fantastic! I googled best chicken Parm in Vegas and this place popped up... It did not disappoint. We got a great view from our table looking towards the strip. The bread they give before the meal is good. Our food came out in under 5 minutes. It was some of the best Italian food I've ever had. It didn't hurt our waitress was amazingly good looking as well. Overall great experience and I'll definitely be going back again. I think my favorite part is that it is underrated and not a lot of people know about the place.

Hands down, best Italian restaurant I've experienced. Italian food is my absolute favorite food and I have been to A LOT of Italian restaurants, but Buddy V's is by far the best. Everything about it was authentic...even our server! He was awesome! I had the Sunday Gravy. It's a pasta with sauce full of different meats. Everything about it was amazing. The Lamb was the best and most tender I've ever tried and the Italian sausage was amazing. The food was so delicious that we passed all of our plates around the table so everyone in our group could try each dish. The Mac and Cheese and lasagna are to die for as well! This is definitely a restaurant worth trying during your trip to Vegas!

Popped on in on a Tuesday for lunch while walking the strip. Service was quick, the servers were happy to be there and very friendly. There is a variety of food and drinks to choose from. The calamari was good sized and delicious! I went with a party of 4. The main courses ordered came out timely and hot!

It was slightly on the pricey side though I'll not complain as the experience there was well worth it!

His name speaks for its self the food is delicious the pasta is just to die for I've probably had almost every pasta and i can't say one is even bad. And the deserts are just as phenomenal. The price is great too i recommend all my clients to come here if they want amazing Italian affordable dinner.

Service was terrible!!!!!! I am in the restaurant business and I saw the busser more than my server. Caleb H checked on us probably about two times during my dinning experience. I ordered the chicken parm and was not even offered extra parm or fresh ground pepper. If you come to this location make sure you don't get served by Caleb H!!!!!! I am a server and I know what to expect for quality service. I felt like I was under served just because I was of the younger age group. Definitely not worth it!!!!
Best chicken parm I've ever had! Really good, comforting Italian food! Scallops were amazing, vodka sauce was amazing.  Really good food!

Average Italian eatery. Laid back atmosphere, do not get dressed up here. There is not much to say - nothing really impressed us but nothing was disappointing either. Not a bad price for the strip. We had calamari, meatballs, and chicken parm. All are average.

This restaurant was stumbled upon because we wanted to find a great affordable restaurant that we could go to before going out for a bachelorette. This restaurant is located right in the Venetian hotel right across from Carlos's bakery. The restaurant was dimly lit inside. It's a great restaurant that has an amazing view of the north side of the strip. You just have to request it when making a reservation. It wasn't too crowded and for Vegas it is truly affordable! The dishes run between $15-30. They give you just the right amount. It's definitely not a family style Italian restaurant so I suggest not sharing. I had the chicken rigatoni which I made spicy and omgosh it was so good that I had every last bite and wanted to lick my plate up haha. It was amazing and this is definitely a winner in my book!

We had an early dinner. Stopped in around 4:30 p.m. The restaurant is really nice, open and clean. There are great views. The portions are pretty big. I didn't care for the drinks. But other than that the menu is pretty simple and easy to follow. The prices aren't that bad for being a restaurant in Vegas. Definitely good for either a big family dinner or casual dining.

The smashed meatball sub was amazing and the rosemary seasoning on the fries was delicious. Loved the vibe in there too! 

I noticed that our server gave the table beside us different attention. He asked them if they had been there before and when they replied no, he gave them an intro speech of sorts, describing who Buddy is and how the restaurant came about. I was a little disappointed that he didn't bother sharing that with us. I'd suggest that it was because  we looked like tourists, but you know...they ARE located on the strip!

I will definitely go back for dessert. They looked phenomenal.

Valastro Sunday Gravy, I was NOT ready for you! When I read the ingredients listing for this dish I just didn't believe it. I honestly took it for a joke. It was no joke. Valastro Sunday Night gravy is one of those thick, rich and hearty Italian dishes that you imagine Sophia would be cooking for the Golden Girls on a cheesecake and ice cream night. So saucy and full of meat, meat,  meat!!! Veal, sausage, pork, meatballs and bones. Ohhh the lovely bones. I ditched the rigatoni for spaghetti and I was soooo satisfied. Shame on me for swooping down on the soft and super tasty basket of bread like a starved hawk. So much bread made for a crowded tummy but I couldn't help myself. Butter and olive oil for sopping weren't necessary. That's just how tasty the bread was. Dessert??? There was no room and no way. This ain't The Olive Garden. The chefs in Buddy V's ristorante were definitely paying attention to their Italian grannies in the kitchen. I'm sure of it.

I came here for an early dinner one night and I enjoyed a good service.

I wasn't really hungry when we walked in here as I just ate gelato not too long ago. So I just ordered scallop dinner.  It was cooked well but flavor was less, I think I was supposed to eat with bacon served with the dish for flavoring, but I put bacon aside and I think I wasn't supposed to do that to fully enjoy the dish.

They had good drink menu including variety of wine.  While the list wasn't extensive it was easy for me to spot what I liked.

Ambiance is really casual, for being casual restaurant, I thought it was a bit pricy. 

Service was great. He was professional with nice smile. The way he presented the desert menu to me, for a moment I thought I was at a fancy restaurant.

Indulgent Italian fare that hit the spot for our family celebration feast! My sister got married in Vegas and we choose this place for our reception, so to speak, and had a fantastic time. The food was amazing with huge portions. The apps we all shared included the meatballs  (EXCELLENT! And I know my meatballs lol), calamari and the focaccia. Everything came out at the same time (bravo!) and we had wine chilling next to the head of the table.

The chicken parm was just like home and was so good after trying it someone else had to have it as well and changed their order. Definitely one of the best things on the menu. There's a great deal where for a set price you get an app, soup/salad, meal and dessert: WORTH IT. I enjoyed my carbonara pasta: SO much flavor. 

You could take home leftovers, but you'll just eat them at 4am without regret and it'll still taste good!

The food was not bad here but definitely did not have that wow factor. Mostly just skip the spaghetti and meatballs, the meatballs were quite the let down :( the calamari is great and the shrimp scampi noodles were on point but the rest of our food (spaghetti and garlic bread appetizer) was just okay. Ambience is cute and servers were nice and on top of drink refills and checking on our table.

The service was outstanding !  My wife was given a complimentary glass of wine for what they called a delay. There was really no delay they were just on top of Service so much that they apologized up-and-down for the delay!  The veal chop was hot and tasty and the lobster tail was out of this world. My wife's veal Picata was outstanding as well will definitely be back.
I've been a fan of the show cake boss four years, so I just had to go to buddy's restaurant  in Vegas! And it did not disappointe, food wss fantastic, great staff and  wonderful at Atmosphere!

So, I'm not crazy about the whole celebrity chef thing. I have seen Cake Boss, but I didn't know they had branched out into regular Italian food. But my friend wanted Italian for dinner so we went to Buddy V's. She was excited about it. 

My absolute favorite, I order it wherever I go, Italian dish is eggplant parmesan. Somehow at Buddy's it is an appetizer, not an entrée. Luckily I asked the server and she was able to make it an entrée and add a side of pasta. I was nervous, not knowing what appetizer eggplant my look like, but it was delicious. It was layered slices of perfectly fried eggplant with a chunky tomato sauce and cheese. Honestly, I was half starving from walking all day, but I would say this is one of the best eggplant dishes I've ever had. I cleaned my plate. 

So, food was fantastic. Our server was pretty mediocre, but I was so happy with the eggplant I don't even care. They get 5 stars from me. I may have to give this celebrity chef more credit.

The food is full of flavor. We decided to eat here after reading a few Yelp reviews and we were not disappointed. My husband had the Veal Marsala and I had the Chicken Parm. Both were delicious! We wish we would have split a dish though, because by the end of dinner we didn't have much room left for dessert, which look so dang good. Sad face. Next time we will definitely split a dish so that we can indulge in some yummy Italian dessert.

This was one of the best meals of my entire life. Molto bene! I wish I had room after dinner for dessert. Lol. The staff are very friendly, helpful and professional. Make sure you make a reservation in advance. The only issue we had was the air conditioning was blasting so it was very uncomfortable. Bring a coat just in case!

Chicken Parm, the bread....the grilled garlic bread....was the BEST I have EVER had. We never leave LV without a stop at Buddy's.  I have sat in an actual old Sicilian lady kitchen's after they have cooked ancient old family recipes for days and it doesn't compare. Yum Yum

This review is for their Spring 2014 Restaurant Week Menu.

Can I tell you how much I enjoy this place? I don't watch "Cake Boss," but I'm a fan of Buddy V's Ristorante. Its setting: rustic and contemporary with a homey ambiance that's reflected in its decor. The tall windows open up the space, providing view of Las Vegas Boulevard below. All right, enough of the interior design, on to the food!

Appetizer - Caesar Salad with Polenta Croutons, Parmesan, and Eggless Garlic Dressing: During Restaurant Week, I ate my share of Caesar salads from one restaurant to the next, and this one was the best because of the polenta croutons that were crunchy and soft at the same time. I wish I could eat this salad every day. 

Main Course - My Dad's Bucatini Carbonara with Pancetta, Cracked Black Pepper, and Egg: One word: Divine. Ok, maybe a few more descriptive terms like creamy, pleasing to the palate. I would lick the entire bowl if no one was looking. 

Dessert - Cannoli: Good, but not the best that I've had. It definitely packs a crunch and isn't too sweet as is, but there's always the option to sweeten it up further by dipping it into the chocolate sauce that it's paired with. 

Not on the Restaurant Week Menu. 

Appetizer - Garlic Bread: Topped with melted fontina and mozzarella cheeses. Makes a good, tasty starter. 

Dessert - Lobster Tail: Filled with buttercream and garnished with fresh berries. Pretty yum, though difficult to cut into. 

Service - Staff members were always aware of our table, never missing a beat.

Overall - This has quickly become a new Strip favorite of mine, and I'm already looking forward to my next meal here.

Great food and amazing service from Kristi and Alex!

The Gravy is amazing with tons of flavors. And the chicken parm is the best I've ever had. Get a booth that over looks the strip and it's perfect to watch. Don't forget the calamari!

I was seated at the bar during happy hour and i enjoyed it. Happy hour is from 430-630 and it includes beers, wine, sangria, and appetizers. I had some beer with calamari and riccotta cheese. They were excellent. Best calamari I've had in vegas. I also liked their cocktail hour music which was a plus. Would come back for sure.

FOOD POISONING on January 6, 2018, Saturday, dinner around 6:00-6:30pm. I had the salmon (cooked) entree and shortly after the meal became lethargic and nauseous. Had a horrible night as symptoms progressed with fever and weakness until finally the poisoning passed around 2:00pm the next day. Stay away from this place, they are not handling their seafood properly and unfortunately most everyone going there is a tourist so they don't have to survive on repeat customers. But from my experience of getting very sick from eating the food here I would not recommend this place to anyone. In my opinion you're placing your health at risk.

Holy moly! This is the BEST food I have had in Vegas and we've been coming here at least 3x a year for the past 6 years. Shrimp scampi and chicken Parmesan along with caprese salad will keep us coming back for sure. Love the atmosphere and windows to the strip. Waiter was great and tiramisu delicious!

Went to Buddy V's today. First let me start off by saying the hostess  tall thin looks like asian descent with ponytail who sat us was not very friendly. We asked to sit at a booth after finding the chairs too slippery and uncomfortable. When we asked to sit at booth it was like we bothered her. 

Once we got to sit down we were promptly served by a great busboy. Our waiter was Rocco.  He did a great job. We were talking and were not quite ready to make our order just yet but the rude hostess came over took all menus but one and said we could share? Does this place not have enough meñus? 

The food was ok. I got the angus burger on brioche and others got pasta items off the menu also said it was ok but not for price. Fries were not savory. It was just ok and overpriced. 

In the past I have tried the zappolis and wedding cake and they were phenomenal!!! But on this trip  I was just here for food. I wanted to give this place a better score but I was not happy with the limited selection, prices and the taste. 

Maybe just a bakery there would of been great.
Yummy food here! We ordered lasagna and chicken parmesan- two great choices! Large orders that we could not finish but definitely took it to go to experience it all over again the next day.

Solid Italian in the Venetian.  I had the fixed price deal with meatballs, bucatini and a cannoli.  Service was OK, food was quite good.  Setting was nice, noisy, but not too loud.  Prices were better than the average Strip restaurant.  I would go back.

What normally is a decent place really seems to have gone downhill with regard to the hostess group at the front.  They have no idea what they are doing.  Upon arriving at 10pm for a table of five, we were greeted with "Is everyone here?" ..Yes, we reply. 'Ok - they're setting it up".....5-10 minutes later we ask what is going on and we're told "It'll be 5-10 minutes" not remembering what they said earlier.  We get to a table by the window and it's too breezy with the vents so we ask to be moved.  She says she can clean off the table next to us and we can move there.  

The waiter comes by later and says that's nonsense because that table JUST ORDERED!

So we ask again.  This time we're told we have table 38 in the corner...they just have to set it up (again).  We wait patiently.  When our group sees another group of five moving to table 38, it stuns me.  They of course get seated and I have to ask for the manager.  

She promptly comes by and asks all sorts of questions - and in the end comes back with "Sorry for the confusion.  It's been really busy".

REALLY?  ROCKET SCIENCE?  I think not.

With so many choices in Vegas, we will be going elsewhere from now on...don't need to be treated with incompetence from hostess to managerial level.

Good luck Buddy.  We even passed on dessert.  A shame really.....


**** UPDATE NOTE ****   Management did contact us directly and seemed truly concerned about the experience.  Very nice to know that they do care about what went on that evening.

If I was on death row and got to choose a meal it would definitely be Buddy V's at the Venetian in Las Vegas.
OMG this meal was absolutely AMAZING! No I did not count calories or point. We started at the bar awaiting our table with sangria's and an app of meatball sliders. (We could have stopped there... but no we continued)
At the table we chose to go for the cheesy toasted garlic bread and the price fix "before show" meal. Michael chose the meatballs for an app, the  Orecchiette & Italian Sausage as an entrée and for dessert the cannoli and I chose the Caesar salad, the chicken Parmesan and for dessert Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake with chocolate sauce and hazelnut praline crunch with salted caramel ice cream and a cappuccino too.
We could have been rolled out the door we were soooo stuffed, but we chose to walk up the Las Vegas strip back to our hotel to "burn off some calories". I will definitely need to hit the hotel gym in the AM to work off this dinner.
But it was worth every bite and calorie.

We had our company holiday party in their back room and everything was fabulous.  The manager, Christina was accommodating to all of our needs.  We had a group of 50 and everyone was raving about the food.  Chef Forgione greeted and thanked our employees for coming.  The food was incredible!! I highly recommend this place!

I am not going to lie, But this was by far the best experience that I have ever had at a resturant. We made a reservation in advance because we knew that it was a popular high demand place to eat. When we came to to the resturant we waited about 5 minutes so that while they got our table ready.  Once we were seated, we were instanlty greeted and served with drinks. Our Waiter was extremley nice! We informed them that we have people with food allergys and they took note to them.  Our waiter asked us what they were and took note (peaches, peanuts, onion, shell fish, and nuts where the allergains.) When it came time to order our food, he helped those with food allergeys first. Insuring that they order somthing that they can eat. He even made sure to check with the chef if it can make something without it in the dish. 

Everytime someone came out with food they asked who the people were with the allergey and told them wheather or not it is safe for them to eat it. One of the managers informed us that it would take a while for the food to come out since there are so many allergeys. All in all it took 50 minutes for our main entrees to come out and 30 minutes for the appitizers. The food not only looked amazing, but it tastes delicious.  We also had some cocktails, which were not only very strong (for those who like to drink with their meals :)) but they were very refreshing. 

Towards the end, we had informed our waiter that we have two people celebrating their birthday and he went to the back and brought them both out a canoli with a candle. 

This was by far the best experience that any of us could have asked for. I highly reccomend if you are looking for great italian food.

Went at 4:30 with some friends for the happy hour specials.  Service was sincere and friendly. The drink prices were killer for happy hour, and the food was great. I recommend the calamari, not to spicy, and the sauce is great.

I am definitely a fan of this place.  The whole restaurant reminds me of classy establishment that will not scare you away from wearing jeans and a tshirt.  The food is Great and the service is excellent.  Our waitress yesterday was I believe Graciela and she did an excellent 5 star job !  Nuggs had the classic cheese pizza.. of course.. and although the presentation was nice the sauce tasted like it was straight from the can (in my opinion).  It did not compliment the pizza at all and I could only compare it to what would seem like Hunts canned tomato sauce accompanied with good pizza dough and cheese.  My friend had the Chicken Parm , and I had the Bucatini Carbonara which I hoped I spelled correctly.  Definitely NO complaints on those two dishes!  I would definitely try those if you are not sure what to get.  Cheesy Goodness accompanied with the subtle flavor of bacon and texture of what seemed to be bread crumbs in the Bucatini are going to have me coming back in July for a double order!  Super deliciousness! My only sadness is that for 23.00 nugget stole most of it from me and there wasn't enough for me.  It's a portion size designed for an average person I would imagine but being that I'm on the bit larger side of the spectrum I could have eaten two plates easily.  Chicken Parm with spaghetti was demolished by my friend so I would imagine that should tell you how good it was.  The Cheese board is also a good add to your list of things to get while you are here.  Great selection of meats and cheeses but the bread was not enough for the amount on the board.
Desserts I might have to say are phenomenal !  I would have to say a best choice would be the Nutella cake and ice cream.  I say this only because after our meal the nugget had finished most of her pizza and half of my pasta so when I asked her if she wanted a dessert she replied NO.  I received my nutella cake and after having one bite I asked her again .. Are you sure?  It's nutella cake.. and the result about dessert is in my picture for this place.

They did a nice job renovating the former First Food space. It feels more homey and approachable. The interior may skew towards an over-the-top, typical Italian restaurant  with red and white checkered tablecloths and a panoply of picture frames, but there are cool touches like the light fixtures and use of rolling pins throughout. The place doesn't reinvent the cuisine, but executes traditional Italian-American dishes with a few subtle modern touches to create one of the better Italian restaurants on the Strip.

The eggplant parm app has plenty of great flavor, but could have benefitted from a crispier exterior. The dough of the aggnolotti was a touch thick, but the crispy texture from being pan fried was a nice touch. The sweetness of the sauce with the savoriness o the pork filling was great. The winner of the night was the huge brick sized portion of lasagna that arrived in a small cast iron dish. The mixture of proteins along with the boldness of the ricotta made for a wonderful combination that was only enhanced by the depth of a red sauce that any Italian grandmother would be proud of. For little ones, there's a kid's menu available. Among the items was a large order of buttered noodles that my kid loved. No meal is complete without dessert, and the nutella cake was a satisfying way to end it. It's their version of a lava cake with a rich, moist cake enveloping a gooey nutella mixture. A scoop of salted caramel ice cream accompanied it with a brittle underneath that added a good contrast in texture.

The execution was solid and the dishes different enough from your typical Italian American joint to make Buddy V's a good choice among moderately priced restaurants on the Strip.

Came Here From California And Had To Stop By Carlos ' Bakery didn't even know that his restaurant was across the hall. only a 20 minute wait and they texted us when our table was ready which was very convenient.  

all the staff is great, very nice and always made sure our water was full ! everything on the menu looked great and our part ordered a little bit of everything. 

the pastas are really good and full of flavor.  of course we had to try desert since the line at the bakery was too long and with my lack of patience I just figured we could eat at the restaurant and order some desert .
