BAMM best of both worlds.  wrong not all the deserts are available at the restaurant, BUT there are some good ones on the desert menu.

the bathroom isn't in the restaurant, it's actually down the hall from the bakery across the hall, seems inconvenient but there wasn't a line any of the two times I went. 

Of course we had to try a canoli and of course we were not disappointed!  overall great restaurant with even better deserts.

If you want a fast food setting and to be in and out as quickly as possible...go to Buddy V's.  

Incredibly disappointing in that we hoped for a casual dining experience. Instead, we hadn't finished our salads and our entrees showed up!  As well, the server pulled my salad away and when I explained I wasn't done they acted "surprised" when I told them to leave it!  A person who may have been a manager, ( who knows....she didn't introduce herself)...apologized but instead of comping us anything ( like the salad I didn't enjoy anymore) she proceeded to ask if we wanted Parmesan cheese on my entree.  

AND as soon as we sat back from our incomplete entree, our check arrived!  Imagine the servers surprise when I told her I wanted another glass of wine.  She was put out because they would mean running our check again.

I don't think this is how The Cake Boss envisioned this. 

Save your money if you want a nice, un-hurried dining experience. We especially wanted this to be nice because it was the last night of our honeymoon.  Epic fail.

I ate here for Restaurant Week Spring 2014 and again the following night from their regular menu. The portions here are nice and the different types of dishes on the menu make it hard to decide what to order. Our server, Perry is fantastic! He checked on us often and made sure everything was to our liking. Managers, Adam and Christopher also stopped by our table at different times to introduce themselves and make sure we were enjoying everything. I could tell that not just the managers care about the experience of every customer, but the servers and rest of the employees do too.

The cost for the RW week dinner was $30.14 per person which I found to be a very fair price considering what I got. I had the following:

Buddy's Caprese

Chicken Parm & Spaghetti

Zeppole

The next day I at the following:

The meal started out with warm bread and oil and balsamic. Nice start!

Buddy's Caprese ($16) - This salad is sooooo good! It had charred green beans, burrata, tomatoes and balsamic. The variety of tomatoes and different colors of them were nice. The tomatoes tasted so fresh. The burrata was fantastic! So soft and tasted great. 

Buddy's Salumi and Cheese Board ($21) - Prosciutto, spicy capicola, genoa salami, gorgonzola, pecorino, grana padano, pickled veggies, olives and grilled bread arranged beautifully on a cheese board. The meats had such great flavor and the olives (they contain pits) had a nice garlic flavor to them. All the cheeses were good, but the gorgonzola was my favorite. It was creamy and easy to spread on the garlic toast. Delish!

Chicken Parm & Spaghetti ($23) - This is oven baked with provolone and mozzarella. I thought mine from the night before was soggy, so I asked that it be cooked longer this time and it was just perfect. Nice and crispy were is should be and the cheeses tasted good. The spaghetti on the side had marinara on it and parmesan and even though I barely had room, I couldn't let it go to waste! I did take half of my chicken parm home and it reheated nicely. 

Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake ($9) - The cake was warm and baked perfectly. It also came with a scoop of salted caramel ice cream that was excellent. 

Zeppole ($9) - These are served hot and coated in a spiced sugar. 2 dipping sauces accompany them, lemon raspberry jam and chocolate. The raspberry jam I wasn't crazy about, but the chocolate dipping sauce tasted great. 

They also have a kid's menu as well a lunch menu that offers burgers and sandwiches. I am eager to come back and check some of the sandwiches out. I was very pleased with the service, food and atmosphere. The first night, we sat at a table near the bar area next to a large window that overlooks the strip. The next night we sat at a booth that was closer to the kitchen. Both are different experiences so try them both! They also can host events here.

This restaurant was really good! We had never been here before and didn't really know what was on the menu other than knowing it was Italian food. Everyone was really friendly and service was fast.
We took our 8 month old and all the waiters and the hostess kept her entertained allowing us to enjoy bout lunch, the hostess even volunteer to rinse my baby's bottle when she dropped it!  Food was excellent and our waitress took time to explain the menu and make recommendations and we love the dishes she recommended. We will be definitely coming back.

This review is for the hostess. She turned me away with an elderly person and my 2 children. I could not get a table and order a drink. She said I had to order food and turned us away. My father in law has a few medical conditions I will not list but to be turned away is a joke. This place will never earn my business again!

food was ok. customer service while at the rest was ok. after was bad. both my gf and i got diarrhea after. called back in the next day asked to talk to a manager, was transferred to christina (i think). she said that i was the first one to call in about the problem and would talk to the chef and call me back the next day. never got a response. so, feel free to try your luck at this table if u have been feeling lucky while your in vegas

2nd review
christina immediately called me after, was really nice and apologized for not calling me back immediately. i really appreciate their efforts in trying to fix everything and will definitely be back and try their food again!
We eat at Buddy V's every time we are in Vegas. The food is generous and always delicious. Great wine selection and the cannoli's are divine.

5 stars for being the best meal in our week long trip to Vegas. A couple people in our party really wanted to eat here. I could care less thinking it was just a cash in on the cake boss thing. I was wrong. This place is legit. 
Food was great, service was pretty good, and prices not really bad if you compare them to other joints on the strip. I paid almost $20 for a terrible cheeseburger at the TI. I paid $24 for some of the most amazing chicken parmesan at Buddy Vs. I know which I'll be going back for next time. 
We started with the salumi and cheese board. Everything on the board tasted great. You really get a lot. We had a party of six and didn't eat all of it. I loved the pickled peppers that came with it. 
I had the chicken parmesan. Crispy breaded chicken with delicious marinara sauce covered in gooey cheese. So freaking good! It came with a side of spaghetti which I don't normally care for (don't shoot me), but theirs was really good. I just couldn't eat it all, and I'm a big guy. 
My wife had the chicken piccata. It was a big portion and delicious. Also served with pasta. 
We both loved this place and will most definitely be back! Next time we'll try to save some room for that awesome looking Nutella cake.
We had a really great experience at this restaurant. The food was great. Service was great and fast. Love the polenta croutons for the salad. Hope to eat here again.

My husband and I are huge cake boss fans. We've visited the bakery multiple times, met buddy, and even ordered birthday cakes from Carlo's. He's such a nice guy, and his family is so genuine. 

Of course we had to try one of his newest additions. We showed up on a Friday right when they open, at 11:30a. We were seated pretty promptly. Our server was friendly, but not very authentic... Kinda 'going through the motions'. Too early to be at work I guess.

We ordered a pizza and a sausage and pasta dish. Both were very tasty and average sized, not huge but not small either. 

The decor is very authentic Italian, and has a homestyle kitchen vibe. Really spacious with tons of seating, only the weren't too many people dining , that day at least. 

I'll be back next time in in Vegas! I hope others will too!

More of a 3.5 star place...
Had a team lunch here on a Friday and they do have a nice lunch special where $22 get you one of the three selected app/salad, an entrée, and a small dessert (tiramisu or cannoli).  I opted for the regular menu, lasagna, and a regular sized tiramisu.  As we were having lunch, we noticed our neighboring tables all got the 'birthday cake' for dessert so we also added that to our order.  It was good, but the tiramisu was still more delicious to me.  The waiter that attended to us seem to be in the weeds...

Overall, the food is decent but was a tad bit pricey for what it is worth.

Place is roomy, food is good. A bit overpriced but it's worth it. Kinda hard to find inside the hotel and casino. If you have someone that can't walk too much I wouldn't recommend it cause it might take a few minutes to find it inside all the Vegas chaos.

Took our workers for a nice dinner after a long day at the tradeshow.  Make sure you reserve this place as lines can get long and you may have to wait a while.  Service is attentive from start to finish.  Food is very good for commercial grade restaurant with a celebrity endorsement.  Live music was very entertaining, playing all the oldies with a drummer and a singer/pianist.  

Food wise, can't go wrong with anything you order here.  Everything is just fresh and piping hot.  Seafood is immaculate, meatball are succulent, desserts just melt your arteries and bread is bread.  Wine is expensive obviously but what do you expect.

I'd come back again to entertain guests or just grab a good italian food fit for a tradeshow attendee.  Their birthday cake is made out of diabetes so it's really good.

In LV for business and this was my attempt at branching out for dinner. The service was very good and we didn't wait for anything; drinks, bread, appetizers, refills. I ordered the calamari and it was ok. A bit too salty for my taste, but my dinner partner liked it well enough. He ordered the caprese salad and loved it. My other dinner partner ordered the meatballs and was gaga over them. I don't eat meat, so I couldn't taste it.  The wine choices were varied. We all got something we liked. Dinner was phenomenal. I had the shrimp scampi and I was bowled over. Crisp, flavorful, tasty pasta and 5 nice sized shrimps. I had plenty for breakfast the next day.  

Two of us ordered dessert. I had tiramisu and he had Nutella cake. I thought he'd lick the plate. I wasn't in love with the tiramisu, but the mason jar presentation was cute.

If you like pasta, give this place a go!

Side note: The live music was wonderful! The waiter kept pushing wine refills on my dinner partner after he says no more, emphatically.

We went here after checking out of the hotel for their weekend brunch. It was pretty darn good! There was such a variety of food, which all tasted great. I couldn't get enough of the meatballs and french toast. The decor is awesome. It feels like an old school Italian home. They had a live performer in there singing Frank and Dean songs. I thought it was the radio until my wife pointed out it was an actual guy. Awesome way to leave our very memorable trip!

I wish I could give this place more than 5 stars!! From start to finish it was the best experience in dining both my husband and I have ever had!! Arrived a bit early for our reservation and were greeted by two extremely friendly and gracious hostesses who said they were happy to seat us early!! The restaurant is beautifully decorated and very clean, looks brand new inside although it's a couple years old! We were seated in a lively bustling dining area. And a young man immediately, upon us sitting down, took our drink order and poured us water. Right after that Caleb (our waiter) arrived, wished us a happy anniversary and asked if we would like to move to a more private table with a special view..we agreed of course and within 2 minutes he had checked with the hostess stand and ushered us to the back of the restaurant where the bustling was at a minimum and sat us at a beautiful table looking out over the palazzo and the strip. Was already amazed at this point and we hadn't even ordered yet! Caleb then spent a few minutes chatting with us and made some recommendations, we ordered the recommended appetizer a crispy mozzarella bread in red sauce..OMG they brought it so fast and it was to die for...could have just eaten that for dinner. I had the 3 course special, chose Caesar salad(amazing), chicken parm(light and Delish..ate the whole thing) and the Nutella chocolate cake with salted caramel ice cream(words can't describe how Devine) hubby ordered the bone in veal parm chop. He was in heaven!! Throughout the meal Caleb gave us just enough attention but was careful to give us space to enjoy our meal, the wait staff had our drinks filled any time they were half empty...never had to ask for a refill and even completely cleared and wiped down our table before bringing desert. I've dined at many 4 and 5 star establishments who could take a lesson in customer service and good food quality from Buddy V's. Thank you Caleb and the staff for a meal and experience 2nd to none, and for making our Anniversary dinner one we will never forget!
Excellent food. Thought I was going to have a mediocre lunch that was "mall food" but i was pleasantly surprised. Definitely a must if you are in the Venetian in las vegas
Average food. Overpriced. Loud atmosphere. Service wasn't all that. Spend your money elsewhere even if you are a cake boss fan

Please Save Your Money
Wife and I had dinner there on Friday night. Overall the entire experience was very very disappointing. The value for the dollar was not good. 
We had 2 drinks, 2 Apps, the caprase tomato's, laughable small  no taste at all. The potion size was the smallest I ever saw. The price was high even for the strip and it was tasteless. Wife had the tomato basil soup. Was only avg. 
I had had the spaghetti bolognese and wife had the regular red sauce. I don't know how Buddy can call himself Italian but the bolognese  sauce was totally tasteless. red sauce was just avg. 
Our male waiter upset us big time. Coming to Vegas 4 times a year I am or so I thought well schooled at efforts to run up the bill however.. We ordered drinks, apps etc and he says, oh do you want garlic bread at the table? Thinking it was an opening (welcome) dipping sauce and bread like most Italian restaurants, we say sure.
Well us and the table next to us made the same exact mistake. It comes and it is actually $13. charge. We both looked over and said, we just got taken! Shame on Buddy V's for this type of tactic to its guests. BEWARE..
Also, FYI, tables are very close to each other, private conversation is impossible. We heard everything the table next to us said and they were not loud at all. 
You need to understand that the value for the dollar you pay is NOT there.. 
Buddy V should just stick to what he does best, bake!! The open kitchen quickly reviled that there wasn't an Italian in the entire kitchen as it shows in the taste! 
There are much better choices on the strip. This is just another celeb chef guy trying to capitalize on the name.
If people stop going to these places to eat they will go out of business or start getting it right. 
For the life of me I cant figure out why there are positive reviews unless these are being gamed intentualy. 
By the way, a manager never came around to even ask us or the other table how everything was. Just another sign! We will never go back.

Nice Italian restaurant located in the Grand Canal Shoppes. I was craving spaghetti and meatballs and I was very pleased how good it was here.  The pasta was perfect and the sauce complimented so nicely I could have had it without the meatballs. But who am I kidding, those meatballs just took it up a notch! Definitely freshly made, juicy with all the right spices. I was so full that I had one meatball left and yes..I took that fist sized meatball in a doggy bag! No shame here. 

My kids enjoyed the oven baked Mac & Cheese gooey on the inside and crispy on the outside & the gourmet burger on freshly baked brioche bread with aioli and side of fries. Happy campers with full bellies! 

Of course being so full we had to take our cannoli to go. It looked so darn good that to my surprise tasted even better than I imagined. We ordered the chocolate chip and pistachio nut toppings. The cannoli stayed crispy/flaky even after eating it hours later. The cream and chocolate sauce was sheer perfection.  Definite must! 

A casual, hearty establishment for the entire family.  Bundt cake molds for wall decor as well as kitchen utensil inspired lighting and fixtures.  Booth seats overlook the Vegas strip. Since lunch was a hit, I would definitely come back here and check out their dinner menu.

5 stars for service... We got immediately seated. Initially we had intended to go to Carlos Bakery but the line wrapped around the corner, it had 3 different lines! So we decided to check out Buddy's restaurant instead and it was the best decision as we got to sit down. The restaurant is clean, large and well designed - it has elements of a modern Italian restaurant and they have pics of Buddy and his family on the dessert menu. We ordered the cannoli, tiramisu and large lobster tail. Since we ate lunch, we weren't hungry and thus didn't try the entrees. But the lobster tail dessert was worth 15$ and it can easily feed 4 people. The tiramisu was not good and the cannoli was sub par.

We are here tonight for my best friends birthday and from the moment the waiter spoke to our table we all felt that he had a HUGE chip on his shoulder. We then proceeded to wait 35 minutes with him never coming back after taking our order, no bread, no drinks. Finally we complained and the manager, who was beyond apologetic, nice and understanding came over and made sure the rest of our evening was great and it was. It was just disappointing to watch the original waiter serve other people in front of us like we were less important than the other parties. I work hard for my money and chose to spend it at this restaurant so it's disappointing when someone treats me like this. Hay being said the four stars instead of five was because of this. The waitress we were moved to was wonderful and lovely. I don't think I would go back but it was a great experience AFTER the first impression was made.

out of the world Italian food
servers were extremely nice and made you feel very comfortable
complimentary freshly baked focaccia bread with olive oil and vinegarette for dipping
(you may ask for more, they don't bite)

the lasagna was very cheesey (good thing) and you get a bit of everything in each and every bite

kid's meals were a good deal also especially their chicken parm

pizza was good but not my taste 

nice and dim atmosphere

Very nice atmosphere, attentive staff and pretty yummy and authentic food. Not too expensive given it's Vegas. I recommend the carbonara. If you want drinks too I recommend pre-drinks next door at rock house!

Had another outstanding dinner here; I stop every trip to Vegas. (Twice a year).   The lasagna was so big and filling, and tonight the spaghetti bolognese was great.    Don't forget the Sunday gravy as a tasty option.   Alexis, our waitress, was delightful and made dinner perfect.   Thank you!!

Best kept secret in Vegas. I brought prospective customers here during Shot Show 2015 and it was an overwhelming success. We ate in the bar area during happy hour. $4 American beers (16 oz) and $5 appetizers. The food consisted of the best meatball sliders I have ever tasted, sausage and pepper sliders, calamari and ricotta cheese with garlic toast points. Outstanding food, great staff (especially Mike the bartender from The North End). What else would we expect from the Cake Boss?

After reading some positive reviews I wanted to try Buddy V's for some decent Italian food. It's a nice place with a nice view of the strip, with the neon lights flickering in the background. Here is what we had:
- Grandmas Meatballs. These were pretty tast but our order was cold. I know they are not made to order  but you expect them to be warm.
-Calamari Fritti. You basic calamari with 2 slivers of a banana pepper and grilled lemon. Another dish that came out cold.
-Lisa V's Linguini and white clam sauce. This dish has the most balanced flavors and a decent amount of clams. This was the 3rd dish in a row that was cold. I would have mentioned it to our server but he wasn't around much.
-My mother in laws shrimp scampi. The one dish that came out warm . It had pretty good flavors but not the best scampi I ever had. My mother in laws is much better!.

Where most authentic Italian restaurants might offer you freshly grated parm you had to ask for it and it took a few minutes to let the food get even colder. We also asked for some bread, mainly for the scampi since it had a nice broth build up in the bottom of the bowl. The waiter looked as if I was asking for ketchup at a steak house. Another dissapointing Italian meal in Las Vegas, my search continues!

Disclaimer: This review is for the experience of TRYING to eat here, NOT for the food! But trying to go to a restaurant--particularly when you are on a vacation or a Staycation--may be almost as important as eating, itself.

Went by Buddy's early in the day (in late morning), to look into dining later that night. I immediately LOVED the decor, and homey, yet elegant look. The awning, wood floors and red checkered table cloths go well together, and it feels like you are in South Street Seaport in New York.

But, the hostess was useless, and had little to tell me that morning.  She was not friendly. She seemed more interested in dancing by herself to the tune that was playing. (They play good music there). So, I just decided to return later that night with my dinner companion. 

Well, that was a mess. Now, for the first time that evening (at around 6:15pm), I learn that we needed reservations, and that the wait was 45 minutes to an hour, which we were not willing to do on our schedule.  And again, the hostess was super useless. She did not apologize for the wait, or invite us to sit at the bar (which was empty), nor did she explain why there was such a lengthy wait when we could clearly see that there were at least 4 or 5 apparently empty tables in the foreground. Instead, she made it seem like we were complete fools for not having reservations.  Not a good tactic with your prospective customers.  

And I have a pet peeve of restaurant hostesses dressed like they are headed to a trashy nightclub.  Does not fit the family vibe that Buddy's seems to be going for (especially with the quaintly named dishes after family relatives, such as Aunties and Grandma).

The bakery across from the restaurant seems much better run and friendly! 

I might return, but it will take a while and maybe some convincing.
AMAZING!     My friend and I both had the Sunday Dinner Gravy and it was incredible.  Service was impeccable and Joy the bartender was great! Loved conversation with her and had a brilliant time.
This is a great Italian food place with great views from Palazzo that look onto the strip. Good place to take your date and score of points! Lol

I'm pretty disappointed because I was really looking forward to eating here. Buddy's menu kind of disappointed me because he is an excellent baker however the menu for his dinner is very minimal and boring. I went all the way as far as sitting at a dinner table to have dinner but after opening the menu and reading the items, I closed the menu got up and walked out the restaurant. I give him three stars because his bakery across the way is very good.

Girls night in Vegas on a Friday night usually a very busy night and hard to get a table but making a reservation made that so easy! Our food was beyond delicious we will definitely be back. From the environment to the service to the awesome view of the strip. They are doing great over here! Our bus boy Christian was so hospitable and got everything we needed so efficiently. Order nonnas lasagna and chicken parmesan it came out so quickly and you cannot beat the fresh out of the over bread! Thank you!!

The service was excellent, food was good on Valentine's day until the AGM Adam Marguiles( not sure of the spelling) Decided to interrupt or experience by chasing his server/bartender around yelling at her and chasing her around the bar...Then he screached at her she was cut, right next to my ear.I was shocked to see how the employees are treated there.Buddy V would not approve ,I'm sure...Someone control this situation, it was horrible.We will never go back.
This place was a must do for our weekend getaway! This place is so amazing that I had to write this review DURING brunch! The food is phenomenal and the service is impeccable! Cheers to Buddy V's!

Came here for lunch since we didnt want to spend too much on a buffet. Food was not impressive. Portions are just ok and definitely pricey.

Make sure you ask for tap water so they dont charge you more than $10 on bottled water. Would not go back.

Came here for lunch yesterday and was pleasantly surprised with how good the food was. Arrived around 2:30 pm and the place was pretty dead. I didn't have high expectations for this place because it had a very chain restaurant feel. SO WRONG. 

Ordered:
x Panzanella Salad w/ Shrimp (buffalo mozzarella, focaccia croutons, tomatoes, arugula, balsamic red onions) - Salad with lots of flavor. Wait, what? It was perfect with the added shrimp, but I think if you order it without protein it'll feel more like a side salad. LOVED this salad. Croutons were amazeballs.
x Grilled Salmon (Mediterranean chickpea & artichoke salad, roasted tomato vinaigrette, balsamic) - L-L-LOVEEEEE! I like salmon, but I don't LOVE cooked salmon. kinda tastes the same for me everywhere I order it, but this one was excellent. Highly recommend for a healthy option from the menu. All the components complimented each other very well.
x Butterscotch Creme Brulee - My favorite dessert in the world. I didn't really care for the cookies or the vanilla cream it came with, but the creme brulee itself was perfection! Probably one of the best ones I've ever had. 10/10 would recommend.

Service was extremely slow, but the food made up for it. Ask to sit by the window and enjoy A+ food with a strip view :0)

Cake boss knows wssup.

My husband & I came here for dinner, they sat us by the window, which had awesome view of the  strip. Our waitress was pretty good, knowledge of the menu. Started with the calamari, which was good & soft. Then I had nonna 's lasagna, so good & cheesy. I would go back again.

I love Buddy V. It's authentic, friendly service and the views are very nice. On the weekends they have a brunch for $35 which is highly recommended since it's a buffet style and you are able to sample out many dishes, my faves are chicken parmigiana and the meatballs. The desserts are to die for as well. Great decor and great presentation
AMAZING. The Lasagna was freaking amazing. Service was great. They serve Coca Cola, even bigger ++++.

From the service to the food, I was extremely pleased with my dining experience here.  I had caprese salad, which was very nice and the lasagna- delicious!! Portions were on the larger side but that's ok with me. It should make a nice late night snack. 
I sat at the bar since I was here alone (traveling for work). The bartenders were lovely, accommodating and attentive. I would definitely come back!
We went for hh and the food and drinks were good. We had sangria that tasted great. We ordered mac and cheese, polenta squares, meatballs, and calamari all very tasty.. better than expected.

The setting looks like "mama's kitchen", which was adorable w/ rolling pins hanging from the ceiling and bundt cake pans on the wall. Their food spoke for itself from their appetizers, dinner, to dessert. Their cheese board is a MUST and worth the price. The lasagna had a good balance w/ cheese and tomato sauce, but for dessert.... the Butterscotch Creme Brule was sooooo good from the sugary shell and the vanilla mascarpone cream. Their customer service was just the cherry on top SHOUT OUT TO PETER bruhh! I can't wait to try their brunch (.... bottomless mimosa and bellinis!)
Best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. Been here many times and every time it's excellent. I've had a real link weenie and clams and the lasagna in there Mediterranean sea bass. All very good
Excellent service and the NY strip steak was incredible.  Would highly recommend this place. Everyone was attentive.

Took my chic here last night for her birthday because she heard Buddy on 98.5 and asked if we could go, so off we went. I have been to the best places in Vegas and some are over hyped and some under hyped. I went into Buddy V's not really thinking anything was gonna be all that amazing but I was wrong on a few things.

One, The mussels they have are the best mussels I have ever eaten in my life. The mussels were so good I ordered another order after dessert.

Two, The surf and turf I ordered was cooked to perfection.

Three, The XL Lobster dessert is probably one of the most amazing things on this planet.

I love to watch new restaurants as they open just to see who really has their shit together and I think Buddy V's did a pretty good job on their opening. Staff was nervous and If I worked there I would be too. Not only is it opening day but the owner, owners business partners and the owners parents are all there. 

We were greeted by Adam Margolies who is the asst G.M. and it was really great to talk to a guy who is really into the property enough to where he had an answer for every question. I know to people reading this that may not seem like much but being from Vegas it is really hard to find knowledgeable people that know things even at the places were they work. We asked him how the XL lobster is made, where the cuts of beef were farmed from, if the scallops are flown in or driven, if the broccoli is organic, if the chocolate chips in the Gelato was made from scratch or store bought. 
We asked all these questions and he answered all of them with no hesitation. 

The decor is 10/10 for the type of restaurant it is and I think it will do well here in Las Vegas. I love eating at places that don't feel stuffy as I don't believe you should ever feel uncomfortable anywhere in Las Vegas.

Welcome to Vegas Buddy V!! Your gonna do great here and we are glad you chose Vegas to serve. Gonna get more mussels now !

My husband asked what's the waiting time, the hostess she said it's 30 Minutes or maybe less. 
we go ahead waited anyway because the kids were hungry. After 30 minutes we still waiting on our table. My husband thinks they forgot about us. After they got us a table and took the orders, there were another 30 to 40 minutes waiting for 
our food. Shrimp scampi was okay, but the kids really liked the spaghetti. That's the only reason I gave them 2 stars.

We were in Las Vegas and stopped in for an early dinner. We were extremely impressed with the food and service. We ordered a healthy amount of food, our bill was $95. We will return for sure if we're in the area again.

I was extremely afraid that Buddy V's Ristorante was going to end up being a case of "never meet your heroes." But luckily the food that they're serving was amazing and the service was even better. We had a designated person besides are waiter taking away our plates, bringing us refills on our drinks, and giving us the best service possible. The only problem was how long the kitchen took to bring our main courses to us. After waiting about 45 minutes after we ordered for our food it finally came, and with an apology from the manager. For desert we ordered the famous lobster tail which was amazing. Definitely go if you don't mind spending the money.

I loved it! Disclaimer: I am a huge fan of Buddy and his shows, so I'm a lil biased.

I came in for a late lunch, the staff was friendly and attentive. It was pretty quiet, not too many people around which was nice, I didn't feel like competing or waiting for a table.

I really loved the decor, it was decorated like a nice italian kitchen; I thought the rolling pins that decorate one of the walls was a cute and creative idea. There were family pictures on the walls that gave it that homey feel, and I have to say I really appreciated that the restaurant was spacious, so it didn't seem cluttered.

My friend and I ordered Aunt Nina's Mozzerella en Carozza, which was fried mozzerella with crotini in a tomato sauce.....OMG!! So Freakin good!!!! We were tempted to order another one, but decided to wait till we had tried the rest of the food we ordered. 

We also order the linguine in white clam sauce that was also pretty good, it had lots of clams yummy!

For dessert, we got a lobster tail and a cheesecake. The lobster tail was too f*ckin good!!! We were in heaven, the flaky pastry filled with fresh custard cream and fresh berries, it was perfect balance! Not too sweet, not too tart, the berries complimented the pastry perfectly.

Needless to say after that we were stuffed, so we had to take the cheesecake to go.

This place is a must for Cake Boss fans!

I came to visit for the first time for Restaurant Week for my sister's birthday. I'm pretty impressed Buddy. I have to admit that so far, your dishes taste just as good as your cakes (well...the cakes look good so maybe as good as your cakes look?) 

I booked reservations for seating on Open Table for my sister's birthday. Told them the occasion and requested a nice little "surprise". They did more than that. They gave us the best seat (take note here because this seat is the seat you want) in the house. You walk past kitchen, past the bar, and the main floor. You'll see these big windows that help open up the room with natural sunlight. In front of that window lies a simple yet perfect table for four. You can look right out and see the strip from above, and if I'm correct the pirate show at TI also!

My sister and I ordered the garlic bread, caprese salad, meatballs, and Chicken Parmesan. 

The MEATBALLS are definitely one I recommend, but beware! These come as appetizer and can be very filling! So if you intend to make it to dessert, I'd be careful with this one. One order would be good to share with your party. It's so full of flavor, juicy, and tender. Major noms. I think it's because of the veal. 

The GARLIC BREAD. Oh the garlic bread is also a major 5! Extra cheesy, extra buttery, and extra extra garlicy. An extra 5 points if I could because it tastes just as good as a leftover. It came with 4 HUGE pieces and one is a good size to split in half with another (that is if you're a light to medium eater). 

CAPRESE SALAD is also a great recommendation if you're looking for a nice salad to eat. Full of color and flavor. They have like 3-4 different types of tomatoes in it. There was cherry tomatoes and some tomato that is red, purple, and green (it's good I swear!). It was topped with a perfect ration to cheese and drizzled around with a light olive oil and balsamic vinegar. 

**CHICKEN PARMESAN two extra stars because Buddy V's chicken parmy will probably become that GO-TO-MUST-HAVE dish. I mean it's just chicken parmy right? I know...but it was perfect. The sauce wasn't too much nor thick or overpowering. The breading on the chicken had that perfect crunch to their tender chicken. It had that nice bed of creamy melted cheese topped with a wonderful POW of garlic flavor and herbs and spices. I'm a variety seeker so I always go to different place and try different things, but once I find THAT DISH it's hard to steer me away from it. That dish is THIS PARMY.

**DRAGO ROSSO-It hasabsolut ruby red, pomegranate, jalapeño & mango. It's divine! I love spice. This has a whole lot of spice. If you're into bloody mary's or the mexican drinks with the clamato juice. You have to try it. WARNING though. It is really spicy so if you only like a lighter taste of spice for your palette I recommend you pass.

BUT! Service was great, the ambiance was amazing. Casual, but upscale? More for business meetings, lunch, and special occasions. Lastly, it was cute after my request they surprised my sister with bakery made cookies with a light up sparkler.

See Jojo S. review for photos: http://www.yelp.com/biz/buddy-vs-ristorante-las-vegas#hrid:pp5PFMp8IqNGvdkgnQe5HQ
Our service was excellent! Nice, friendly, and attentive server and busser. The drinks were also great. I enjoyed the carbonara mac and cheese and caprese very much. The buddy pizza was just okay.
Fantastic food! I do Vegas once or twice a year, this place was great! Reasonable prices, good portions, good service (even though they were slammed), and the food was great! I went twice!
Very good service and food was good! I would not say it is a must go to place in Vegas but it will not disappoint you either.
Nice food and service. I like the place with enjoying out sight view and food. I'm very picky. Some of the order was not mine taste  as other might have their favourate

Go here, Vegas must! BEST Italian food I have tried by far! I had their chicken parmesan which was absolutely perfect! My sister had "Buddy's Favorite Pizza" and it was also delicious. Their cannolis are also to die for, so yummy! Also, SUPER friendly staff! No complaints here.

I have heard of Buddy V thru his cake boss show but I didn't realized he had a full restaurant.  The kids had mac and cheese and a cheese pizza and my wife had the Shrimp Scampi and I had the 3 course meal with a salad, sea bass and cannoli and cookies for desert.  Everything was very good.  There was so much food we didn't have room for desert!  Good food, good service, can't do wrong here!

Was in Vegas for work and took the family with me. My daughter who is a huge Buddy fan wanted have dinner here. She is 10 and she loved it. The place is charming, very cute. The food was very good as well. Service was friendly and fast. I would definitely come here again if I am ever in Vegas again. If you are looking to have a nice dinner at a place that  is kid friendly, this is a good choice.

This place has everything from great food, amazing ambience, incredible service, and live music as the icing on cake.  I came in for brunch for a friends birthday and was blown away.  They have 3 different buffet stations as well as a Bloody Mary station to build your ultimate Bloody Mary which I did.  I am stuffed and can't wait to come back.  Well I have returned and the experience was incredible once again.  The manager came by I believe her name was Milly.  Great suggestions and I loved the Nutella cake.

Where to begin??? This was our third trip to Buddy V's and the food will keep us coming back. We love the flavors, rich sauces, perfectly cooked meats, and quick, tasty appetizers, almost everything we have ordered here is amazing. 

The Service is good and friendly and realized last night what my biggest issue with this restaurant is. The appetizers come out fast, which is awesome, but the wait time between your apps and your entree is excruciatingly long. We ordered plenty of apps to keep us busy but 45 minutes elapsed between apps and entree. This was way too long. I think I blamed the server on my second trip when the same thing happened but I realized the kitchen is just slow to get out entrees and the servers lose attentiveness when they have nothing to bring you. I hate having to ask for more water or a refill. 

That being said, I highly recommend Buddy V's, the food is amazing Italian food, the desserts are delicious and the live music was a nice touch last night. 

Food:     5 stars
Presentation: 5 stars
Taste: 5 stars
Desserts: 5 stars
Service: 4 stars 
Waiting for second course: 2 stars
General Manager: 5 stars
Thanks for the attention and for listening to our previous concerns.

Everything is good, from their savory butter garlic bread to their Octopus salad to their non-rich but so damn good four layers tall tiramisu! The atmosphere is pretty darn special too (giving you a warm holiday feeling)!

Amazing food and service!This restaurant has the best service by far and our server, Peter was simply outstanding! The GM Christina also was exceptional! My husband and I will definitely be back again!

Good all-around experience. Came here with a group of 7 business colleagues. We decided to go with their special "family style". This was a great call as we got many, many plates of appetizers, mains, and desserts. Very good value for money when you have many folks sharing!

The ambiance was an enjoyable one. A touch loud on the music, but hey it's Vegas, that's petty much the norm. Good for families and business groups alike. Good options for wine and cocktails as well!

Great food and decently priced. And the service was amazing. The restaurant was about to close and they served us. They were extremely friendly. The live music is pretty good and is somewhat loud but enjoyable. Some people might not like the music though. The view is also pretty good too.

This was a very pleasant surprise. Better than I expected. Very authentic Italian good that reminded me of home (New York). The meatballs and eggplant parmigiana were like my Mom used to make - delicious! The cannoli was to die for! My kids loved it too.

Decided to try Buddy V's when I was out with one of my friends since we both had been wanting to go. When we arrived, they told us that they didn't have any tables available. I could see that there were open tables, so I'm not 100% sure this was true. My friend mentioned that he was an employee at the Venetian, so the hostess said she could seat us in about 10 minutes. They put us at a table in the back corner of the restaurant with empty tables all around. I wasn't a fan of being put back in the corner. It took a bit for our server to come to our table, so the experience didn't start out too great. 
I thought that the food was okay, but nothing to write home about. 
I haven't been back since, and I honestly didn't even think about Buddy V's last time I was thinking about going to an Italian restaurant on the strip. 
It's possible I might give it another shot.

Located in the Palazzo Hotel, it's not the best Italian food on the Strip, plus the service was poor. We spotted this restaurant, after seeing the huge line for Carlos' Bakery. That's the bakery from the TV show Cake Boss. Honestly, who would wait 30 minutes for a pastry, when Sprinkles Cupcakes is down the street and pure perfection. Anyway, we saw Buddy V's and read the menu at the front door. The prices seemed reasonable for a Strip restaurant, so we made reservations for 7:00 p.m. We arrived on time, only to wait 30 minutes while they took walk-ins before us. Once seated, the greeting was non-existent. I actually had to stop our waiter, and ask what his name was. It was Chas. After bringing our beverages, he quickly recited the one special, and he asked what we wanted. Totally rushed. I stopped him right there, and began asking questions about the restaurant. "Chas, who is Carlos?" "If Carlos and Buddy V are famous for their cakes, why did they open an Italian restaurant?" As he became increasingly annoyed with my questions, he explained that the restaurant is based on Buddy V's grandmother's recipes, not Buddy's recipes. Naturally, I commented that Buddy V shouldn't have his name on the restaurant if they're not his recipes. Oh well, just a logically conclusion. The veal Marsala came with a side of pasta. The pasta was good, but the veal Marsala was tough and the sauce was tasteless. Really salty and bland. Our dining experience lasted a quick 35 minutes...even with my insistent questions. Don't waste your money or 35 minutes eating here. There's lots better Italian restaurants on The Strip.

What a pleasant surprise! We went on Christmas Eve because it was one of the few with reservation still available that had good reviews. We loved it!! Service was on point, we got our meals fast, food tasted delicious. The pizza sauce is great!

AMAZING DINNER! I went to Buddy V's with my family and was a bit nervous at first. I love the show and have been dying to try this restaurant since Buddy announced he was opening it. It was probably one of the best Italian meals I have had in a long time, the meatballs were amazing, great portion size and lots of flavour. The caesar salad was also good, very garlicky which I like. Next was the mains, we got a few but the most memorable were the shrimp pasta and the spaghetti and meatballs. Both had tons of flavour and great portion sizes. We were celebrating my 25th birthday and all I wanted was to try something at Carlos Bakery. The manager was incredible, he went across to the bakery and got me a cupcake because he knew how much I wanted to try it and the line was crazy. For dessert, we also had the apple pie, this was the only item we ordered I was not crazy about. It came out like a hard cookie shell and it was nothing to write home about. The waiter was very annoying, he kept trying to push us to order things and he didn't take no for an answer until we said it more firmly. However, overall, it was a great meal. The manager Adam was very nice and seemed to really enjoy his job. He was all about customer service and customer satisfaction. 
My only recommendation is people who dine at the restaurant should also be able to go to the bakery.

I was all excited to eat at Cake Boss Buddy V's and it was a treat.. The staff is very very friendly and made me at home!! This is a very relaxing place with tables that gives you a killer view of the strip.. I always wanted to try the Grandma's Meatballs that Buddy V is popular for and man they were soooooooo good !! Full of flavour and moist .. Simply an awesome brunch for me!! 

Next is to head to his Shop right in front the Carlo's Bake Shop for the famous Cannolis !!! I am soooo full :) ....

This restaurant is exemplary. The waiter told me that the Philly Cheesesteak was voted one of the best outside of Philadelphia. He was exactly right. I also had the Nutella cake and it was divine. The service was fast, attentive, and friendly. I would return here in the future.

So lazy. That's part of my Vegas living. I don't want to go too far for food. Luckily this was a short walk away from where I was staying at the Venetian

What I ate: 
- Cheese and charcuterie plate: I love cheese, I love charcuterie. Why wouldn't you enjoy this? Great to share. My friends didn't like the blue cheese, but I gobbled it all up!
- Chicken rigatoni alla vodka: Plenty of large chicken pieces, flavorful sauce. This was just a tad on the salty side. The rigatoni were perfectly al dente!
- Buddy's special pizza: Dough was fresh and flavorful, the toppings were delicious. I was glad I stole a slice from my friend and tried it

Pros:
- Easy access from the strip, located in the venetian shops
- Ten min walk from venetian hotel
- Great food
- Service was nice
- Plenty of room for large or small parties. I watched staff bring together tables for groups of 10, and quickly break it down for smaller parties
- loved the open kitchen
- you can definitely get some of their famous desserts without having to wait in like across the hall at their bakery
- Lots of bright light and space

Cons:
- can be confusing to find if you've never been there
- Lots of bright light. If you're nursing a hangover, this may not be the place for you. Order the pasta/pizza to go and eat it in the dark cave of your hotel room

Would I come again? Sure
Enjoyed Buddy's with my friend while in Vegas! Service and food were excellent!!!!! Thanks for the fun experience! Don't forget to go next door to the bakery :)
My kids love it. Best kid's macaroni ever!  Waitress was nice and attentive. Meatball and lasagna was awesome! I forgot to take my backpack when I left, Waitress chased out and returned my bag.

"I think good things happen to good people."
Buddy Valastro

A good thing happened to my wife and I. We were driving down Las Vegas Boulevard and were trying to decide where we wanted to eat lunch.

Heart Attack Grill ? Been there, done that. Please see review.
Carson Kitchen ? Been there, done. Please see review.
Lagasse's Stadium? Been there, done that as well. Please see review.

Lola's Louisiana Kitchen?
Rock N Noodles?
Grimaldi's Pizzeria?  
Been... there... done... that...
Please... See... Review.

Long story short, we found Buddy V's Ristorante and we enjoyed it a lot!
I ate a Hoboken Cheesesteak. I love cheesesteak, but have never been to Hoboken. I'm not really sure what Hoboken would taste like? But the sandwich was delicious.

My wife ate a Chicken BLT and said her's was delicious as well. 
Service was spectacular. Our server, Danny was one of the best we have had along Las Vegas Boulevard. If you don't believe me please see my review for Mon Abi Gabi. 

The bill was under $40.00! But then again that was without alcohol. That's right it is possible to eat on Las Vegas Boulevard and not consume alcohol!

I have two concerns about Buddy V's Ristorante. One, the bakery across the hallway is over the top and smells addicting. Two, there is a kid's menu, but I have a feeling, Buddy V's Ristorante would not be good for kids in the later hours of the day. Lunch or early dinner, sure. 

Great Place. Great Service. In closing I would like to suggest reading my review for Buddy V's Ristorante... but you just did.

Everything was beyond delicious.  Calamari was tender with the proper hint of seafood taste.  The shrimp scampi I ordered was perfect, the added side of scallops were done right.  Angel hair pasta was el dented and not sticky. The atmosphere, the staff, the service was amazing.  You guys crushed it!!
Loved this place.  My choice of pasta taste like it was home made.  I finished every bite!  We had a nice view to the Vegas strip

Mamma Mia!!! Wow!!! Way to go Buddy Valastro! This feels like a classic Italian home the second you walk in. Family photos of the Valastro family, hodgepodge furniture, comfy sofas and chairs...only thing missing is the vinyl and plastic covers, but honestly who misses them? 

Teaming up with Kim Canteenwalla & Elizabeth Blau, who have created beautiful restaurants here in Vegas (Society Cafe + Honey Salt), the trio came together to make the Cake Bosses culinary debut a real knockout, start to finish. 

I went with my Italian buddy to try it out and we were really impressed (to say the least)! Straight forward and diverse food menu, doesn't overwhelm; drink menu follows the pattern of the food menu with good wine choices by the glass.

I chose the agnolotti which was seasoned perfectly and was in season with the sage brown butter sauce. My buddy went to spaghetti central with a rigatoni and meatball bowl and he couldn't hold back the tears knowing the impending rejection his mother would give him after finding a better meatball. 

The meatballs came really really really close to beating my Italian grandmother's secret recipe, but that leads to a lifetime of questions and heartache on my nonna. So, its easier to say that grams are better and avoid the remaining years of rejection by telling her a little white lie.

Dessert was the highlight (as expected) as my Tiramisu was not only flavorful but semi deconstructed as the lady fingers were on the side that you could dip into the cake and creme combo. My friend's salted caramel ice cream came loaded with bits of dark chocolate and an awesome biscotti.

If the restaurant wasn't in the Venetian/Palazzo's Grand Canal Shoppes: A) It would be way busier and the menu prices wouldn't be so high; and B) it wouldn't have awesome floor to ceiling windows facing the strip that make the space even more visually enjoyable.

Mangia!

We spent NYE at Buddy Vs at the Palazzo. What a great experience!  The food was great, fresh and tasty and not too much, but enough to share tastes with everyone at the table. I had the linguini and white clam sauce, it was delish. I also appreciated that most dishes were slightly under salted. The flavors really came out. But, if you go for no other reason, go for Giorgio!  Even though the place was crazy busy he took the time to give us special service. I've been in family-run trattorias in Italy and that's how Giorgio made us feel, just as if we were in his family's kitchen. It's Buddy's, don't skip dessert!  We had the Italian birthday cake and, Giorgio you were right. It made me forget about run-of-the-mill tiramisu!

Food is absolutely amazing!! Perfect portion sizes and unique twists to traditional recipes. Try the mozzarella sticks as an appetizer. Delicious!! And not what you expect!! Service is personalized and impeccable!!

I came here Friday evening for my birthday.it was kinda hard to find,but when I did it was well worth it.very nice restaurant,open,clean and great atmosphere.we had a booth by the window with an amazing view of the strip.our waiter was awesome!! Be prepared to spend some $ for two pple it was 98.00. We got a Caesar salad,lasagna,lobster tail and shrimp dish.the lasagna was to die for...so amazing and dishes are very filling.most people were dressed in just shorts and thirst I felt overdressed.
Had a blast with two others I was with. The server, Danielle was great. Very knowledgable and attentive. The food was very good, pizza and pasta. The two I was with enjoyed the deserts also.

We had dinner here on Mother's Day & the service was excellent!  My guy had the Sea scallops  and they were cooked to perfection. I had the Chicken Parmesan & spaghetti & it was delicious ! We had the meat & cheese board for starters. Everything was just perfect! Nice casual dining experience & delectable Italian dishes.

We came across the restaurant and I really want it to have dinner their to celebrate my birthday.  When we asked if we need it any reservations the restaurant hostess was very rude. I asked if we can make reservations for a later time and with an attitude she said "well I guess,  I'll try and squeeze you in," although I really want it to eat their didn't feel like dealing with attitude. We decided to eat at a different restaurant.

Food was ok. Service was a little slow. I've had better Italian. 
My friends' food was a disaster -tasteless and too salty. Mine was ok. 2 stars for the price and meh food.

We had the Roma Gnocchi, Mac & Cheese, Lasagna, and Cheese Ravioli. All were amazing! We sat in the bar area watching the game. Our server, Christian, was top notch! I'm talking Disney trained top notch. Had the Butterscotch Creme Brûlée for desert. It was to die for! So glad we came here to eat.

Had been at the Venetian for 2 days and realized that I have't eaten any Italian food. Walked past Buddy V's several times and decided to make reservations for later in the evening. When I arrived I was seated promptly. The menu was short and sweet covered all of the classics. I usually order Chicken Parm but I was in the mood for Spaghetti. The noodles were great and the meat sauce had great consistency. Buddy V's is very approachable and a solid choice for classic Italian cuisine. I will be coming back.

Made a reservation through Open Table for my birthday. We arrived right on time and were immediately seated at our table. We were immediately given ice water which was much needed in Vegas! 

My husband ordered the Sunday Gravy and I had the Agnolotti which was a ravioli filled with a mixture of beef, pork and veal covered in a sage brown butter sauce. We also shares the garlic bread which we didn't really need because they bring you this delicious focattia bread fresh from the oven. During our meal the manager came by and chatted with us for quite a while about restaurants in Chicago he and my husband has both visited. He let us know that what I ordered was the best dish on the menu. 

We could have easily shares the Sunday Gravy between the 2 of us because we were so stuffed we had to order dessert to go! Bit the cannoli was delicious in our hotel room a few hours later!

As with most great places in Vegas it helps to make a reservation so you don't have to wait. And I will absolutely bring my family next time we are in town!

Went for the Brunch Buffet, I chose the unlimited beverage add-on. Food fresh and delicious (Mac-n-cheese carbonara & cannolis were my faves) mimosas were great & Thanks to the attentiveness of Graciela, well replenished!! She made the experience just so awesome along with the natural daylight beaming in & the cool wisk chandeliers & rolling pin decor! She was very friendly & inviting considering they were kind of busy..! She should be recognized!!

Great place.  Our server was very nice and the busgirl was nice as well.  They were very attentive, no attitude and the food was good and came out quick (they were very busy too) I had the calamari which tasted very fresh, meatballs and parmesan chicken .  Most servers here in vegas are consistently nice compared to our area(md) .
Lisa's warm nutella cake is exceptional and so are the people who work here. Emily was super sweet and made my day.

Excellent! Service was great, very friendly and entertaining. Good wine list, reasonably prices- menu with good variety of classic Italian meals- we had the octopus with fingerling potatoes- very good, tender with orange, rather than the usual lemon
  Also had the caprese salad with small tomatoes and fresh mozzarella-very good 
  Chicken Marsala was excellent, with side if pasta, lasagna was incredible, a veritable brick if meats and cheeses! Plop, you will jot leave hungry
  Ended the meal with lobster tail, split ingest 4 people- very good with its flakey crust and creamy goodness

Overall, great meal, reasonably priced - would definitely return

What do the macaroni grill, bucca di beppo and Buddy V have in common? More than you would think.

 We had the lasagna and chicken marsala, both were fine, but very ordinary. If you gave me these dishes from any of those 3 restaurants I don't think I could tell the difference. That doesn't mean the food is bad, but Buddy V advertises and charges like it's something more.  

On a side note the lasagna was a massive block of melted cheese, it was very heavy. Again not a bad thing if you love cheese.

Wow! What a gorgeous, cozy restaurant with beautiful views of the Las Vegas Strip! I absolutely ADORED the decor, from the lighting fixtures to the brick walls displaying real photos of Buddy Valasco's family, to the STUNNING open-air kitchen!! I just felt HAPPY being in engulfed in the ambiance of this restaurant! 

The staff was so friendly and the food was classic, comfort and delicious. (don't miss that salumi/cheese board! YUMMMMMM)

This will be the next place that I plan a big get-together because it is PERFECT for large parties. Can't say it enough... I LOVE it!!!!!!

This was our second stop at Buddy V's while visiting Vegas.  First you can't beat the location if you are a shopper.  The restaurant is located in the Canal Shoppes which is one of our favorite haunts while visiting.

What always blows me away is the line across from the restaurant for his bakery, it usually is formed at least halfway down the corridor.  All I can say is the bakery must be delish....but I digress.

We only had to wait 10 minutes for a table at lunch which you can sit in the bar or wait in the corridor.  We were seated in the bar area.  The best way to describe the vibe here is casual chic.  The restaurant feels very open yet has a Brooklyn restaurant feel to it.  Servers are dressed casually and make you feel very comfortable.

I would have liked the server to be a little more friendly...don't get me wrong she was very efficient...just didn't seem happy to be there.  However she gave us great service and everyone has those days so it did not take away from the experience.

I had the eggplant parmesan  which was HUGE and delicious.  No way I could eat it all or even half of it...but I sure did enjoy trying.  Hubby had the spaghetti and loved it.  The cheese garlic bread is like an entree on its own...perfectly toasted with yummy gooey cheese.We both enjoyed the menu as all of the entrees have special ties to the owner like My Wife's Eggplant Parmesan or Lisa V's Linguine, this just gives you the feeling of being in an Italian grandmas kitchen.

Hubby ordered a Buddy V's lobster tail for dessert and I can tell you they look just like they do on his tv show...big and stuffed full of tasty goodness.  I only had a bite as i was still trying to tackle the eggplant parm but it was magnificent.

This is definitely going to become a lunch tradition when we are in Vegas.  Great food at reasonable prices

My boyfriend and I went to this restaurant for our 6 year anniversary on Friday 9-11-15, he had made a reservation with a special request for desert as a surprise to me! I have been wanting to come to this place for some time as I'm a huge fan of Buddy!! 

We show up and get seated very quickly it was about 8:45-9:00pm we are sitting for five minutes when a biased comes to the table and asks us if we would like some water...sure he brings us water...we've never been here before so we are taking our time with the menu and decide to order mozzarella as an appetizer when our server finally arrived at our table we had already drank our glass of water it was a good 15 minutes after we sat down...unacceptable if you ask me! I don't know his name cause he talked so fast and was trying really hard with what seemed like a fake accent to be "cool" and laughed at himself....we told him we've never been here and that we would like to order the mozzarella...he then said are you ready to put on your Order for dinner...I said could I have a few minutes he then proceeded to say that I wanted the Veil Parmesan without giving me time to look uhh ok I guess I'll have that since you are in such a rush for me to order when you haven't even put in my appetizer...my boyfriend ordered lasagna...
I never saw my server again...well not willingly anyways...I had to flag him down for more water...the buss men were passing out cheese bread and vinegar and oil to every table that was there...except us not once were we offered anything nor where my drinks refilled without having to ask!! I wanted to order a soda and nope didn't even get to do that!!!
Our appetizer came was different and so yummy!!! Server never came to see how we where....our food came no server nothing...what if I didn't like my food...oh but I had to flag a biased down again for more water even though they have walked by my table 100 times and I know they seen my water empty!!!
So on with it...I had to yell for my server who had been ignoring us after I've asked for him 3 times by a bus man he came I said may I please have a box...10 min later my box arrived...he asked if we wanted desert I said may I see a menu!!(been wanting Buddy's lobster take for years almost went to New Jersey just to try one!!) then my boyfriend asks for a manager cause the special request he set up was to have a lobster tail desert show up to the table as a surprise with writing on the plate saying happy anniversary....my boyfriend was so upset that they ruined the surprised when he talked to the manager he kind of still felt like it was no big deal!! A new server delivered our desert and the comped it(didn't asked them to nor did we want them to) 

At the end of everything the SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE! I have been in customer service my whole life never would I treat someone the way we were treated!! We felt abandoned when the people around us where being well taken care of!!!

I give a HUGE SHOUT OUT TO THE KITCHEN THOUGH!! FOOD WAS AMAZING!!! I don't eat leftovers never have my whole life but I did eat the left overs for dinner Saturday!! That says something!!

Just disappointing about the service kind of heartbroken cause j was so excited to finally be going to BUDDY V's
Came here for dinner. The Bucatini is the best Ive ever had! Could eat it again and again.

Best Italian food I've had in Vegas hands down. We were seated promptly after arriving for our reservation. Hostess was very nice and friendly. All the food came out pretty fast for as busy as they were. The server was pretty short and blunt but he never let our drinks run dry and came by to check on us pretty consistently I would recommend this to anyone coming to Vegas that's likes Italian food. Just make sure you call ahead and make a reservation a day or two in advance

A friend who also travels often to Las Vegas asked me to do one thing on this visit...and that was visit Buddy V's and just sit at the bar for minimum one drink.

Everything she said about the bar was accurate: Comfortable, great view of The Strip and really friendly employees.

Honestly, it was not easy to find this place and I know my way around The Venetian as a longtime fan of Grand Lux Cafe and that casino floor where I once played blackjack with 90210 hottie Lindsay Price.

My bartender at Buddy V's was a tremendously nice guy named Mike and he poured me a strong vodka cocktail.

The entire place just smelled too good to not at least look at the menu while sipping so Mike steered me right in a modest order of Grandma's Meatballs with some delicious bread that was exactly the right amount of food.

This simply was not your typical Vegas bar or restaurant experience...and that's why I will be back on my next visit.

Oh, and the place has some nice windows that overlook The Strip and a few tables are right against these windows if you want to just eat, drink and take it all in.

Buddy V's wasn't too loud, wasn't too snobby, wasn't too busy and wasn't too expensive either.

Maybe the fact that it is not easy to find is a good thing for those of us who already know about it.
Had a birthday dinner here and the staff was amazing.  The night we went there was a live performer there and he was great! The food, price, portions, and staff were all fantastic!

We made this reservation on New Years Eve, not knowing what to expect from a restaurant on the strip. Our experience in one word, AWESOME! From the exceptional service, to appetizer (meat and cheese board amazing), to entree (Lasagna is a no brained yummy) and finally dessert (Italian wedding cake, never had this before...soooo good) Buddy V's hit a home run. Thank you for making the start of 2018 very delicious!

Went to this restaurant for my Wife's Birthday. It was "FANTASTIC" the service was awesome and the dishes that we ordered were delicious. It was impressive!!!  The only thing missing was not being able to meet Buddy in person and having the staff sing happy birthday.. I love his TV show Cake Boss and I'm a big fan.

Hopefully next time we can meet him.

This is the place to go for Italian! I made a reservation online so we didn't have to wait for a table.  I would advise doing that if possible as it is a very busy place! 

The wait staff is incredible! There is the main waiter and then they have another waiter working for the main waiter.  Setting tables, refilling drinks, bringing bread, etc.  It was a very unique concept that I had never seen before.  It made things run so smoothly. 

They start you off with some amazing complementary focaccia bread. It is seasoned with some Italian seasonings and cheese. It was piping hot when delivered to us in a very cute basket.  I ordered Nonna's lasagna AL forno. The waiter asked if I was ready for the most incredible lasagna I've ever eaten?! To be honest I was kind of thinking "ya right."  well...  He was right! It really was the best lasagna I've ever had! The presentation was great as well.  It came in a cute little cast iron skillet. We also ordered the garlic cheese bread.  It was good but I honestly liked the focaccia bread better! 

You will not be disappointed coming here. The relaxed family atmosphere was very nice! There were pictures of buddy's family on the walls which made it feel like home.  Can not wait to come back here!

The cheese ravioli is wonderful! The spaghetti was also great. But the desserts!!! OMG! The cannoli was delicious , and the cheesecake too! Wait staff could not have been nicer or any better. Would definitely recommend!
The Nutella chocolate cake and the salted caramel ice cream were to die for! Everything was amazing and we'll definitely be back again

I didn't know Cake Boss had a restaurant here and I actually found it through Instagram. My friend and I came on Saturday and we sat at the bar since it was happy hour. We ordered the sausage and pepper sliders, mac n cheese and Italian birthday cake. And we were very pleased with our order. The sliders tasted like what you would expect typical sausage and peppers, but tasty. Mac n cheese had chicken and veggies, which is more like a entree versus what most Americans think of it being a side dish.  Service was standard and considering we sat at the bar I've never had a bartender treat me poorly, but I must admit she was kind of awkward towards us. Lastly, the Italian birthday cake was really moist, but not dippy. I can't wait to come here again and try the Chicken Parmigiana, a customer next to us ordered this and it looked delicious. I highly recommend Buddy V's to anyone especially if you're at Venetian already.

The dining experience was great.  They accommodated our party of 8 with no reservation, the wait was minimal, and the food was good.  
But, they added a $29 branzino to the bill that we didn't order.  When I inquired about the mystery dish to the manager, she could only bring the waitress to apologize and say sorry.  Is this normal practice??  
Restaurant policy is to simply add an entree to any large party and hope they will just sign and leave?
Very shady.
Be sure to double check your receipt!!!!!!

Good Italian food with a fun, casual atmosphere.

When we are in town we love to go to Buddy V's.

I would honestly give this 10 stars if I could.

I was craving lemon chicken and saw on the menu they had chicken paccata, which is close enough if I modify it. So my husband and I walked from our hotel over to Buddy Vs without having a reservation. When I first saw the place, and how large it was, I kind of thought this might be just a so-so place, maybe closer to fast food than I had hoped. But it absolutely was not fast food. It was lovely.

Upon being seated, our waiter (Peter) immediately came over to inquire about drinks. When I went to order, my picky self literally needed to modify everything (sorry, chef). Instead of a salad, I asked if I could have just tomatoes and cucumbers with a little lemon. For the chicken piccata, I asked for it without the capers and without any garnish. Sweet Peter says, "oh, so you basically want lemon chicken?"  Be still my beating heart. Yes. My cucumbers and tomatoes (at least 3 different varieties) came out quickly and were fresh and delicious. My lemon chicken came out exactly as I wanted it.

From the person filling the water, to the person bringing bread to the table, to the person delivering the food, and - of course - Peter, the service was way beyond our expectations. Not once was I made to feel that my modifying the food was a problem, which is huge to a picky eater like myself. Everyone was genuinely nice, enough so that we went out of our way to find the manager before we left to let them know how happy we were.

If I am in Las Vegas again, I will definitely visit this restaurant and will specifically ask to sit in Peter's section. I hope he knows he can never, ever quit.  :)

Great Food. Great Decor. Great Service. Started with a glass of Merlot and the eggplant parmesan appetizer. A crispy tower of eggplant with a golden brown exterior coated with piping hot cheese. Definitely a winner. The shrimp scampi was a delicious main course with a healthy amount of shrimp in a nest of linguine, roasted garlic, spinach, tomato and white wine. For dessert we enjoyed the Nutella cake with salted caramel ice cream. I'm not usually one for dessert but how could I pass up salted caramel ice cream!? All things considered it was a great experience and I'd certainly dine there again.

5 Stars for Food. 2 Stars for Service.

The food was absolutely delicious!

From the reviews I expected it to be really good but it was excellent. My husband who isn't a big "food" person, was actually quite giddy. I got a Caesar Salad and Chicken Parmesan. The Chicken Parmesan and the Spaghetti it came with, was the best I have ever had. My husband had the Panzanella Salad and Orecchiette Pasta. He said both were amazing. We also shared the Warm Nutella Cake. It was magical. 

I could tell that they took great pride in the way the food was made.

The service was really spotty. Maybe it's because they just opened. But the food was so good it all worked out.

Went to Vegas for a bachelorette celebration and we planned to have a nicer dinner on the last day of our stay. Everyone loves Italian, right?! Right! 
Buddy V's is located inside the Palazzo and on one side is the restaurant and on the other side is the cake shop. We had reservations for 7pm on a Sunday night (on Memorial day weekend) and we still had to wait a pretty long time to be seated. So much for a reservation, but that's not too huge of a deal I guess. I was just getting tired standing in my heels lol. 
Aesthetically, this plays feels very home-y, which I liked. There were photos of Buddy and his family members incorporated into the dessert menu (it was really cute), and there were photos all around the restaurant--makes you just feel good inside when you know that this is a longtime family tradition! 

We were seated and a few minutes passed before we met our server. He introduced the idea that we could order family style or we could just order individual plates. Although ordering family style would probably be a more economical option, it was just too much fuss to do with a group of 8 girls. A lot of us (including myself) ended up getting the chicken parm, and a few others ordered a pasta dish (the one with the vodka sauce, I forgot the  name). ALL OF THE FOOD WAS SO DELICIOUS. WOW. Even the appetizers and bread that we got was finger-licking good. JUST LET THE CARBS WIN. GET THE FOCCACIA BREAD APPETIZER TOO. You'll thank me later... 

Although we didn't need the server too much, he was nowhere to be found, never really checked up on us, so service gets a ding. 
The price point was really reasonable given the enormous portions we got (chicken parm dish gives you 2 large breast cutlets; this is easily shareable). We had tons of leftovers that we happily ate after a long night of dancing. 

The only reason this review gets 4 stars is because the service. It was just lacking. But everything else, just superb! Superb food, superb pricing, portions, value, etc. I try not to eat that many carbs, but when in Vegas, carb it up. And come here to do it. Pasta and bread all day BRO! ha.

Don't waste your time and money going to Buddy V's for Happy Hour.  We were seated outside the restaurant in the walkway and the seats had wood slates that were uncomfortable. We tried 6 dishes that were basically fast junk food with little flavor.

Our waitress was hap hazard with her service forgetting twice to fetch a glass for a bottled drink and only bringing 5 of the 6 appetizers with the 6th one arriving about 15 minutes later.

Afterwards we walked across to Carlos bakery and there was not one item that looked spectacular.  Food was grossly overpriced even in comparison to other Strip bakeries by 30%.

Ótima opção de comida Italiana no Venatian em Las Vegas. Fomos muito bem atendidos e a comida estava muito gostosa. Pedimos de entrada anéis de lula frito e os mesmos estavam perfeitos, de entrada eu pedi o sea bass, muito bem feito e com sabor leve, meu parceiro pediu às vieiras e tive a oportunidade de experimentar, estavam deliciosas.

This is 2nd time we came back for Chilean Seabass (only in October).  I am not a fan of fish but this fish is the bomb!!! Simple cookingn with garlic but perfect combination with salad.  Defenitly need to try if you have a cahnce.

Great Italian restaurant in a sea of Italian restaurants at the blue canal shoppes. My wife had the half chicken and she very much enjoyed it. I was craving spaghetti and meatballs and I really enjoyed my meal. I will admit we did get two very basic dishes but I've been to a lot of places where they mess up meatballs and this place did it right. We also got calamari for an appetizer and as a connoisseur of calamari I can tell u that Buddy Vs is top notch they have a very good sauce they serve it with. Now the best part. The bread. Their bread might be the best bread I've ever had at an Italian restaurant. My issue was that they didn't give enough.

Was disappointed with the food and service, all I can say about this place is OK.... 
I had the chicken parmigiana, it was good, but the sauce was very acidic, way too strong for me, I had asked the server prior to ordering and she said it was very mild.
My friend had the carbonara, she said it was average.
Our other friend had the scallops and she liked it.

I couldn't leave Vegas or the Venetian without having some Italian food and I especially wanted to try Buddy V's. We only had time to run by for happy hour but I'm glad we did. I grabbed a glass of house red - not my fav but okay. I ordered the meatball small plate and the Mac n cheese small plate for my husband and I to share. The food was delicious. I really wanted to try the chicken parm but I wanted to stick to a small plate. Hm add a chicken parm slider!!!  So the happy hour menu has $4 drinks and $5 small plates. I will post a photo. The weird thing was that you could only get happy hour pricing if you say in certain spots of the bar. I laughed at the hostess. I have never been to a place that excludes certain bar seating. So if you want happy hour pricing - sit at the bar or the high tops. The low tables and other options are excluded

The food here was good, but wasn't anything to rave about.

We started with the fried calamari.  It was served with banana peppers, which I love.  The calamari itself was tender and not rubbery.

We both went for the chicken parmesan.  My husband loved it, I thought it was just average.  I wasn't in love with the flavor of the sauce, so had to doctor it up with red pepper flakes and parmesan.

The service was not that great.  Our waitress was pleasant, but never came around.

You can get a decent meal here, but for the price, you will not be blown away.

Usually we find with celebrity places that the impression outweighs the quality of what we anticipate we are going to have. 
Such is not the case with Buddy V. The food was amazing from grands meatballs to egg frittata and red velvet cake. We went for brunch and between both of us tasted all we could with no complaints at all.
The service was great and everything tasted homemade from family recipes. We didn't eat again the rest of the day and there was something for everyone (except fish) since its Italian.
I do have a suggestion though:
If you are eating at Buddy's how about providing a menu for the pastry shop across the way and having those to go orders ready and waiting. Having to wait in line shouldn't be something you have to do if you have already splurged on the meal.
Pricey but worth it. Reservations recommended'
