We went to Buddy V's on opening night. Our server was a little nervous but did a good job. Buddy and his family were in the restaurant and were very friendly. I had Caesar salad which featured freshly made croutons that were crunchy on the outside and creamy inside. For a main course I had the chicken parm it was nicely breaded still crunchy just enough sauce and small side of spaghetti. For dessert 3 of us shared the lobster tail and Nutella cake. The lobster tail pastry was a little tough but the filling was great the Nutella cake was amazing. The decor was very welcoming like grandmas house and whimsical with bakery influenced designs.

I went to Buddy's for the first time last week and I was very impressed! My mom and I shared Buddy's Favorite Pizza I believe was the name. And I actually think I fell in love. Everything about it was amazing. We actually shared with the random group next to us. The atmosphere is great! There is a fantastic view of the Strip. You can watch the cooks make meals which is fun for the kids! The service was also very good! The Assistant General Manager Adam was as nice as can be. The only problem is there isn't a Buddy's where I live!

Not a bad experience, but definitely didn't meet my expectations. I'm a Cake Boss fanatic and have stood in line for hours to get in to Carlos Bakery in Hoboken when it was the only location, so Buddy V's was a no brainer. 

A long line outside the bakery across the hallway, but no wait for the restaurant, possibly just because it was FILLED with exhaust/smoke. They assured us it was not normally that way and let us pick our table in the least-smoky area of the restaurant, which overall got better as we went. Not sure what the issue was.

The octopus salad was super small, so I was glad I wasn't that hungry. More so, the octopus smelled like tuna in a can. I've never had octopus that smelled bad, and almost didn't eat it, but took a chance. The special Cake Boss dessert cocktail was strong, gross, and the red velvet crumbs on top weren't even red. 

There are two cakes on the dessert menu, and we got both. The chocolate cake was underwhelming, but the Italian Birthday Cake.... oh my gosh amazing. Is this really what Italian Birthday Cake is like? We have been DOING. IT. WRONG. Chocolate ganache filling AND cannoli filling, covered with mounds of fresh whipped cream, sliced almonds. Definitely Top 5-10 desserts of my life.

Our waiter Charlie was very nice, but he was overbooked it seemed as it took 12 minutes for someone to take our drink order, and we often waited and waited just to have someone walk by so we could grab their attention. I also asked him 3 separate times to bring the check before he did. 

It all felt extremely, extremely overpriced, too. $100 for 2 entrees, a cocktail, and 2 desserts, that mostly were not very good? Meh. 

Pro-tip to you people standing in line at the bakery: if the dessert you're planning on ordering there is on the Buddy V's restaurant dessert menu... why are you waiting? Order it here. (But skip the food.)

Asked for side salad with dressing on the side. Got a side salad with dressing mixed in. 
Ordered a meatball sub, the bread was so stale that I wasn't able to bite through it. I told the waitress she gave me a sad look but didn't respond, didn't offer to replace or partial refund. 
Disappointing. 
Atmosphere was decent thats why this place gets 2/5 stars.

I wanted to just check out Carlo's and didn't know Buddy's was here.  I was so tired from travel and we were staying at the venetian anyway that we just came here.  My wife got the spaghetti and meatballs and I got the Sunday Gravy, which includes Lamb, meatballs, sausage, and pork, and pasta all for $26.  We also got the Cesar Salad which they told us was too big for one person and gave it to us on separate plates to share :) .   I've never had croutons like the ones they served.  Had I known they tasted that good I would have asked for extras.  There was so much food we didn't have room for desert.  We will have to stop by Carlo's in the morning and pick up a few for our road trip to the grand canyon.

We just finished doing some engagement photos at Venetian, and decided we wanted to try some Italian nearby. Buddy V's had good reviews, so why not?

On one hand, we were incredibly impressed with the quality of the food. We're accustomed to plain-jane low-budget Italian restaurants (that many people scoff at even calling Italian) like Olive Garden. Buddy V's was accommodating and everything we tried was exquisite. They even made a custom Alfredo sauce for me that they don't have on their current menu.

I had the eggplant parmesan with added Alfredo, as well as the cheesy garlic bread and a caesar salad. The eggplant was perfectly crispy on the outside and juicy and full on the inside. And the Alfredo was to die for, especially since I had been craving it so bad. And their caesar salad had croutons made of polenta! Definitely never had that before! It reminded us of tofu at first, but we knew it couldn't be. So good!
The fiancé also was in love with his lasagna but had devoured way too much bread for sure beforehand, and whined that he couldn't finish the size. Haha. 

The downsides of this place is that it was busy, so we ended up having to ask for our own complimentary bread and balsamic/olive oil dip that only about half the restaurant was getting. Also we got sat next to this horrendous couple that were so weird and probably bored with their lives that they sat there discussing and making fun of us like we wouldn't be able to see and hear them. Not really Buddy V's fault, but it dampened my experience.

If I'm remembering right,  they have 7-days-a-week happy hour. That's always a plus for any restaurant!

We were pleasantly surprised by Buddy V's. I had a fantastic Caesar salad with warm polenta cubes and Veal Marsala that was delicious. I'd say that the prices were in line with a standard Vegas restaurant. We sat in the bar area by the HUGE windows which gave us a great view of the strip. If you're in the area and want some Italian food, it's worth your time to check Buddy V's out.

The food was just ok. We expected a lot more for the price and hype. 

Only thing that really stood out was the appetizers: meatballs and tomato soup. Very fresh and well seasons. But it's $13 for 3 meatballs so I would really not expect anything short of amazing at that price point. 

As for the pasta, nothing exciting about the flavors or presentation. The ravioli dish looked messy and rushed. Reminds me of Chef Boyardee canned raviolis (except bigger) that when you microwave them the sauce splatters everywhere on the plate. 

As for dessert, we shared a cannoli. That was good but seemed a bit soft on the shell. Not sure if it was pre-made so it was starting to get soggy or just a softer shell recipe but not the crunchy cannoli I was expecting. 

We live close to Vegas and go every few months. We will probably not got go here again. I prefer Gordon Ramsay's Fish and Chips, and so does my debit card.

We came for dinner before seeing Human Nature.  I didn't watch the Cake Boss show but I knew about it and wanted to try the restaurant.  We were early and they were still serving lunch so we ordered an appetizer so we could order off the dinner menu.

We got an order of Nina's mozzarella en carozza.  It was like having a toasted cheese sandwich with mozzarella cheese with some tasty marinara.  It was very good.  We shared the order and each had two wedges.

For our mains, my wife ordered  Nonna's lasagna.  It came with beef, pork, sausage, and four kinds of cheese and it was huge.  We could have split this between the two of us had we known how large it would be.  It probably weighed a pound at the very least and it was very good.  We brought 2/3 of it home and have it frozen for a meal for the two of us.

I got the Sunday Gravy.  How could I not go with his signature dish.  It's meatballs, sausage, lamb, and pork simmered in a Sunday gravy and served with a bowl of rigatoni.  The rigatoni was a sensible serving size, but when you added all the meat, this also was a dish that could have been shared.  This dish is worth the praise it gets from reviewers.  The Sunday gravy is excellent and the meat is so tender from the hours of cooking in the gravy!  Saving room for dessert, we opted to have part of this boxed also.

For dessert, we wanted something small and went with our server's recommendation of the Nutella Cake, cake with a warm Nutella center, chocolate sauce, some praline crunch, and served with salted caramel ice cream.  It was delicious and perfect to share at the end of the meal.

Our server, Graciela, was a gem.  She was around often to check on us.  The bus people refilled iced tea glasses quickly,  Service was very good!  The only drawback was the large Palazzo sign along the Boulevard which was at the level of the windows and was extraordinarily bright.  They have a shade which was partially lowered but it should have been lowered more or we should have changed our seating position at the table so our backs were toward the sign.

A very pleasant evening in a really good restaurant!

Underwhelming brunch. Limited selection of dishes and desserts. Best part is the appetizer bar with very fresh green olives and thinly sliced cold meat. Small fresh carrots/veggie bar at the kids section were also quite refreshing. Friendly service but won't come back.

My husband and I came here for my birthday dinner on August 22nd and I can not express how wonderful our meal and service was. The food was so delicious as well as the dessert. Our server Peter was so kind, helpful, knowledgeable of the menu and provided excellent recommendations. The manager Emily was so sweet and made us feel so welcomed! Over all it was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had. They truly made us feel so special. I can't wait to go back. Thank you Peter, Emily and the whole team at Buddy V's

The meatball sliders and sausage sliders were very tasty. The bread on the sliders  melted in your mouth... The Nutella Cake was great, especially with the ice cream it came with. The manager Shawn, was so nice and  professional and made sure we had good service. He gave us a complimentary dessert because they were short staffed.

The food was good. The service was ok. We had a group of 10 people eating for dinner. The waiter argued with us when we didn't order what he thought we should order, Including drinks. At the end of the meal he wouldn't separate our checks. He said that they couldn't do separate checks, but after We had to figure out each persons portion of payment he took everyone's cards. Made no sense. Would not recommend to a big group.

I had a reservation for 930 and the hostess was just crawling each time she took somebody to a table she was gone for at least 5 minutes.. I don't entirely blame her I would probably have a bad attitude if I was all by myself on a Friday night . The part that really mad me mad was that there were 2 managers just standing around doing nothing. When I asked one of the managers if he could help he said we had to wait for the the hostess and he couldn't help us. When we finally did get seated we were sat in the bar. That would of been fine but in the bar they had one waiter to take care of the entire bar area while the two managers sat and ate at the bar. The food took for ever and they even showed up with the wrong food for my mother and that took 15 minutes to get her food while we starred at are food till she got hers .the food was just alright and way over priced. I was disappointed
Spaghetti and meatballs are amazing, reminds me of my grandfathers cooking. The fresh warm bread melts in your mouth. Definitely a must try while in Las Vegas

brought my family for the Sunday brunch which we have enjoyed many times before. The food...still outstanding...the service...mediocre at best. the host actually made us choose at the hostess stand if my family wanted brunch or A La Carte before we sat. when i suggested we choose at the table.."No..I do it this way". Then the pay me no mind severs refilling all our drinks wrong takes away from the overall experience. Still, the best "East Coast"  Italian food in Vegas.
Awesome brunch buffet on Sunday. Great food and well worth the price. Came hungry and left full and happy. I would recommend it to anyone staying at The Venetian or Palazzo hotels.
Service is a little slow but the food is pretty good for the price; Bolognese was our favorite!

Really lovely restaurant -- once you find it!  We asked four employees and most looked puzzled!  We eventually got there and settled in for happy hour -- which lasts till 6:30 pm. Great deal -- $4 wine/proseco/sangria and $5 appetizers.  We enjoyed the calamari, meatballs, and mac n cheese (it was delicious).

Headed to the front desk at 6 pm for our dinner reservation and they assigned us a table right outside the open kitchen hub.  When I requested something quieter?  She walked me back to the bar area!  First I was a little annoyed -- why did I make a reservation if I'm still in the bar?  But turns out it was for the best, a quiet window table in the bar area with a view of the strip.  Perfect.  We were able to order another round of happy hour drinks and their pre-theater menu for $38 pp!

Opting for light choices, we had the tomato soup, salmon, and cannoli.  Salmon was cooked perfectly and the cannoli was a perfect ending.

Both servers in the bar were EXCELLENT, friendly, and attentive.

Sadly, our only disappointment was the quality of the happy hour drinks.  The chardonnay was very dry, which is great for some people, but the big issue was the sulfites in the wines.  Really didn't enjoy the chardonnay or the proseco.

Otherwise, lovely restaurant with good food and great service!

Holy hell. The food here is amazing. If you're here for the weekend, the brunch buffet is the best. As for weekdays, any entree is great although i always go with the steak. Their tomato soup is to die for and it's one of the best Italian restaurants I've been too.

Wow, not sure where to begin because there were so many amazing aspects to our buffet brunch! Part of the reason we decided to check out this spot was because of the amazing drink special. We were sold on the $14.95 for bottomless drinks, thinking that the food would be a run of the mill Vegas buffet. Our group of 9 ended up arriving pretty late to our reservation due to traffic and the navigation of the hotel. Our waiter, Charlie, couldn't have been more understanding and cool about it. When we ordered our drinks, we found out that with the special you could switch your drink at anytime. Because of that, our boy Charlie was generous with keeping a mixture of carafes on the table, and kept them flowing! Once we actually got started on the buffet.... Wow. Everything was DELICIOUS. I highly recommend the Mac and Cheese (it was on my plate every single time!)  Overall for the price of the buffet/drinks and the actual quality of the food, this place is a steal! I cannot wait to come back the next time I'm in Vegas. I also hope to have Charlie as a waiter again, because his helpful and sweet attitude really just enhanced the entire experience!

My husband and I ate here in late June 2017 in between lunch/dinner crowd. We were seated and our waiter was spot on (not hovering but available whenever needed). I had seen Eggplant Parm on the lunch menu but noted it was not on the "Sunset" menu (3-5pm) and our waiter responded he thought they could manage that but said he couldn't promise...but he delivered. OMG...it was DIVINE!!! It was the perfect balance of crispy eggplant on the outside and not too squishy on the inside. My husband got the Spaghetti Pomodoro - it was delicious. But, honestly, it was the Caesar Salad that was even more memorable. My husband took a bite of the "crouton" and told me I had to try it. Well, it was polenta squares that were deep-fried. WOW! It transformed the salad to something we had never experienced. Their Acai Mojito was great, too. Impressive and memorable!

Came in valentines day weekend for a 7:30 reservation. I was worried that they'd be slammed and food would take a while. Pleased to say that was NOT the case at all.
Our server and bus boy were very attentive, made great recommendations and took good care of us. 
We are Las Vegas locals that braced the traffic and tourists to come check this place out because we are big cake boss fans. It was well worth it! 
I think their Mac n cheese was my favorite. It's hard to tell. It was so good we couldn't help ourselves, SO FULL!

Came here with a group of 10, overall consensus was that we expected it to be better but glad that the prices weren't steep. 

I had the spaghetti and meatballs, the pasta was perfect consistency but the sauce was a bit runny and the meatballs nothing to write home about.

I was looking for a quiet place to do a web meeting during my trip and saw this place so I stopped in.  I took a seat on the couches in the bar area and quickly ordered an ice tea and some cannoli.  Once my meeting started, the server checked in on me quietly once or twice to refill my ice tea.  I didn't realize that he didn't know I was in my meeting already.  Oops.  Anyway, this was a nice place to sit and relax away from the crowds in the shops area.  The cannoli was a treat, which I enjoyed one and took the other back to my hotel for a late night snack.  I'll have to try Buddy V's place again so I can check out the whole menu next time.

Not gonna lie the cake boss annoys the crap out of me but we decided to try this restaurant for a few reasons: proximity to our hotel, cuisine, and price point. Well, everything was delicious and service was outstanding! Highly recommend for Italian comfort food (red sauce menu) that won't cost a fortune. Bartender was so nice and attentive, we decided to eat at the bar instead of wait for our table. Enjoyed this meal much more than the $$$$ dinner we had the night before.

I'm never entirely happy with my brunch choices in Vegas, possibly because we pay so much and my standards then are equally high. Buddy V's fulfilled my brunch expectations and was trully wonderful. Each bite was amazing! I will absolutely come back on our next visit. Don't leave Vegas without coming here, and specifically Sunday Brunch. Try everything!!

Our waiter was the best, funny and point. We were there around 8pm. Place was packed. Once waiter took our order it long to get our food. The food was ok. I ordered the Lasagne it was good. I had better.  Their portiions are big. I was not able to eat half of it. Also to heavy to have this late. I could not sleep.
The desserts were very good. I will for sure be back for the desserts.

The portions are large enough to share...which allows you to share and try more. The service was just fine. It wasn't the best meal I've ever had but fed not the worse... If your in the area stop by but I wouldn't make my way over here just for Buddy Vs

Cake Boss Restraunt? Really?!? Yes. Bunt cake tins and rolling pins decoration. Not bad. They even got a good Dogfish IPA on tap!! Yay!!!! 
Pasta aldente. Look. I'm not Italian but I consider this home cooking by any standard.  I had the veal. Good stuff. 
Pricey but you are in the canal shops (whatever).
Service great! I'll come back!

Let me start out by saying that if you come here without trying the calimari you are making a mistake.. In fact you will want to come hungry and order more than one because you may not want to share... I ordered the smashed meatball sandwich with parmigian fries.. This was a 10! Great flavor and healthy portion size. I haven't been this pleasantly surprised by a meal in a long time. 2 thumbs way up to buddy v's

Great ambiance, service and food. Meat and Cheese plate to start. Meatballs and chicken Parmesan to follow. Mac and cheese melts in your mouth. I only wish they had spoons so I could get every last drop off the plate. Family oriented for the afternoon and adult ready for the evening. Desert is steps away Carlo's Bake Shop. Our server (William aka Raspberry) was excellent. Worth the $.
This place is awesome! Great food, great prices. The chicken parm, will fill you up! Love the garlic bread!

Went here a couple times already. Perfect date spot. Great customer service! The food is just like my friends mother's cooking back in Jersey! The pasta was cooked perfectly. I wasn't surprised with the dessert but his bakery across the restaurant is a must try!!

Overall love this place! When I come to Vegas I have to come here to eat Grandma's Meatballs and Cannolis for desert. Great service. Is a little pricey but a good option is Happy Hour 4:30-6:30pm everyday in the bar and lounge.

Wow. We stopped in for some lunch here and our expectations were nothing short of exceeded. We ended up having a few appetizers. The eggplant and fried motz (not on menu)  and some ceaser salad. It was fresh and flavorful. Down to the croutons on the salad everything was crafted perfectly. We were gonna go grab dessert next door and the bakery and we're glad we didnt. Our enthusiastic server named Georgio recommended us to have the dessert there. They brought us the desert menu which was adorable like a photo album with family photos in it as well. They had what we would have gotten next door and served it garnished with extra cream and chocolate and even fresh fruit. This place is a must to stop in.

Went here last week with my girls and was blown away literally! They had a cute lil jazz band which was a unexpected surprise. They played right up until we got our main course so it was perfect timing. We split the caesar salad 3 ways and it was enough since we had the hot delicious focaccia bread with it. This is the best caesar salad I've ever had because of the warm polenta bites instead of croutons! Who knew a caesar salad could be exciting to eat?? I got the chicken rigatoni alla vodka sauce...OMG! sooo much flavor. I was full but kept eating it because it was soo good! Definitely have to come back to try the other dishes. One of the girls got the scallops which looked beautiful but wasn't too filling. The other one got the carbonara which she loved. The ambiance was perfect. Didnt have a long wait. Definitely a 5 star experience!

Muy buen servicio, llegamos sin reserva y nos dieron buena mesa con vista al strip. Los platos son demasiado grandes se podrían compartir para poder probar postres que es por lo que se conoce más a buddy y cómo está Carlos bakery allí enfrente puedes aprovechar.
En las paredes hay fotos de la familia sobre la historia de cómo comenzó la empresa familiar, muy buen toque
I got here at 9:15 after walking about 2 miles for them to tell me fully committed to reservations for the evening never coming back horrible management

Great service, customer service was excellent, the manager on duty was amazing she went above and beyond for our party of 10. 

We did wait over 20 mins but the manager and the server sure did make up it.

I took my husband to Buddy V's for his birthday and we LOVED IT! Great service. Their lasagna / raviolis / spaghetti were delicious and the garlic bread they brought was the BEST. Plus, afterwards we were able to walk across the way to Carlos' bakery for desserts.
This is one of the best Italian restaurants I have bet been too. From the moment we walked in, service was spectacular! They were so on it and sweet!! The food was amazing!!!! I mean to die for!!
Great food! Excellent service! The chicken parm was wonderful! The cannolis were awesome as always!

There are too many Italian restaurants on the strip or in the Venetian for that matter to waste your time here. Service was kinda crappy. I was severely underwhelmed by the lunch menu and felt like I was at universal studios at buca di beppo. Tourist trap. 3 stars because it wasnt bad and price was fine. Just not great and certainly not worth trying while in Vegas. Oh and the entrees are splitable despite their up sale attempts. Again think buca's
Enjoyed the lasagna and the chicken parm. I'm not a fan of canollis, but these were especially good. Also enjoyed the Italian bday cake dessert.

We had a 5:30 dinner reservation but had to wait to be seated.  Not sure why, because the place had lots of empty seats.  The service was good and the food excellent.  We ordered the shrimp scampi which was made with a tomato base sauce and caesar salad.  The croutons were very different...they were served arm with cheese filled inside of these huge croutons.  It was very delicious!!  The breadsticks in packages in a holder on the table were also delicious.  We wished we stayed for the lobster dessert, but we were too filled.   We will be back the next time we're in Vegas visiting.

The service was GREAT right from the start.  The host immediately had the authority after walking us to our table to honor a request to sit at table adjacent that was bring swept as this was a window view table.  No hesitation, she asked for a minute to have table swept and immediately prepared. 

The waiter and the support staff immediately started service even with a full house.  Great team work for service.  

Fresh bread and olive oil was nice.  The meatballs are worth it just to dip the bread.  Kid's spaghetti was high quality and nice with the meatballs to start.  Pasta perfectly cooked.  Caesar was large enough to share with 3 and a real Caesar dressing.  It was really good with unique croutons.  

The Brocalini was great.  But the lasagna was best and perfect.  The wines are appropriate and match nice.

Prices are very reasonable considering location and level of service. The service team was great and a joy.  They treated my daughter with respect and wasn't condescending despite her age, 6 years. 

I'm very dissappointed at myself for bypassing this place all my previous trips to Vegas.  This is now my go to place for Italian on the strip.  Very homey and tasty.  Really high quality and straight forward.  Nothing complex needed.

Great restraunt. Great place, The meals are huge! 

 I went there for my 33erd Birthday and was stuffed. The Granny meatballs were great. If you love meatballs you gotta try them on your visit. Also the calamari is a great dish as an appetizer very good. 

Chicken parm was a good dish too but if I go again I'm getting the lasagna..

Everything was perfect except it was extremely loud. And our souvenir glasses. 
We ordered the drinks in very nice souvenir glasses. We usually do this at all the tourist places that offer this. We thought our daughters would love them. They love watching the cake boss. Usually they will bring you a new glass wrapped up and you're set. 
When we got back from our trip we gave the boxes to our daughters and they opened them and here they were the glasses we drank out of and had beer residue and lemonade residue in it. How embarrassing. The beer one smelled so bad. I thought we were getting new glasses. They could have at least washed them. Good thing we gave them to our kids and not someone else. They were horribly dirty. 
Our Server was explaining the appetizers and I heard absolutely nothing he said. 
We were sat at a small table for two and I maybe said 5 words the whole time. Because it was too hard to carry on a conversation. 
It was our last night in Vegas and I wanted something romantic and memorable. 
When I think of Italian food I think romantic and intimate. 
It was not. That's the only thing I didn't enjoy. 

Food and drinks were amazing.

In Las Vegas for several days and headed to the strip looking for a dining establishment...just because we were in Las Vegas.  Now here is the problem for one that does not know Las Vegas...it can be very overwhelming by the selection of dining establishments and trying to walk to / find another option than those in the casio/hotel complex you are in, can be challenging given the distances involved.  We were in the Venetian and enjoyed walking along the Grand Canal.  And we ended up at Buddy V's and very glad we did.  Unfortunately it was a Friday night and there was a 90 minute wait for a table.  There was seating in the bar / lounge area and it shares the same dinner menu, so off we went.  

Ordered the $40 price fix menu which included an appy, entree, and dessert.  I selected the caesar salad, chicken parmesan and for dessert, the cannoli.  I will start with the good.  The chicken parmesan is good, really good...nicely breaded and covered with a nice tangy tomato sauce then melted cheese.  The cannoli was okay...very rich and a nice end to a dinner.  The portion size of both were quite large and one will not leave hungry.  Unfortunately there was no taste to the caesar salad dressing and the polenta croutons were simply awful...really terrible.  I had higher expectations for their caesar salad.

Our server was pleasant and attentive and the food was brought out fairly promptly after each course.

All in all, it was a positive food experience and happy to recommend Buddy V's...just not their caesar salad.

The food is phenomenal ! One of only 2 restaurant that I would recommend in Vegas. I ordered off the lunch express menu which gives you a 3 course meal for $22. I had the meatballs for an app. You get 3 in a small boat of gravy (pasta sauce ) And they were spot on east coast Italian meatballs. They use the holy trinity of meat which is hard to find on the west coast and the sauce can't be beat . This is the kind of sauce that makes me want to step up my game because it Puts my gravy to shame !! For the meal I ordered the bucatini carbonara - again it knocks your socks off. The pasta is cooked perfectly , pancetta is crispy and the sauce light and creamy.. Simple and elegant . For dessert I ordered the tiramisu which came in a 2 oz canning jar and 3 lady fingers .. What a divine way to end a perfect meal. As a side note my husband ordered the 3 course meal as well. He ate it before I could get a pic , and I didn't get to try anything he ordered except his dessert . So we will have to take his word for it when he says the tomato basil soup was fantastic , and his chicken Parmesan  was the best he's ever had . He stated that the chicken had a light breadcrumb coating (he hates when it's thick like some sort of chicken bird sweater )  and his side of spaghetti was cooked perfect and served with the same type of sauce as my meatballs . For his dessert he ordered the cannoli.. Oh holy cannoli was that amazing!! I ended up eating it for him as he is lactose intolerant .. A good wife would have explained that cannoli are stuffed with marscapone cheese ! But.... Here we are ..

Such a great restaurant! Great vibe, great food and even better people! The food was fresh and incredible! Especially the croutons! The wine selection is great. Service is great. And to top it off, we got to meet the Cake Boss himself.

I made reservations mid afternoon on Wednesday for our group of ten.  We were seated shortly after arriving and got sat next to a noisy group.  Our waiter was able to project his voice to go over some of his favorites on the menu.  We ended up ordering two orders of the salumi and cheese board.  I am allergic to fennel and was assured by the waiter that pasta dish I ordered was in the clear.  Several in the group ordered the  Sunday gravy and were in heaven.  The chicken Parmesan was also a hit (a dish I had on my first visit several months ago). One couple in the group ordered the  waiters favorite grandmas meatballs.  The bread and oil/vinegar was amazing as always.  The group was really impressed with the service we had.  Six of them had never been before.  They were very happy with our pick for dinner our first night in vegas!

Very good and wonderful service. I like the decor. I feels like you're in a home and the food is very filling. It is like a home cooked Italian meal. Great experience and good food. I would definitely recommend it.
Amazing food, amazing staff, worth every penny and not expensive.  Chicken Picatta is to die for!  Absolutely love this restaurant!

Wow, this place was excellent! Every single dish we ordered was superb!!! The pastas were perfectly portioned and flavorful. The portions were huge. And most importantly the customer service was excellent. 

I ordered the chicken parmesan. At first I was very hesitant because EVERYTIME I order chicken parmesan the chicken is dry and junk. However, I got the $40 special that comes with salad, an entree and a dessert... so out of the entree selections I chose the chicken parmesan and boy did i absolutely enjoy it!! The chicken breast was soooo tender and juicy. They put a nice amount of cheese on top too. I wish they gave a little more noodles, but that's okay. They give two chicken slices and each slice was huge. So good!!


I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who values food Italian food!

Like I said about the bakery, this place symbolizes overrated businesses glamorized by the media for no justifiable reason:

The spaghetti my sister ordered was extremely sour and the flavor was disgusting. One bite of it and my insides starting screaming. Mid-way through the meal, my sister needed to use the restroom.. for a while. 

My margherita pizza? Equivalent to the taste and thickness of a napkin. Zero flavor and toppings spread so thin, they must have evaporated upon baking.

After dinner, I left it to Lisa's Nutella Cake with Salted Caramel ice cream to save Buddy V's reputation. I mean, there's no way someone can mess those flavors up - the title alone is perfect. I was wrong. Overly sweet, dense, rich - one bite was too much (and must have contained at least 75g of sugar). The ice cream had nothing salted or caramel about it. I am a huge lover of desserts - and this made me so so sad.

Summary:
+long wait, pricey, not good - Why would you come here?

AFFORDABLE DELICIOUS BUFFET! We did the Sunday brunch Buffet the weekend after Thanksgiving (2015). This was one of the cheaper buffets in Vegas. Cheap in price ($34.95 per perosn), but not in quality that is. The food was delicious and there was such a good variety of Italian food, breakfast food, seafood, desserts & fruit. Not to mention, it wasn't your typically fruit you find in your local market. The garlic cheese bread was Heaven! The pasta dishes were great as well. The seafood was fresh and great quality. Honestly, I'm not a big fan on buffet's but this was a great way to try out several of the dishes at this restaurant. ALSO...The pianist really added to the ambiance of the place. We will definitely go back again.

Great food, great service. Enjoyed the bread & oil.  Strong drink menu.  Portions are good. White tablecloth place - though priced medium for the Vegas strip.  Hits that sweet spot, where a couple *can* dine for $60 + tax/ tip.  

Based upon strong portions, I highly recommend splitting with your dining companion (easier to do on romantic getaway than conference with "the work guys!")

On our visit in Dec., 2016, we split: calamari (good flavor), meatballs (yessir!) and chicken piccata.  This latter option had the most absolutely delicious pasta i have EVER HAD.  So much so, that despite the $7 addition, I asked the waiter for an extra side.  Huge mistake: by the time the kitchen made it, my tummy was starting to bloat.

But this is Vegas baby, so we still visited the bakery counter across the way!  One observation: they are really strict/ serious about the Happy Hour ONLY in the bar. As i recall, they were equally adamant that we would have to "move tables" to the main dining area (4 feet away) to order off the regular menu.  We didn't fuss with it.  You've been warned : - )

Would return !

Truly impressive restaurant with Strip view. 
I've been coming to Buddy Vs for a few years now. No weekend trip to Vegas has been complete for me without Sunday brunch here. Their Bruch buffet features high quality breakfast and lunch dishes, fresh premium fruits, cheese, Italian cold cuts and best of all: the desert bar. The service has always been good and the overall value is reasonable for a major resort Strip front restaurant. 
Today I came for regular lunch. We ordered the salami and cheese platter, spaghetti Bolognese and tiramisu. As always, the food was outstanding. The three cheeses and three meats were of the finest quality and paired with freshly open-fire grilled garlic butter feloni bread. The Bolognese, while a simple dish, has always been one of our favorites here, as they do it perfectly. Saving the best for last, the tiramisu by itself is worth coming here for (and it's served as part of the Sunday brunch buffet as well !!). I also loved their new coffee from Fonte, which is a perfect pair with the tiramisu. 
The weeks before Christmas are always slow, so we were able to get a table by the window with excellent Strip view. Danny did an outstanding job taking care of us and making this a truly enjoyable lunch at one of my favorite restaurants.

While in Las Vegas for Xmas we decided to check this spot out after checking their reviews which were great, We ordered several dishes and was very happy we made a reservation at this restaurant. Great food and great service. I enjoyed the Chicken Parm with a salad and a Shrimp pasta dish. Everything was excellent they had a buffet at the time we arrived but we opted out to order individual dishes instead. The restaurant has a great decor and the staff service was great.

Made dinner reservations before going to see the Fortunate Son in Concert.  The cheese bread is good, and I am not a big fan of cheese.  I ordered the linguini  and clam sauce and my wife got the spaghetti with meat balls. We topped it off with the Apple pie ala mode.

My boyfriend had some pasta that had chicken and a vodka sauce.  I desperately wished I had ordered that instead of the scallops.  The scallops I had were seared pretty nicely and had capers around them for some saltiness, but I kinda wished I had salt or something besides mashed potatos with them.  Mashed potatos and scallops kinda don't go together in my head.  Anyways, his food was so good I kept eating off his plate and he kept letting me because I'm his girlfriend so he has to...  The calamari was also okay.  Compared to Nora's it wasn't that great but if you aren't a spoiled brat then yeah, the calamari is Ok.  I also had the nutella cake with icecream and that was Ok too.  The icecream was raved about by my server last night, and he told me that it is the same icecream as Honeysalt.  I thought I had had it before!!!  I didn't care for the cake so much and just picked out the Nutella.  I don't know why I got that because I can have Nutella at home.  I should have gotten some different dessert.  I will know now for next time to get the pasta and get a different dessert.  That dang vodka sauce and pasta was SO good.

Always have heard about this place so my husband and i decided to check it out. Service was great...but the back waiter was right on. He pretty much took care of everything. My husband had thr shrimp scampi he said it was ok nothing to brag about. There was not much of a robust flavor to it and the pasta was very starchy as in they didnt rinse it very well. I had the Caprese salad and I have to admit that it was amazing. We also had the meatballs which were tasty. The garlic bread was ok but not fond of the cheese on it. The atmosphere was laid back which was nice. We sat in the bar area because there werent any seats available in the dining area.

So I give this place 3 stars because it wasnt amazing but it always wasnt that bad. Average i would say. Minus that Caprese salad that was amazing.

Was visiting Vegas & leaving on Sunday so I knew I couldn't do the brunch but I checked the facebook & saw they were doing the "Sunday Brunch" on Saturday now & was so excited! We had the best experience, from the amazing food to the wonderful service. The cannoli I see on TV were so worth it & the red velvet cake, wow! We are definitely making this a Vegas tradition!

I used to watch Cake Boss. While I haven't seen an episode in recent times, I recall not only being amazed by Buddy Valastro's cake designs, but wishing I could try some of those hearty Italian meals that he and his family would cook up as well. I finally had my chance to try both the sweet and savory while my husband and I vacationed in Las Vegas. 

Buddy V's restaurant and Carlo's Bakery are right across the way from each other inside The Venetian. The line for the bakery was a mile long, so we opted to have lunch and enjoy one of the desserts in the restaurant instead. I loved the feel of the place. It was cozy and warm with large windows to view the gorgeous strip. 

They serve warm focaccia bread with olive oil to start. It was so light and fluffy... We both asked for a second piece even though we promised each other we would save room for that dessert! They offer a prix fix lunch special for $22, which is what my husband ordered. You can choose from a few slightly smaller portions of appetizers or salads, entrees or pastas, and desserts. He went with the meatballs, chicken parmesan, and cannoli. I had the whole wheat penne primavera, which included all sorts of tasty grilled veggies. My husband split his cannoli with me... I really didn't give him a choice. :p It was stuffed with sweet ricotta and dipped in chocolate chips and pistachio. Not to diss my hometown of St. Louis, known for its Italian foods and restaurants, but this was the absolute best cannoli I've ever had in my life! 

My husband and I both left Buddy V's completely satisfied and determined that we would definitely return on our next trip. Thankfully, we visit Vegas often, so I shouldn't have to wait too long for another cannoli!

UPDATE: 

Last night in Las Vegas, for this trip. It was uncertain room service, Table Ten or????? Well I went back to Buddy's. Sat at the bad this time. Again the service (Danny) was stellar, the food was delicious and again, I ate too much and had no room for dessert. Gonna miss this place! 

Staying at the Palazzo we saw a show about the owner, his love for desserts. We checked it and thankful that we did. The restaurants pretty spacious but not a whole lot of tables yet we were able to get a reservation for two. Service was top-notch full bar there's enough there to please everybody. We ate so much from bread, salad to entree that it's a shame we didn't save room for desserts. What were we thinking! I feel like we got robbed by our own decision to eat it all because it was so good. 

Guess it means we have to go back! Great wine selection too!

Went twice during my stay in Vegas and I must say, Buddy V's has great service. 

It also has an awesome happy hour with their yummy calamari with fried green peppers coming in at $5. Such a steal especially for a place like this. The meatball sliders were yummy and I enjoyed the sauce of the mac n cheese but it was definitely more sauce than pasta.  Sangria was also delicious and affordable.

Next time I know not to come for dinner though. The pastas were just okay and I've definitely had better.

What a great happy hour menu! $4 drinks and $5 apps every night from 4:30-6:30. Really great service from friendly bartender named Tawny and cool live music playing Sinatra, Bennett, etc.

Can be comfortable in jeans or more dressy.  

You won't be disappointed. Check it out!

This is some quality, authentic Italian food on the Vegas strip. The service was semi snooty when it came to strollers and an extra chair at the table, but overall it was fine. Try to get a seat near the window it's a nice view of the Wynn water show area.

I am a big fan of the cake boss and when I found out that he opened a restaurant I was over the moon. Good parts the food and portions are excellent, the price is pretty comparable considering it is on the Vegas strip. Unfortunately the service was horrible!!!!! The server never paid attention to her tables. It took a lot to get refills on drinks, our check, and our change. She didn't even check our table to see if our meal was tasting ok. I will go back for the food, just hope they can fix the service.

In Vegas, never sure if you will be gouged by high prices and mediocre food and service. This place delivers high quality on all aspects. Food was delicious. Prices reasonable. But most of all ... The SERVICE. Wow!! Nailed it!  We dine out 3 times a week (let's face it, I have no business being in a kitchen) and this experience has been by far, one of our best. Georgio, out server ... Hats off to you. Thank you for providing is a welcoming and phenomenal dining experience. And Alex ... A busboy ... Another wow in our books!! Nicely done gentlemen!

We just got back from Las Vegas and I am still thinking of the meal I had at this restaurant.  We went for a birthday celebration so we made reservations.  I was skeptical because I am very critical of Italian food because I am married to an Italian.  I ordered the Sunday gravy with meatballs pork lamb and sausage.   The dish was fantastic.  Gravy was just as good as homemade sauces I have had.  I will definitely order again.  I probably will share with hubby because entrees are Hugh.  The waitress was accommodating and even allowed us to split the check.  I hope one opens up in Houston soon.
Saturday brunch was fantastic! Be sure to try sunday style eggs, veggie fritatta, and meatballs.

APPS: 
MAC AND CHEESE CARBONARA
MEATBALL

ENTREE:
VEAL CHOP PARMESAN

everything was amazing!! With all the different Italian restaurants and being this was the last dinner we had in vegas it was hard to choose but so glad we came here! Meatballs were scrumptious, carbonara was rich and decadent and the veal Parmesan was so tender and perfectly fried....veal chop was huge hubby and I shared the entree and it was perfect, and of course the pasta was perfect as well. Will def be back to eat here when we return to vegas.

If you like the Olive Garden and Buca Di Peppo then you'll love this place.  if your idea if a good Italian meal is something you'd get in a large northeastern city, you'll find this place very average
This has become one of our favorite places to eat when we are in Vegas,, service is great and the food has always been amazing. Highly highly recommend.

The pasta is fresh and  I love that.  The meatballs are flavorful and really do taste homemade, like mom used to make.  The cannoli for dessert, which my husband loves, tasted good to me too, even though I just had one bite.  I do not like cannoli but I sure liked theirs!  The service was horrible.  Absolutely positively horrible.  Nice people, don't get me wrong, but horrible service.  The "bread guy" needed to be told what to do in his job but why couldn't he remember on his own you fill up the water glasses and you keep offering the focaccia?  The waiter was sure to tell me that it was his helper's 19th birthday, but who cares?  Do your job and party later.  The floor manager with the dark black hair and who I believe was dressed too casually for this type of price point restaurant wasn't doing much of anything.  He barely looked up from his texting while showing a waitress what he was texting and laughing about to mumble "Good night.".  Help your waiters out man!  Be a team! I believe the waiters have too many tables to be able to give you the service you deserve for paying those "on the strip" prices.  My hubby did state his linguini with white clam sauce was not flavorful at all.  He ended up asking for a lot of cheese on top, which you have to wait for also since it is not on the table.  Don't be cheap Buddy, put the cheese on the table!

A dream come true after watching Carlo's Bakery on TV for years.  Service was good and food was amazing from the bread to the entree to dessert.  Had Madeline's Whole Wheat Penne and then Cannoli for dessert.  Just as good as I had hoped it would be.  Clever interior with rolling pins hanging and whisks on the light fixtures.  Family photo album in the dessert menu.  Great option for getting dessert since the bakery across the hall is always so busy.

!!!So good I tipped the Chef responsible for my Chicken Parm plate $20!!!
 It was the best spaghetti I've had. Not the typical American style spaghetti swimming in sauce. It was true Italian full flavored perfection. Service was very good and attentive as well.

Had chicken parmesan and it was amazing, big, thin, lightly breaded and juicy. We also had grandma's meatballs which were great as well.

I'm def coming back here next time im in vegas.

This is my favorite chicken parm in Vegas!

I think celebrity chefs restaurants get a bad rap on occasion just because a lot of Yelpers don't want to appear "trendy". Buddy V's, IMHO, could be named BLANK and have the crowds it does based on their food alone. As my Uncle used to say when he called us to the table at one of his BBQ's, "It's real good and there's lots of it!". Great service and views along with great Italian food gets 5 stars from me.

WHEN YOU GO- Reservations at night are a must! I recommend lunch and a window seat!

Our family had a great meal here last night. The only problem we had was the waiter pushing everything but what we were ordering, pushing us towards the more expensive items on the menu. Making us feel guilty for not ordering dessert. 

The food was amazing and filling,
Fique decepcionada que não era dia do buffet. Não sabia que era no domingo. Entrada gostosa. Prato principal pasta e lasanha muito gostosa. Ambiente vintage. Bom atendimento.

Brought my family in for my birthday dinner this past Sunday night. Great experience from service to food! The hostess was very friendly, our server was very educated on the menu items, the manager (Sean) stopped at our table and asked how everything was. All in all, we felt very well taken care of. My wife is also in the restaurant industry and she could tell that the managers pay very close attention to up keeping the service standards. Highly recommended for special occasions or just a great dinner out with the family!

Delicious food!!! I'm sorry I don't remember my waiters name but he was super nice and made great recommendations. The panzenella salad is a must try. Beautiful restaurant, amazing food and atmosphere. Can't wait to go back.

Spaghetti was the overwhelming choice at the table and it was worth it.  The sauce is not a strong tomato taste as most Italian restaurants, almost had a light cream added to it.  The meat was perfect.  A lot of crumbled beef on the sauasage.   Excellent.  

Would have been 5 stars with better service.  It seems to be a common theme in Vegas, mediocre service at the restaurants.  I think we asked for coffee 7-8 times before being served.  Just not very attentive and no sense of urgency.  

5 star food and 3 star service gets you 4 stars.

It was a wonderful experience overall, the service was great, the view was beautiful. The only thing I didn't like was that the menu was very limited and the food was kind of too salty, but overall it was not disgusting or anything just okay.
Great food . Friendly staff.  Second time here. Great desert... Yummy. Thank you Buddy V

Das Restaurant ist im Hotel Venetian gelegen. 
Wir sind dort spontan aufgetaucht und haben auch ohne Reservierung noch einen Platz bekommen. 

Allerdings nur im Bereich der Bar an einem kleinen Tisch für Zwei mitten im Raum. 
Etwas ungemütlich platziert. 

Die Geräuschkulisse ist extrem anstrengend. Man muss sich ziemlich laut unterhalten. Dabei ist es egal, wo man genau sitzt, da der ganze Laden einfach laut ist. Das wird auch nicht besser, wenn die Live-Musik aus Schlagzeug und Keyboard wieder anfängt zu spielen. An der Stilrichtung der Musik ist allerdings nichts auszusetzen. 

Wie zu erwarten ist das Essen typisch italienisch. Man kann sogar zwischen der uns bekannten Bolognese-Sauce und der Soße mit Meatballs wählen. 
Wir haben die erste Variante genommen. Die Nudel waren schön al dente und die Sauce sehr lecker abgeschmeckt und mit reichlich Fleisch. Portion war auch angemessen. 

Für den Preis muss man halt Vegas-Maßstäbe ansetzen, aber immer noch erträglich. 

Abzüge gebe ich aufgrund der Lautstärke. Nach dem ganzen Trubel am Tag wäre es schön beim Essen Abends mal etwas die Ohren entspannen zu können. 
Zu beachten ist auch, dass der Laden schon um 22 Uhr schließt. Wir haben gerade noch Glück gehabt, kamen aber auch schon in den Genuss des abendlichen Aufräumend um uns rum.

Not sure if we were unlucky or what but our service was poor most of the evening. Starting with taking others ahead of us at the beginning. Perhaps it was the fact we had kids and they wanted to segregate us. Everyone else got bread immediately but I had to ask because the kids were hungry. Waitress really seemed preoccupied. Food was OK but nothing special. Very overpriced but I expected that on the Strip. Overall not a great experience.

Stopped for a few drinks and appetizers. 

Service was good. We ordered 2 specialty drinks to try something new and they were great. Mine was the sweet tea vodka drink. Yum!  I wish I had the names. 

We had the garlic bread and meatballs and they hit the spot.  The meatballs were perfect. Very tasty and not dried out. 

Would go again.

Made a reservation here because it was close to the theater where we were seeing a show.

We showed up 30 minutes late and they accommodated us and sat us quickly anyway.  Awesome!  Further, told the busboy that we had a show to catch and could he please tell the server we had to move fast.  Within 2 minutes, server appears to take our order to ensure that we could make our show.  Excellent!

Food:  
Garlic Bread:  Good
Buddy's Caprese:  Very Good
Chicken Rigatoni "Alla Vodka" :  Very Good
Valastro Sunday Gravy:  I did not try, but my friend claims it was Excellent.  In fact, he insists I write this in here because he wants to encourage others to eat it.  (He insists that others dip the Garlic Bread into the "Gravy".)

We had a bottle of Chianti and it was very good, as well.

Great service, great food and would definitely go again.  So thankful, they were so accommodating to our tight schedule!
Food was so awesome we didn't have room to try any dessert! Get the panzanella...seriously so good. We also split lasagna and vodka rigatoni.   Wonderful and well priced for vegas!

Great Place to eat!!! Wifey had me try the garlic cheese bread.....OMG!!! was so Freaking GOOD!!! Highly recommend this place. Staff was great! Service exceptional! Ask for one of (Caleb's Tables). Food Amazing! I will keep coming back any time I am in Vegas.

Great service, delicious-- ridiculously good-- food. We ordered the fried mozzarella appetizer, grandma's meatballs, then chicken parm, and pasta a la vodka-- SO good. We were stuffed but took a cannoli and lobster claw to go-- more crazy deliciousness. Pomegranate martini a bit to syrupy, but no big deal since everything else was perfection. Great atmosphere too.

My husband and I enjoyed our last dinner in Vegas at Buddy V's. The service was excellent and we were seated right away with our reservation. The live music was also enjoyable. We split a Caesar salad and the croutons were warm and stuffed! I had the orchiette pasta and my husband had the chicken parm. Both entrees were big portions. I recommend getting a table next to the window so you can enjoy the view of the strip.

Buddy V's is a great place for Italian food!  We recently took my daughter, son and grandson there and all of them enjoyed it.  Lots to look at inside and we were kind of close to a window overlooking the strip.  My wife and I get the grandma's meatballs and the garlic bread.  And we were thoroughly satisfied.  The spaghetti my daughter got was very good also.  The only thing that was bizarre  was when our server asked to move the baby seat that was sitting on a chair, bothering no one, to the floor.  My son responded, "whatever is good for you..I guess."  Whatever.   Food was good so we overcame the weird request.

Was super excited to come here being a huge lover of Italian food and a Cake Boss fan.  We were seated relatively quickly in the "patio" area for their happy hour.  We started off with small bites right away, but our waiter never came back to take our freaking entree order.  We sat there patiently for half an hour after finishing our appetizers.  He specifically knew we were ordering more since we said we'll start off with the appetizers and asked to leave the menu since we were still ordering an entree.  While we were waiting for him to come back, the host grabbed the menu off our table and gave it to the table next to us, without even asking if we were done. We continued waiting and were so annoyed we didn't even order more food. So after 60 minutes of waiting for them to take our order, even though we told someone to grab out waiter so we could order earlier, we just asked for the check, which took another 30 minutes.  It's not like it was busy. Maybe 25% of the restaurant was full, and they had a separate person seating, a separate person taking order, another delivering the food, and another cleaning the tables and refilling water. Not to mention he was one of like 4 waiters, and the place isn't that big.  He charged us $16 for a medium beer, which is totally fine, but other waiter told us it should've only costed us $12, and then they said just kidding.  Seems kind of steep to go from $9-small and $16-medium. I'm a waiter so I'm pretty big on tipping.  Didn't bother to tip as the service was awful. I think our waiter's name was Danny or something. The host sucked too for grabbing our menu without asking, like dude, come on.  They were middle aged people so this was most likely their full time job since we went on a Thursday. You suck at your job guys.

Staying at the Venetian and craved Italian without breaking the bank. Found Buddy V's thanks to yelp! Never watched Cake Boss, so didn't know anything about the celebrity status of the chef. We didn't have reservations and tried to get a table around 6:45pm on a Saturday for 2 people. Apparently there was a private event so they couldn't seat us til after 9pm, but luckily there was a table at the bar, so we took that. The bar is a bit noisier than the restaurant, but totally worth it to not wait. Before 7pm, they have a 3 course menu  for $38 which includes an appetizer, entree, and dessert. 

Loved the moist and soft Grandma's Meatball appetizer. You only get 3 and they are half dollar sized. For my entree, I got the bolognese. Absolutely delicious and extreme chunky sauce. I also loved the fact that they were very generous w/the sauce so that I actually had plenty of sauce for my pasta! Even had some sauce left over to dip a piece of bread! Got the nutella dessert and thought that it was a tad sweet. Very decadent, but just a tad sweet.

I can't say enough about this restaurant!  Food is moderately/higher priced, but expected in a casino.  Italian food and steaks are awesome!  Drink menu is one of the best to enjoy new things!  One of the best dining experiences of my life!  We enjoyed with friends as a group of 4.  Top place and hidden gem in Sin city!

I came here for lunch with a Group. I ordered a margarita pizza and it was delicious. The pastas also looked amazing but I did not want something too heavy. The pasta sauce is well-made and the ingredients are fresh. The ambience isn't too fancy so if you're looking for a upscale Vegas dinner place this spot might not be it. It was however a great place to get in and out for lunch.

The food at this place is delicious. I can't say the same for the deserts though. Had the "Lobster Tail" and some cannolis. Baked/desert goods were  nothing special. Odd and funny as this is what Buddy is supposedly known for and yet the food was better than the bakery. Chicken Parm on point. Will be back for the food (ALONE) for sure; Next time I'm in Vegas.

Definitely not worth the hype. We got calamari for an appetizer which was really good. But as for our main dishes the food was okay nothing special. Definitely needs to have more flavor and spices. We got the cannoli for desert and it was awful. The service was attentive and friendly. Wouldn't come back though.

The Italian food is exactly as generic as you're thinking it may be. It's a noisy environment just like you're expecting it may be. Yes it's a tourist trap type of restaurant. Yes, your teen age daughter will love it.

Honestly all I do is really check in to pecs now a days but decided to write a review because the food and service was so good. Ordered prosseco, lemon chicken piccata (?), and an Italian birthday cake for dessert. I NEVER eat the pasta but it was so good. I'm crying at the workouts I'm going to have to do for this. Everything here is exactly what Buddy V would want it to feel like...family. The food is homey the service people the ambience I will come back!! Highly recommend :)

Great meal & great service. My friend & I shared the Caesar salad to start. Instead of regular croutons they were made out of polenta. The pomegranate martini was nice & tart, not sweet which it how I like them. I had the seared scallops w polenta & prosciutto. Melt in your mouth. My friend got the eggplant parm w appetizer with added meatballs & spaghetti. She enjoyed. We shared the Nutella molten cake w salted caramel ice cream. Great finish to the meal. I definitely would come back here!!
This place is the best Italian food every! Everything was great. I come from a Sicilian family straight off the boat.  Just like Nona's cooking.  Would give it 10 stars if I could

It was my third time in this place last Saturday so this review is long overdue (I have to go every time I'm in vegas) and again  it didn't disappoint the food is great it has this amazing home taste the place is so nice and the service is great any employee you talk too is soooo nice. I had ordered different things every time and every dish is better that the last one. And lets not forget the dessert I've got the Tiramisu every time and its the best dessert ever. I've also tried the chocolate cake and its amazing. So if you decide to go you won't be disappointed
Went to Buddy's for Saturday brunch and it was so delicious! There was such a wide variety of good food and the service was wonderful! Would definitely recommend to anyone heading to Las Vegas

Long review: First off let me start by saying this review is not about the food. The food is amazing. I've been coming here for 3 years in a row for my birthday and once for our anniversary and the food has not disappointed once. 
This is about their service. Like I stated I, with my family, having been here 3 years in a row and have received excellent service and food, until this last time in August. I originally called to reserve a table for 8 guests and a baby. I was later informed that one more person was to be added, so I called to see if I can get a bigger table. I was told I couldn't because it was a busy night for them, that maybe we could squeeze another chair, that was fine since it was for a kid. When we sat down there was so space for a car seat sling, my cousin's baby was on the floor behind her chair. The manager did not want to move us to a bigger table, which there were plenty of! The whole time we sat and ate and left there were bigger tables all around us! How is having a baby sitting in a car seat on the floor behind the chairs next to another table safe? We asked if this was a hazard or safe or a fire hazard and she kept saying no. We felt uncomfortable leaving him there (he was 2 months at the time) so my cousin had to hold him the whole time we dined. Then came time to pay. We could not do split. He la according to the waiter, the "computer" wouldn't let him. So we all wrote down our amounts and the card number on the back of the receipt. He then came back to say we were short. He was talking about the SUGGESTED gratuity. When then explained we would add gratuity when we signed the receipt. He said again that the "computer" would not let him because the total of the bill was the amount with the SUGGESTED gratuity includes. How is this even possible? My cousin tried arguing with him other wise but the waiter would not budge! He was determined to get his suggested gratuity. My cousin was getting rather upset so we budged and paid the total and walked away. Happy 30th to me! Sad to say that even though I LOVE the food here, this will no longer be my annual birthday dinner spot.

Had my second visit to this place this past weekend and I'm glad I made the choice to have dinner here on our last night in Vegas. 

The service was amazing. Everyone who came by the table was nice and friendly; there was a lot of personality and charm in the staff which made our time here fun! They were very attentive without being overbearing. 

Everyone loved their food. The chicken parm was a crowd favorite and I finished my shrimp scampi even though the button on my pants was about to pop off. 

Although I don't come to Vegas often because it's not my thing, I would come back here because I know the food and service will be memorable.
Einfach super! Für die Fleischbällchen würde ich alles geben. Wir waren zweimal dort bei ubserem Las Vegas Besuch und es war alles vom feinsten!

Had a great meal , very traditional Italian offerings !  I ate the Sunday gravy special & it was perfect - just like grandma's !  The atmosphere, staff, decor was all very friendly & roomy.  If your looking for traditional Italian that's fairly priced - you found it !  I would return for sure.

I was pleasantly surprised to how wonderful my dinner was.  I had the Chicken Piccata, which was quite tasteful w/a lot of flavor.  The pasta that came with piccata was the best tasting pasta, yet...it had so much flavor...I can still taste it, yum.  The Eggplant Parmesan and Calamari was just as tasty.  I truly was pleased w/how flavorful each meal was.  I definitely will go back and oh...we did go to Cake Boss's bakery...wow!  I had the strawberry tower, will not disappoint you, I promise.  Loved it!
Bought their carrot cupcakes, sugar cookies and  walnut cookies...will be baaaack!

Great Italian food with an awesome view! It is super cool even going into the restaurant, the ambience is like no other and the decor is perfect. Fun, loud environment, but still good for a date. Made a reservation last minute and they had no problem taking us early when we arrived. Good service, good food. Will be back!

I've dined here two years in a row for Restaurant Week and have been happy with both food and service. 

The service has been attentive and friendly. Both times I had reservations and was seated right away. 

On my most recent visit I started with the Caesar Salad. The salad was basic and not overly exciting, but the polenta croutons on top were tasty. The warm bread served with oil and vinegar was pretty good. 

Spaghetti and Meatballs made for a hearty, delicious lunch. The meatballs were fairly seasoned and I liked the spaghetti sauce on the dish. My friend's Chicken Parmesan was my favorite of the two dishes though. The chicken had plenty of breading and cheese. 

I'm a big dessert person and both hit the spot for me. The Cannoli had a great tasting filling with yummy chocolate chips and pistachios on one end. I just tasted the Cheesecake, but loved the flavor and I don't usually care for cheesecake.

Buddy V's is probably not my first pick for Italian in town, but a solid option if in the area. A big perk is Carlo's Bakery across the hall for more post dinner sweets.

Well, I wasn't feeling very hungry so ordered the Caprese salad and it was absolutely delicious! It came with heirloom tomatoes - some fresh and some were pre-marinated and slightly seasoned, almost as if they were pickled, which enhanced the depth of the flavors. The various ingredients truly came well together. The creaminess of the burrata and the fragrant basil with the tomatoes were simply perfect. I would order this dish again and again. Oh, not to mention the chargrilled garlic bread to boot!
Great place to go for casual dining in Vegas. Friendly staff. Recommend the meatballs - they're a must! We also loved the caprese salad. Save room for dessert. His bakery is just across the way.
Best Caesar Salad I have ever had! Polenta croutons are an amazing touch. Dinner portions are small for the price but they still get 5 stars for the salad! Will be back every time I am in Vegas!!
Great food, great service from Crystal.  The meatballs were fabulous,  ravioli was great and their tomato basil soup was excellent.
Decent Italian place. Nice decor. Food was tasty. Had the Margherita pizza, pretty good. Price is good considering it is in Vegas.

Loved this place. Delicious food, nice ambience and very good customer service. We didn't have reservation and the restaurant was busy. So we only got the table with super tall chairs. That was the only uncomfortable thing (am short). Would love to come again when visiting Vegas.

Buddy V's is like eating Sunday dinner with my Nona. The food was traditional, impeccably crafted, and amazingly delicious. The service was beyond helpful, informative, and all around pleasant. The general manager Adam, went out of his way to chat with our table and surrounding tables several times. I highly recommend this restaurant for the good and the atmosphere.

Made lunch reservations while in Vegas! I was super excited to try Buddy's restaurant! The place was casual, not very busy and our table wasn't ready. Ok fine. We were seated and it took us 15 minutes before anyone came to us. Mind you it wasn't very busy. Finally, waitress came over and filled our glasses with water and took our order. We got our appetizer which was like breaded mozzarella, still no beverages. :/ we had to ask the bus boy for our drinks. I ordered lemon piccata, dh ordered chicken Parmesan. It was all decent, but the terribly slow service really ruined the whole experience. With so many better options I won't be returning.

Sunday Gravy was AMAZING!!!!.  I have had many excellent dishes at this restuarant but this was by far the best thing I have ever eaten.  Being Italian I don't understand the review that said if you want authentic Italian don't go here.....that person does not know Italian food at its best.  The Cannoli is amazing and I don't know what he is talking about.
Best Happy hour food, service & ambiance we've had in Vegas. Definitely would recommend!

Had the margarita pizza, just ok, the frozen one from Vons is better, not flavored enough (bland), crust a little burnt, had the Cesar salad w/grilled shrimp, it was good, but the fresh croutons was not what I was used too, was still warm and a bit undercooked in the middle, it was very soft w some lemon or sour taste, didn't eat those, didn't mixed well with the chilled salad, also had the fresh garlic bread and tomato basil soup, this was the best! Our waiter was a Jerk, our bus guy was better then the waiter I wish I could have tipped him, I tipped the waiter but trust I didn't want too! I'm not going back, I'll stick to the bakery!

Let me start with my granddaughter 
She loved this restaurant
S he had spaghetti 
See pic

Now the chicken piccata according to my daughter and her friend fell flat like a New England patriots football 

The shrimp scampi was excellent 

My son in law ate the chicken Parmesan 
He likes it because it has 2 chicken breasts
But one of our friends gave him another and he ate it
I have a strong feeling he enjoyed it

I had the meatballs and they were okay

The service  was excellent 

The ambiance was excellent

Good ambience and decent prices.  The food is cooked perfectly, compliments to the chef!  And on top amazing service from our waitress and table runner (Tammy).  They did such an amazing job with getting our orders in a timely wander and making sure we had excellent service.  Two thumbs up!  A must visit in Vegas.

Surprisingly delicious! My son and I dropped by Buddy V's for lunch and really enjoyed it. We sort of expected a "cheesy," chain style feeling. We were wrong!  The restaurant is spacious and nicely decorated. He had the $22 Express Lunch (he chose meatballs, chicken parm and a cannoli) and I chose the Caesar salad with grilled shrimp (included these amazing polenta croutons!). Everything was tasty and the portion sizes were filling and just right for lunch. The service was extremely friendly and attentive from the servers, hostess, busboy, etc. We look forward to visiting Buddy V's again next time we're in town and would recommend it for anyone looking for a casual, low-key, fair priced and tasty meal.

Not impressed at all with the food. Everything was extremely salty. It's like they tried to make up for flavor with salt. And the service was absolutely horrible from the hostess that's nipples were showing through her see through dress to the rude waiter. This place is a def SKIP

Skip the restaurant and enjoy the Bake Shop across the hall instead.

I thought this place looked interesting and who doesn't love Cake Boss so I tried them for lunch. Had a tough time find them at first. I was traveling solo and dining alone not for whimps. This place seemed to cater more towards families and was not that comfortable here; don't know how to explain it but almost like it was a bother that 1 person was taking a table. Food was average (meatball sub and tomato basil soup). Service was meh. Overall I was under impressed. Hit the bake shop up on the way out and that pretty much saved the trip. 7 layer rainbow cookies, yum!!!

Food is great... Nice atmosphere great view from upstairs windows ... Service was great until dessert time then our bar/waiter got busy and forgot about us for 20 minutes and he wasn't very accommodating for being so slow to take dessert order ... Just said sorry I got busy at bar otherwise this place is great .

I came in the restaurant at 3pm on Sunday. Maybe it's because of the odd hour, they are obviously short-staffed. It took them almost 10 minutes before I was greeted by a waiter and served with water. However, service aside, their food was good. I ordered Madeline's whole wheat penne, and their pesto is one of the best I have ever had, but I do think they are a bit over-priced (not by much). In general, I will rate their food 5 star, price 3 star, and service 3 star.

The service at Buddy V's was some of the best I've had in Las Vegas. Everything about the restaurant is very warm and welcoming. The staff are friendly and attentive without being overbearing they where knowledgeable of the Menu and made useful suggestions.
 I had the Sunday gravy it was a nice assortment of meats sausage, lamb, and pork in marinara sauce. My girlfriend had the sea bass and gave it high marks. I don't eat fish so I can't vouch for it personally. We finished with the Italian birthday cake. It was very moist and flavorful without being too sweet. The price was a little high, but this is a celebrity chef with a restaurant on the vegas strip what would you expect. In the end we left satisfied and happier than when we went in.

Very good food!!! 

I had lasagna and my husband had the chicken parm and both were delicious!!!

We order also the octopus appetizer (don't really know the exact name) it was surprisingly yummi!!!! Like a soup but very tasty!!!! 



Huge portions so go very hungry!

Decided to come to Buddy's on the spur of the moment because of the novelty of being on tv and didn't expect the food to be great but, man were we wrong! We weren't looking for anything too heavy because this was a late lunch and dinner was scheduled for 8pm. 
There wasn't a wait and we arrived during happy hour (4:30pm-6:30pm seven days a week). My wife had the Sangria and I had the Bloody Mary & Caesar. Tasty! 
We ordered the calamari, mac &a cheese carbonara, smashed meatball sliders, & sausage & peppers sliders. All of it was perfect. 
Service was attentive and prompt. Definitely on the list to come back!

My husband and I had lunch here the other day.
We weren't as thrilled as some of the other Yelpers, it may be because we didn't choose Italian items... But honestly, I didn't see it as an Italian restaurant when we walked in.
We were also in quite a hurry, so we were looking to be in-and-out people.

That being said, our waiters were terrific - polite and kept our sodas filled. My husband ordered the meatball sandwich, which he enjoyed. His one complaint was that the bread was toasted and made it very hard. I ordered the Chicken BLT, which also had avocado on it. It was quite yummy. It came with a tiny tiny Caesar Salad... So tiny, you can't help but wonder what the point is? 

All in all, tasty and a good experience!

We got the ravioli with the white sauce and the chicken parmigiana. The food was fabulous and the staff were tremendous. We spent about the same or less than in our hometown. This place is very much worth the visit!

No complaints about this place. Everything we had was quite good. We came here on a weekday afternoon and it was pretty empty. My husband had the Philly cheesesteak and i had the lasagna. The decor was very nice and the waitstaff was helpful. Nothing was overly amazing...simply good food in a very nice place. I'd go again.
Awesome place to sit down for food or apps with good wine! Our waitress was amazing and suggested fantastic food. Great relaxed atmosphere

For a restaurant on the Vegas Strip, we were more than pleasantly surprised.  From soup to nuts Buddy V's delivered for a family vacation with four adults and three children. Everyone was happy with what they ordered which does not usually happen with such a large diverse crowd.  I was a bit disappointed in the pastry shop but the girls in our crew loved the chocolate covered strawberries! We would definitely re-visit when in Vegas again and recommend to friends and family. Service was good too.

Stand outs: 

Lasagne
Garlic Cheese Toast
Linguine with White Clams/Sauce

Food and service were both top notch. We sat at the bar and ate because we were in a bit of a rush. I got the chicken penne alla vodka and it was delicious. The fresh bread they provide is awesome as well. Our bartender was extremely friendly and attentive. I would definitely recommend this restaurant

Amazing Italian Ristorante!! The food was delicious, the service was great & the portions were large. We were so happy we decided to give Buddy V's a try. We will definitely come back next time we are in Vegas.

We were given a table to for 3 outside of the restaurant and placed by the public restroom. There was a communication barrier with the pre-server which resulted in a $8.00 bottle of water. The entrees were not aesthetically pleasing to the eye and tasted bland. We ended up wasting 2 hours of our vacation on subpar food. The server was good, that is why I am giving it 2 stars.

This placed is SOOO GOOD!!! This was in our
top 3 favorite restaurants on our last Vegas trip. We went for lunch, the atmosphere was pretty casual,
for dinner you would need to be more dressed up. 

My husband got the meatball sandwich and said it was amazing! I got the Buddies Favorite Pizza, it was the perfect size for lunch.

Everything tasted so fresh! I wish I could eat at Buddy's again.... (well sooner than a year from now)

I'm not a big Italian foodie but everything for dinner that I tasted was amazing. I ended up having the beef tenderloin and I ate every bite. 2 days later I'm still craving it. Wasn't too impressed with the desserts but did like the creme brûlée a lot.
