Met a group of peeps for lunch.  Our first discussion at the table was where is the best place to park. Well, it wasn't the Venetian, where I was lucky enough to park and walk from. Grrrr!  After getting the waiter to confirm, use the Palazzo Valet, but it's still a little trek. 

The waiter was super friendly and nice, even when I returned my soda, because it had a funny smell. I promise it wasn't me...I made half the table confirm it smelled bad. 

I asked the waiter what was good and he said many things. I mentioned the chicken parm, because so many people on yelp ordered it, and he said that was a good option. So I went for it.  Buyers remorse!!  It was decent, don't get me wrong, but the guy across from me got a burger that looked amazing!!!  Who would have thunk it...a burger at an Italin joint?!  Next time!

The parm was ok, and most would probably love it, but I am super picky about my sauce, being raised in an Italian pasta sauce making family. It did have two big pieces of chicken, fried well, and not dry with ample cheese on top. I wouldn't throw it away, but it wasn't OMG, I am ordering this again.  I already know I will be ordering the burger next time. :P

I also wish I had room for the lobster tail dessert, but I just don't. :(

I would come back again, because I think this place could make me happy.  Just not a good start with the strange soda this time.

We were in town for work and didn't have much time for play. We picked this restaurant as our one night out, and it did not disappoint. The service was fast. We wouldn't get half way through drinks before it was filled back up with a smile. Would recommend this to anyone.

I am still in love with Buddy V's. 
I have been to this restaurant several times, and EVERY single time the service is perfect, and the food is paramount. 
I always get the Caesar Salad, I just can't get enough of the polenta croutons. I tried the Steak Pizzaiolo, and IT WAS PHENOMENAL!! The steak was cooked perfectly, the sauce had a delicious Cacciatore flavor, and the cheesy polenta it came with was supreme. For dessert I tried the Butterscotch Creme Brûlée (it was the only one I hadn't tried yet) it's my new favorite dessert. 
When you come to Vegas and your craving Italian try Buddy V's, you won't be disappointed.
My boyfriend took me here this past weekend in Vegas, we sat in the bar area. Good food, good service, cute restaurant and ambiance.

The food was excellent and with it being a newly opened I expected some issues. When we first arrived the waiter was not my favorite and was extremely rude, once he realized that we were there during restaurant week. But I spoke to the manager and she switched us to a new server. This guy made our night and I would go back just for him to serve us again. The chicken parm was the best I have ever had and lobster tail dessert was amazing. The only other issue was that we got a child's pizza for my son and it arrived after the rest of us were done with our meals. But the problem was fixed again by same manager and they took it off our bill.
Food was awesome. The service even better. The cost will put you in the poor house. Welcome to Vegas!

My wife and I had a really great experience here for lunch.  I wanted the Sunday Gravy, which was the special, but it turns out it is a dinner item.  The waitress insisted on going back and checking with the chef and he agreed to make it for me.  I'm glad he did, it was amazing.  We also had the cheese sticks for an appetizer.  They were delicious, though a bit unorthodox, it was more like a grilled cheese sandwich in tomato sauce.  Service was great and friendly.  The restaurant, for lunch, was relatively empty, but everything was amazing.

Had brunch here on a recent visit to Vegas and was not disappointed.  Their weekend brunches consist of a buffet option with plentiful options of the traditional Italian food options to normal breakfast options.  There is also a massive dessert table consisting of bread puddings to concoctions from Carlos bakery across the hall.  Our server was amazing and made sure our drinks were never more than half empty as we had all partaken in the all you can drink mimosa/sangria option.  He was even kind enough to get our last rounds in to go cups so we wouldn't have to wander the strip drinkless!
Great appetizers the calamari was exceptional with a good lemon flavor.....chicken parm was on point

If you want great Italian food with great service, come here! You don't have to get that fancy and the price is just right. The portion size of these dishes is remarkable. I ordered their Chicken Picatta and was blown away. I think I've probably had Chicken Picatta three times in my life. This was the best I've ever had. The lemon and garlic sauce was buttery, but not too thick and the pasta was cooked perfectly; as well as the chicken. I also enjoyed their bread that's cooked fresh. Everyone else was also very pleased with their meal. Two thumbs up!

Meatballs great flavor. Nice texture 
Ceasar salad v nice. Can taste the anchovy and served w fried polenta instead of croutons. 
Tomato soup, too salty but otherwise good. Very rich. 
Carbonera excellent and also rich. Nice contrast of texture with some crunch too.
Excellent service with effective waitress and water was always filled. 
Nutella dessert puts most molten lava desserts to shame. Must get it.
Too loud.

This place is great for happy hour! Affordable food and drink prices.  The macaroni had a crispy bread crumb topping that was not my preference, but the macaroni itself was good.  The fried calamari was a pretty decent size and also cooked well.  We also ordered the octopus appetizer off the regular menu.  It was tender, but sitting in a little bit of a bland sauce and the octopus was a bit burnt on the outsides which made it difficult to eat.  The fresh foccacia bread which they make is yummy.  Very reasonable prices for what you get. Service wasn't the quickest, but they were also pretty busy.  We'll be back!

Decent place, loved the Alfredo Pasta. Not sure why I assumed this was Patio Dining. Staff is nice and responsive. They even adjusted my billing so that it can be billed to the room at The Palazzo which can earn my points towards my status. We really wanted to like the Tiramisu but it can be better.

Fine option if you are looking to spend a lazy day not doing much.

Holy cow, this was the best experience yet! We always go to Buddy V's for lunch when in Vegas. Delicious food, great ambiance and made to order. 

Joy was our server and she's quite an amazing bartender too! Joy's upbeat and positive energy rubbed off as soon as we were seated. She was very attentive, and had excellent customer service skills. She recommended we try her espresso martini to compliment our dessert plate. WOW. BEST MARTINI I've ever had!!! Ask for Joy!

Jose was also kind and attentive. He took photos of us and made sure we were comfortable. 

We gave Joy high accolades to one of the managers (Sean?), sadly he didn't seem interested in hearing our feedback and left the table right away. His attitude was less than impressive. 

Thank you Joy and Jose! Thank you to the chefs and kitchen staff for a wonderful meal!

I was really looking forward to Buddy's and we got in for a late brunch.
You know it's Vegas when you sleep after breakfast and wake up for brunch.

The restaurant wasn't very crowded.
we were seated right away and i parked myself in a comfy booth.
we got 
~ grilled garlic bread (melted mozzarella and fontina cheese)
~ eggplant parm (crispy and crunchy eggplant tomato,mozzarella, parmesan)
~ cannoli (sweet cinnamon pastry with sweet ricotta)

The garlic bread and eggplant parm were good but the star was their famous cannoli which is loaded with sweet ricotta cream, pistachios and cocoa drops served with chocolate sauce.

What i didn't expect was the sloppy service, our server seemed to be having a bad day and it just felt like he wanted us to leave.
I wasn't offered bread and he was ready to bring the check when i had to interrupt him and ask if he would be so kind as to bring us a Dessert Menu.

In the end we let it slide because we were in a good mood and wanted to enjoy ourselves.

Cheers!

Today my friend and I were craving Italian food, and im glad that we chose this place. It definitely hit the spot! 

The restaurant was super clean, and not overly crowded. We were seated immediately. This was refreshing since Vegas tends to be crowded everywhere. We had a nice view of the strip and some of the surrounding hotels. 

I ordered the chicken parmesan, it was very good. The chicken had good flavor, and I substituted the marinara sauce for a cream sauce with penne pasta. 

The whole staff seemed to stop to offer us refills on drinks and bread. Everyone was working together to make sure we had everything we needed. 

No complaints, I will definitely be back.
Awesome food, large portions and Stewart is a great manager. Talked with us for some time. Definitely going back!!

I will start by saying,  I'm a native and I avoid the strip like the plague.  However,  my mom had been here before and wanted to come back for her birthday.  So my sister and I decided to take her and her best friend here to celebrate her 65th.  I'm always down for trying new places and venturing out.  Let me just say this place did NOT disappoint!! 

Oh my goodness!!!   We sat in the bar area so we had a view.  Our bartender/server was Danny and he was amazing!!!  He made us a pitcher of sangria and it was ridiculously good.  We ordered lots of small plates/ appetizers so we could try different things.  The calamari was the best I've ever had outside of Maui.  My moms friend doesn't even like calamari and she loved it.  The caprese salad was hands down the best EVER!!!  The eggplant was incredible.....   I could go on and on but I honestly cannot say one  bad thing about this place.  

The service,  the food,  the ambiance....  it exceeded every single expectation!!!  I cannot wait to go back!!!  Absolutely incredible!!!  

It was awesome to celebrate my moms birthday with the most amazing meal possible!  Thanks Danny,  you rocked!

Poor service, over-priced and mediocre food at best. They were not accommodating to special requests such as a different pasta sauce or adding cracked red pepper to a dish. People come here for the name but leave thinking Buddy V should stick to cake instead of restaurants.

I had got the chicken rigatoni alla vodka and a kale salad. Of course it was a meal that is a little pricey because it is at a hotel/casino. Its hard to share these dishes because they are more individual portions. The kale sald was very flavorful and good. I enjoyed the texture of the kale and it was way to eat. I didnt really like the rigatoni. I think it was undercooked because the rigatoni was hard and very difficult to chew. The sauce was good though. Our waiter was cool to talk to and welcoming. Nice to try because i do like buddy from cake boss, but I'm not planning to come back.

It was good. I saw this place on the hotel eats channel and ever since then, I've wanted to go.

The decor was cool. They're trying to make you feel like you're in your Italian grandma's house on a day where the kitchen is pumping out homemade lasagna. They definitely succeeded in this respect.

I only gave it four stars because the food is just good, not great. Very good ambience and service, but very average Italian food.

Excellent food!  I had the chicken parm.  The chicken was good but the spaghetti side that came with it was fantastic!  The pasta was perfect and the sauce was the perfect amount and a great taste.  I look forward to returning.  Great environment too.  Yum!!!!

Well we didn't get to actually eat here because the hostess wouldn't seat us. I had promised my kids a treat from Carlos' Bakery but the line was huge, so we decided to get a table here instead & have dessert & drinks. It was around 3:30 & as it was between lunch & dinner the restaurant was mostly empty. The hostess informed us that since we weren't actually eating a meal she couldn't seat us at a table reserved for people who were eating a meal.  Hmmm, in a mostly empty restaurant. We would have had a few cocktails each as well as desserts, & we always tip well because regardless of how much or little we eat, the staff still has to do their job. So I guess my one star rating is for the hostess. Maybe we'll be back some day...

came here on a recommendation from a friend. the restaurant is sort of hidden and yet a secret spot to go to when you're around the area. 
my girlfriend and i loved the atmosphere and the attentiveness of the server and staff with refilling our water and checking up on us! i'm in the service industry myself and i'm blown away by now we'll this team took care of us. 
i would recommend this place and the Chicken BLT to anyone!! it was delicious!

The calamari fritti was a great opener for the family; daughter had the Margherita and polished it off too; father in law had the lasagne, he barely had 1/3 of it, it was huge, but he enjoyed it; hubby had a the steak pizzaiolo and he enjoyed it; had the linguine and clams and it was good, not great, too creamy for my taste but we had a great time, great view of the strip too.

We've always loved watching Buddy V on TLC's Cake Boss.  While standing in line for Carlo's Bake Shop, we noticed that Buddy V's Ristorante looked like it had a great environment so we made reservations for dinner.  We couldn't have been happier.  The food had a true Italian flare to it.  I had the Chicken Parmesean & my wife had the Shrimp Scampi w/ Angel Hair pasta.  We'll definitely being paying Buddy V's a visit the next time we're in Vegas.

Well, we've been here the last three times we visited Vegas!  This place definitely hits the spot if you're looking for an Italian fix.  It's traditional Italian food.  I love the lasagna!  The cheesy garlic bread is delicious too :)

5 stars for the delicious food and the fantastic service I got!!! Its always nice to walk around the Venetian, but the location of this restaurant is quite strange to me, I thought it would be at the heart of Venetian.                                         But anyway I've heard of this place through a client of mine who went to the grand opening, I watch cake boss on tv all the time and I've been curious about this place so I had to check it out for myself.So the wait time for our table on a Saturday night was only 15 minutes, our waiter was great and the amazing client service we got was from our busboy Jamal. He was very attentive,efficient, and he just paid attention to everything. He should definitely get a promotion and a raise! Ok so now the review of the food. We started with a charred octopus (recommended by our waiter)as appetizer and it was seriously delicious, I love squid so this was perfect. For our drinks we got the brooklyn ipa and prosecco which went perfect with everything we ordered.For entreè we ordered Eggplant Parmesan with marinara pasta, Meatball Spaghetti and Garlic Bread on the side. Everything was so delicious. The garlic bread was a meal by itself. The portions here are huge, so you better go here with a huge appetite.And lastly we got the lobster tail and this was the cherry on top it was light,airy, and yummy! I'm very excited that the cake boss opened a restaurant in sin city! Now I don't have to drool all the time while watching him make amazing pastries on tv, I can just stop by Buddy V's ristorante instead! I will definitely go back because the experience and service I got was excellent.

Only thing better than the food was the service. A taste of Italy in Nevada! Made a reservation for a Friday night and got right in with no wait. Hostess staff was warm and welcoming. Started off with a nice Brunello and Caprese with burrata cheese and organic heirloom tomatoes,  accompanied with grilled Italian bread. The manager Kristina was very attentive and brought us their nicest red wine glasses for our Brunello, which we really appreciated. The Caprese was one of the best my husband and I have ever tasted. We have been blessed to spend lots of time in Italy and have had some spectacular Italian meals. Buddy V's was right up there with the best we've had in Florence, Rome and Tuscany. The pasta was perfectly al dente, prepared by Executive Chef Bryan, who we had the pleasure of meeting. We finished our meal with their spectacular cannoli's that were clearly made fresh to order based on their crunchy shell. We can't say enough about our experience at Buddy V's.....from the hostess, busboys, server, managers. This group definitely worked well together just like a big Italian family.

We had Sunday Brunch here and it was a wonderful experience.  The food was all excellent and our waiter was fantastic.

The Sunday Eggs were our favorite, and my wife isn't much of a fan of scrambled eggs.  The frittata had a lot of huge chunks of vegetables, especially asparagus.  The meatballs, chicken apple sausage, freshly smoked bacon, chicken parmesan, and mac-n-cheese were all excellent.  Of course, there were croissants, fresh breads, pastries, cannolis, tiramisu, zonuts, and other desserts.  The food was all delicious and far exceeded our expectations.

We also had all you can drink alcohol.  My wife had bellinis, sangrias, and mimosas.  I had a few beers which, unfortunately, was cheap domestics, but whatever.

I definitely recommend Buddy V's, which is right across the hall from Carlo's Bakery, and the next time we're in Vegas, we'll definitely be back.

In Vegas last week for a convention made reservations when we arrived we still had to wait around 10 minutes. Once we were seated took forever for our waitress to get to our table so the Manger took our drink order. And then again for another 10 minutes we waited to place our order. She finally takes our order. The food was good not great. Wanted to place a desert order but when no one comes back to take your order how can you.!!Finally waved down the Manger to pay out. Pricey place for such Terrible Service.!

I have visited Vegas twice this month on business and had to eat at Buddy V's both times. I love the classic Jersey Italian dishes. I had the Chicken Piccata the first time. Skipped Appetizer and Salad since we didnt want to risk getting too full for dessert. Chicken was the perfect amount of Piccata. Dessert was the star of the night with the "Italian Birthday Cake". I consider this the perfect dessert. Beautifully presented on a signature chocolate signed plate and pedestal. The perfect balance of not too sweet and not too rich layers of rum soaked sponge cake and cream filling. Coffee was good too. 

Skip Maggianos Little Italy across the street and go to Buddy V's Instead. Far better quality and flavor.

Went for Sunday brunch last week and I would go again if I was in the mood for a treat.  Very friendly waitstaff and managers.  Pretty much a nonstop flow of people refilling our drinks, taking our plates, checking in on us and making conversation.  There was kind of a weird moment at first when our group first came in and went up to the hostess podium and two young guys up at the front literally just turned and walked off without saying anything, but later on made up for it.  

Most of the food was delicious (a few hot items were cold already due to there being too much AC in here, as other reviewers have mentioned, but it's not under their control).  They have mini cronuts!  And really excellent french toast.  Our whole group was very satisfied - there was something for everyone - seafood, veggie items, fancy meats, lots of sweet stuff.

We ate at Buddy v twice during our most recent stay in Vegas. Our first meal was so good (and so reasonably priced) that we went back a second time. For this visit, Kristina, the restaurant manager, could not have been any nicer. She accommodated us with a great table where our stroller could fit (we were traveling with a 3 year old and 2 month old) and checked in with us multiple times throughout the meal, including engaging in playful banter with our son. At the end of the meal, she gave him a light up cup that made his night. In a tourist-laden city where the service often slacks, Kristina did an exceptional job. I couldn't recommend buddy v any more if you are looking for a reasonably priced and family friendly Italian restaurant on the strip.

Everything here was amazing including the service, cocktails, and entrees! Surf and turf was perfect. Big thanks to Mourad for the great service and for recommending we add scallops to our plates. Everything was simply amazing.
Best dining experience you can get in Vegas for great taste, generous portion, and chic ambience. Outstanding service

This the second time we eat here with the wife when in Vegas. Glad we came. The wife and I enjoyed the food. We tried the calamari and lasagna. We were pleasantly surprised with the calamari. I hate when the calamari comes out chewy. Luckily this was not the case. The lasagna was also good and recommended. 

The portions of big so I recommend sharing and entree. My wife and I did and we still didn't finish the food. 

Overall I would it give it a 4.25

First time here at the Cake Boss' restaurant. Quiet Monday so the place was not crowded. We were seated tight away in a nice circular booth with a great view of the Wynn.

Our waitress was very helpful and went over the menu with us and brought us some hot bread while we made up our minds on what to order.

We ordered the Shrimp Scampi and the V. Family Sunday Gravy. Delicious! The best Italian food and good value for the money.

In addition to the restaurant, there is a bar and a bakery for take out desserts.

Overall a five star experience...

The BEST linguine and clam I have ever had!!!!
I could tell the clams were extremely fresh. Plus, it had a generous amount of clams and chopped clams in the dish. Heaven in my mouth!!!
It was too good to the point where the margherita pizza seemed so bland. I had to take the pizza home but it was perfect for the late midnight snack. The tomato basil soup was a little bit on the salty side but wasn't terrible. The mac n cheese was also very delicious! The bread crumbs made a great combination with the mac n cheese.
Overall, the service and food was amazing. I would definitely come back more often.
Loved the food at Buddy V's. Great Gluten free options as well!  Very accommodating of our larger group.

I was really looking forward to going here but we were very disappointed in Buddy's restaurant.  The service was lousy.  The food came room temperature and was sub par.  The veal my husband ordered was overcooked and tough so he didn't eat it. The server hardly came by to check on us and when she asked how our dinner was, my hubby said "it's ok." She left without really listening or noticing that he had barely touched his food. She never attempted to correct the situation or ask if he would like something else.  This place is overpriced and over-rated.

If you want touristy low grade Italian food this is the place. Very low quality food and way overpriced. Buddy isnt going to make it in vegas just on his good name. Meat balls were good, chicken parm tasteless , cheap low grade spaghetti side thrown next to it. At the price point should have used linguini with a higher grade sauce.

Servers are pretty hot and intelligent. Pizza was a little bit too salty. Everything else especially the antipasti tastes great. The main dish medium well steak was somehow pricy. I didn't see one single cow on the way from Los Angeles to Las Vegas. This may explain the tag haha.

By far the best spaghetti I've ever had.  I'm from a place where we don't have many options regarding Italian food SO I have not gotten away from large franchise Italian restaurants much, but this is the best.

Ordered grilled octopus(spicy), chicken parm, food is really salty, just ok level. However, the tiramisu and Italian birthday cake are awesome. I think the ads guy was in Cake Boss show? Desert is worth the visit. Should have made reservation otherwise line is long.

Disappointed!! I ordered my food with high expectations, because well it's a famous restaurant. I ordered the chicken marsala. The chicken marsala at Olive Garden is better than this one. Definitely not worth it for 28 dollars.

Nothing to write home about. The food was good, but the service was a bit odd. Maybe it was because we were seated in the bar area and it was just a server "free for all" but we had probably three or four different people helping us. You would think "hey, awesome! You must have been really taken care of!" But no, we found ourselves repeating orders or answering the same question to several different people which became annoying. Prices were Vegas high, which is no surprise. So yeah, just a "meh" experience!

It was good, but $24 for spaghetti and meat balls should have been closer to $17/18. The Caprese salad was also pretty unique and comes with a large tomato you slice yourself as well as cherry tomatoes.

This review is for Buddy V's brunch. It's $34.95 with soda, ice tea, or coffee from 10:30am to 2:30pm (I think) on Saturday and Sunday. In short, it's awesome. It's probably our favorite brunch on The Strip due to the selection, quality, value, and service. 

The selection is huge and there's a menu online but for a brief recap there's a carving station (ham, bacon, 2 kinds of sausages), shrimp cocktail, eggs/frittata, charcuterie station, a couple kinds of pasta, meatballs, chicken parmesan, salad, french toast, crespelle, pastries, like 5 kinds of cookies, like 4 kinds of cakes, cannolis, and fruit. A nice touch is that there's two sets of meatballs/chicken parmesan so if one is empty you can get some from the other station. They were great about refilling the dishes and every trip I went up, everything was available.

It's a buffet so don't expect things to be the same as ordering from Buddy V's off the menu. That being said, it was all still very good. Even the fruit was good (because it was sweet), and they had more exotic options like dragon fruit and rambutan as well. 

Service was friendly and they were very good about refilling drinks and clearing plates. All that said, I think what you get is very good for the price.

Horrible experience at this restaurant , I looked it up here on yelp and thought It  would be kid friendly . Well I Was súper wrong, my 18 month old started to cry maybe 5 min and I Was asked by the manager to take him outside if I could not control him kinda like a dog. I could not believe it !  OMG  of course I wanted to control him! It was 4:30 Pm on a Saturday, instead of making a scene I walked out of the restaurant with my baby and did not come back in. My husband paid our bill, for the meal that we weren't even able to eat because of this horrid situation.  I still can't believe it ! I felt so angry.  I don't recommend it to anyone and I  recommend that anyone with a child  Boycott it !!!!!!

O M G. If you are looking for homemade, delicious, traditional, NY Italian food- this is where you need to be. The food in this place tasted like home in Brooklyn in my mother in laws kitchen. The restaurant is in a wing of the Venetian and across the way from it, is Carlo's Bakery. (You can easily access the restaurant from outside the Venetain. Its above the Walgreens close to the Deuce stop. Almost like you are leaving the Ventian and walking towards Palazzo). The restaurant was very pretty with gorgeous views. The vibe is very causual, laid back, like you stopped by a friends house. Any clothing goes. No dress code. Not at all stuffy and pretentious like Giadas. (see review). We had a friend with us from Texas who had never had NY Italian food, so we had to take her there and see if it was authentic. Authentic it was. We started out with the mozzerella and Carozz that was amazing. I got the "Sunday Gravy"- which is exactly how we make it here. You get a bowl of pasta, with a seperate skillet of red meat sauce with meatballs (OMG delish), pork shoulder, lamb. My husband had pasta bolongese. Insanely good. My Texas friend had the lasagne. It was huge and she ate it for 3 days. All portions were big. The food was not pricey. The dessert menu comes in what looks like an old photo album, and it contains pics of a young Buddy and family with his dad, and then pics of him with his own kids. The whole place is decorated in family pictiures in frames on the walls. For dessert, we had the Nutella (yes Nutella) Lava cake!! OMG. Melted Nutella runs out of the center of this lava cake served with Salted Caramel ice cream. There are no words. Get yourself there  ASAP. You will not be sorry. It was so good, we went twice during out 10 day stay. Had to go back for lunch and got more meatballs, eggplant parm and 2 amazing salads. My new fav place in Vegas. Buddy needs to franchise these places out across the country. I hear Buddy is there monthly. Sadly he was there as soon as we got home to Nyc. Cant wait to go back.

I am so glad we stopped by here... we were famished for lunch.

Best chicken Parmesan I've ever had.. Seriously.  The spaghetti served with it was al dente unlike so many places in the USA.  We split it and it was good size for my bf and I.  Wait staff was wonderful to do it without us even asking.

We also had the cheese plate with sliced meat which was really good.. A lot in quantity.  My fav was the salami and blue cheese.  Pickles weren't bad either.

Shared the meatballs as well which were good.  Not the best ever.. Six small meatballs come in the order with marinara.
Fantastic food, amazing atmosphere! This one was really Italian for a very good price! The only cherry  missing on the cake, was having a sgroppino afterwards..

It was mine and my husbands 14 year anniversary and I was looking for a fantastic restaurant for us to go out to for a romantic evening! I was recommended by a friend to try Buddy Vs because she works as a concierge on the strip and said it has been a pretty popular choice among tourists.... Let me start by saying people must like this place bc of the fact that it's owner has a tv show because I was very unimpressed! 
Ok, let me say that it is a beautiful restaurant but not much for a romantic evening... My husband and I were sat at a table barely large enough to hold out plates on, and we were in between 2 other larger parties! We felt completely cramped and not the least bit romantic! However we decided to try to make the best of our night and ordered some of our favorite Italian dishes! When our food arrived I wouldn't put it too far past a fast food Italian taste! There was nothing great about our food and most definitely not worth the price! We are locals who love good Italian food and there are many, and I do mean many, that we have tried off the strip who far exceed Buddy Vs! We will leave this restaurant for the tourists!

I love a home style Italian meal. The food at buddy v's is simply perfection in this catagory. We had a special birthday lunch here. What can I say, service was oecable. Our waiter t.j. Was highly versed on the options we had a couple if starters the fried mozzarella left us speachlesd, and the calimari was a great compliment. The best part was their adaption if chop salad for a lunch salad it was huge! Save room for dessert, we had the famous lobster roll and the most Devine Italian rum cake served in a miniature cake stand complete with candles for the birthday girl! We can hardly wait for the bakery to open trust we will be the first in line! Yes this will be someplace to come again and again - oh I almost forgot auto pilot parking if you love valet pull in hop out and a quick elevator ride and you are there! This is a winner! Hands down.

Just returned from Vegas. Had reservations for 5pm before seeing Rock Of Ages Show.  Went personally at noon to confirm reservations, as the two ladies in our party of four were celebrating birthdays, and wanted to make sure we would get window seats.  The original reservations were made at the same time room reservations were made by the pallazo hotel.  We were told we would be given window seats. Well the hostess said she could not guarantee, but made a note of the request as well as the birthday celebration.
We arrived at 4:45pm fifteen minutes early, and found an almost empty restaurant.  As luck would have it, the original hostess was there.  She said she would be able to seat us "near" a window table.  I laughed and said, well it looks as though you have lots of tables.....her comment was to go sit in the lounge "bar" area until our reservation time.  Trying to sell drinks I suppose.  We sat there , not ordering drinks, and she started to seat us away from the window....again I reminded her, and miraculously she found a table.. It dawned on me later (after my wife explained) she was fishing for a tip to "find a table"
Anyway, we ordered.   The Lasagna came, large portion, lots of cheese and meat, little skimpy on the sauce.  Wife had Chicken Parmesan which was overcooked and little sauce.  The other couples order consisted of a new York steak which she raved about, but her husband had steak and lobster, and said the steak he had was tough, but the lobster was good.  
Table service was good, lots of flat bread, water refills.
Oh....if you happen to like a nice fruity White Zinfandel (the fastest growing wine category in the US) you will not get it there.. They don't carry one,  I know some restaurants are a bit snobbish because its a "blend"  

So regarding the birthdays?  Well most restaurants will make an effort to do something to acknowledge a celebration.... Desert came and went, nothing...

Anyway, I know they have not been open for very long.  Our waiter was good, food runners ok...The Floor manager spent his time looking from a distance, but made no contact with the customers.  

Place looks nice, food ok, price ok....but Buddy......you need to instill a little passion in your place...Your gonna have to step it up to compete with the upscale establisments located in the same building.

Let me start off by stating the positive, the service was excellent. Our waiter was very attentive, efficient and friendly. The food was  average, a bit overpriced. I probably won't go back but had to try it.

This might not only be my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas but just my favorite restaurant period. I have been here multiple times and have never been disappointed. We first came for dinner with a couple friends. We loved it so much we returned the next day for their Sunday brunch. It been a Vegas go to ever since. They also have a great happy hour! I suggest the lasagna or the mac n cheese carbonara. The Sunday brunch is a great spread and different from other brunches. Of coarse Carlos Bake Shop is just across the hall so definite plus for after meal sweets.

a tad hard to find if you're walking over from the palazzo - it's easiest if you exit through the palazzo entrance and then swing a left and walk down the sidewalk. there's a side entrance that brings you right to the front door of buddy v's.

it's a cute italian restaurant and seems very family friendly. portions are huge and easy to share. i had chicken piccata, which is one of my favorite italian dishes of all time. they do an excellent rendition with linguine!
Customer service is top notch here. Food options not so much to choose from but everything we ordered seemed good. Great portion size and food came out quick. Would eat here but only for lunch.

After spending most of the day in the sportsbook, I was ready to chow down and my belly was craving some Italian food. Upon check in at the Palazzo, my wife and I were handed a coupon book to select restaurants, bars, etc. inside of the Venetian and Palazzo. This included a coupon for Buddy V.'s. So we decided give this place a shot when we saw that this place had opened recently and had received four stars on Yelp. 

We started off on the light side of things with a Caesar salad. There was nothing particularly great about this salad except for the croutons. I'm not really a crouton fan because they tend to be too bland, salty and/or crunchy.  Normally I would pass over them completely. After my wife urged me multiple times and after I had refused multiple times, I saw my wife's fork with a crouton on the end of it right smack in front of my mouth. I succumbed to peer pressure and tasted what was probably one of the best croutons ever. The crouton had a crunchy exterior and then evolved to a smooth and creamy interior with a terrific garlic flavor inside. It was so delicious that I had to fight my wife for the rest.  Looking back, she probably regrets shoving that crouton in my mouth. 

I ordered the Nonna's Lasagna Al Forno which was served in an incredibly hot iron skillet. I think the cheese was still bubbling a little bit when they brought it out to our table. This was probably one of the thickest lasagnas I have eaten in a long time. This lasagna came with generous portions of fresh Italian sausage and ground beef and layered with ricotta, mozzarella and provolone cheeses. The marinara sauce was a perfect blend of sweetness and spiciness and had settled to mostly the sides of the lasagna. The top was sprinkled with a tiny amount of Italian parsley. This was one of the best lasagnas I have had in a long time. Each bite melted in my mouth. There was no doubt I was going to finish dish.

Because of the reviews, tips, and photos of meatballs on Yelp, my wife had to go with the meatball spaghetti. Needless to say, she polished off the dish easily and said it was one of the best meatball spaghettis she had tasted. The meatballs at Buddy V.'s inspired her to go home and cook some meatballs herself. I think that in itself should speak volumes about their meatballs.

We had just enough room at the end to split their Tiramisu which was equally as delicious as our entrees. It was a nice touch to include a side of lady fingers in order to swipe any remaining coffee flavored cream at the end with them.

The service here was top notch. Our waitress was fully knowledgeable about the menu and was ready to offer suggestions. She was great from start to finish! 

Even with the coupon, I agree with the other reviewers that say this restaurant is on the pricey side.

This place has quality Italian cuisine. The salumi and cheese board are high quality ingredients and a must have! This appetizer would feed up to 4 people. The chicken with vodka sauce was delicious. The sauce was perfectly seasoned and the chicken was tender. I did get the famous dessert "Buddy V Lobster Tail". It was a croissant style pastry shaped like a lobster tail filled with cream. It looked really fun, but the pastry was so hard I couldn't cut it with a fork. Other than the dessert everything else was great!

The service was very good. We had a reservation and showed up 10 min early and people were overstaying their time at their tables but the staff made it a priority to get us seated. 

We ordered the garlic parmesan cheese bread and calamari for the appetizer. The bread had very little taste of garlic and was mostly just a cheese bread. The calamari was delicious and was nice and crispy, and I always go for the deep fried jalapeño pieces. For my main dish I ordered the salmon which was cooked perfectly and was light enough for me to leave room for the Italian birthday cake for dessert. The cake was nice and moist but it was very hard to eat for how it was served.
Always the best experience when we go there. Great food, Great Service, Fabulous company.

I have eaten here twice so far this year and can't wait to come back in August. The veal parmesan is the best I have ever had. Appetizers and salad also great. I am always with a group and everyone always raves about the food. Good job guys.

Came here for late drinks with a huge party so this is really about the bar service and menu.

They didn't have a huge cocktail menu but whatever they served was pretty darn good.  It's good to see that even the Cake Boss knows you gotta spice up your drinks to make people get sloshed (like we did for a big reunion party).  I had a berry mohjito that was absolutely kick ass.  The bartender was also very friendly and did a good job of making sure the drinks kept flowing.

The ambiance of this place is really nice and there's a good amount of space that can accommodate a large number of guests, making it a great meeting spot if you're part of a big party or celebration.
Came here for Sunday brunch. Absolutely love this place. Got a window seat, had a life band, service was excellent, food was delicious. I can't wait to go back!

Einfach nur lecker von A-Z!!!
Dazu noch eine tolle Atmosphäre und sehr freundliches Personal, wir kommen wieder!!

Great spot. Fast and very friendly service. Food was delicious. Good variety of options on the menu, and our server Crystal really knew how to get everything right even though we had a complicated order. Would definitely go back.

So you are on the strip and don't know what to eat? Come here. This place has nice views of the strip and the restaurant is very well designed. 
I ordered the cheese stake and it was amazing, the most addicting part of the fries. The menu offer variety of foods with a mix of Italian and American. You can't go wrong, oh and they specialize in desserts! I loved the tiramisu, must get with coffee. This is my second time here and I'm a local. Oh, and free parking at the palazo/Venetian!

The wait staff service was great. Hostesses were unfriendly. Food was very bland. The caesar salad was good, but the croutons were terribly weird sponges. Between my husband and I, we had a Caesar salad, a meatball sandwich, and pasta bolognese...the meat sauce was bland, making both the pasta and the sandwich a bore. Another downfall, no fresh bread was served, but instead there were packaged crunchy "bread" sticks sitting on the table. Although the location is conveniently located in the middle of everything and the decor cute, the actual food was a disappointment and the cost even more so (+$50 for our 3 item meal!) We will not return.

It was good but not blow-your-mind good. We had the calamari appetizer (great), caesar salad (ok, thought the croutons were weird), chicken parmesan (good, didn't care for the spaghetti that came with it, big portion), and shrimp scampi (wasn't a creamy type scampi, I liked the noodles but thought the shrimp were really salty), and the cannoli (good). Overall pretty tasty but not amaaaaazing.

We were just there last night, and we found it to be great.  Our server was Caleb and he was wonderful, he helped explain everything about our dishes so we could make the best choices for us.  Food was great, service was great, I would go back in a heart beat.  The manager that night was Adam and he was very attentive and funny from the time we walked in to the time we left.  The two of them really made our visit go over the top.Food AAa  Service AAA

The party I was with of 7 dined here on Labor Day weekend on Friday evening.  Some in the party were in no shape to dine, while I was ready to feast.  As usual, another benefit of Yelp is doing a quick search and relying upon fellow Yelper's to point me in the right direction!

I had one of the best plates of lasagna in recent memory and the photo I took and am attaching with this review attest.   Perfect sauce, heat and layers of fresh and flavorful awesomeness.   So good that those who follow Anthony Bourdain and those who are with Guy Fieri would appreciate it.

The bread to start was perfect warm crunchiness and the cheese plate was incredible-really tasty pecorino and a solid gorgonzola.  My wife's rigatoni with vodka sauce was tasty.  Attentive service in a relaxed atmosphere with a great view facing the strip at night.

Buddy has done it again! Not only is his bakery next door amazing, but his restaurant is great too. I've been here both during lunch and dinner, but at night it has a more dark tone with warm lights, great for a romantic night but good too for families. No matter what table you are seated in, you will have a view of the kitchen and the chefs. 

Our server Brittany was really nice and bubbly. I was having trouble deciding between the scallops and the chicken parm, she recommended the chicken parm and assured me that in case I didn't like it that I could order something else. 

But she was right! The chicken parm was delicious! I personally don't like chicken, but this was juicy and crunchy, covered with hot marinara sauce and cheese covering it all.  It also came with spaghetti marinara on the side. 

My friend was jealous and wish she had gotten mine. She ordered the seabass, which was flaky and good  too, but I still liked mine better.

This is such a great restaurant and I highly recommend this restaurant. I had a lot of food and the stomach pain from so much food was totally worth it. This restaurant has great service and the breadsticks were the bomb. Furthermore, the meatballs were fat juicy spheres of goodness. . Also their cannolis give me life. I hope you enjoyed this review as much as you will enjoy this restaurant assuming you really liked this review. 

#foodislifesoyeeeet

Did not know much about Buddy V background and his rep on desserts. We went in a couple years ago as guests at Palazzo. Now it's a staple on our liSt based on the food. It's not a huge menu but what they got is goooddd. I always go for the chicken parm. Two big breasts and a side of pasta. It's plenty for two. Other folks in our party had bucatini and it was rich with great fresh pasta. Was not over sauced to allow all flavors. We did the Price Fix menu which for $40 bucks gets you an app, entree and choice of dessert (cannoli or tiramisu). Meatball appetizer was really good though they are a little on the small size compared to Carmine's, Lavo or Matrianos. Chicken parm is a little thicker than other places but keeps the chicken juicy without too much breading. The red sauce on the parm and pasta side is super fresh tomato taste. We had one each of the cannoli and Tiramisu. Cannoli was crunchy with cream and chocolate chunks with a side of chocolate syrup. Wow was it good. Tiramisu was also very good and I liked because not to bitter with coffee taste. It comes in a little jar with a couple of side cookies. Both great for sharing at the table. Atmosphere is really good with view looking over the strip. Nice bar/lounge area with live music some nights. Service was really good and efficient.

Delicious! To start, the garlic bread and fried mozzarella really set you up for a great meal. Then for the main course, we had the lasagna (not pictured) and the eggplant Parmesan with a side of spaghetti. Amazing!! And what's a trip to Buddy's without the famous lobster tail?? This has got to be one of my favorite Italian restaurants I've been to. Thanks buddy!

This my first time here and this is absolutely amazing. The meal the service everything was absolutely amazing. I will definitely be back... this food made me feel like I am home. Will definitely be coming back

HORRIBLE...I went there yesterday to celebrate my birthday.  I'm a Cake Boss fan.  I'm 100% Sicilian and thought it would be fun to try.  VERY DISAPPOINTED.. OK tell me what Italian Restaurant doesn't serve bread... you have to order garlic bread full of grease flavor garlic not even real butter flavor and smothered in melting cheese... how about some nice Italian bread you can dip in olive oil ...the Caesar salad didn't have any anchovies on it,,,, HELLO Italian eat anchovies,,, the portions were very small and just NOT GOOD.... the Lobster Claw said it was filled with Canoli filling and cream... sorry it was just straight whipped cream with baileys in it.... very disappointing.  I'm a NYer and I know what a real lobster claw is supposed to be..., I will never go there again and OMG the prices were very expensive.... 2 for lunch came to $100.00 and it wasn't good at all... Sorry Buddy... you need to get those people trained right... and get some good bread in there...

Food was very good. Waiter was outstanding! Although a little pricey, its Vegas, you get what you pay for. The service was excellent and the food was very good. It was a little noisy, but all in all, I would visit again.

I would like to thank Buddy V and his staff for making my sons high school graduation dinner exceptional . The food was unbelievable and the staff outstanding,  this is the place to go if you want to have a memorable dinner with a wonderful group of people , they truly were the icing on the cake ..

Food and service here is great! Lunch prices are pretty decent and portions are more than enough for one person. Our server recommended some of their best dishes for our group and they were all delicious! The buddy pizza, lazagna, mozzarella appetizer, chicken BLT sandwich, YUM! :)

Food was a 4 star but the service was a 3 at best. We used open table to book a reservation for 2 at 9pm about 30 min before we arrived on a Friday night but other people were walking in with no problems. Cheese Bread was good, lasagna was excellent, grilled chicken was good and Ceasar Salad was great. Other servers looked more engaged with their tables than out blonde waitress but maybe just luck of the draw. For $120 for 2 people before tip I'd rather go to Buchon.

Herb bread has a very strong flavor. Lots of herbs. Their cheeses on the adult Mac n cheese is out of this world. There is ham an peas in it. I am a vegetarian so I was surprised that there was ham bits in the Mac n cheese. Salad was very fresh and dressing definitely homemade. Spaghetti bolognes was a very generous portion and tastes of Italy! Excellent ambiance!

It's a pretty good Italian place.  Good atmosphere, reasonable prices for Vegas and super great waitstaff. I'm a pretty snotty Italian reviewer so for most people this may be a 4 star. It has a fairly mainstream flavor. Do try the garlic bread and buddy's Sunday gravy.  Both really good.

How about the best Eggplant parmesan ever. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside but not mushy! Just perfect! The marinara sauce was perfect too. Since it was an appetizer but a good sized portion, got a side order of pasta it. The garlic bread was also amazing! Great location inside the Venetian Hotel on the 2nd floor.

Delicious! Highly recommend the salmon and Cesar salad! The bread is so soft and warm, freshly made. Quality of food is great and portions are more than enough! Price is $$$$ of 5 plan to spend $100 per couple, but I definitely think it's an experience one must try if your in Vegas! 
Cons: No restrooms, restrooms are outside the restaurant not far but an inconvenience. Lasagna had a little too much Rosemary and same with the Cesar salad to many herbs. Other than that great serve and super friendly staff!
The food was delicious. We were there for our anniversary. Best Italian food ever,fast service and very friendly waiters.

We didn't expect much from Buddy's. We figured, ah, another TV personality restaurant. Like, whatever. However, we stopped in for a late-night dinner after seeing the Beatles Cirque show at the Mirage, when not much else (even in Vegas) was open at 9:30pm on a Sunday. And Buddy's turned out to be the Boss. As in, very NJ Italian.

Caesar salad usually has hard-as-rock bread croutons. Not here. Buddy's croutons were amazing, soft, warm polenta/cheese cubes. Loved that! The Chicken Piccata was also very tasty, a generous portion with lots of capers and lemon. Very nice. Cute Italian breadsticks-in-wrappers on the table. Surprised and pleased with our meal. 

Finally, don't get the weirdly-frosted cupcakes at the Carlo's bakery across from Buddy's (the ones with gobs of over-colored icing on the top). Instead, DO get their authentic Italian/NJ "lobster claw" pastries filled with cream. You could die. They were that good.

I came here the other day for their Sunday buffet brunch special.

 My experience was very enjoyable, from the good food to the excellent service.

Since it was a buffet, I ended up trying a lot of the food they had to offer. Some of the food that stood out to being especially good was the Sunday eggs, the chicken parm, panetone French toast, the caesar salad, the chicken apple sausage, and meatballs. There was mac and cheese there as well. This was the first time I had mac and cheese at a buffet or all you can eat setting, and it tasted exceptional. The noodles weren't over cooked, and the cheese sauce was tasty and creamy, there was a bread crumb like topping on it that help bring it all together. There was even some partially peeled shrimp there. Unlike some places, it was properly cleaned and deveined, on top of it not being over cooked and mushy. I wish the cocktail sauce that accompanied it had some more flavor and horseradish in it. The, what I were to assume, mini cannoli were excellent, even though they were already filled, the shell was still crispy and crunchy while the filling wasn't overly sweet.

All of the food I tasted had flavor, and was appealing to the eye, which tends to be a lacking attribute for a lot of buffet places. While you saw the cooks actually make the food, it actually tasted and looked like it was made from scratch, not something that came from a bag, frozen, or reheated from the day before.

The service was top notch. My glass was never less that 1/3 empty, and the busser made sure I always had fresh forks and knives when I came back with more food. The waitress and busser were very attentive, always making sure I was comfortable, enjoying myself, and asking if there was anything they could do for me.

For the price, selection and quality of food, and service, I was very satisfied with my experience at Buddy V's Ristorante. Not only will I most definitely be coming back for the brunch special, I would recommend the place to other people that I know.

One of the best birthday dinners, ever. The server and busser were so attentive, they could not have been more wonderful. In addition, the food was incredible. Homemade ravioli, yum. Oh and obviously, you're not allowed to not have dessert there :) Thank you. Delizioso!

2 stars based on decor alone. Everything else was really unsatisfactory.  We were seated at a dirty table with napkins, a receipt and straws on the sticky floor. The hostess grabbed a towel and wiped it off but not entirely.  Still sticky and gross. We ignored that but the wobbly table was obnoxious. The server came over and ignored the garbage at her feet so I pointed it out and asked for something to even out the table. The busser brought by our share plates and mine had a nice long hair attached to it under my napkin. We ordered the garlic bread and meatballs. The garlic bread wad just that. Simple, not exciting, garlic bread, and the meatballs were very dence. We are both Italians and they weren't the soft flavorful moist meatballs we were use to. Just dence and dry. The sauce wasn't memorable either. The wine was fine, but we were just kind of turned off by then. I asked for the bill and got the wrong one. All together I really don't think we'd be back.

The food is average, but the desserts...oh oh oh!!! Some of the best I've ever tasted! The Italian birthday cake and Lobster Tail are to die for. Skip Carlo's bakery and order the desserts at Buddy V's!!!!

Best experience ever 
We went a group of four and ordered different food
For starters appetizers we got the calamari fritti and the Aunt Ninas mozzarella en carozza

The calamari fritti has been the best ever calamari I've ever taste very delicious the flavor is mouth watering so good 

Ninas mozzarella en carozza is also another must try very delicious 

I had the  Nona's lasagna al forno ,very very delicious very bite was amazing I've never had good authentic Italian lasagna it was with every bite so delicious 

My brother in law : ordered the  spaghetti central meatball ; let me tell you that I've tried different spaghetti and this place right here at Buddy V Ristorante has been the best spaghetti and meat balls I've ever tried in my life the best of the best 


My girlfriend ordered Buddy favorite (pizza) very delicious and flavorful



If your in Las Vegas and craving real authentic Italian food stop by at the Venetian 

Check out Buddy V Ristorante best of the best and a must ride the Gondola it's an Italian experience worth it

Came here with a reservations and got seated right away. They weren't packed at all. Our servers and bussers were super nice and accommodating. I ordered the scallops which was 5 pieces with prosciutto. The scallops are too seasoned in the rosemary flavor, which threw me off. I'm not a fan of rosemary so it was too much for me. I had to swap dishes with my boyfriend. He had the sea bass which was not bad; crispy on skin and flavor was a bit salty but decent. We had cheesy bread to start off too and it was too filling to finish with our entrees. Our wine was good and the we had a side of broccoli that had a kick of spice to it. It was my birthday too, so they gave us a cannoli with happy birthday written in chocolate. It was complimentary which was nice. It wasn't that great for it to be $114 (without tips). Reminds me a lot of Bucca too except that it's not made for family style. I want to return to try their lobster tail dessert, since i heard good things.

All started out well. After our salads the kitchen then fell apart. We waited and waited and waited. All the other tables were served. Then we asked when we would get out dinner. Oops. Sorry. Few more minutes. About 10 min later we get the food. All ok not great. Cold pasta probably waited while chicken was cooked. By now all we want to do is leave. No offer to comp. No we're sorry we sucked how about a dessert. Nothing. Waiter hovered while we filled out a comment card. Manager disappeared. Found a hostess who was giving a free dessert to another table for their inconvenience. All in all. Don't go there not worth it. Price high. Value low. Food mediocre. Service terrible. Will not return and will tell all to avoid. For a much better meal go to Viva Las Arepas!

My Fiancé and I had dinner here on a weeknight. The service was prompt and attentive...perhaps a bit awkwardly overly attentive, but no complaints here. The food was discouraging though - It was only so-so. Afterward we moved onto dessert and had the birthday cake and it was mind blowingly good. I have never had better. Although a fan of the show, I can now say I've experienced why Buddy is called the Cake Boss. The disappointment came at the check...we split all dished: an appetizer, main dish, and desert with ice cream and had no drinks....$76. I probably won't return to the restaurant, but I sure will hit the bakery when it opens up next door.

I have many food allergies and our waiter took great care in taking note of them. Then the manager came over and informed us that the chef would be making all of my food himself and fresh. They did an amazing job keeping me healthy and made me feel like a queen. They treated my 3 children like little kings and queens. Such a great experience!

Bad experience.  They put a single diner in a corner table. No server ever showed up.  The place wasn't busy but they just kept walking past the table.  No one cared until I left. 
The bakery is busy but the restaurant needs some work.

Great food, great atmosphere, great service.
However, how do you run out of Pinot Grigio in an Italian restaurant at 6:30 pm on a Tuesday night? Secondly, after switching to a $16 per glass red wine, it was served in  a Libby 's style wine glass !  Time to upgrade the glassware Buddy!!!!

This restaurant was really great! I went with my family at 11:30 for brunch and was very satisfied with my experience. The restaurant is huge and the little details make it special. You can tell that it is inspired by Buddy's family which gives it a homey and comfortable feel. The coffee and food was fantastic as well as the service. We ordered the eggplant Parmesan, buddy's pizza, pasta carbonara, calamari, caprese, spaghetti and meatballs, and the tomato soup. Everything was so delicious and satisfying. The dessert menu was a nice touch as well because it is like a family photo album which I thought was a nice detail. Service was excellent and our wait staff was very attentive. We ordered in advance from Carlo's bakery and ate in in the restaurant along with our coffee. Overall this place was excellent and I will probably be back in the future.

This is a perfect low key Italian joint.  The best chicken parm I have had, which is saying something.  Also, the pasta was a perfect al dente.  

Kid friendly, reasonable prices(for Vegas, anyway), good portion sizes.

Casual, non-spectacle joint, which is needed once in a while when visiting this town.

We had a wonderful experience here. The atmosphere is fabulous and the staff are simply brilliant. We had coffee and a cannoli (hope that is the correct spelling) one afternoon and then came back for dinner. We ate the best lasagne ever with a gorgeous ceaser salad. The view was lovely. I loved it and will go back next time I visit Vegas. 
Thanks for a great experience.
A bit overpriced, but hey- it's Vegas. The food was definitely good- HUGE and too filling GOR us to get to try the desert, but it hit the spot.

The sea bass was very tasty. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars was that all I had on the plate was the bass and an itty bitty salad....more of a decoration. A small vegetable garnish would have made the plate. I think the plate was $29. It was overpriced for what was received

I got the cheese ravioli and the Portion was sorta small for the price. Atmosphere is casual and very family friendly. I'll come back an maybe try something else. Servers we're VERY attentive and even gave us appetizers on the house!!
This place had a very modern homey feel, good menu selections, make sure to ask for the bread it was great.

Best tasting food and dessert. Fast and excellent service . Try everything you can , don't miss the Nutella cake with salted caramel gelato . All pastas are great .. and the appetizer bread is a special mention

I like the food here. Definitely a go-to spot when guests are visiting and need a family friendly spot for dinner where we can just meet them on the strip. The only thing is that they need new bust boys or more training. My first visit, they just weren't up to par esp on refilling the water. I don't remember too much on the last visit what my complaints were. It just wasn't good. 

Although tonight, it was crappy. My son was eating the cracker sticks and we placed the opened packet on top of the plates. The guy comes to pass out the plates but dumps the cracker onto the table. Literally took the plate and dumped it. Hello...my son was eating that and what kind of table manner/service is that. 

Then they came around with oil. He left and then a few minutes later came with bread. Our waitress finally asked if we wanted balsamic vinegar with it. I said yes, of course. I never had bread with just the oil! I guess the guys did that to the same table as well. 

Our waitress was good it's just the bust boys. They're not what I expect for a restaurant like that.

Came in with group of seven. Said 40 minute wait and was seated around 20 mins (so early).  Took a awhile to order food. And they were out of pizza at 8:30p (so I take it they are frozen)....  So not a good start to the night.

Wasn't bad, but doesn't come close to actual Italian food. Basically a few steps above an Olive Garden. The service was great though and our waiter was attentive. Should have went next door and tried the desserts.

we were a large group and they convinced us to order off of a fixed menu family style. surprisingly, the portions were very very small for family style.
it was overpriced and the food was very average.  
I would never come back

We enjoyed everything about this place!  We sat in there "outdoor" seating. It was freezing out when we were there so it was nice to pretend to be outside. While we were sitting their was a cute little skit/show. The bread and olive oil that came out was exceptional. The olive oil had a deep yellow-green color, there was no salt and pepper on our table. I would have liked to add a little for dipping. 
Chris ordered the pasta of the day, lasagna. SOOOO GOOD! The béchamel was layered thin with a great nutty flavor the sauce was light but flavorful and the cheese was gooie with small charred bubbles that still had their crunch when it got to our table. 
I ordered the charred octopus salad OH MY GOODNESS so so so so SO SO SO SO SO GOOD! I was a little iffy about the potato but I should have never doubted whoever made this salad lol. It was excellent.

Excellent service,  delicious food and live music for dinner (specific evenings)!  The best chicken picatta I've ever had and the desserts are divine.   The creme Brule is unlike any other.   The Nutella cake with the star of the plate. ..salted caramel ice cream.  The mac and cheese is also very unique with crunchy topping and decadent smokey flavor.

Great place for some good food and a nice stroll through the Venetian! The servers were friendly the second we walked! Would highly recommend, go again, and listen to the live music soon! Thanks Buddy.

This used to be one of my favorites in LAS.  Went there tonight with a friend all the while telling him how great the food and service was going to be.  Boy was I wrong.  While the food was adequate, the service was non-existent.  To get anything, we had to constantly flag down staff members.  While some may accuse me of being too picky, I think the fact that the restaurant did not have fresh grated parm cheese available (they claim their wheel broke) is a major blunder for an Italian themed restaurant.  I mentioned how poor the service was to one of the floor managers on our way out, and all she could say was "Please don't let that stop you from coming back."  Really?  That's it?  Spend a couple of hundred dollars on dinner only to be told that?  I think it will be long time before I head back that way.  Which is too bad because the bone-in veal parm, with our without parm cheese, is really a wonderful dish. Ironically, shortly after we were seated, a table of 10 or 11 was seated next to us.  The wait staff fawned all over those folks and the chef even came out to meet the leader of their pack.  I guess we weren't high enough rollers to get the attention that we expected.

Fantastic, a MUST eat!!! The Caesar salad with melt-in-your-mouth croutons, the grilled cheesy bread appetizer, and the lasagna were absolutely delicious! Wife had the salmon and was thoroughly pleased with her meal as well. This will be my go-to Vegas restaurant for future visits, absolutely loved it. And that doesn't even speak for the service staff, they were absolutely excellent at what they do. Thank you for topping off and already fantastic night with Rascal Flatts!

I must admit I was skeptical due to the fact that many of the celebrity restaurants in Vegas are not worth the hype, but Buddy has a winner with this one! The food was delicious, the service was exceptional, knowledgeable, and entertaining, and the atmosphere is lots of fun.

We had the Cesar salad, pepperoni pizza, spaghetti and meatballs, and bread with olive oil and butter. The bread and salads came out first and we couldn't get enough, they were so good! We ordered more bread even though we had pizza and pasta coming. The pizza was crispy and the flavors really popped, and the spaghetti and meatballs were perfection. We had a table where we could see the strip out the window, which was very pleasant and surprisingly serene. Our waiter was truly Italian and a riot. He made our dining experience even more enjoyable. 

I definitely recommend Buddies and make sure to check out his bakery across the way!!!
First time here and the food/service was outstanding!  They cooked the pasta PERFECTLY and every item we got tasted delicious!  We will definitely come back!

I was very excited to try famous BuddyV restaurant and we arrived at happy hour time. Excellent food but very bad service. Hostess they do not communicate properly because we over waited for seat that while happy hour bar where was empty. We had to inquiry once more happy hour seat and were seated after some time. Food was excellent we took calamari,meat balls and meatballs sliders, 2 prosecco for great price of $4 each and we skip tiramisu due to slow service.

Food is so good, and the prices are reasonable...same prices as Italian chains. Service was excellent. My husband had the chicken parm and it pretty much melted in my mouth. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is because I wish there were more options on the menu, and options for gluten free individuals (besides salad).

Wow, did I say wow? WOW! As soon as you've put your order in. The order is at you're table! How do they do that??? Start off with fantastic meatballs. The rigatoni with red sauce was outstanding! The carbonara dish was out of this world. Would it be bad to say go ahead and lick the bowls at the end?

I'm a NY Italian living in Las Vegas. Most of the time I find it difficult to find great tasting Italian food like I've been accustomed to eating. My husband and I decided to try Buddy's for Easter dinner today. We started with the calamari which was perfectly fried. I usually prefer red sauce with mine, however, the sauce that came with it was really good. The slices of fried peppers were also a nice touch. For dinner I order the lasagna. It was so delicious and had a lot of great meats in it. I ended up bringing more than half of it home. My husband ordered the chicken parm which came with two large chicken breasts. We each had an iced tea and our bill was $80 and change. We skipped dessert and went across the way to Carlo's

This restaurant is the noisiest place in Las Vegas (the casino is quieter). 
There is absolutely NO option for a conversation, the wait staff is so rushed you get your food handed from all different directions and from different staff each time. 
There is NO atmosphere only a mad rush of feed and fee then flee. 
The food is mediocre to poor and sadly the dessert was the worst plate of all!
What a let down.

Was in Las Vegas for a conference and always try to stay at the Palazzo.  It is a very nice hotel with lots of restaurant choices.

One of my favorites is Buddy V's.  They have great traditional Italian food that is simply prepared with the best ingredients.  The flavors and quality of the food for the price is pretty incredible for anywhere, but especially in Las Vegas.

One of my favorite dishes is the Bucatini Carbonara.  It literally calls my name sometimes.  The best carbonara I have ever eaten is in Austin, TX at a place called La Traviata, but I digress.

Buddy V's Bucatini Carbonara is pretty amazing.  It has just the right mixture of flavors and with the richness of the sauce is just amazing.  I have to confess I was a little high maintenance and asked for a flat pasta (linguine).
 
My dinner Caesar salad was large, but as Caesar salad go, pretty uninspired.  Don't get me wrong, it was good, but it wasn't up to the level of the pasta dish.

The wine list was reasonable (for Las Vegas) with several good selections by the glass.  Since I was dining alone, a bottle seemed an overindulgence.

If you are anywhere near the Palazzo, Buddy V's is a must.  You need to eat this food.  The one star deduct is for the just average Caesar salad.  Everything else was great.

Visited this restaurant on a Sunday evening as a party of two. The maître de was accommodating to our needs and had very good suggestions in accordance with our likings. The service was cordial and quick and not pushy. Personally we tried garlic bread, cheese ravioli with a white sauce ,and a pasta al la vodka. The garlic bread had the perfect portions of additives making it a great addition to our meal. The ravioli with our requested white sauce tasted phenomenal. Great cheese blend with an accommodating white sauce that was buttery but not too heavy. The vodka sauce was a phenomenal mix and just the right portion of red to white. Customer service was great, we look forward to coming here again!

The food here was delicious! There were 5 of us and we all loved our dishes... the only reason I am knocking it down a star is because our actual server did nothing for us - the bus boy did everything! And then the server took his own tip. Instead of giving us our change, he kept was was left ...so unfortunately for him that's all he got! 

We will probably be back before our trip ends!
This place is so good. The meal I had was light and filling and the service was exceptional
I had the chicken parm which was good. My husband had the scallops and they were delicious!  Not to heavy, just right portions. The garlic cheese bread was very good. The service was great!

Let me start off by saying that the food was amazing! And the portion sizes are crazy.  I went here with a group for a friends birthday and she absolutely loved the place. We were all pleasantly suprised with the food. The reason I gave this place only four stars is because of the service. The staff there were really nice but at times were too attentive (refilling the water after a simple sip...wait till my cup is at least half gone). All in all though I loved the place and so did all of my friends. We will definately be going back there next time we are in Vegas!!!

Amazing Dining Experience!!!
Came to Las Vegas for our 30th Anniversary.  Used Yelp to pick a good restaurant near a concert venue in the Venetian.  
The waiter, Giorgio, was incredible.  Recommended the couples special that consisted of two appetizers, two/ three main courses and a dessert tray.  
Apps- meatballs and a meat and cheese sampling was a meal onto itself.  
Main Courses- Beef tenderloin in a red wine reduction, over mashed potatoes. Wow!
Grilled Sea Bass and Rigatoni. Unbelievable!!!
Finally, a tray of pure delight!!
Cookie Dough Gelato, Molten Chocolate Cake, Canoli and Tiramisu!! 
This place is so good!!
Do yourself a favor and ask for Giorgio, he makes the experience complete!!

Our party of 7 wanted to eat here after the NCAA tournament basketball games and we were seated sooner than promised on a busy Saturday and st patty's day evening   .  Service was outstanding and food is delicious!  We had pizza, chicken Parmesan( very tender and large serving)  , eggplant Parmesan ( crispy and perfect!)  and Sunday sauce with rigatoni  which my husband loved !   Focaccia bread with olive oil was a great starter.  Definitely recommend and will return next year!
Absolutely amazing!! The spaghetti and meatballs and chicken parm were the best I have ever had! The Nutella cake was chocolate heaven!!

I chose Buddy V's for our 10 year anniversary reception dinner. We were a group of 12 people including two young kids and a preteen. When we arrived for our 6:30pm reservation, we were asked to go to the bar and wait for the table however once we all started to walk into the bar, the receptionist saw we had our two small kids with us and said that the kids could not be in the bar area. She told us to wait a few minutes and she would have the table rushed to get ready. A few minutes later it was ready, and we sat down at a nice large rectangular table near the open kitchen. At the time, I didn't think twice about the 'go to the bar' hand off but now that I am writing the review, I realize that this was mostly likely a way for them to get us to spend some additional money. 
Anyway, we sat and we chose to do the family style dining. Everything tasted amazing, the food just kept coming out. I waitress told me the chefs knew how much to serve, but it was clearly too much. A shame really, as a lot of it was boxed up but we were all staying in hotels with no available space in the frig (all weight sensitive booze filled frigs). I would recommend order your own dishes, according to your group appetite, and then share it all. Every dish we had was excellent. Meatballs, lasagna, pasta, sea bass all excellent.

Very pleasantly surprised.  Granted, my friends and I stopped by just for a light lunch, so we didn't have any entrees.  But the eggplant parm appetizier, garlic bread and panzanella salad were superb!

We wanted to try their happy hour, unfortunately when we went here last weekend around 515 pm the hostess said we need a reservation they are expecting 400 something reserved guests so they can't accommodate us. So I'm like it must be really good. I just find it weird when the time we tried to check in, the place isn't crowded inside there are even opened seats outside. So we decided to go the next day for their weekend bunch. It was a bit pricey $34.95 including drinks. Our server was nice and very attentive. Selection was not that many but it is a good food. The tomato basil soup was superb. Their apple sausage was tasty. I like how they have a small portions for kids meal too. I was able to get  Reese chocolate. I was a big fan of sweets so dessert is big deal for me. They have red velvet cake and bread pudding not to sweet but it was good.

Pizza and mimosa lunch perfect after a wild night . 
Terminando with a delicious cannoli. 
Fantastico!

So I never watched the Cake Boss and only ended up at Buddy V's because they had space for our party during a busy Saturday night.  We were seated at the worst possible table in the restaurant right up in the front and the hostess wouldn't budge when I asked to be moved after I saw a lot of tables available since it was 9:30pm (strike 1).  Our waiter was fast talking and nice but he really tried his best to have us order more than we wanted and actually charged us for a salad which he said was going to give us compliments of the house and then forgot all about his promise at the end of the dinner (strike 2).  Those two experiences were the true reason why I brought the score down because the food (except for the salmon) was very fresh and delicious.  
Charred Octopus-amazingly good
Panzanella Salad-fresh combination of flavors
Seared Salmon-overcooked and dry (strike 3).
Buddy V's is a very large and pretty modern restaurant with decent prices but the little incidences along the way had me leaving on a sour note.

Awesome! We had the Brunch Buffet. My wife and I were pleasantly surprised when we came upon Buddy V's on accident. We just so happened to come during a time they were offering the buffet. I did not find a single thing offered that wasn't excellent! The service was prompt and helpful and the selections were tended to regularly so everything was fresh. Make your way here if you find yourself in the area, you will not be disappointed!

My wife and I was at Buddy V'S on 10/3/14 I had Lasagna, which was good but it could of been better with more red sauce, the portion was great the price was high 27.00, the Focaccia bread was outstanding, they put us right in front of where they cook and there was a lot of noise, our server did a great job!!

This place was fabulous !!! Our waiter was Giorgio and he was FABULOUS !! The food was also very amazing to top off the nice service! My friend and I had the bottomless mimosas/bellinis and our amazing waiter made sure our glasses were never empty! The food was amazing, as well as the desserts, my favorite was the cannoli, chicken parm, Mac & cheese and pasta salad ! Would recommend this place for anyone visiting Vegas! This was a great ending to our great vacation!
