My wife and I decided to drop in Saturday night to see if we can get a table without a reservation.  Unfortunately they were booked for the night, but the hostess asked if we'd like to sit at a high top at the bar.  Since they offered the full menu we readily agreed.  Within minutes of sitting down we had waters and our waitress greeted us.  The service was great and she happily gave recommendations.  We started with the calamari and it was excellent, the fried anahiem peppers were a great counterpoint to the calamari, which was cooked excellently.  I ordered  the chicken parm and my wife had the chicken picata.  My chicken parm was delicious!  It was two chicken breasts fried to perfection topped with mozeralla and a side of spaghetti with marinara.  I'm very picky about my marinara, I can't  stand when it's sweet, and this was done really well.  Very savory and went perfect with the chicken.  My wife's picata was cooked wonderfully as well but was lacking in the citrus.  She asked for a plate of lemons and was able to season to get desire.  We finished off the meal with a lobster tail dessert.  The pastry was beautifully done, the cream rich and smooth, and the berries tasted very fresh.  

All in all it was a great meal, my only gripe was the decor / ambiance.  It was like they couldnt figure out what they wanted to be.  The decor was that of a nice italian restaurant, low lighting and dark wood.  But their menus looked so cheesy like something from Farrels and the busers all wore bright red shirts but the hostesses wore little black dresses.  They need to go either elegant or cheesy, either would be fine but straddling the line is kinda weird.

This review is only for my pre-shopping Sunday drink experience :) I was just about to order a mimosa and the bartender was pouring what looked like a fresh pink-ish juice of some sort then topping with champagne. I asked what it was and she told me white peach juice. I had her make me a drink with the juice and it was delicious. She was very generous with the champagne and I really appreciated that. I hate paying for a drink of mostly juice. My mom and I had a couple of them and took off to do some shopping. 

I'd love to return to eat the brunch buffet because it looked delicious.

I do not like being cheated out of my money, and sadly, guys, that's exactly what they did to me here. This is the first time I have stopped by in years after claiming they have the best tiramisu. It was so HUGE. And now.....it comes in a mini mason jar. 

I understand businesses have to make money, but some dishes and desserts have become painfully small and remained at expensive prices, which is just plain sad. 

Furthermore, they try to trick you into paying for water now. Instead of offering tap water like they used to, they get rid of the option in their speech. 
--SO if you DON'T want to pay for nestle water, and they say "Still or Sparkling?"...SAY TAP. Don't pay for water unless you really want to. Because that is just a damn waste of $10 folks. 

They never used to trick me before, so I was totally not expecting this. I can't even rate them like I normally do, because I was so mad. 

The big points are: 
1) Their food is just average, so just skip it. 
2) The dessert is the better part of the meal, so if you want some, just go to Carlo's Bakery. 
3) They do have really good service, but they tricked me, so that was a little messed up since they didn't used to do that. It's totally what you expect restaurants that serve $80 per head to do. If you're going to do that, can't you at least do it during the more expensive dinner time?

I'm pretty mad, so it'll be a while when I come back, if ever.

We love the food, but today the service was terrible! The chicken parm is FANTASTIC! My husband loves the meatballs and the kids swear the pizza is the best. Usually the service is wonderful, but for whatever reason today the server was totally inattentive. Luckily the food is so good, we will come back.

I have been here every time I visit Vegas because we like it that much. The food is your typical italian food, but so much better tasting. I always get the three course meal they offer for $40 a person. It gives you some pretty good options for the appetizer, main dish, and dessert. The chicken parm is by far my favorite. The portion sizes are relatively large too which is great! Also, the service was fantastic as usual and we are never forgotten for too long. While it can be a pricey meal it is worth the food and restaurant setting. I would recommend trying this place on your visit to Vegas.
Great service.  Excellent seat by window on Strip.  Super low lighting only negative.  Great value.  Mains are huge.  We shared.

Good food. Good service. Nice restaurant. Not much to complain about. The service was great. Our server was very nice, kept our waters filled and really seemed like he knew what he was talking about. The restaurant was very nice, good atmosphere. We came for lunch so it wasn't so busy so it was nice and peaceful. The food was good. The tomato sauce tasted a little canned but we only had 1 dish with sauce on it so over all it was good. Dessert was good as well. The tiramisu tasted very authentic. Over all a very nice restaurant.
I had brunch here and it was just ok. Not great and not bad. The service was good and the food was average.

Booked a reservation for my anniversary here, they sat us by a wall in the bar. In the bar?? Really!!?? We couldn't get a regular table or booth after booking a reservation? On top of that I mentioned that is was a special occasion as I booked and they never made any mention of it or brought out dessert for us. Service was awful, food was almost too salty to eat and way overpriced for the quality. I was extremely disappointed and embarrassed for taking my fiance here on our special day. Will never ever return!!
Delicious food! I had the chicken rigatoni and it blew me away! The canoli shells were incredibly flaky and rivaled my grandma's.

I am a baker, I love watching Buddy's Baking Show. I had to come here. Omg! I had the best Cannoli ever. Pure heaven. Hell if I could only work here, lol ... Love the bakery and next time around I definitly have to eat here. I cant wait to come back. Friendly employees and good customer service.

Stumbled upon this place by accident and it was absolutely amazing! My boyfriend and I actually went twice when we were in town for the week. The calamari appetizer was tasty to start. The shrimp scampi is awesome and the gravy with rigatoni is delicious! Great service and atmosphere as well!

Great atmosphere!! The waitress, Deanna was awesome. She was very helpful, gave a great recommendation for what we were hungry for and kept our glasses full.  The piano and band were very good in the background adding to the ambiance. We definitely recommend this place to anyone. Prices were fantastic compared to other places we ate at. We will be back for sure!  Thanks Deanna for making it a successful dinner!!!
Awesome all around. The food is amazing. Service spectacular and view is perfect. I give my highest rating and will come every time I am in Vegas.

If I could give this place more than 5 stars I would. The food was amazing and our server was excellent! Georgio was absolutely incredible. He made dinner so much fun and even sang me happy birthday in Italian! He was awesome! I will definitely be back!

Amazing!! Everything is delicious! We had the salmon, cheese ravioli, shrimp scampi, chicken piccata and Caesar salad. The sauce is perfect. Service was quick and friendly. We only had to wait 30ish minutes. All in all a great experience.

We were at a party in the bar.  There were many foods laid out and an open bar.  The bartenders were up beat and helpful.  They never seemed stressed or impatient even though they were going full steam with many customers.  They took the time needed with each customer to serve them professionally with kindness.  
The bar area is open with easy access from the inside shopping area of the casinos.  There is adequate seating.  It is clean and the food is good. Everyone at the party seemed to be pleased.

Food is fresh, served quickly and delicious. I had the free range chicken which was good; but that was it. The potatoes, mushrooms and artichokes served with it were very little. My mom had the chicken Parmesan and it had pasta and two huge pieces of chicken. Much better value at a dollar less than the free range.

Who's not a fan of Buddy V? I drool over the eye candy on Cake Boss (the food eye candy!).  When I realized that Buddy brought Jersey to Vegas, I couldn't wait to try it. It's difficult to find a restaurant on the strip that has character, good food, and great service. Buddy V's has all three. We made reservations on a weekday evening and the restaurant was about 3/4 full. The ambiance was casual with an upscale Italian vibe; translation: fine dining without leaving a hole in your pocket. Win Win. There were two people taking care of our table, so we got double the attention and service. Both our waiter and waitress were friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered "My Wife's Eggplant Parm" as an appetizer and chicken rigatoni alla vodka and Nonna's lasagna al forno as our mains. 

My Wife's Eggplant Parm- clever! I like how Buddy gives cred to those who deserve it. The eggplant parm was pretty much a tower of crispy goodness. Eggplant, melted mozzarella, tomato parm, eggplant, melted mozzarella, tomato, parm...you get the picture. The eggplant was had a nice crunch and the melty cheese and tart tomato sauce were a delicious combo. I'm using to a more traditional baked eggplant parm as opposed to the deep fried dish that was served. Don't get me wrong, it was delicious, but I was missing the deep flavors of the eggplant that was fried away. 

Chicken rigatoni alla vodka- rigatoni, pancetta, grilled chicken swimming in a decadent tomato cream sauce was heaven. I really enjoyed the creaminess of this dish. The sauce was a perfect combination of flavors (it's all about the sauce). This pancetta was a nice touch of smokiness. Super filling, you will have leftovers! 

Nonna's lasagna al forno- YES. CHEESY, MEATY, traditional lasagna with a ton of flavor. This hefty lasagna had Italian sausage, beef and pork, ricotta cheese, mozzarella, provolone and parmesan baked to perfection. Four types of cheeses people. It was cheesy. If you are looking for a classic and delicious lasagna, look no further. The only thing I was missing was a bit of sweetness in the tomato sauce. Otherwise, I would absolutely order this item again. Totally big enough to split. 

I truly enjoy traditional Italian food. Big portions, big flavors and lots of sauce. Warning, you will be in a food coma after you finish your meal. Come with an empty belly and be prepared to eat. We had a ton of leftovers which is what should happen when you go out for Italian food. I enjoyed the decor of the restaurant, the ambiance, as well as the service. We let our waitress know that we were on a time crunch, and she got us in and out of the restaurant in no time with full bellies and smiles on our faces. This restaurant was closer to Palazzo then Venetian and somewhat of a mission to find, but we found it and we were glad we did. A very solid option of casual Italian food in the heart of LV.

An unexpectedly good place to eat, we didn't really have a look online on where to eat, just went to the casino and picked a restaurant. We didn't realise it belonged to that 'Buddy' from the TLC cake boss until we sat down. There was virtually no wait at all and we got a table within minutes. The service was wonderful and the staff seemed well organised and knew what they were doing. We were given fresh bread to start off with, just like an authentic Italian resturant. Then we ordered the Sunday gravy and the mac and cheese. Both dishes were full of flavour and was delicious! It was a perfect amount of food for 2 people, however it was such a shame we couldn't squeeze dessert in.

Came here on a Friday night with reservations. The service is excellent. The servers and employees are very welcoming and check in on you. As for the food, my wife and I both had the prix fixe menu for $40/person which include an appetizer, entree, and desert. I had mama's meatballs and the chicken Parmesan, along with the tiramisu. All of the food was out of this world. My wife had the Caesar salad, chicken Parmesan, and Canoli. She really enjoyed the food. Also, I should mention that the restaurant overlooks the strip and has an awesome view. Come here. It is reasonably priced with great service and awesome Italian food.

Solid Italian food.

I had the lasagne which was delicious. My wife the chicken picatta.  She loved the pasta but thought the chicken was just ok.  They only give you one piece of bread at a time, would be nice to have a basket of bread on the table instead of having to ask everytime you ate the one piece they served you. 

Ordered the meatballs for an appetizer, they were very good.

Overall a nice meal at a decent price.

I'm always down for Italian as a safe favorite. After a long day of traveling, we weren't really sure what we wanted, and Buddy V's had availability on a Friday night. 
I got the dinner deal that came with an app, entree, and dessert, while my BF got pasta with vodka sauce. 
The Caesar salad was fantastic! The croutons were the best croutons I have ever had. They were piping hot with soft centers. 
My chicken parm was apparently the thing to get (I listened to everyone else's suggestions). It was so much food and very tasty. 
My BF's pasta with vodka sauce was good, but he said it tasted like a dish you could get anywhere. Nothing too special 
The tiramisu for dessert was good, and had little shortbread cookies for dipping. 

Overall, I liked the ambiance and location (within the Venetian), but it wasn't anything super standout. Should've just stuck with his cake shop across the hall!

I had a couple of friends in town to celebrate a 21st birthday. We tried a few options; the club, people watching, etc but it wasn't living up to The Experience (although I am local) for my friends. We ended up stopping by at Buddy V's and Joy, the bartender there, completely turned our night around... From her wonderful personality to the detail she put into creating and explaining our cocktails - THAT is what Vegas is about. The experience. We didn't plan on being there last night but we spent a good 2-3 hours there having a wonderful time and joy ended up giving my friend the experience we were all looking to get.

Buddy V's is a great Vegas strip experience.  The Brunch is fantastic , and a window seat for people watching is a fun way to chill out while you sample their unlimited drink option. We tried the sangria with brandy and fresh fruit, the pomegranate mimosa, and the Bloody Mary with a full condiment station. All were superlative, we sampled them over and over.

The brunch is done buffet style but with small trays that are refilled  frequently.  The antipasto/charcuterie table is outstanding we selected a great blue cheese variant, prosciutto, shrimp, focaccia and cheesy bread. The chef's corner entrees were fantastic, the standouts were the mac n' cheese carbonara, Sunday eggs, and crepes with in-house whipped cream and an amazing compote that was entirely comprised of fresh berries. The carving station had delicious sausages and a sumptuous slab bacon that was more like pork belly. At most brunch buffets the deserts are so-so but this is the cake boss's place so they were all incredible the exceptional items were the cannoli, zeppoli, and Italian cookies platter. 

The service was friendly and accommodating regardless of how busy the restaurant became.

Came for my mother's birthday. Let me tell you about my mother:
- She was born in Calabria, Italy
- Loves Italian food (given), but almost never goes out for Italian food since we have it with family often and her standards are high.
- She does not like to spend money, everything is compared to a cheaper alternative and rarely thinks money is well spent at restaurants. 

Our waiter hyped up the family style dining experience, which we usually do on our own. The fact they had a program to do so was great to hear, and it did not disappoint.

The food was amazing. Exceeded all of our expectations. We had a great spread that really covered all the bases from the menu. One dish was better than the next.

The waiter, Georgio, was the best in the business. I've eaten at great restaurants around the world and had great service but he was truly world class and made the night. He was funny and entertaining but did not overdue it. Sometimes you get a funny or personable waiter who you like but they are too busy chatting they forget a request or get distracted, but not Georgio. He even sang happy birthday to my mother in Italian which really was the icing on the cake. 

It was a night to remember, thank you to Buddy V's for making it special!

We walked and walked and walked and walked..... this place is hard to find! After going on a mission to find this spot for something sweet - my two friends said it all looks like supermarket bakery items and didn't order- wtf? We worked too hard to get here! I ordered a hazelnut mini cream puff (about $3 or $4 I don't remember exactly- a little pricey for its size but not crazy). The ordering part sucks ballls! You order with one person then another bags it up, while you wait on yet another line to pay then another to pick up.  There were only 4 people in front of me and this ordeal took 20 minutes! This is where they lost a star.  I finally got my little golden chocolate hazelnut nugget- and OMG!! So good.  Worth all the hassle- I didn't even share with my friends- who judged this pastry by its cover.

I am a fan of the Cake Boss and was excited to come here. A bit hidden in the Shops at the Canal This has place delicious authentic Italian food. We did not have to wait to be seated, with a view of The Strip. The service was great. And the food exceeded every expectation we had. We started with the tomato and basil soup and was so good that we wanted to order some more (and I'm not a tomato soup person). We ordered the chicken rigatoni "alla vodka" and it tasted amazing. It was rich and creamy. We also got the roasted sea bass with arugula salad and it was a great choice too. We went big on desserts with the Italian birthday cake, a layered sponge cake, YUM! And the lobster tail also great. If you want rich Italian food with an Italian feel don't look any further. He also has the Carlos Bakery across from here. Didn't get a chance to go but the pastries looked delish.

So let me just start by saying the food here is amazing.  The drinks are meh, but the pasta was DELISH!

The reason why my review is so low is because our server sucked.  I'm not some snooty restaurant goer either.  I used to work in a restaurant, so I know how it's not hard to be an okay server.  However, that being said, we were there for a Bachelorette dinner, and we had maybe 2 small interactions with our waiter.  He was extremely show, didn't check on us once, but decided to charge us extra for some souvenir cups we didn't ask for and failed to inform us that a smaller bottle of water was $10 each.  We waited for 30 min after we were done eating for him to come by to us and check if we wanted anything else or our bill.  Horrible service and really disapointed about this restaurant as I'm a huge Cake Boss and Buddy fan.  If the service improves by a lot, then I'll be back, but until then, I'd rather be checking out other restaurants on the strip.

This is the first time I didn't bite into a tiny pice of rock in my clam linguine  The service was excellent. I would tell my friends who like to eat to come here.  Buddy's bakery is right across from the restaurant. Yum yum. .

This food is like Ragu.  Really, I am losing trust in Vegas yelpers.  :P
I got the special sauce with meat, the one with lamb, meatballs, sausage in sauce which came with some type of tube pasta.  The sauce was so bland.  Maybe add some oregano, basil, less tomato paste, I don't really know what it is.  The lamb was okay, the balls were okay, the sausage wasn't bad.  The pasta was nothing special.  Though if you go, hubby enjoyed the chicken parmesan, so give that a go.  We didn't stay for dessert, I wasn't feelin' it.

But the waitress was fantastic!  She was really polite and I noticed she had a rude customer and she kept smiling.  The drinks were okay, the bread was eh and the Cesar salad was heavily dressed, but wasn't bad.  I enjoyed the croutons in the salad.

Disappointed. Went in for Happy Hour. Sat down and waited. No one approached for almost 10 minutes and then only to tell us us the table we were at wasn't for Happy Hour. We moved to the bar and sat for another ten minutes. Bartender was not around when he did come into view,
He never looked our way ignoring us completely. We finally gave up and left. It wasn't that busy to not even be acknowledged! Too bad!

Visited the Ristorante for my daughter's birthday. The food was excellent. I had the eggplant parmigiana. The ambiance was great. I really enjoyed the feel of the place. It was a bit loud, yet i enjoyed the hustle and bustle around me. It added to the character of the place. The only issue that I had was that our waiter was not very attentive. On arrival, we had him store a birthday cake that we bought at Carlo's Bakery so that we can sing happy birthday and have the cake for dessert. It took the a very long time to take out order and being our drinks. The food took even longer. He did not stop by our table to check on our refills or if we needed anything. We had to flag him down each time we needed something. It seemed like we were in the restaurant forever because the service was so slow. We could no longer wait on him so we asked for our cake and decided to bring it back to the hotel.  Other than that, I loved everything about the place and plan on visiting again.

Great dinner tonight. The service was excellent as was the food. Lately, whenever we go for Italian I order chicken piccata and tonight was no exception. It was delicious. My daughter enjoyed her "Mac and cheese" and my hubby loved his sea bass. Our server suggested a wine which was great and the cannoli for dessert was one of the best we've ever had. I would definitely return and recommend!

The cheese ravioli was good. Service wasn't great. Our server Peter J seemed pretty put out by us being there. Never got the Pepsi I ordered. He catered to the other tables and made us feel very unwelcome.

The food was good. The child's cheese pizza was big and delicious. The chicken piccata had a great white wine sauce and the capers were delicious. My wife enjoyed the chicken Parmesan and couldn't finish the lunch portion. The price was decent for Vegas (lunch, about $17 per person). 

The only reason it didn't score higher was the service was VERY slow. We had to ask for water multiple times and generally had to follow up with our waitress quite a bit. 

We would come back again.
Boring average Italian food that lacked adequate service.  There are much better places to spend your vacation dollars.

I have eaten here twice and have been very impressed both times! The service was great!
The food is amazing. Best pizza ever. The crust is the perfect combination of soft and crisp. Tomato sauce has just enough spice. My kids, who aren't sausage lovers, thought the sausage was amazing!

I have also had the vegetable salad which has just a little lettuce and TONS of vegetables. The steak - tender, juicy!

I can't wait to return!

Absolutely amazing food, ate here two nights in a row because it was THAT good!

Sunday Gravy is incredible, sorry to say but better than my mom and grandmas...and I'm Italian!
Garlic Bread is killer!

Excellent place to get authentic Italian, service is great and vibe is not stuffy like most Vegas celebrity restaurants. 

Lobster tail for desert!!

Great dinner with the family to celebrate moms bday in Vegas.  After walking and shopping in the Venetian we opted for Buddy's so that we can get Carlo's bakery cannoli's right after. The restaurant was beautifully decorated with various seating options. We were seated in a quieter room next to a window that overlooked the strip!! We started off with sangria to share and calamari! The calamari was flavorful and crisp! Even the cut lemons were edible! The sangria was perfect with our pasta, fish, and steak dinner.  I couldn't decide between red sauce or clams so our server was kind enough to get me a side of pomodoro sauce.  My dad enjoyed his steak that was cooked evenly throughout with a nice semi glaze.  My moms salmon was seasoned well and my sisters chicken picante was tender.  Overall, a great dinner in a beautiful setting!
We've been here twice. Once for happy hour and the other for Sunday Brunch. Both times the food and service were amazing!! Definitely would recommend!

Not bad considering the expectations - mine were a little on the lower side based on Buddy's Cake Boss background. Pretty fast and friendly service -bussers were always making sure you don't go thirsty. Portion sizes are on the larger side, but leftover pasta is always great. The sunday gravy special is pretty solid, perfect for a meat lover - spicy sausage, pork, meatballs. Rigatoni and the sauce were pretty good. Orrechiete sausage pasta had good texture and flavor as well. For dessert the warm nutella cake was their most popular- it was great. Cannoli was unfortunately not as tasty and had a strong cinnamon flavor that somehow reminded us of Fireball whiskey - not that pleasant. Overall not bad, not great. 
3.75/5.

Went specifically for the creekstone farms burger. It was a decent burger. It didn't amaze me neither did it disappoint. Cooked medium like I requested and it was juicy with some nice greasiness. I appreciated the grilled brioche bun and the nice melty cheese. Their tomato aioli (cough mayo) added very little. The burger could prolly use a stronger compliment to the meat and cheese. The Parmesan dusted fries paired well with the burger. Overall I was pretty happy with it. Also happy with as many restaurants using creekstone farms as possible.

Loved this restaurant! My friend and I came here for dinner on my birthday weekend before going to see Mysteré across the street. We had the garlic cheese bread as an appetizer, which was AMAZING. Seriously we both moaned upon the first bite. For my main entrée, I got the Chicken Rigatoni and it was soooo good! The portion size was perfect and the pasta was very delicious! For dessert I got the italian donuts which were also delicious! My favorite was the strawberry one, but the chocolate was a close second! Our server was awesome too, he was very attentive and we never went too long without seeing him. I would definitely come back to Buddy V's!

Food here was fantastic. We came here last minute without a reservation. The wait was about 30 minutes, but we were able to get seated at the bar right away. 

Service was good and the bartender was friendly. The Nutella lava cake was probably one of the best desserts I've ever had.

Minus one star for high prices, and small portions.

Dont overlook this as a celebrity chef-outrageous hotel hyped prices. The service was alright but the food is really good, with prices reasonable! I split the orrechiate and the portions were large despite splitting it. The pasta was some of the best Ive had and the side fries were really good too. Overall, I paid $25 for dinner which is not bad at all for Vegas dinner prices.

Seeing as my awesome bf let me drag him into all of the restaurants I wanted to go while we were in Vegas when he said he wanted Italian food for brunch on Sunday I gladly obliged.

They had a buffet set up and for $34.95 we got to choose from an array of antipasto, pasta, meats, soups and desserts. We also took the option for all you can drink for only $16.95 additional which included peach Bellini, mimosas, sangria, domestic beer and wine. 

I took full advantage of the cheese board/antipasto area and filled my plate with prosciutto, salami, Gorgonzola, pecorino and focaccia bread. The marinated olive mix with peppers was delicious! Must try this. Also grabbed some iced peel and eat shrimp that had a nice spice to them that I wasn't expecting, but enjoyed. 

Chicken parm was a bit soggy from sitting in the hot tray unfortunately. Orecchiette and sausage pasta was simple, but great and probably my favorite thing. 

Loved the Italian sausage, did not really like the chicken apple sausage. 

Tiramisu was awesome. Cannolis were just ok in my book. 

Great place for families to dine and well worth the price tag for the brunch buffet.

We went to Buddy B's for their Sunday Brunch to celebrate my  birthday. It was fun and delicious! $35 for the buffet that had an antipasto station, carving station, dessert station, breakfast and lunch station and a kids station. Then there we bottomless mimosas, bellinis, sangria and beer for $15! And bottomless bloody mary's with a do it yourself bar for $16! Non-alcoholic beverages were included. Everything was delicious! My favorite was the pasta carbonara. We will definitely be coming back!

Buddy V's wins for best happy hour on the Strip! The bartender was super helpful and fast. The portions for HH aren't that large but allow for a taste of a variety of options. We had the meatballs, calamari, ricotta and polenta-all delicious! The sangria was AMAZING! If I was eating on just the HH it would have received five stars!

After HH we sat down and had dinner. The majority of the courses were excellent. I didn't like how the waiter pushed more food than was necessary. I also had the veal piccata and it wasn't that good. Eating starved baby cows only happens once a year for me and it wasn't worth it on that meal. The cheesy garlic bread was very delicious. I would definitely return for the HH but probably wouldn't eat in the main restaurant.

I recommend stopping here if you want some Italian, in Las Vegas. It's located by the Shops in the Venetian.

We both got the Prix Fixe and it was so good! It seemed a little pricey at $40/person, but for what you get, it's better deal than you would think at first glance. 

The complimentary bread they bring for you to dip in oil & vinegar is as a type of a focaccia, so delicious. I don't care for Balsamic vinegar, so the waitress kindly brought some marinara for me, and that sauce was perfect. I chose the panzanella side salad, which was so huge and packed with goodness. They didn't just throw some salad mix on a plate! Very fresh, croutons made in-house and packed with flavor. The cheese, the tossed-in dressing, all in perfect proportion to the greens. Also noted that they halved the grape tomatoes, which is a sign to me that they pay attention to detail. (I love the taste, but hate biting into a whole grape tomato and having it burst.) 

As entree, I had the Bucatini Carbonara, which is a dish I am super picky about, and it was the best I've ever had! Pasta was perfect and I could have easily saved half, if I was a little less hungry, or it was less delicious. As it was, there was such a generous portion, I didn't finish it. 

My guy had Orecchiette and Italian Sausage. It looked lovely, and had some red peppers, broccolini, roasted tomatoes, and the spicy Italian sausage. Really, all the flavors he loves. I tried a bite, and it was fantastic. 

The wine  Paolo Scovino Dolcetta d'Alba 2013- was great pairing with pasta, just enough sweet and mild acidity and richness to be a wonderful accompaniment to the meal. It's a variety I hadn't tried before, so I have a new love. 

Tiramisu was beautiful and flavorful, not too much of any of the ingredients, and a couple of lady fingers on the side. My guy finished his cannoli in about 3 minutes, as well, so I'm assuming he liked it. 

All in all, Excellent! We were stuffed and happy, and the service was attentive and friendly.

I'm sorry,  a restaurant of this calibre and it ran out of honey to serve with tea....  Unacceptable.  Oh yes,  I forgot to mention that no milk was served with coffee... It had to be asked for after trying to hunt down the server.. 

Although this may seem like a small thing the attitude of the server goes a far way to contribute to the star rating given. 

The whole experience was marred with slow service,  inefficiency and smacked of a back street joint rather than the upmarket restaurant it is supposed to be. 

Guys it is the small things that that matter,  big name but small on performance....  Won't be back!

Best value for lunch.  Appetizer, main corse and dessert for $22. For the Venetian or anywhere on the strip it was a great deal and very good food. I had Caesar salad, carbonara pasta and tiramisu - all great. My friend had salad, pizza and cannoli - again excellent.  Service was good also.

This was hands down one of the top places I've ever eaten. Amazing food, beautiful cozy and inviting atmosphere and the service was phoenomial to say the least! I believe our servers name was Georgio? Not positive on the name but he was spectacular! SUPER friendly, helped us find great drink and food choices based on what we were looking for. Answered  every question we had thoroughly, he was quick and effiecient, even made us laugh and took a picture for us before we left! Of course knowing this is the 'Cake Boss' restaurant, needless to say the dessert was on point. The drinks...they were certainly not messing around with a lack of alcohol but it wasn't so much to ruin the flavor of the drink! With their current special, depending on what drink you get, you can take the glass home. Overall lovely experience and I wish we had on in Kansas City!

Stopped by the bar for a quick drink. Joy, the bartender, was awesome! Best customer service in the whole casino hands down. Oh and not to mention she makes a hell of a drink. I told her to get me whatever and I was not disappointed. She knows her way around a bar inside and out. Not only was she great, the whole restaurant was amazing. Very relaxing, and a great view if you get a window table. I recommend this place to anyone going to the strip looking for a relaxing time with superb individuals!

Made a reservation and was given the worst table there! Stuck at a small table when there was plenty of seating. This angered my bf who preceded to order something small for the both of us. Food was good but restaurant seating sucked!!

My first Buddy V's experience was truly amazing! It was Sunday Brunch so I was expecting the typical all you can eat eggs and bacon. There was nothing typical about the fabulous offerings. 

First the all you can drink package included way more variety than what you usually get at a "champagne brunch". The options included certain wine, beer, bloody marys, mimosas, sangria AND bellinis. We ended up trying almost everything and I can't say a bad word about any of it. The fruit was so fresh and delicious in the sangria and the red wine and champagne were top quality. 

 The service was prompt and the waiters and bussers were extremely attentive. Our glasses were never empty, our table was never dirty. The staff was also helpful in making sure we knew where everything was and offered suggestions on the food and drinks. 

Speaking of food... The first thing I noticed was that the food was put out in small batches to keep everything fresh. You could really taste the freshness. The Italian offerings were obviously great and I couldn't believe the antipasto area. Everything was so delicious from the fresh, perfectly cooked shrimp to the very flavorful meatballs. I barely left room for dessert. I was able to take one little bite of most things and well... there are no words!

I can't wait to go back

Great Place to eat!
My husband and I were staying at the Venetian and stopped in Buddy V's for lunch. 
I would highly recommend this place, reasonable prices and amazing food!
The server and hostess were so sweet I asked their names and it was Joy and Emily. So friendly and made great suggestions. 
Next time we are in Vegas this is a must for us!
You will not be disappointed or feel ripped off with the prices!

The Bottom Line: A bustling restaurant with dim lightning, large plates, and good service make this a great place to bring friends.

Try:
Spaghetti Pomodoro
Chicken Rigatoni Alla Vodka

Pro:
While the restaurant is usually quite lively, they separate the tables out in a way that makes conversation possible, which is usually an afterthought nowadays. The service was quick and practically invisible, which can be good or bad, depending on your preference.

The food itself was simple, solid Italian. You won't be disappointed, nor will you be blown away. It's a safe choice for a good evening out.

Con:
If you have a large party, you'll have to be split up amongst several tables.

Ate at Buddy V's for lunch yesterday. Ordered the calamari and Garlic bread for appetizer. The bread was crispy and cheesy, it was good. Calamari was big and the jalapeños in it gave it a nice flavor. My husband ordered the meatball sub. The meatballs were lacking a little flavor and I would have liked more cheese, but the sauce had good flavor and the roll it came on was soft. I ordered the chicken piccata. I really liked it. The chicken was pounded thin and the sauce was a little thick and it was the perfect mixture of lemon and capers. I LOVED the Italian birthday cake! It was vanilla cake with a chocolate filling and there was cannoli filling too. It was to die for. It was not overly sweet either and it's definitely big enough to share, but I wouldn't...;)
I really liked the lasagna!  Very nicely done!  The chocolate molten lava cake was to die for too!!!

Decided to have Italian on a Friday night and made reservations.  It was painless and pleasant.  

We were seated promptly at the reservation time and greeted for drinks and water immediately.  I also noticed some plastic packages on the table that resembled chopstick containers and discovered they were mini breadsticks.  Yum.   

We ordered salads and the calamari appetizer and they also brought out complimentary bread and olive oil.  Everything was perfect as was the Pino Noir and Cabernet we were drinking.  

For the meals everyone tried different dishes which were almost all shared by the time the dinner was over.  We had eggplant parmigiana, chicken parmigiana, spaghetti and meatballs and cheese ravioli.  Everything was spot on and delicious. 

I finished my meal off with an espresso and two others shared a butterscotch creme brûlée.  As expected everything was perfect.  

As you may see from my reviews, I eat out often and across the globe.  This meal, service, ambiance and decor were as good as it gets.  Me and my 3 other guests all had a memorable time and will be back again.  If I can complain about anything, it would be that they should have linen table cloths on the tables instead of the rustic looking wood surface.  

Enjoy!

Probably the best tasting Italian restaurant I have ever been to! We ordered the Panzenella salad, shrimp scampi and chicken parm, and everything was delicious. The chicken was served with a side of spaghetti which totally redefined how incredibly tasty spaghetti can be.
The staff and servers were friendly and professional, the atmosphere was upscale yet casual, and I fully intend to return the next time I visit Las Vegas. One word of advice: Bring coats as they keep the air conditioning at a very uncomfortably cold temperature.

First time visitor to this restaurant. I'm Italian, I've travelled the world eating amazing food and I will admit right away, my dining experience was average. First time ever I was not offered bread in an Italian restaurant. I ordered grilled salmon and a side of capellini with "tons of garlic".  The salmon was on a bed of cold, uncooked vegetable. Really? I had to send the $7.00 side of capellini back because they forgot to put any garlic in it.  My wine (Super Tuscan) was very good but I don't appreciate drinking a $16.00 glass of wine out of a cheap ass wine glass. Have you heard of crystal wine glasses? Given all of the options in Vegas, I would not come back. First time ever I was not offered bread in an Italian restaurant.

Did you know the owner of this place is like a famous chef or baker or something? Yea, I didn't know either....but I was schooled by my boyfriend's 60-something year old mom. Learn something new everyday!

Our party of 8 came here around 10:30pm on a Sunday evening. We got seated quickly, even with our big party. None of us were very hungry, so we ordered all appetizers or small dishes and a couple of drinks. 

My boyfriend and I shared a Margherita Pizza (definitely big enough for two -- has about 8 small pieces). Both my boyfriend and I agreed that the pizza was really tasty! We happily ate the whole thing. It was cooked just right and was hot and steamy when it got to our table. Just the way I like it! I also ordered a Salad...I don't remember the name of it, but it was decent sized and tasted fresh. I was so full on pizza, I couldn't eat my whole salad. I definitely could have just done one or the other. 

I don't remember what the rest of my party ordered. There was a variety of dishes, but they all must have been good because I don't remember anything left on anyone's plate when we were done. This means the food was delicious! Or else we were all just hungry. Either way, it was good overall. 

Service was great. Our server was friendly and personable. I like that when it comes to servers!

My only gripe was that our food took forever to come out. We waited a good 15+ minutes before anything came out. That was a long time considering they weren't that crowded or busy when we were there. They may need to work out some kinks in the kitchen. 

On a side note, this restaurant has good views of the strip. I really liked that, and I spent awhile gazing out at the bright lights and the busyness of the strip. Good people watching!

Overall, I enjoyed my time at Buddy V's. I would definitely come back here again on another visit to Vegas!

Cheers!
Very good Italian food in Las Vegas. We were in a party of 8, so they offer a "family style" dinner (bringing out multiple courses for the table to share). All courses were delicious!

Having enjoyed dinner shortly after opening with friends in town from Phoenix, the plan to re-visit Buddy V's at a later date somehow getting lost in the constant shuffle of Las Vegas' restaurant landscape, recent rumors from a trusted source suggested that the All You Can Eat Sunday Brunch pairs a good price to food better executed than it needs to be, something each day more difficult to find in the Casino properties of Sin City.

No doubt still a hot-spot amongst tourists, the restaurant itself just under capacity by noon as the line at Carlo's Bake Shop continues to snake out the door at all hours of the day, it was just past 11:15am that one adult and a child checked-in at the hostess podium to be quickly led to a tight two-top adjacent the open kitchen, food displays tempting on all sides as the décor of rolling pins, whisks and ingredients continues to impress without making the environment feel like a 'theme' restaurant in the least.

Half-expecting service to be sub-par, most of the full-time Buffets in town generally better suited to this style of dining than a place converting the dining room into a free-flowing event once a week, it was with greetings from a young man who poured water and occasionally returned to clear plates or refill Coffee that instructions were given to "get started whenever you like," a quick perusal of the options that are mostly laid out on the tableside menu showing a decent variety, though certainly not the same multitude of options as the Hotel's AYCE space.

Obviously focusing on Italian American classics and Buddy's interpretation of the topic by way of long-time Chef Brian Forgione, it was with a plate of Charcuterie, Cheese and Baked Goods that the meal got underway, the 9-year old happy to see Peel n' Eat Shrimp offered, but confused as to why the Salami did not taste like the version offered at Von's, the quality theoretically superior and not nearly as processed but nonetheless lacking in flavor while the Prosciutto, Blue Cheese and Pecorino were all good specimens, though the Focaccia was nearly inedible and hard enough to make one wonder whether it had been baked the previous day.

Modestly impressed by the Croissant as well as two mini-Muffins, a Pain au Chocolat entirely forgettable as a result of too little filling, the decision to investigate the Cake Boss' desserts early was well served by a pot of Tiramisu that would rival any in town, the Red Velvet Cake also quite tasty with a most base and tangy frosting while the Cannoli was much like that across the way, already feeling the sog of being pre-filled and generally underwhelming.

Batting about .500 on Italian Cookies, the Almond Cluster and soft Chocolate far better than the dried Butter rounds topped in Sprinkles or Jam, it was with patience that a fresh pan of pasta was waited on as part of plate three, the Mac n' Cheese Carbonara far too heavily salted to be appreciated for any sort of subtlety while the small Breasts of pounded Chicken Parm and Orecchiette with Italian Sausage were better balanced if not particularly memorable, the surprisingly light Roast Vegetable Frittata offering some evidence of a kitchen that is capable of doing 'high volume' right.

Far more impressed by the Garlic Bread than the Focaccia, crispy and fragrant with just melted Mozzarella or when used to scoop up Grandma's Meatballs and Sauce that takes no short-cuts en route to a fresh Tomato flavor without any added sweetness, choices from the carving station including Spicy Italian Sausage and Smoked Applewood Slab Bacon are well-displayed and prepared properly, the youngster at the table also fond of the Maple-Glazed Ham and sticks of Beef Jerky procured from the Bloody Mary Bar.

Going back to the sweet stuff for plates five and six, the common occurrence of dirty stacked plates and an empty mug at this point almost more amusing than it was an annoyance, fans of Bread Pudding would be well advised to save room for Dessert as the version served hot from a steamer with Caramel Sauce and Whipped Cream is a custard-laden masterpiece that far outperformed Panettone French Toast that is a bit dry along the edges, a better investment for the sweet tooth being the dainty Crespelle served with Nutella, Pureed Raspberries and Whipped Cream...or perhaps a bag of piping hot Italian Donuts offered with the same trio for dipping.

**1/2Charged $36.95 per adult and $10.95 for a child, a price not inclusive of tax or tip, the question of whether Buddy V's Brunch is 'worth it' comes down to whether one prefers quality or quantity as well as an understanding of celebrity Chef branding, the recent Buffet upgrades at Wynn, Cosmopolitan and Caesar's seemingly a better value with superior service, though certain items and the chance to sample several of Buddy V's Signatures without investing in a full lunch or dinner seems worth it for fans or those looking for a family-friendly alternative to Grand Lux Cafe while staying at the Venetian

Service...slow
Meatballs are excellent! (That is the only reason why I would give this place a 4 star)
Our table had lasagna, chicken parm and vodka rigatoni. 
The lasagna received raves from my niece. The rest of the food was sub par at best. I definitely would not get the rigatoni again...ever! 

Loud, yet fun atmosphere. Friendly staff. The management was helpful.

Wow what can I say about this place. Let me start by saying we had high hopes for this place. However, the reality is that this place was mediocre at best. I will start with the good. The service was good, the meatball appetizer was good, and the fresh bread was great. This is where it stops, the spaghetti was somewhat chef boyardee tasting and the chicken parmigiana lacked flavor. Consequently the only flavor from that dish was from the cheese, which was all cheese no chicken. At this point the wife and I chalk it up to a loss and believing the hype and figures hey the desert has to be good, after all it's the cake boss right. WRONG!!!! This was probably the most disappointing part of the meal we got the cannoli and tiramisu. The cannoli was bland and lacked any depth and the tiramisu was also boring lacked any real flavor and to boot was but in a small Masson jar. Oh let's not forget the cookies that were served with the cannoli they were as hard as a biscotti. Now I can chalk up the good as a loss but the desert really?! That should have been second to none. The bottom line, if you want good Italian food and dessert go anywhere else but this overrated excuse of an Italian restaurant!!!!
Was here a couple years ago. It was great then and still great today. That kind of consistency is rare in Vegas. Highly recommended.

Had a reservation at 7. Arrived a little late but we were seated shortly after our arrival. Our booth was right next to the window so we had a view of the strip. Service was very slow though. Waiter was very pushy on what he wanted us to drink. I wanted to drink a sangria but instead he insisted I tried some other wine. Food was okay but nothing spectacular. Had the birthday cake for dessert and the alcohol taste was VERY strong.

Buddy V's is mall food at best.  Not bad but not great either.  We were a group of 12 and our waiter was in overdrive pushing the bill up.  We asked about ordering family style, he had us each order an individual dish and we left a ton of food behind.  He recommended the veal to each one of us (the most expensive item) and when I ordered chicken picatta he asked if he could bring veal picatta instead.  Same for wines.
The food... Eh, what your paying for is the view and the establishment... Drinks are over priced as well as the food. But it is a place for big groups with $ to spend

As a Las Vegas local, I try to avoid the strip restaurants as much as possible.  They're usually over priced, and over crowded, but when I found myself at the Venetian with my wife and daughter, we swung into Buddy V's on a whim for lunch.  

My wife and I are typically appalled by kids menus because everything tends to be fried, or bathed in cheese; Buddy V's was no exception.  With that said, I ordered the kids chicken parm, however I requested the dish be with a grilled chicken breast, and no cheese. Our waitress gladly made the change, and my daughter loved the food. $12.00 for a kids meal is a little pricy, but it is the strip after all, and the food was a big hit with my daughter. I don't mind paying for quality.

The lunch menu is a little small, and I was wishing I'd looked at it before getting a table, I figured I'd just grab something with little expectation.  Big mistake! I ordered the adult chicken parm, and my wife had the chicken blt.  The pasta with the chicken parm was slightly al dente, and perfectly cooked. The chicken breading was crunchy with juicy chicken inside. 

My wife was a big fan of the thin piece of chicken that came on her sandwich, and the perfectly toasted bread.  The basil was fresh and tomato not mushy, another big hit.

I would have given a higher rating of not for the poor service.  Our waitress, Bethany, disappeared from our table for 20+ minutes. She took our order, and didn't come back until it we'd been finished eating for quite some time.  All in all, we'd come back for the food but the service needs some work. Out total bill was $57.62.

Amazing!  Very nice ambiance with lots of decorations to look at and a semi open kitchen.  High ceilings so it doesn't feel cramped or dark.  Comfortable seating.  Excellent food.  My girlfriend and I shared the Caesar and it was a very nice portion with polenta instead of croutons.  So good!  She loved her shrimp scampi and I loved my veal Marsala as both were recommended by our server.  Everything tasted fresh and real.  Service was attentive and genuine.  I loved that there a nice view of the strip as well.  Will definitely be going back

The service was so good they were so nice the food was amazing it tasted like real home made Italian food. They brought out are dishes fast too! Definitely recommend to come to this restaurant when coming to Las Vegas.

We had our wedding reception at Buddy V's and everyone left full and happy! The food and service was amazing. The staff was helpful. I did not have to worry about a thing. The lasagna was so tasty and satisfying, the croutons in the Caesar salad were a delicious surprise, and the cake we got from Carlo's bakery was so amazing and pretty. Thank you again Buddy V's!

I came to this restaurant because I read a review of burgers and they said this was the best burger ever. Even if it was in an Italian restaurant. It took us forever to find the restaurant. It's not well signed. When we got there a nice lady took us to our table. We waited quite awhile to be noticed. Finally a snoody server came over. He tried to upsell us bottled water. We declined. Of course I didn't order the burger. Instead I had the smashed meatball sandwich. It came on a crisp french roll. It also had ricotta cheese on it. That just ruined it for me. The meatballs were dry and very little sauce. All I could taste was the ricotta. It came with french fries that were nothing spectacular. My friend had the vodka rigatoni. He said it was very good. It should have been for $23.00!! That was the lunch price. I think this place is over priced and to snoody for me. I would have much rather gone across the street to Mangiano's. I never have a bad meal there. No, I won't be back and won't recommend it.

We've been here for dinner and Sunday brunch...we always forget the exact location of this place is: 2nd floor, walk towards Las Vegas Blvd side. The food here is ok and service is great. If the Carlos Bakery line across from here is crazy, you might as well eat here and order bakery items for dessert.

I like how they have "healthier' options here. The portions are perfect - which means, if you're starving or have hug appetite, you'll be hungry if you eat just 1 entree.

***DINNER***

Roasted Sea Bass:
Branzino with cured lemon, arugula salad and pine nuts.This was just ok. 3/5

Italian Greens:
Tuscan kale, plum tomatoes in garlic oil. Tasty but a little too oily. 2/5

Caramelized Sea Scallops:
Perfectly seared scallops with crispy prosciutto, parmesan polenta in tomato vinaigrette. 3.5/5

Seared Salmon:
Crisp salmon with charred broccolini, pickled vegetables in balsamic reduction. 4/5



***BUFFET BRUNCH***
Muffins, croissants, pan au chocolat, bacon, ham, sausage, scrambled eggs, French toast, crepes, nutella, jams/preserves, mascarpone, chicken parmesan, meatballs, orochiette with sausage, mac n cheese, salad, veggie frittata, garlic bread, tiramisu, cannoli, bread pudding, zeppole, red velvet cake, cookies, etc.

It's a pretty good spread. Definitely get the French toast, meatballs, mac n cheese and veggie frittata. I drizzled Nutella on my French toast....mmmmm...however, I don't think I got my $35 worth.
During lunch they have a buffet. It's not spectacular by any means. I was expecting more from the dessert section. The rest of the food was early average. I enjoyed the live music though.

Amazing Italian restaurant with a great view! Huge serving sizes, definitely think about sharing. Reasonably priced for what you get. I ordered the spaghetti with pomodoro sauce and started with a caprese salad, both really great. Highly recommend the lasagna and the chicken Parmesan. Really you can't go wrong with anything on the menu! I think it's even better food than Lavo Italian. 

Our server was beyond awesome! Good service in Vegas is really hard to come by.

After wanting to try this restaurant, we finally had lunch there recently. So glad we did!!
Our party of four started with calamari fritte and cheesy garlic bread. So good!! The most tender calamari we had ever had!! The bread was hot and cheesy with the perfect blend of herbs and garlic. 
The smashed meatball sandwich with Tuscan fries were delicious!! The most tender flavorful meatballs I've ever had!! The applewood bacon turkey club was also delicious!! Perfect amount of everything with good balance of flavors. The Caesar salad served with the turkey club was just okay. The dressing was mediocre. Overall, great experience!! We'll be back!!!

Pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. They do simple Italian dishes really well! Their octopus appetizer is full of flavor and cooked to perfection and their egg plant parm is some of the best I've had! Only downside is that they served their wine in cheap small wine glasses which really took away from the experience and did not highlight their well thought out wine list. Just remember to ask for a better glass if you get stuck with one! No other complaints, just a jersey girl proud of a Jersey chef!
Everything was amazing I was kind of surprised! Expensive but everything in Vegas is... best calamari ever so perfect! Tiramisu and eggplant were delicious as well!

Revision -  oops, Buddy V not Bobby V!  

My sister's nephew said they serve great burgers here for lunch.  So we came for lunch and three of the five of us had the burger.

Angus beef burger served on a brioche bun.  Cooked to order.  Good but I'm not sure I'd come back just for a burger.

Attentive service at lunch.

You can access the restaurant which faces the Strip.  You don't even have to step into the casino.

Directly across the restaurant is the Cake Boss shop.

The food was really good. It's restaurant week so they had a special. We all got chicken parm with Caesar salad and cheesecake or cannoli for $20.18.  We thought this was a great value. The bread they bring out is delicious and melts in your mouth. The Caesar salad had the most amazing, what we initially thought were croutons, melt in your mouth cornbread-ish squares. The main entrees were plated beautiful and tasted delicious!  Our daughter got chicken parm off the kids menu and it was the same serving size but no dessert or salad for $12.  We got a sangria carafe for $24 and it was very good and it had a lot of fruit...but not so much alcohol which was ok with me. Service was super friendly, but a little slow.  All in all we were so glad that we stopped in.

I came back for the croutons...wait, what? You read that right. Croutons. The little, dried-up bread scraps on salads. I ordered a Caesar salad to start with before my entree, completely unaware of the discovery I was about to make. When my salad arrived, I was immediately intrigued by the croutons - they were unlike any I had ever seen. These croutons were perfect, one-inch square cubes, caramelized to a perfect golden brown on the outside. Biting into one, I discovered a filling of warm polenta - also known as grits in some parts. It was apparent that these croutons had just come out of the oven, and they were HEAVENLY! I wished I could  have ordered a whole plate of them - they were that good. The rest of my experience at Buddy V's was outstanding - the main course, the service, the ambience were all great. It was those croutons, however, that brought me back for dinner the next two nights in a row.

UPDATE: I stopped in for lunch on a Thursday with the family. They had a three-course lunch special. I started off with a Caesar Salad with those heavenly polenta croutons...WOW. My main course was the Chicken Parm, which was delicious. An order of Tiramisu and a cup of coffee was the perfect finish. The service and atmosphere were impeccable. I may have discovered one of the world's best Italian restaurants. I will not miss an opportunity to return!

I was skeptical at first about trying a place based on a TV personality. But I am so happy I did. They have a brunch on the weekends until I want to say 230 and it looked amazing with a large variety. I did not try it due to arriving at the end of the time frame but I would go back just for that. I had the meatball sandwich and a cedar salad. The cedar salad had polenta croutons with like a lemon flavor. I love love love polenta so this was everything. I'd even go back just for this salad and it was a very large portion. Also tried the chicken parmigiana and the creamy pasta carbonara. All good. The theme is also very cute with checkered table clothes and very good service. There is also a view of the strip from the windows that I enjoyed. I would highly recommend this place.

If I could give 3.5, I would. The food was really good! We wanted to dine at the restaurant on my birthday, but they were closed for a private party. So they asked us to make a reservation for the next night and they would take good care of us.  Not so true! We had to wait for a table and the service was bad. The guys in the red tshirts were better than the waiters. As for a bday dessert or a bday wish from the waiter- NOTHING!! Did not make me feel special at all, and to think I was soooo excited to celebrate my birthday there a day late. Very disappointing.
Really surprised how good it was.  Ordered the linguine with shrimp and clams. Wasn't on the menu, but added the clams for a small up charge.  Server was really nice as well. Will be back.
The food was great and the friendly service even better. Thanks to Caleb, Rasberry, Adam, and chef Bryan Forgione for making our dinner for six a fantastic memory.

I visited this restaurant on 1/30/2017 which means Vegas was packed for the New Year festivities. I went to dinner with 11 of my friends who I was visiting Vegas with. The first thing I noticed about this restaurant was that it has a very cozy feel. Great place for family or a romantic night out with your significant other. We had a large group so we were seated toward the back of the restaurant. No complaints there because there was a huge window by our table that overlooked the strip. Our waitress was super friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. She took the time to help us order... all 12 of us which I thought was great. For the appetizer, they offer a very flavorful bread with baked on cheese. So not really a cheesy bread. The bread was soft and came with a balsamic and olive oil mix. It was so delicious. For the main course, all of the meal come in very large portions. The menu offerings are also kind of pricey. I simply ordered their meatball appetizer because I wasn't very hungry that night of our trip. The meatballs were delicious. The dish came with about 6 meatballs for about $9. I also sampled my friends' meals and everything everyone ordered was delicious. I would absolutely recommend this restaurant if you want a nice, authentic Italian meal. My only regret is not have a big appetite the night I visited this restaurant so that I could have tried a full size meal. Maybe next time!

YUMM!!! I can't say enough about how delicious this place is! I wanted a second stomach so I could eat more. The tomato basil soup is AMAZING, the garlic cheese bread is sooooo good. I went with a group of 6 people and everything was incredibly delicious. Seriously come here hungry. We all ordered different things so we could try different items and they were all so yummy. Then of course went across and ordered some desserts ;)

Day two of the restaurant being open so all the staff were on their toes.  Tried the Buddy's Salumi & Cheese Board (olives, pickled vegetables, grilled Italian bread, genoa salami, spicy capicola, proscuitto di parma, grana padano, tuscan pecorino, and gorgonzola).  The capicola and proscuitto were the best I've ever had and the gorgonzola was epic - bleu cheese flavor with the texture of brie.  Cheeseburger at an Italian restaurant?  You bet because the Pat Lafrieda Burger (brioche bun, tomato aioli, provolone cheese, tuscan fries) was really tasty.  The tiramisu was the best I've had anywhere.

Ask for a table bordering the outside perimeter windows for great views of The Strip.  Bring your camera to take pictures of the incredible entree cakes Buddy and his team made.

I give this place a two star because of the following 


1- this message is to the manager: there are ridiculously less amount of staff working in the restaurant,  i was waiting forever to get the check and i had to literally ask for everything. My water was not getting refilled and easily 30 min of our time got wasted for lack of management.

If you want customers to come back hire more staff and be professional, you also impact the poor staff by getting less tip and more work load.

When someone comes to your restaurant expects great experience


2- the food was good but there was so much fat in the chicken... 


The reason i give it a two star is because of friendly staff. I wont go back to this restaurant again.

What a fun place to dine. We went for lunch. The service was amazing and fast. All employees were very nice. We ate off the lunch express menu which was more than enough. Sangria was delicious. Bloody Mary was good but a bit on spicy side. Would highly recommend this restaurant especially if looking for a place Away from casino. Loved it! Don't forget to go across the hall to Carlos bakery. Get there as soon as they open!

The service was outstanding! Our 8 year old girls were cold and the Venetian sets the thermostat so there is nothing they can do about it. The manager brought over two tablecloths for them to wrap up in!

The Sunday Gravy is very good. The cheese board is a bit average. The Italian fish was liked and so were the meatballs.

The lower rating is due to the dessert menu. It is limited and not very good. We ordered the apple turnover, tiramisu, cannollis, ice cream, lemon blueberry cheesecake and the hazelnut chocolate cake. The ice cream is great, but not home made and the only other great dessert was the hazelnut chocolate cake. Everything else was very average. What a surprise!

You have to walk by their bakery across the hall and you see the pastry chefs make these amazing looking desserts through a glass window, but none of them are on the menu! I expected fabulous dessert, but it was pretty disappointing.

Best meal in Las Vegas in recent memory. Great service - thank you, Georgio.
Amazing lasagna and linguini with clams. The croutons in the Caesars salad were warm and made of polenta. And the desert! the cannoli is what dreams are made of.

Very good place! Some of the best gravy you will find outside grandmas kitchen. You can bank on that.

Also the best Mac n Cheese I've ever had. If only it had Lobster as an option! 

The meatballs are excellent. The Lasagana was excellent. The Caprese was excellent. The calamari was very good.

We will definitely be back.

Oh and the bartender was super hot. We didn't catch her name but we both appreciated her mucho.

Sunday brunch was fabulous! The macaroni and cheese and meatballs were great! I personally didn't care for the cannoli, but the brownies were to die for and the cookies were delicious. The food choices were adequate, but I was surprised that there wasn't any spaghetti. Definitely not disappointed!  Great place to dine.
The servers were extremely attentive. The decor was nice and the prices were moderate for a meal at a high end location.   The Mac and cheese appetizer was to die for.

This review is for Sunday brunch. It starts at 10:30 in the morning. It goes until early afternoon.
The price is around $35 per person, unless you include bottomless Mimosas or sangrias or Bellinis for an added $15 or bloody Mary's for an added $17 with the souvenir cup. We chose not to do that.
There are a few stations around the restaurant. To begin with, there is a children's station with candy, pizza, fruit, and raw sliced vegetables. There is a meat section with apple sausage, thick bacon, and other choices. There is a soup and salad/antipasto section. There is a warm food section which has scrambled eggs, Sunday Alex, French toast, crepes with options for feelings, a penne carbonara dish, a tagliatelle dish, traditional Italian meatballs, and several other yummy choices. Finally there is a desert section.
The tagliatelle and penne dishes were disappointing and very average. Other than that, everything was delicious. The breakfast is very good. The dessert table is pretty good and the best part is the bread pudding. The tiramisu was a let down for me which is surprising but I have had way better.
The service is very good. The restaurant is nice. We did have to ask for a different table as we found out our table was way too close to the next table and it was hard to get out to get to the food stations.
For the price, this place is reasonable. Other places are way more expensive. It is not a five star brunch, but it's a solid four star. 
This is a good place for families and it is a great place for kids.

I had a awesome time at this restaurant 
I really loved the food , great taste , great drinks .
Beautiful interior design and really friendly staff.
I really recomend it

Had tomato basil soup, chicken Parmesan and cake. Everything was ok but comparable to Buca de Peppo or Eastside Marios. Actually the later two I would consider going to before buddy vs. I love his Sunday gravy recipe so I thought this would be an excellent place. Spaghetti was a little underdone. Server was nice. Beer selection was ok. Probably wouldn't recommend or go back.

Fantastic! First time here and it was for a friend's birthday. We had an amazing view overlooking the strip. First, the decor was super fun with bundt cake pans decorating the walls, rolling pin room dividers and light fixtures that looked like giant whisks. Like entertainment too. Although we couldn't see him, his piano and voice could be heard throughout. And a nice variety of music too! Everything from Frank Sinatra to Maroon 5. Now for the food... For appetizers we got some amazing Jersey mozzarella dish as well as a grilled cheese garlic bread. Both were amazing but now looking back perhaps we shouldn't have ordered two cheese appetizers. Cue in the awkward silence... Just kidding! No such thing as too much cheese! For entrees I highly recommend the lasagna, Sunday gravy and orecchiette with Italian sausage and broccoli I. For desert we had some amazing lemon raspberry cheesecake and the Italian birthday cake. Both were excellent! Will definitely go back!

fantastic service, there were waiters walking by us and checking on us constantly. they did well to not interrupt us but quietly fill water and bus empty plates. my mom and i shared a caesar salad and a calamari appetizer and it was almost too much for us! their bread and croutons are unexpectedly yummy.

We came for dessert after drooling over Buddy V's cakes. I haven't had this terrible of desserts since...I don't know. They served frozen desserts from some chain supplier like Cisco. Had cannoli, Italian wedding cake, and three scoops gelato of different flavors. Cannoli was in a greasy shell that tasted like Mexican fried ice cream shell and cheese was more like whipped cream, not even mascarpone. Wedding cake was cold and also similar cheap greasy flavor. Gelato had not enough flavor for "gelato". Top that off with Vegas pricing and slowest service in Vegas, plus people smoking freely where we were sitting, so will not be back.

This place is amazing. You feel like home when you eat here. The plates are huge and filling. Our servers were amazing and super nice. The food tastes homemade and treated us like we were important. The lasagna is huge so if you're not that full, they can split it and it's still a big portion.

Seriously really delicious food. Must orders:
Calamari - one of the best we've ever had
Lasagna- the best we've ever had
Meatballs- better than mine and the best we've ever had

We also had 
Parmesan chicken- moist and yummy probably the best one we've had as it has a tendency to be dry but this one wasn't.

Linguine and clams- very good
Cheese pizza - kids liked it

I will definitely come back!!

Tried the bakery earlier and discovered this gem.  

Don't forget to ask for Rosemary fresh bread and dip into oil with Parmesan....

I was really excited to come here for dinner based on all the reviews but once I left, I wondered why it was so loved. It wasn't terrible, but it also wasn't amazing. 
I called in a week ahead and made reservations for a Friday night. They were accommodating and I called the night before to confirm the reservation. The place isn't hard to find, but it can be better described..I was told it was across Barney's, but there are many levels and entrances. Anyhow, we were seated promptly, but without menus. The waitress came by a few min later and described that they do family style or menu if we prefer. We preferred the menu. Since we were pretty hungry, I ordered 2 fries for our table and we all ordered our food- some of us to share the meals. 
The fries came, and they were mediocre. Then someone came by with warm bread for the table- I wish they did this sooner so we knew. Or even mentioned it. Anyhow, food arrived and it was fine. I shared the chicken parm and it was decent. No one complained about the food, but no one raved about it either. 
It did take some time for the check and then for them to come back to collect it. 
Would I go here again? Maybe but it wouldn't be my first choice.
One of the best Italian experience I have had and their lasagna was phenomenal! Great service and decor.

I came here for lunch wanting to try Buddy V's chicken blt since it looked pretty good in pictures and seemed to have pretty positive reviews.  Honestly, while it wasn't terrible or anything, it wasn't as great as it looked or as tasty as I thought it would be.  To top it off, service was "meh" and my reservation requests were totally ignored.  I requested a booth by a window but did not get that.  (It was busy for lunch though and almost every table was occupied.)  I also noted that we were celebrating a birthday but not even a simple birthday greeting was given.  Totally disappointing.  I wasn't crazy either about how close the tables were to each other.  One good thing at least was that our water glasses never went empty?  Also, the Caesar salad that came with my sandwich had warm, soft croutons which added a different but interesting taste to it.  Glad I could check this place off my "to try" list, but after that experience there really wasn't anything to make me want to come back here again.

This place is so incredibly good buddy has done in amazing job making sure that this food is a real Italian food the meat balls are and spaghetti are a must. Staff is super bz but they still do a good job.

Buddy V's Ristorante is located within The Venetian hotel. My best friends parents treated us out to lunch here on a Saturday. It wasn't too crowded and I wasn't sure what to expect. We were seated promptly given we had a reservation for 10. After looking at the menu a few of us decided to get a few different items and eat family style. 

// FOOD //
Margherita Pizza: sliced tomatoes, basil, fresh mozzarella. Simple and light. It's a medium sized crust, not crispy or too doughy. I really enjoyed this one with a little grated parmesan and crushed red pepper. 4.5/5

Buddy's Favorite Pizza:  spiced sausage, caramelized onions, fennel, four cheese. I didn't care for this one too much. The sausage and the blend of cheese didn't go well together. I would definitely go with the margherita pizza instead. 2.5/5

Spaghetti Central with Meatballs: Your basic and simple spaghetti with five meatballs. It was simple, but I thoroughly enjoyed the tomato sauce. I thought it had excellent flavor. I would definitely order this again and maybe try it with the bolognese next time. 4/5

Chicken Parm: Provolone, mozzarella, spaghetti marinara. This dish was excellent for sharing. It would have been too heavy if one person just got it, but it was great for our group. They give two chicken breasts with a decent portion of spaghetti on the side. The chicken parm was deliciously cheesy! 4/5

Overall, I was extremely pleased with the service and food at Buddy V's Ristorante. I will definitely be back for more of that tomato sauce goodness. The only thing that can possibly make this place any better is if they served you some fresh break with oil and balsamic in the beginning. Just saying... 

ENJOY!

Came here based on the reviews. Stayed for the fantastic service and food. I've traveled far and wide in the world and I have to rank this high on my list of great dining experiences.  My thanks to Chris and Tawny for making me feel right at home. 
And to the kitchen for an incredible meal of bone in veal chop!  Absolutely outstanding. Great job Bobby V.  on your hiring and training!!!

This is a place I have been wanting to try since we moved to Vegas. I think I blew it by going to Bootleggers before coming here. I love Cake Boss's show so I had high hopes for his restaurant. We went at about 345pm on a Thursday afternoon. We were sat right away at a great window table that over looked the strip. It is always nice to feel like we are tourists here even though we have been here almost 3 years now.  We decided to get things we could share...so of course I had to order the garlic cheese bread and Mac.n.cheese to start. Both delicious. The garlic cheese bread was served with amazing marinara sauce. The mac.n.cheese was creamy had pancetta and peas with a crumb top on it. Delicious. Made the way mac.n.cheese should be...creamy goodness. For our main dish we ordered Buddy's favorite pizza and Bolognese. The pizza was yummy, sausage, grilled onions, fennel and 4 different types of cheeses. The crust of the pizza was cooked to perfection, a little crispness, but still soft and very tasty. The sausage was perfect with all the onions and cheese.  The only item I was not impressed with was the Bolognese...lack of flavor, creaminess, and the spaghetti noodles...we're just store bought...I guess since he is a baker...I expected homemade noodles...so I was a little disappointed...and the Bolognese I had at Bootleggers blows this out of the water. It was also $23 for a bowl the wasn't even big enough to feed my man. Had we only ordered this we would have left hungry....and we probably would not ever go back. But luckily we ordered other good dishes...so if we happen to be at the Venetian again and are craving italian...we would go again. I only gave them a 3 because I was disappointed...but I think I just set my bar too high!

Dinner was delicious!  Our waiter Peter J was exceptional!  Everything he recommended was fantastic.  From the cocktails to the entrees!  I will definitely come back again the next time we are in Las Vegas!

Against my better judgement I went to eat here because I assumed that even if the food was mediocre at least the dessert menu should be stellar. Not the case. Two thin,appetizer sized pieces veal and some third rate lasagna for almost $60 in a space that only poor people wont mind dining in. I thought the dessert menu would make up for this but boy was I wrong. About 6 underwhelming options from the "Cake Boss". WTF? I ordered two items that were as pathetic as the food. Steer clear of this place.

Happiest Happy Hour

Happy Hour 4:30- 6:30 pm 7 days a week..$5 small bites & Select alcoholic beverages are $4 (Wine, Sangria, Prosecco, Domestic Beers, & Bloody Mary's/Ceasars)

I ordered the sangria...not the best, I wouldn't order it again...But My friend ordered Prosecco and it was a full glass...
