We ordered fried calamari (It Was Good), Gnocchi  (Good), & Mac & Cheese Carbonara  (GREAT...smoked mozzarella & fontina set it off)...

Definitely a great choice!
Love this place.  I was with the chef Bryan Forgione for a Guns N Roses concert at T-mobile arena.  Private box.  He is a cool guy and knows how to cook!

5 stars for service. Team work, communication, a sense of urgency, and very polite. Our food was SALTY (chicken piccata and pasta with vodka sauce)!!!!! 
My boyfriend and I have worked in hospitality for years and understand that mishaps.....happen. We don't rush to complain but the food was not made for consumption. HOWEVER, the service and quick replacement of meals made all the difference. Server and manager were fantastic in having us leave there very satisfied. I ended up getting a new chicken piccata with less salty sauce on the side and my boyfriend opted for lasagna which was awesome (light and airy and full of flavor).
Octopus appetizer was very good and not too salty! 
We shall be back Buddy!
By the way, great team you have.

Way overrated. I think these reviews are based on the happy hour. Just ate there. Food was just ok. Portions aren't huge like people are saying here. SERVICE was horrendous. Waited for ever for a waitress. It was our anniversary even said happy anniversary but didn't even offer a free cannoli. We didn't even want it but she didn't even offer. Her and the water bus boy were too busy cavorting.  The FOOD was just so so. I would never return

So far this place sucks. Arrogant hostess that just keeps saying we are working on your table. This was going to be a nice company dinner for 6 people. Reservation was made 2 months ago and it is now 30 minutes past our reservation time. Rude hostess and at least 30 minute wait for our table so far.
Not a good start.
In the end the food was good and the server was great. The manager came out and talked to us.
All in all once we got seated it was a nice, pleasant dinner with good food and very good service.
Amazing food great service not a long wait for a table, just keep in mind you get what you pay for in saying that the food is worth the price.

Great Italian food, will definitely come back here again.
5/5 Shrimp on a chopped vegetable salad. Better for the healthy conscious.
Shrimp was cooked perfectly, tender in a butter garlic. $23
4/5 Veal Marsala. Thinly sliced veal in a dark thick wine mushroom sauce. A bit too salty or concentrated. Really good buttery garlic pasta with light cheese topping. I wish I had double pasta.
$26
4/5 Trying to decide Lobster tail desert or chocolate Nutella cake? Lobster tail won, very light, flaky crust with cannoli cream and fresh fruit. Some of the crust was non uniform in crunch but very good. $9/each.
5/5 Unsweetened ice tea. The best tea taste in Vegas so far. Surprising to me so I had to rate it.
Overall with tip and tax $97 for two.

We weren't quite as impressed as a year ago. First, with a reservation, we were seated in the bar area. It was loud, noisy and the a/c was blowing directly on us. The hostess said nothing else was available. We spotted a booth that just opened up lower down and requested the change of table from the server. Great service in the booth that we were moved to. I ordered from their special menu that was all inclusive. I chose the chicken Parmesan. It was tasty but the sauce was a bit more bland than I prefer. I have to say the cannoli and tiramisu were out of this world. I enjoyed the tomato basil soup as well. This experience was ruined by the hostess seating a reservation at a bar table.

After losing a small fortune in a matter of minutes I didn't think I could be so happy so quickly. Buddy V's was literally on of the best restaurant I have been to in Vegas. To start the lobster tail (dessert) could make a grown man cry of joy, I literally would have been happy to stick a straw in it and suck out all the cream out instead of actually ordering a meal (Which is what I did the following day, pretty sure i gained about 10lbs just off of lobster tail filling)

Enough about the dessert (I'll be talking more about it more when I write my Carlos Bakery review, yes it was that good!) The entrees are not something to overlook either. Let me start out by saying I am a somewhat food snob when it comes to classier restaurant. While I have left some places questioning the quality based on what I paid this is certainly not one of those times. As far as Italian food goes it doesn't get much better, the quality is spectacular and there is nothing that I would have changed. To top it off the portions were HUGE! Being a guy in his early 20's of course I forced myself to eat every bite. However most people would have probably took half of it to go.

If you are ever in Las Vegas do yourself a favor and stop by Buddy V's for dinner.

Seriously one of the best Italian restaurants I've been to in a long time. Always been a fan of the cake boss and was excited to try his restaurant. The decor was nice, the tables can feel a little close together but that's not a big deal. The staff were great at helping me to decide what to order from the menu. Ended up trying the Aunt Nina's mozzarella en carozza, Buddy's dad's bucatini carbonara, and Nonna's lasagna al forno. 

Everything tasted amazing, and I was a big fan of the mozzarella en carozza and the lasagna. Definitely coming here again the next time I'm in Vegas!

Loved this place!  Peter our waiter was great. The chicken parm was excellent. Would definitely go here again. Portion was just right.  Meals came out quickly. Definitely make a reservation because they had long wait time if you didn't have one

With relatively easy entrance from the Strip, competitive pricing to other Italian spots nearby and a nice dining area, it's clear to see why Buddy V's Ristorante has maintained a good level of success since they opened.  I had only previously been to happy hour here, which is one of the best values on the boulevard from 4:30pm-6:30pm daily by the way, and had my mind set on a couple of items prior to walking in.  

Skipping formalities, like ya know...salad, we started with "Grandma's Meatballs".  The six spheres mixed with beef, veal and pork were very good and perfectly portioned for the group.  I usually prefer them pan-fried first before being dropped into sauce, which these were not, but eaters gonna eat and they disappeared within minutes.  

And funny how things are always extra special and endearing once "Grandma" is added to the front of it. Grandma's apple pie.  Grandma's pet rat.  Grandma's criminal record.  

The "Bone-In Parm Chop" was screaming out to me and totally rocked my world.  With a  hefty quantity of crispy, juicy veal meat doused in a mouth-watering marinara sauce and then finished in the oven after being topped with ooey gooey mozzarella and provolone cheese, this dish was outstanding, well presented, and worth the $42.  Being such a large entree, I'd recommend two people going in on it together while getting a few more appetizers to make it a better rounded meal.  I personally felt rounder afterwards.  

A couple of other "can't go wrong" items I was able to sample were the ultra meaty "Nonna's Lasagna Al Forno" and "Veal Marsala" with its rich mushroom ragu.  No room for dessert this time, but I am confident that I can count on this spot for a solid "pasto" in the future.

It was mid day and needed a snack from all the walking we've just done. The bar was not too busy as it was 3pm in the afternoon. The bartender was extremely nice along with all the staff that came by to drop off items. 

We asked the bartender what he'd recommend and he stated it was the lasagna. By jolly gee was it fantastic. It came out scorching hot in a pan like skillet. Cheese melted and meatiness in every bite. We also had the Nutella cake with a scoop of ice cream if this wasn't a snack I'd say you can finish the lasagna on your own but it was a perfect share. 

The price was reasonable and the portions are right sized not too much or too little. If your craving Italian this is the spot.

Came for all day outside patio happy hour so you sit inside the hotel watching people wait in line to get there sugar rush on at Carlo's.  We ordered the calamari for my 3 year old and server forgot to tell me its fried with hot peppers so he couldn't eat it and this kid loves calamari!  On top of that both appetizer and pizza came out at once.  Obviously she forgot to ring in our calamari.  Rays loaded pizza was dry and hard bread, don't order it.  Bloody Mary's were delicious.  Server was nice but we were forgotten.  Prices for happy hour is worth it, $6 apps and $5 drinks.  I think the food is good but we ordered wrong.

We are Cake Boss fans, so we enjoyed this restaurant. We had a half hour wait on a Thursday night, not too bad. Good kids menu & a pretty good selection of Carlo's Bakery desserts.  Probably the best meal we had in Vegas.
The customer service is excellent. Our waiter was very attentive. The food is super good. The experience was so worth it.
The chicken parmesan is delicious. Beware their dinner plate is very large. They have friendly staff as well. A bit pricey.

Very disappointed!!!! We came here for my sister-in-laws birthday dinner and with all the great reviews we thought it would be a great experience but boy was I wrong. We got seated pretty quickly without a reservation so it did start off good. We placed our drink order and thats when it all went wrong. We got our drinks but after that did not see our server for 20 min even after asking other workers for him and that we were ready to order. He finally came back and we placed our order. Our appetizers came first and after finishing they cleared the table completely taking all napkins and utensils. The food finally arrived to the table and we all were starving but couldn't start eating because we did not have any utensils to eat with. After asking for our waiter and waiting another 15 minutes and having our food get cold we finally got our waiter and he grabbed the utensils. Finally we told them it was my sister-in-laws birthday so they brought out a cake which was not that good and we sang to her. We then received the check and they charged us $10 for the cake we didn't even eat. Definitely will not be going again.

Excellent service, and food. Had a taste for spaghetti and meatballs - best I've ever had. Water glass never went below half, and I drink a lot...lol. Had a melon blossom drink, not a big drinker but that was very good as well. Highly recommend.

We had a great time at Buddy V's for dinner! The wait on a Saturday night was a little long (45 min when we came at 8:30 pm), but we were able to get a seat by the window which we requested. 

We ordered the lasagna and grilled salmon. The lasagna is huge and big enough for 2 to share. The salmon lies on a bed of salad and was light and enjoyable. 

We also tried the specialty cocktail with the lemon sorbet and it was delicious! 

The view of the strip is a great addition to the food. Service was perfect. Would love to come back to try other menu items!

Was just here in April 2017, and had the best time! Wait staff was timely and friendly. Knew what they were doing!  Our table of 4 had: MY MOTHER IN LAW'S
CAPELLINI SHRIMP SCAMPI - huge portion, even larger shrimp; NONNA'S LASAGNA AL FORNO - there's no such thing as too much cheese Wonderful!; BUDDY'S CAPRESE SALAD - so many heirloom tomatoes, it's almost a full meal; CAESAR SALAD - with croutons dripping with garlic butter; ORECCHIETTE
& ITALIAN SAUSAGE - large, large portion; GRILLED SALMON - wonderful, moist, flaky; and TIRAMISU for dessert - nice way to end any meal.

Enjoyed the visit - no, it wasn't cheap, but nothing is in Las Vegas, and you're paying for the ambiance and experience as well, and we weren't disappointed.

This was a great Sunday Brunch, my first time there. Flavorful items. They also have a regular menu, for those who prefer there meals served. Delicious Sangria! Kids will love what they offerhave a small appetite and it was enough! I recommend Buddy V's. I will return for the full menu!

Been here about 5 times. Food is either always really good or just a little off -- like too salty -- but still decent. 
The desserts are always ridiculously good, creme brûlée and lobster tail are delicious, the desserts are definitely the best part of the meal. Customer service, not so good. Servers disappear or really rush around to where you only see them 10% of your entire visit when it should be more like 40%. Drinks go unrefilled and putting in orders or requests can take a while. 
Good food, a little pricey. Just wish the servers would slow down and be more attentative to their tables needs. Wouldn't normally say anything but been here 5 times and noticed this every time.

I honestly had a hard time finding things to eat here as a vegan. I opted for the whole wheat penne pasta with roasted vegetables - mostly mushrooms! It was delicious, aside from the mushrooms. I'd prefer if it was listed in the description what the veggies were! Otherwise, seems like an average Italian restaurant to me.

We had a very nice family dinner with my parents at Buddy V's restaurant. We shared the appetizers family style - Cesar salad with yummy polenta croutons, calamari fritti and scrumptioius Grandma's meatballs.  

We had the following entrees:
1) Linguine with clams
2) Mediterranean sea bass
3) Grilled salmon
4) Chicken Parm
5) Classic cheese pizza

For dessert, we had the butterscotch creme brulee with vanilla mascarpone cream, pecan nib shortbread and the apple pie with caramel cinnamon apples, oatmeal & raisin crubmle and vanilla ice cream. The dessert menu was in a mini photo album with shared memories of Buddy growing up and his family. Overall it was delicious authentic Italian food, fresh pasta and flavorful meatballs, chicken and seafood. The service was excellent.

First time here, had the orecchiette with Italian sausage which was delicious. A little bit on the pricey side, but very good food. Also nice that it's a few steps away from the grand canal so is a little bit less noisy.

The grilled octopus is probably the best I have ever had. My husband and I still talk about it. The drinks are great and the pasta is the real deal here. The service was excellent! This is another restaurant on our list of favorites in Las Vegas.

My girlfriend and I went to Buddy V's Ristorante on May 10, 2014. I'm a fan of Cake Boss so I knew in advance of our trip that this would be one of the first places we would eat at. She ordered Nonna's Lasanga al Forno which we both enjoyed. I ordered the Valastro Sunday Gravy which also was pretty good. To be honest I expected a little more from the restaurant before arriving there, but at the same time it is what it's described as. A casual Italian restaurant with a famous owner and I'm ok with that.

Me and my Family had an early dinner in the restaurant this Sunday. We had a really bad experience as for your customer service. We arrived with a 1,5 year old toddler and my pregnant wife, they let us wait on the side - even we arrived before the peak time. We needed to ask for a highchair multiple times. Our server (Caleb H, if I can believe the name, what is on the check) was super pushy. He didn't event care about we are with a small child. No plastic cup was offered, not even straw for a child. As soon as we told him nicely we don't want any appetizer, he became even more pushy and extremely rude. 

We just wanted to have a nice dinner, and enjoy our first night in Las Vegas, in a special restaurant. Especially because it was the first experience for my mother in law from overseas - who loves Buddy btw, she even went to see his Hoboken cake shop! 

After we had our meal, Caleb never came to offer Parmesan cheese to our dish and hardy did any check back on us. It was super obvious, that we received "different" service, comparing to the table next to us. We felt really unwelcome. 

The food was really delicious and the busser/or server assistant was super nice and caring. He took care of us better, than our server. Unfortunately we don't know his name. He was the only reason we left tip for the server. We hope at least the server treated him better that night, than the paying costumers. 

The restaurant was really busy, so we had no chance to speak to a manager. So we couldn't leave any feedback personally.

I will let you know up front I usually do not like celebrity restaurants because they are overhyped and don't seem to deliver value for the price.  There are a few exceptions to this rule and Buddy V's is one of them for the following reasons.

1) As celebrity restaurants go, Buddy V's doesn't try to be trendy, rather it sticks to rustic italian fare and is very successful at it.
2) Pricing is actually more on the reasonable side than ultra expensive.  For $38.00 you can get a fixed price meal of an appetizer, entree and desert.  I had the Grandma's meatballs which were incredible, light fluffy balls of flavor in a red sauce; a pasta dish consisting of Bucatini, a thin tube spaghetti with pancetta black pepper and egg(this was my favorite dish of the night and is worth going back for more), and closed the night with nutella cake which was delicious.  Everyone at the table enjoyed their meals.
3) The service is fantastic. The waiter was very knowledgeable, guiding us with knowledge of all the dishes on the menu and providing prompt drink service and bread service. 

All in all a great experience for the simple Italian cooking.

Agree with the reviews, we really enjoyed dinner here. The caprese salad is out of this world delicious! I ordered the bucatini carbonara and my husband got the spaghetti bolognese. Both were tasty. We ended the meal with a tiramisu. I loved the casual atmosphere of this place. Would recommend for a nice casual meal.

Delicious meatballs!  The garlic cheese bread and delicious home made marinara sauce are the bomb.
The bar seats have a nice view of the strip.

Expected a tourist trap and average food. Instead received unblemished service, dynamite meatball appetizer, delicious chicken parm and great desserts. Never know until you try something, and Buddy V's won't disappoint.

Nutella Warm Cake was Life changing! We finished that in less than a minute. All four stars are for that. The atmosphere was charming, I love open kitchens. My fiancé loved the Chicken parm, she said it was the best she ever had, and she gets it everywhere we go, so that says something. Our waiter was being super thirsty and was giving all the attention to the people next to us who he was hitting on ferociously, I was kinda jealous, he didn't even ask us one question except, if we want dessert. The bus boy though he was on turbo mode, my glass was never empty, we always had bread and he was on it. So all and all that balanced it out.

We came here for the brunch. The quality of food was top notch. I am not a big cheese person but I enjoyed the cheese here. The olives were something else!!!
Overall great place to eat.

I came here for a Sunday brunch and holy cow this place was amazing! They serve shrimp cocktail early in the morning at 10:30AM (YES!)

First of all, the hostess and waitresses are very kind and attentitive. They were also informative as well since they knew it was our first time here at Buddy V's. I ordered bottomless mimosas, but you could also change your drinks to a sangria or a Bellini! I thought that deal was one I had to take! Their food was delicious! I loved their tomato soup and the ham that they served. I also loved the scrambled eggs and the mini crepes they had. Their "Grandma meatballs" were also very flavorful and satisfying  I've been to the brunch buffet in Paris but I've got to say this Sunday brunch buffet tops Paris! 

I can definitely see myself coming back here again, my only complaint would be that the area is too cold. I think if they raised their tempurature it would have been more comfortable for me but everyone in my party was so cold, which was the only reason why we wanted to get out of there.

When I was booking the Palazzo as the hotel for NYE 2016 I noticed they offered a $25 dining credit for Buddy V's. As I was choosing from several options the Buddy V's credit sealed the deal as I can always fall back on this restaurant to serve delicious "homemade" comfort Italian food. With this I convinced my family to dine here for dinner.

Dinner is a different beast from lunch. With lunch the No1DP and I are able to have a pretty quiet meal with plenty of natural sunlight. There's also not much activity going on in the middle of the day. Come dinner, especially on the day before NYE, the place was swamped and the tables were loud. There were also plenty of people in line to get a table or in line for the nearby Carlo bakery.

The 3-course pre-theater menu ($38/person) was a hit with everyone in my family. It made ordering a lot easier and since I was covering the dinner tab, along with the $25 credit made a Vegas dinner more reasonably-priced (but still expensive for regular casual Italian). What made it particularly appealing for me was that the menu options included my favorites: Grandma's Meatballs, My Dad's Bucatini Carbonara and Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake. These were the standout dishes I stated in previous reviews and I was very happy I could have all my favorites in one sitting. This was a lot of food - I remember eating cold bucatini carbonara the next day for breakfast (which BTW is still very good if you don't mind eating it cold).

In summary I've enjoyed both lunch and dinner at Buddy V's though the situations that I'll recommend both are different. I'll recommend doing small plates for lunch as the portion sizes are more manageable if you want to save your appetite for a big and fancy dinner. This is currently the arrangement for the No1DP and I whenever we're in Vegas. I'll recommend dinner as a non-date or casual date option if all a party wants is just some good comfort Italian food.

LUNCH: 4/5.
DINNER: 4.5/5.

Expected way more then what was received.the restaurants decor itself needed help. Very plain Jane nothing special. Looked like a country restaurant serving Italian food. Food itself was bland and plain. Services was just down right disgusting. The waitress and hostess are judgment and rude. Not worth the trip.
Excellent food, great service. Had dinner there with the family while in Vegas. Everyone was very happy with their dishes and drinks. Definitely recommend!!!

Arrived about 5 pm Wednesday to take advantage of happy hour pricing which runs 4:30-6:30. Small plate specials were $5.00 each, side salad for $7.00. About 8 choices total. Items we ordered were very good. Originally met by an unfriendly Hostess (I assume she's tired of answering "where do I sit for HH?") but our server was very nice, attentive and busy. Would like to revisit if in the area and order off menu but it is pricey.

We had a very enjoyable dinner at Buddy V's in the Palazzo Hotel. the prices were very reasonable, the service was good, and the food was delicious.

I had the chicken parmigiana and really enjoyed it. It was a very large portion with two large cutlets. The chicken was so tender, I didn't even need a knife, as I could cut it with a fork.

My wife had linguini with claims, and she also enjoyed her dinner. There were plenty of claims with the pasta.

We will definitely return during our next visit in Vegas.

Sorry...not a fan. We opted to do Sunday brunch and the food was just not good. The hot offerings had 2 types of eggs, chicken parm, frittata, and pastas. It was cold and gummy. Mac and cheese was saturated with oil. Carving station had your choice of apple sausage, Italian sausage, and Ham. They were so stingy with the meats only giving you one piece of meat. Nothing special about that. Peel and eat shrimp was good and the panzanella salad. The salad was very light and refreshing. Desserts pretty to look at but sadly, disappointing, even the famed cannolli's not enjoyable. Waitress was too busy flirting with guys instead of serving us. Not acceptable nor enjoyable for brunch.

We had lunch here and all really enjoyed it.  Our waiter was great and helped guide us through the menu. We started out with appetizers of the meatballs, calamari, and the antipasto board. Everything was very good. We didn't leave a bite. For lunch we had the family style serving. We had lasagna, salmon, chicken parmigiana, and vodka pasta. The salmon was very good along with the lasagna. The chicken parmigiana was also very good. Chicken was fried smothered in cheese. Even though everyone was satisfied with the meal our waiter talked us into dessert. We had a tray of canolli's, molten chocolate cake, gelato, and other desserts. Great lunch experience.

That lasagna is amazing and enough for 3 people.  I ate a third of it and could not eat anymore.  The flavors were great and the portion size was even better.  I also had the shrimp pasta dish that was a party in my mouth.  The service was excellent and the location in a great hotel.  I would come here again.

My wife and I had lunch here for our anniversary, we asked for the Express Lunch menu (you have to ask) which includes an app, entree and dessert for $22/ person, Out waiter, Danny was very pleasant and took note from my opentable reservation that it was our anniversary and gave us a free cannoli on the House. We will be back on our next trip to Vegas
Short wait for lunch. Service was good and the drinks are strong. The salmon was excellent and had a balsamic reduction which gave it a nice sweet crust. Overall good experience.

Terrible customer service and food was bland.

They couldn't even make a chicken btl correctly, they "forgot" the slice of bread .  No apology fr the manger or chef.

I don't recommend this place

All I can say is WOW!  The food was amazing! We had the whole wheat penne and the orecchiette with Italian sausage. Really good. We also split the Nutella cake with salted Carmel ice creme. One of the best deserts I have had.

Buddy V's is actually quite an interesting place to dine. This joint is not one of the high end Italian joints that you're used to seeing in Vegas, it's more of a casual dining experience in which you can wear shorts and a t shirt and fit right in. The ambiance is actually pretty nice and the location has some decent views of the strip. The food taste was just average, IMHO... Essentially nothing to write home about, the lasagna was just ok and rather small in portion while the Caesar salad was below average but did have croutons that were awesome (warm and soft). Overall, this may be a good spot to go the next day after a long night out, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here. 

Pros-
Location
Service
Decor
Menu

Cons-
Average taste 
Pricey

Great family style Italian restaurant and bakery.  Food, service, drinks, ambiance and prices are all great.  Loved the pasta, octopus, meatballs, sausages,  appetizers, kale side dish, fish and bread.  Desserts are to die for and awesome coffee and espresso drinks.  Speaking of drinks the bar menu is fantastic and the wine list is right behind it.  I don't go down to the Strip much for Italian, but, when I do, I go to Buddy V's.

We enjoyed the meatballs for appetizers, and the bread was some of the best we've had. The lasagna was so filling, I had quite a bit for leftovers. This is one of the best Italian restaurants I've tried recently, and I highly recommend it. The customer service was excellent, and we look forward to going again.

I can see I'm one of many who loved this restaurant!  We arrived about 9 PM on a Thursday night.  The place was packed but fortunately there were two seats at the bar, which we prefer.  Christia was awesome.  She made me a great martini and then proceeded to help us order.  We had meatballs and a caesar salad to start.  Both yum.  The croutons are made from polenta which was a nice surprise.  We ordered Sea Bass and Chicken Parm for entrees.  Once again, yum! Nutella cake for dessert.  After stuffing ourselves silly we walked around the beautiful Venetian Hotel and Grand Canal.
I make sure to come here whenever I am in Vegas. Not really that expensive given it is in a strip casino. I really enjoy their chicken parm.

I wanted to start out by saying Buddy V's Ristorante was highly recommended to me by my son from the night before on Mother's Day. My boyfriend suggested we dine there for my birthday the next night. Being raised in an old fashion Italian family that cooked a lot, I usually do not like to eat out at Italian restaurants because the food usually taste too Americanize and falls short of true Italian cuisine.  Well, I must say I give Buddy V's a big 5 stars. Their food, Charred Octopus, Orecchiette & Italian Sausage (pasta), Roasted Branzio (seasonal fish), Italian Greens (Tuscan kale, garlic oil, plum tomatoes) was the best ever!! My whole crazy Italian family would approve! Be warned the tropical drinks are very delicious but very strong. I got cockeyed 1/4 of the way drinking from my glass. I ended the evening with a cannoli which I give a 4 star because I still think my Mom's cannoli were a bit better. I was a little disappointed they did not offer a SMALL comp birthday dessert however they did write happy birthday on my Cannoli plate with chocolate. Coffee was great tasting and the serves rocks! Everyone is friendly and attentive.  I love this place, I may have to come back for brunch!

let me first state the food was good to very good, the service was lame. our server "Kristi F." left us waiting to the point we had to ask a person who cleared tables to have her come by and take our order. She rarely came by never checked on us. We had ordered several fixed menu items, that included desert, yet after the table was cleared from the dinner course she spread out desert menus saying, this and that were good.. We told her we had ordered the fixed menu that was inclusive of such and it seemed rather a  surprise to her, as she collected those desert menus Luckily the two young girls with us were entertained during the obscenely long 2.5 hour meal fest. I am not impressed.

Do not misunderstand me the food was good, the service was quite poor. I did not see a manager walking around, critiquing the troops on their performance and yet obviously it was needed.

The restaurant did NOT appear full, several tables were unoccupied. This adds to my confusion of tonight's performance. Perhaps we caught a bad night for our server and her customer skillset? 

We had a table of 7, 5 adults 2 children and 2.5 hours is well too long for a restaurant dinner, that is NOT a  dining experience.

It was lame.  

2 stars for food 0 for service..

I fell in love with this place! I am a huge Buddy fan so coming here was a must. It definitely was all that I expected and more. The service was great and quick. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and gave great suggestions. Our food exceeded our expectations. It was full of flavor and the the portions were great. We got a cannoli for dessert and it was AMAZING!!! I cannot wait to come back and try some more dishes, wines, and dessert.

I LOVED Buddy V's and cannot wait for my next trip to Vegas to go back. The atmosphere in the restaurant was great, but the food was what set this restaurant apart. I had the shrimp scampi and my husband had the chicken parm. Both were simply outstanding. Had I been wearing a looser dress, I would have been tempted to finish off the entire bowl of pasta.
Great place.  The marinara sauce was excellent and the motzerella appetizer was amazing.   We went between dinner and lunch so it wasn't crowded so,the service was very good.

Best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. Came here for the second time tonight & they have nothing but fast, excellent service. Their alfredo sauce is on the secret menu but is to die for! Def. must check this place out. One of my favorites on the strip!

The interior is really nice and the atmosphere is great for just a casual meal or a date.My server was really attentive and always checked to make sure everything was ok. I had the orecchiete and Italian sausage pasta and it was delicious. It was so good that I can't stop thinking about it. Even though the most popular item is the chicken parmesan,I have no regrets getting the pasta. I also ordered a special drink and was given the glass as a souvenir.Next time I'm in Vegas,I will make sure to get the chicken parmesan.
Fabulous food and incredible service! I look forward to eating here again next time I'm in Vegas!

Way good!  The chicken parm was fantastic.   Very tasty and much better than Otto down the street.  I couldn't be more pleasantly surprised by this meal.  The chicken was cooked through but not over cooked.  The breading was NOT soggy, was firm and crunchy.  Just a well executed dish.  The pasta was good too.

Services was attentive and nice!  I never had an empty glass and before I could ask for something like extra cheese, they were asking me.

Awesome!  Just awesome!

We had Chicken Parm and Shrimp scampi. Both were delicious. Most amazing is of course Tiramisu. Made my birthday very special. Finding Tiramisu made right is hard and definitely this place has one of the best I had after a long time

Our tradition is to go to Vegas every year and find a place to eat for Thanksgiving meal. I will be honest the price is high but the food is great. We have now gone to Buddy's twice now for the Thanksgiving meal.   We love the food. They have a version for kids or they can order from the kids menu. Note: you can order from the menu if you don't want the chefs menu. 

The desserts are to die for. We had the pumpkin cheese cake.  The kids had Chocolate cake and Nutella ice cream

Very good... So much food we had a lot of leftovers. And the next day it was still awesome. I had lasagna and my husband had the chicken Parmesan (both our meals were so good). Nice place. Sucks cause we were too full to eat or have room for desserts. Happy note is Carlos bakery is right across the way. This place is at the Venetian.

Snap! I go to Vegas frequently and I ALLWAYS hit Buddy V's at least once! Everything is fabulous but the Cheese Ravioli is A-mazing!!! Save room for the famous deserts (the lobster tail is the best IMO)
Their macaroni and cheese is the BEST that I have ever had! I wish it came in a dinner portion. Their service was nice and the atmosphere was relaxing.

I wasn't too impressed. But to be honest, I didn't expect to be either. While I had my moment watching Buddy master cakes on the Cake Boss, to attach his name to a restaurant wasn't as exciting as say, having a bakery with his name on it.

I will say the meal started strong with the meatball appetizer. You get large meatballs in sauce and both were very good. So it set the standard high.

One of my favorite items at Italian restaurants is the pasta vodka. While it was good, it wasn't great by any means. Just okay. I did appreciate the al dente noodles though. 

But the most surprising thing was the desserts. I get it, you want to include some family favorites like cannoli's, but still. No cake? What about featuring mini cakes that are decorated? Just something to play off the show. I just expected more than just three plain jane choices of sweets. 

I'll admit I sought it out, having the name attached and being new, but I wouldn't urge anyone else to visit this spot while in Vegas.

We made it to Buddy V's at the Venetian!  Tip: Park at Palazzo Valet, walk down to strip and up escalator next to Walgreens for a shorter walk!

We came during Happy Hour, 4:30-6:30 pm 7 days a week. We were here Memorial Day weekend, and it wasn't too full on a Sunday afternoon. The seating in the bar was really comfy with stuffed chairs and couches, high top bar tables with padded seats and bar seating with padded seats with backs. 

We tried one of everything on the Small Bites for $5 Happy Hour menu!!!  We also had the Butterscotch Creme Brûlée for dessert for $9. So creamy and great butterscotch flavor! It's a good sized bowl, but only about 1/2 inch thick, so not as many calories!

Ricotta cheese was smooth and creamy. It came with grilled buttered bread, and was a great accompaniment to the Olives and Pickled Vegetables, which was served with the same bread. There was enough cheese to also put some on the amazing and Must have Grandma's Meatballs. 3 large beef, veal and pork meatballs with about 1/2 of tomato sauce, sprinkled with a good amount of parmesan cheese. Our other favorites: the Calamari had some big tender pieces that I loved, there were crispy big pieces that that the little tentacles that our friend loved and some fried banana peppers that the spicy food lover liked. My wife's favorite was definitely the Mac and Cheese Carbonara, with smoked mozzarella, fontina, egg, pancetta and peas with a creamy sauce and golden bread crumbs. We got Roma style Gnocchi, which are little fried cubes of polenta with a little metal tub of marinara mixed with pesto dipping sauce-delicious. Crunchy on outside  and smooth inside, great sauce. The smashed meatball sliders was a fun little 2 bite sandwich with peppers on top. Same for Sausage and pepper sliders, which are a bit spicy. 

Loved the little to go novelty light up cup for the soda with unlimited refills for $7. 

Krystal waited on us, and was very happy and attentive. Manager Kristina Poole visited the table and sat and visited us for a nice chat. We got an update on the restaurant, it's sister restaurant in Bethlehem, PA and Buddy's moms health when we asked. The Assistant General Manager, Sean Fiori, came and whisked her away after a quick picture and check to make sure we were happy. 

Very nice evening, could be quick, but this time we stayed and enjoyed ourselves and they were not pushing us out after we paid the bill.

We are here again on 12/18/16 and it's all the same-menu, Krystal the waitress, me and my wife and Flower. She's having the Sangria. No hot chocolate for Tutu, they need to add it to the menu during cold weather.  She got some across the way at Carlos Bakery. Along with Cannoli and a strawberry cheesecake.

last minute decision to meet up friends in vegas and to celebrate my birthday. stayed at the palazzos and had dinner at buddy v's. we tried their popular lasagna dish, pastas, calamaris, cesar salad and a steak entree. everything tasted delicious and authentic, especially the lasagna. the pastas were done al dente with the right amount of sauce and flavor. it reminded us of italy. this is an upscale place preparing solid classic italian dishes. las vegas + great dinner experience = feeling like a winner.

Discovered Lunch Express Menu

I had done some research on Buddy V's Restaurant and found about their lunch express menu. For $22, you can choose an appetizer/soup/salad, your choice of entree and dessert. We had - the Caesar Salad - yummy and creamy. Salad was well tossed. OMG the cheese croutons! I could pop these nonstop! - the meatballs - quite yummy and tasty sauce - Spaghetti Bolognese - mum liked her meal a whole lot - Margherita pizza - fluffy and light pizza. - Bucatini Carbondale - the waiter recommended this dish. It is indeed one of the best carbonaras I've ever had. - Tiramisu - OMG - you don't taste the bitterness of the coffee very much. - Cannoli - crunchy she'll with a cream filling- it was OK Gelato - chocolate and vanilla - cools you down Thinking of coming back for their Sunday Brunch next time.

Traveled to Las Vegas and had dinner at Buddy's!
Restaurant was super nice and clean, open kitchen in the center of the restaurant. My wife and I had spaghetti and meatballs, a Caesar salad and garlic bread. Food was great and reasonably priced based on the quantity and quality. Staff was great and the manager on duty was very friendly.

We had the Aunt Nina's mozzarella and then proceeded to the bone in veal Parmesan (to split)--big mistake!  The veal Parmesan was great but holy cow -that alone for us to split was enough!!!!!  Great food-loved it...but now I am ready for a food coma....

Been here a few times, as we are a fan of the TV show.  

Prices have definitely gone up.  Usually a "traditional Italian" (Buddy V's sells tradition throughout his advertising)  restaurant includes fresh bread.  Not this place.  Order the garlic bread, and await your bill $$$ .  The price of the drinks have skyrocketed as well.  The pasta is not fresh.   For the price of Buddy V's pasta, you have to offer some fresh pasta.  The deserts were actually terrible.   Not sure if Buddy V has actually dined at this restaurant for a while.  The quality has defiantly decreased.   We will not be going back here.

My wife and I stopped in for some lunch after seei by Buddy's place on the map. The bread is great, my salad was so-so. We shared a combination plate that had lasagna and chicken parm. The meal was great.

My boyfriend and I were looking for somewhere special to celebrate our anniversary. We spent a good hour narrowing down Italian food restaurants based on reviews and the menu, and we were very disappointed with our experience at Buddy V's. When you walk in the atmosphere is very welcoming, dimly lit, guy playing the piano, and nice decor. That's where the nice experience ends. Once we sat down, our waiter tried to hard sell us on this wine that was clearly the wine the restaurant wanted the waiters to sell that night. We had to tell him "not interested" at least 3 times. I don't expect to get hassled and given the "hard sell" by our server at a really nice restaurant. The food we received tasted like it had been frozen and reheated. Definitely did not taste fresh. We started out with the Meatball appetizer. The meatballs had no "crispiness" to the outside. The sauce was thin and had no flavor.  My boyfriend got the Lasagna (which was supposed to be their signature dish), and I got the Pasta alla Vodka (normally very yummy if done right). The sauce with the Lasagna was runny and had no flavor. He even commented that the Lasagna I made at home tasted better than what he got at Buddy V's. As for my Pasta alla Vodka, the sauce was runny and had no flavor, the chicken was tough, and the pasta wasn't cooked enough. I went to an Italian food restaurant in Shenzhen China that had better Pasta alla Vodka. To top it off, the menu prices were $25+, which is kind of what you expect from Vegas, but I expect top quality food at that price, and especially from a celebrity chef. Do not eat here.

I was hoping that this restaurant was gonna be good... Big fail;( well we went for sunset menu ( 3-5pm) . We started off with the Buddy's Salumi n cheese board($19) as an appetizer...nothing special for the price. Then waiter asked if we wanted garlic bread (FYI not free it was $9 for 3 pieces) bread wasn't even warm, great Italian bread is a precursor to a great meal, not even close.  Menu was limited which isn't bad bc that usually means that the stuff on the menu is usually great...Uhm not the case. The linguine n clams ($25) portion small & there was spaghetti noodles instead of linguine??? Caprese salad($14) there was a whole tomato on the plate which was like boiled n peeled, unimpressed. The angus burger had no flavor n the French fries were overdone n cold, really??? 
Ok so after being disappointed by the food I was really looking forward to dessert... The XL lobster tail ($15) was so disappointing bc the pastry shell was hard as a rock n hard to eat. As you bite into it all the cream would shoot out bc the shell was so hard. The cannoli shell was hard as well, like a hard cookie ($9). If you had real cannolis you know that they are not supposed to taste like that. To top it off the coffee yes the coffee tasted horrible, like it's been sitting in the pot all day. For 3 people and sunset menu which is cheaper than dinner total $153 and that's with no alcohol..for that total there was not one thing I could say anything nice about. I had leftovers that weren't even worth taking home. 
Yes, I should of known better to go to a gimmicky restaurant. But I liked the show and I'm from NYC and was hoping for some good Italiano food n dessert. No love in the food at all. Don't waste your money n time going all the way to the crazy strip for this place. 
Buddy .....if your reading this or your PR person lets you know what's going on with your restaurant. This place is giving your familia a bad name. I've had your pastries in NJ. This place is not giving your bakery any justice. People who travel to Las Vegas and who will never go to your bakery in NJ are going to think that your desserts taste like this ( specifically in the restaurant) not good.

Huge fan of Buddy and his family and this restaurant did not disappoint. The bread they bring you is delicious. Our waiter (wish I got his name) was extremely kind and made small conversation with us which I loved. I got the cheese ravioli and it was amazing. My mother got the meat lasagna which was absolutely amazing. Definitely recommend that. My brother got the scallops and fell in love with it. The portions weren't huge (the turkey lasagna was a pretty good portion but the ravioli and scallops weren't huge), but were very filling! We had Canolis and lobster tails for dessert which were amazing. We had a great experience and it was 100 % worth it. So good in fact we are going back tomorrow for brunch!

I'm giving it a lower grading this time because we did the brunch buffet and it wasn't that grand.  I had to come back here because of that AMAZING carbonara mac n cheese, but it was on the verge of awful this time.  The stuff in the brunch is not good at all compared to when they make it fresh for you!  It is to die for when it's fresh.  In the brunch, it's been sitting around etc, and isn't very good.  The salads were good.  The Caesar salad croutons are very different.  There almost like a cornmeal texture.  The arugula salad was delicious.  Chicken Parmesan was ok, but I'm sure it would be excellent if made fresh.  All around, the pastas were kind of disappointing.  It's cool to have a bottomless mimosa/Bloody Mary option.  Roughly $15, but it's bottomless.  Service from the bartender Emily was fantastic!  Not a remote complaint in that department.  We would come back, but won't do the brunch.

Wanted a good, affordable meal while in Las Vegas and Buddy V's filled the bill. It's a bit cramped and, of course, touristy (you should see the line for the bake shop across the way), but all in all was an enjoyable, casual Italian meal.

I had the clams with linguine and hubby had the lasagna. We started with mozzarella en carozza. All really tasty and fresh. I took cannolis to go - MY GOODNESS those were awesome!!!

After a lengthy research online we picked Buddy V's at the Venetian for our Easter Brunch. The selection was not huge but all the items were fresh and had amazing flavor. The salad and bread selection even featured a traditional hot cross buns. Carved meat station had slab bacon along with an incredibly tender leg of lamb. The pastas and meatballs were an excellent nod to the Italian side and made me want to go back for dinner. My kids favorite item was the French toast. The cake boss did not disappoint for the dessert. Individual tiramisu was perhaps the best I ever had and the mini cannoli's had very flavorful filling but we're probably made a bit too early and the shells were already a bit soggy. Unfortunately the only downside to our meal was the grumpy servers and unfriendly host staff. It is a family atmosphere place and they all acted annoyed to be serving children. A pleasant attitude and a smile goes a long way to make you feel welcome. Overall we are glad we picked Buddy V's to celebrate Easter at. As locals we will most likely be back.

We went with the family of seven and wanted to pay separate bills. For some reason we were told we could not do this and had to put everything all on one bill. Imagine The fun at the end of the night of trying to divide everybody's dinner and then pay separately. But then being told that you can either pay on the all-cash or only on a credit card. thank God we had an accountant with us who could figure out each individual bill and tip. Dinner was very good, my meat was overcooked which they took back and then replaced. I did think they would have discounted my dinner a little bit since I did not get to eat with everybody, however they did not; but I guess it was OK because the food was good. We had two people that had birthdays, which we told them when they asked if it was a special occasion? At the end of the night they brought out two birthday desserts to share. The unfortunate part about this was that they charged us for these desserts which we thought were free since no one asked for anything! All in all the food was good, but the crazy bill rules and being charged for what we thought was a complimentary dessert on top of having my dinner late made it so that I probably wouldn't go back.

This place was really good! Living in NJ, i'm spoiled with access to the best Italian food in the county (in NYC), so I'm a tough judge. But our food was delicious and the service was A++++. We had the mozzarella en carozza which was tasty with a chunky tomato sauce and pesto; delicious, but more like a glorified grilled cheese than the carozza I'm used to on the east coast. The complimentary homemade bread was great though. We also had the veal marsala and chicken penne alla vodka and both were GREAT. I was also pleased with the portion of everything; they weren't gluttonous but large enough for a small leftovers meal. I'd suggest it to anyone going to Vegas, but with SO MANY restaurants on the strip, I don't think it's a "must visit" if you're only there for a short time. Staying 4+ days? Add it to the list.

Don't request a different seat they will cancel your reservation! 2 dozen tables open and I can move to the one 5ft away without having to wait another 30min... Thought Buddy was all about customer service! Guess not.

The ambience and staff made our dinner memorable. We arrived a bit early for our reservation and they were able to seat us in no time. Since it was obvious that we were going to be seated at the bar section, Kelly reminded me that bars likely do not allow minors in their section since Katharine is only 17 so I informed the hostess. She apologized and asked us to return to the front for reassignment. For the next 10 minutes three other similar sized parties are seated ahead of us. We end up sitting in a table next to the waiters' cashier station. Not much of an issue since we were still towards the front of the restaurant. We open two of the three menus and the entrée pages are missing. Kelly walks over to the hostess station to show them this and picks up new menus. This slight hiccup at the beginning of the evening would've been disastrous for most establishment but Buddy V's made up and bent backwards to ensure our satisfaction. GM Christopher and his manager kept checking on us to make sure we were ok. We ordered the Caprese to start and had the Shrimp Scampi, Spaghetti and Meatballs, and Spaghetti Bolognese. All fantastic! We finished with the Apple Pie topped with a scoop of Vanilla Ice Cream. They do a really good job with their food. If you ever get the chance to visit one of their restaurants, it is well worth it!

The first impression I had was "housekeeping" they need to do some serious cleaning in that place! The chandeliers although very pretty were dusty as hell. There was a display of fake food on the right hand side... It was covered in black dust. I work in the customer service industry and I'm sure that the dust that had been accumulating was there for months. 

When I go to a establishment of that caliber, I expect it to be spotless. No excuses. 

About the food, the pasta was great but the portions were rather small. The chopped summer corn salad was a fiasco. It tasted like if the corn and green beans were poured out of a can directly to the plate. If the story was different than the one I'm telling, well taste and appearance didn't make the trick. 

Needs a lot of improvement. Definitely underwhelmed.

Food was good but overpriced. There are other restaurants in town just as tasty for almost half the price. 

I had high expectations for the Lobster Tail XL and was extremely disappointed. The size, first, and then the shell of the pastry wrapping the custard. It was so hard I could barely chew it, much less finish it. The custard itself was good though. 

The bake shop outside of the restaurant is all I'd ever go back for.  Their cinnamon cannoli's are much more worth the price for their quality.

A revisit here did not quite replicate our earlier 5-star experience.  The restaurant was not as accommodating as before, and did not honor our reservation request for a booth.  Instead we were seated at a table where one-half of my party of four was temporarily blinded by the sun near sundown.  Then we settled in, and things soon improved.

Grandma's Meatballs covered in Red Sauce (Sunday Gravy) were authentic classic Italian meatballs, and Aunt Nina's Mozzarella en Carozza was a hot and cheesy confection once again.  Calamari Fritti was another nice starter.  And the complimentary Focaccia Bread was great.

A big side of Caesar Salad was good.  And Nonna's Lasagna Al Forno was again one of the best lasagnas I have ever tasted--besides Diane's vaunted cheesy and saucy concoction which won the 2014 Ardiente Lasagna Baking Championship in a blind tasting by judges.  This time I did not even bother to finish the whole rich lasagna dish.  I filled up on half of what was presented to me, and took the other half home.  Alas, Diane failed to persuade the chef to make her Veal Parm Alfredo, and had to settle for a good Veal Marsala instead, which unfortunately arrived late to the table.

For dessert we were served great Cannoli compliments of the chef, to make up for the late arrival of Diane's dinner entree.  Service was excellent except for the ordering miscue, no peppers offered on the side of the Calamari Fritti, and no available Roasted Potatoes this particular evening.

4-1/2 stars overall!

Hey,  ba da bing, ba da boom, I'm at the Cake Boss's joint.  You gotta problem with that?  Cause if you do,  he knows a guy who knows a guy! 

That said,  and it needed to be, I rarely eat southern Italian in restaurants because growing up in NY, I had the good fortune to eat the real master chefs cuisine,  my grandmother,  father,  aunts and friends parents. Anyway my point is,  I'm seriously biased. 

My goal was to eat something tasty and not heavily laden with sugar,  flour, carbs as I'm in the middle of a book about that stuff which is gross, scary and fascinating all at the same time.  But,  I digress. 

I went for lunch and ordered grandma's meatballs and a side of Tuscan Kale with roasted tomatoes.  While I get that we didn't use real San Marzano tomatoes here,  it did come close to replicating an authentic flavor.  I should point out that meatballs to Italians is a very serious and personal matter. My extended family can argue endlessly on the what constitutes the perfect meatball, whether there should be inclusions such as pignola nuts, raisens and tons of other stuff you can't possibly imagine. 

The Tuscan Kale wasn't on the menu,  but Star, my server,  not wanting to disappoint,  checked with the kitchen and they said they could do it.  I was very happy.  That's service! Problem was,  it came out very tough, chewy and barely edible.  So I appreciate the extra effort,  not the result, and the results are what matters. Once you commit to me, I'm expecting your A game stuff. 

Appropriate classic Italian Frank Sinatra,  Dean Martin, Louis Prima and other legends sang in the background. I'll go back ang give them another try for dinner.

Buddy V's Ristorante is a lovely place to go for home-style cooked Italian food.  The menu offers a variety of appetizers, salads, pasta, chicken, veal and seafood.  Last but not least, the cakes are insanely delicious- not surprising, seeing the restaurant is owned by the Cake Boss himself.  Do whatever you have to do to save room for dessert!

Our server brought us a tray of freshly baked focacia before the meal.  It was so fluffy and warm.  i could have eaten a whole tray myself!  My sister and her boyfriend shared some of their fried calamari appetizer.  It was great!

The cocktails were wonderful.  I tried my sister's martini called the Cake Boss- red velvet cake, chocolate liqueur and Bailey's.

The restaurant sadly did not offer any Alfredo entrees, which are typically my favorite, but my Chicken Piccata (breaded chicken cutlet in a white wine & butter sauce) was excellent!  The side of pasta was also very good.

I tried my mom's Eggplant Parmesan and was very impressed!  The food truly tasted like we were eating a homemade dinner at a family member's dining room table.

Even though we loved our meals, the best course of the meal was dessert.  I had trouble deciding what to order.  The Cannoli, Butterscotch Creme Brulee and Nutella Cake all sounded so good.  Our server recommended that I try the Italian Birthday Cake- Rum soaked sponge cake with cannoli filling, chocolate pastry cream and toasted almonds.  It was heavenly!

The restaurant's ambience is perfect for a nice family dinner.  It is beautifully decorated with a combination of vibrantly colorful kitchen items and upscale decor.  The restaurant has an energetic and happy atmosphere,  They commonly have upbeat live music playing, but at a reasonable level so you can hear the people at your table talking to you.

The service is also amazing.  The employees make you feel like old friends of theirs- definitely the ideal Italian kitchen.

BEST DINNER OF THE TRIP!!!!! I got a caesar salad to start, the carbonara, and Lisa's Nutella cake! OUT OF THIS WORLD. The only problem was I was so stuffed by the time dessert cake I couldn't eat the whole thing lol. The ambience was very laid back, with piano music playing as we were overlooking the Las Vegas strip. The musician even came over to the tables to see how we were enjoying ourselves. I eat Italian food very regularly as I am Italian and from Boston, and this was up there with the best Italian dishes I've ever had!!! 

The busser was so sweet and attentive we thought he was our server at first! Could not bring us enough bread or help us enough!! However the waitress had no personality, was rude when we asked about the happy hour specials and really did nothing for out experience. Overall I would recommend this to all!!!!!

Went there for dinner on the way back to California. First of all, we were greeted when we went in. We were sat down right away. I had the Blackberry Collins (drink) and it was delicious. My brother had the drink with Jalapeño and mango and it was so good. Alex Rivera was thee best server I have come across. His skills with explaining the menu to giving us options on what is the "thing" to eat. I ended up eating the Osso Buco. It was soooo tender and the flavor was impeccably mastered. I highly suggest going here. Ask for Alex to be your server! I was impressed, hopefully you will be too.

I went here for a small meal with my parents before departing for the airport.  Among us 3 we split a Buddy's pizza and a pasta carbonara.  Pizza was quite tasty and good, very flavorful, but I thought it was too salty for my full and complete enjoyment.  The pasta arrived in a small-lookin portion, for the price we were paying . . (~$23?).  It's not like I was expecting Cheesecake factory portions, but given the price, the pasta could have either used a bit more pizzaz or a larger serving size.  It was a very .. bland okayish dish overall, something I feel that I could have made at home.  Definitely a skippable dish.

I was in need of a sweet fix since Carlo's Bakery right across the way was such a let down. Buddy V had a happy hour, so we decided to take a seat in the bar area where the live band was setting up. I tried a red sangria. It was so bad, I could only take one sip. I also ordered Lisa's warm nutella cake. The nutella was missing and the cake was dry until you reach the middle where the chocolate sauce oozed out. The combination of the cake, ice cream, and the praline crunch paired well together, but the ice cream was the best out of the three, although not amazing. The dessert wasn't as bad as his cupcakes. I just expected more from the Buddy brand. Our waitress and the ambiance were great, however.

Sorry Buddy but everything as just Ok for me. Had the meatballs, lasagna, and a antipasti lasagna was the best out of the 3. Also had the red velvet alcoholic bev. Just ok. I was really rooting for it to be good. Good luck and good eats!!!

Soooooo pleasantly suprised by this place. Went to the famous Cake Boss bakery since there are only 2 stores world wide! After standing in line at the bakery we found ourselves starving and impatient so we decided to just go into this sister restaurant right across the hall. Went in with no expectations and having read nothing about the place and was totally blown away! 

I had the chicken ceasar salad cause after spending 3 days in vegas all I wanted were vegetables and water. The romaine was crisp, the dressing was yummy, and the crutons were the star of the dish... parmesan polenta crutons!? That's a thing? You're damn right that's a thing and it's amazing! Would give it a full 5 but they were a bit skimpy on the chicken. 4.5/5

The man ordered the Philly Cheese Sandwich which was also delicious. Crisp and soft bread, ooy-gooy cheese, juicey thin slices of perfectly seasoned meat. It's not a traditional Philly in any sense but it's truely one of the best I've ever had. 5/5

Might I add they offer the dessert we were standing in line for at the bakery. Kind of wish we had just dined here and ordered a pastry for dessert!

Would definitely dine here again give it a shot for sure!

Was in Vegas for a fun weekend and then a conference, so I got to try Buddy V's twice. The first time was for a late Sunday brunch, but we just got there too late for the buffet brunch, which looked really good. Gonna definitely have to come back for that some time.

Me and my date tried the salumi plate, which was pretty good, especially since it came with crispy grilled baguette slices. Schmeared some of the blue cheese on a slice and then layered the salumi and prosciutto for a nice little open face mini-sammy. Yum! I ordered the chicken parm, which came with a side of spaghetti marinara and my date ordered the caesar salad and we split them both between us, which was more than enough food since the caesar was pretty good size and the chicken parm came with two equal sized filets covered with cheese and sauce. The caesar came with polenta croutons, which were amazing and would have been a great appetizer on their own with a side of red sauce! Crispy on the outside and warm and fuzzy in the middle. Almost took away from how good the caesar was. My date thought there was too much dressing, but I like it that way. The chicken parm was awesome! Probably the best I've ever had anywhere. Good thick tender piece of chicken, nice breading, and great cheese to chicken ration with a nice marinara on top. But the coup de grâce was the unassuming side of pasta on the dish. I don't know what it was, but it was just spaghetti marinara but the size and texture of the pasta was just amazing. It was like the unknown actor stealing the spotlight from all the big name actors in a movie! 

I went back for lunch later in the week and got the Express lunch for $22 which included a 3 course selection. I got the caesar, spaghetti bolognese, and lemon sorbet. All were awesome, expecially for the price. But the spaghetti again was amazing. And the bolognese sauce was nice and thick and held to the pasta like glue. Easily the best spaghetti dish I've ever had. Again, I don't know what it was about the pasta (size? texture? taste? perfectly al dente?) but it was like crack in pasta form. I can't wait to go back! And this is from a guy who try's not to eat pasta much because it's a carb bomb. And I don't think I've ever had a more perfectly balanced sorbet. Not too sweet, not too tart (lemon sorbet). And 2 big scoops! What a great way to finish the meal and cleanse the pallet!

Well done, Buddy V! Well done!

This restaurant was just ok for me.  We went on a Saturday for lunch.  Service was ok, but not great. The food was ok, but nothing outstanding.  Finally, the prices were high for what was served.  Now for more detail. 

My husband and I both had salads.  I had the panzanella, which is mozzarella and grilled bread on a bed of greens.  The bread was wet and mushy.  The greens had way too much dressing.  The good news: the tomatoes and cucumbers in the salad were delicious.  

My husband got the Sicilian charred octopus. He said the octopus was nice.  The problem is, with so many outstanding restaurants close by, "nice" just doesn't make the grade.  

Sorry Buddy!
Love eating here everytime when visiting Vegas ! All the food , and staff are excellent ! Always AWESOME!!!!
This place is excellent!!! Last night I was craving Italian food and noticed this restaurant across the street from my hotel. I'm so glad we found it. The food was great and the service was awesome.

Came here on a Saturday evening and was able to get a table pretty quick by sitting in the bar area. Eggplant parm and spaghetti and meatballs were both excellent, lots of seasoning, tons of flavor. Service was great, very polite and friendly wait staff. Will absolutely go again next time I am in Vegas!

AMAZING. Been watching cake boss and drooling over their food for years looking at it on the show, and tonight we finally got to go! Everything was fantastic! Had 2 three course dinners (Mama's meatballs, salmon, and a cannoli and then the chicken parmesan, and nutella cake) and at 38 bucks each, you can't beat that for huge portions at a relaxed atmosphere on the strip. The staff was super accommodating and made us feel welcome and relaxed as well. If I could give more stars, I would! :)
We had the surf and turf, finished every bite! Excellent food, it was cooked perfectly. We can't wait to come back.

For the good:

The bus staff was the best thing about this place, making sure your drink was filled and bread was on  the table.  The ones to clear as well.

For the bad:

I know there is over 300 different types of pasta, but the waitress should at least learn the names of the ones where they work.  She didn't know the difference in the dishes, when I had a question.  I asked for the dessert menu up front, so I could decide if i wanted salad verse dessert, she never brought it.  (finally got it from the bus staff).  Slow to do service, waited a long time to pay my bill at the table.

I ordered the carbonara, was not happy with the type of pasta, but more important way too much "cracked" pepper on it.    The bread/focaccia was just average.  

For the real bad:

About an hour later, made my stomach very ill.

The calamari was truly the best I've ever had!  Hot and Tender as butter with a  wonderful dipping sauce!  The lasagna was huge, 7 layers, cheesy deliciousness 

The grilled salmon was divine and the scallops were tasty.

Great view, service and ambiance, however it was a little loud.

Do Not Miss the butterscotch creme brûlée!!
My husband has gotten my birthday cake here for the past few years. They never fail, it is always the best! My favorite is the strawberry shortcake. Yumm!

Went here for the Nutella cake. Common with the cake boss reviews you have to try it.  The cake was amazing with a nice hot interior and fresh taste.  This is a cake that kills every dessert that I have had.    Wonderful melt in your mouth sugar high.  Is this heaven ?

While vacationing in Vegas with family we decided to check out Buddy V's at the Venetian.  It was a very pleasant experience for our party of seven.  The restaurant itself is lovely with a tastefully decorated interior and comfortable seating.  The service was excellent, very professional and courteous from our waitress to the bussers. The complimentary bread with Olive Oil and Balsamic Dipping plate was delicious, the bread warm and fluffy and the olive oil and balsamic very flavorful.  The Garlic Bread Appetizer was so tasty, warm and very cheesy...we ate every crumb.  The Salumi & Cheese Board Appetizer was outstanding...very flavorful, quality, thinly sliced Proscuitto, Cappicolla and Salami along with Grana Padano and Parmeggiano, and Gorgonzola Cheeses and delicious olives. The entrees were a home run for all seven of us.  The Veal Marsala, Chicken Parm, Chicken Picatta, Steak Pizzaiola ...all perfectly cooked, good portion size and the accompanying Broccolini and/or Buttered Spaghetti Noodles just made the dishes even more pleasing.  The Sunday Gravy signature dish was excellent, the sauce authentic Italian and the combination of meats reminded us of our mother's and grandmother's typical Sunday dinners.  The wine selection was impressive and our Pinot Grigio and Chianti choices did not disappoint.  Loved this restaurant ... the best dinner we had in Vegas during our trip.

This joint was classy and service was great. Located in the Venetian Hotel, this is one of many great Italian restaurants that offer a unique dining experience. My mom and daughter and I were all under the weather with a stomach bug and was disappointed that we couldn't get the upmost experience but we ordered the shrimp scampi, served with pasta. The shrimp was huge fresh and delicious. My daughter and I split the Filet served with mash potatoes...fabulous in both flavor and presentation and they divided it for us at no extra charge. We were so upset that we were not feeling well enough to experience anything on the dessert menu. I hope we can get back soon. I only have two complaints: the music was really loud so it was really hard to have a conversation and there were two, I assume, managers, one man in a suit and the other a lady, who cased the joint like they were one of the Sapranos...I understand they are paid to keep the place running smooth but I felt like if you had checked his pockets, you would find a pair of brass nuckles or something worse #RoadtripUSA

Best part is the view of the strip from the bar. It wasn't super busy. Slow service from the wait staff, arrogant manager on-duty, and one-drink-at-a-time bartender make this restaurant experience drop a couple of stars. The positives are a very nice greeter, fast kitchen and casual Italian ambience. Skip the basics, don't get the spaghetti or lasagna al forno because they are not much better than local joints. It's expensive for what it is, so you might as well go for the good stuff. Try the veal or chicken parm, veal Marsala, and the bar. I'll try it again and hope it gets better.

Another favorite place to eat! The only negative is that it is really loud and difficult to have a conversation. We ordered the family style meal with the appetizer, dinner and dessert. It was a homerun! 

The variety was perfect for our group of 7 and there was plenty to eat. I included the before and after of our dessert plate just to give you an idea of how fantastic it was. 
I would like to go there when it's not so crowded next time.
Excellent service with Casey and Georgio! The group of 20! The food was great. No complaints.
The clams and linguine, AMAZING.  The where cooked perfect.    The bread that was brought to the table was very fresh and really liked the olive oil and balsamic vinegar.   Service was excellent.

While waiting in the super long line at Carlos bakery across the way I noticed this restaurant. (Found out later that they are connected) My friends and I had already decided on Mexican food for dinner but I wandered over to look at the menu and inquire about the wait time. As soon as I walked in I was in heaven! It smelled amazing! The prices weren't bad and the hostess sad she could seat our party of 4 right now so I went ahead and followed her to a table (with an incredible view of the strip!) I never went back to my friends... I just texted them and told them we had a change of plans and would now be eating Italian at Buddy V's! We told our server, Casey, we had reservations and were kind of in a rush. She was fantastic and told us which dishes to avoid because of a longer cook time and made a few recommendations on dinner and wine. We ordered Salmon, spaghetti bolognese, chicken piccata and ravioli and all four of us loved our dishes. As promised, Casey had us out of there in under an hour and we made it to the show with time to spare! Great food, great service, great views & I can't wait to go back! Next time I'm ordering dessert because they looked delicious as well!

Its a little pricey but its Vegas after all (everything in Vegas is pricey).

Hubby and I had the Sunday brunch for $35/each. It was decent but I have to tell you, the bread pudding was one of the best I have ever had! 

View was awesome. Waiters were friendly.

This review is for happy hour and not any of the meals. $5 sangrias were incredible and dangerous - barely tasted like alcohol until they hit you. We got the ricotta cheese small plate, and while the cheese was pretty bland, the grilled filoni bread was incredible!

My last meal before heading back to oc was here during summer. It's so hard to leave Vegas when you are having fun and with family. I celebrated my mom's bday early here and service was beyond exceptional. We 5 of us were seated in a booth, dinner was about to begin, it was a Sunday but eating here made it feel like we were really away on vacation. The calamari was well seasoned, not too much battered, and crispy. We had Moretti's and it went well with our meals. I love Italian food and the pasta was cooked perfectly and not too al dente.  For us cali drivers, a heavy meal is not the way to go before heading home. Plus the 100 degree weather doesn't help so much. We were stuffed and with to go boxes. They gave us a little cute cookie plate for dessert. I want to come back here for a romantic dinner next trip. Thank you Buddy V's!!

First thing I am going to say is" I am so sorry Buddy! I love you, I love your show! I love your charisma, but unfortunately the food at your Las Vegas restaurant is very disappointing. ;( We came here on Dec. 24 to celebrate my daughters first birthday, this i will give you though, your staff is excellent! Great customer service and great ambiance! They were very accommodating and on top of things, Kudos on that! We ordered various things from desserts to appetizers, the most disappointing item was the veal, it tasted funky and it had a weird smell to it, so i returned it and they graciously took it off my bill. the tastiest item we ordered was the linguini with clams, but it wasn't amazing, the other items like calamari, osso buco, grilled cheese, was ok, but not great as well. The lobster tail dessert was just horrible, it was as hard as a rock! I am sorry to say that my expectations were a bit higher, especially since the menu was a bit pricey, but even if the menu was more reasonably priced, the taste was just not exciting my palate. I mean overall it was a fun time, I don't regret celebrating my baby's first birthday there, hey at least the baby loved the free bread sticks, but would I come back? Maybe if somebody else paid, i would be willing to give it another shot, also keep in mind that they just opened this location, and every restaurant will always have its growing pains, that's why these reviews are necessary.

One of the best places for a lasagne on the strip! This place was honestly not the first place we had picked to go for dinner that day, but some how we ended up there and we were not disappointed! The service to begin with is AMAZING. Our server told us that one lasagne would be good for the 3 of us, but we were being naive and didn't want to believe it. So we got 3 lasagnes, because of the high praise from the other staff as well. Our server was not joking, that lasagne is one plate you might never finish in one sitting. All three of us finished only about a quarter of our lasagnes before we were stuffed to our eye balls. We literally couldn't move. But it was so delicious, form the sauce to the meat and the cheese! They also make fantastic drinks and offer great insight on the various dishes. The restaurant offers great views, and even though we didn't get to try it, we heard the high praise of their cheese cake!

TLDR: Get one lasagne for 3 people, you will all be stuffed!

It's one of the best happy hours in town. Prices are great. Only 5 dollars for appetizers and 4 or 5 dollars for drinks. I can tell that they have the best  fried calamari in town. So soft that they are melting in your mouth . I tried my boyfriend's gnocchi and loved them too even though they are totally different from real Italian gnocchi which you try in Italy. Just a different recipe, not a big deal. The environment is very classy and it has outdoors. There is also Carlo's bakery just in front of it where you can get a desert if you like.

Carlos bakery was too packed so we decided to go to Buddy V's Ristorante instead to taste some of the desserts. We sat in bar area and our waitress/bar tender was not good. She barely spoke, her hair was in my drink and she really didn't do anything more than what she had to. We witnessed another customer, 2 women waiting to be served. They started at the bar, moved to a table, moved to another table and waited and waited and the waitress/bar tender never helped them so they left. It wasn't busy either. As far as food, I had the Italian cake and I wasn't impressed. I'm not a cream person so maybe that's why I didn't like it.

Terrific Happy Hour, 7 days a week, 4:30-6:30 pm in the bar and lounge!  This has to be one of the best deals on the strip, and the best part is it's not just a deal for deal's sake, but it's good quality too. 

We stopped in after having been at another happy hour nearby where it was quiet and more expensive.  Buddy V's was like a happy hour explosion in comparison, complete with live music!  I had $4 wine, while Husband had $4 beer.  We shared two $5 plates of Mac & Cheese Carbonara and Sausage & Pepper Sliders.  Both were really really good!  Warning though, that is a HOT pepper slice on top of the sliders (looked like a slice of tomato to me).  Really good sausage.  The real star of the show was that Carbonara.  Brilliant to make a mac & cheese version of it.  It was rich and creamy and the peas added a nice pop of freshness. 

We would have ordered a lot more if we hadn't just come from another happy hour.  Next time, we'll head straight for this one, or come for a full meal, as we were impressed enough by the quality.  Our Server Gal did a great job, and we enjoyed the free entertainment of the Brothers so much that we tipped them well.

Perhaps I went during the wrong time. My husband and I visited, unbeknownst to me, during restaurant week. Perhaps they prepared their food ahead of time. All I have to say is that I was disturbed by my meatballs. I was flat out disappointed by my meatballs. Those were not good meatballs. 

I had spaghetti and meatballs. My first cause for concern was that our dishes came out insanely fast. Never a good sign in my book. I'm not at Burger King, I do no expect my food to arrive in less than five minutes. The meatballs were small and when I split one with my fork, it did not crumble like a freshly made meatball should.
