It was hard. And I bet you anything it had been frozen at one point. Sauce was incredibly bland. I was incredibly disappointed. 

Main cause for disappointment? This was not my first time here. I've had their meatballs before. They were heavenly, delicious, tasty and FRESH! 

Saving grace was their Italian Cake. That was pretty good. But as for the meal, all I can say is how corporate of them.

I had a surprisingly solid lunch here the other day. First of all, the view is a big selling point., overlooking the strip. They have lunch specials and they are relatively reasonable in price for a restaurant on the strip. 

I ordered the Italian hero with Caesar salad and my friend ordered the meatball appetizer. The sandwich was really good. Perfectly cooked bread, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The meat was flavorful and had a nice kick. The tomato tapenade added a nice spiciness as well. I tried some of my friend's meatballs and they were great. Moist and well-seasoned. Some of the better meatballs I've tried in town.  

We couldn't stop by without trying some dessert, so we gave in and ordered a tiramisu as well as a Nutella cake with salted caramel gelato. The tiramisu was enormous, large enough for four people to share. The Nutella cake was not overly chocolatey and wonderfully paired with the caramel gelato. I'm not typically a fan of Nutella or cake but this was the perfect combination. 

They are opening a Carlo's Bakery across from Buddy V's, which will be a great addition to accompany this restaurant.

Fried calamari appetizer was delicious. Chicken parmigiana was just ok, needed more seasoning, came with a side of spaghetti which was delicious, wish the portion was larger though. The lasagna was just ok to me, it has Italian sausage in it and I don't care for that. A bit pricey for what you get, but it is Vegas, so expect to pay. Outstanding service, on top of everything, very friendly, polite and polished. Would definitely return, but would definitely get the large bowl of spaghetti instead.

I guess I missed the part of the show where Buddy went to Vegas to start a restaurant??  I'm a huge fan who occasionally watches episodes of Cake Boss and dreams about going to Hoboken to taste his food.  So when I heard about Buddy V's Ristorante during this recent birthday trip, my heart skipped a beat and I told my husband we HAD TO go!

From the outside, the charming decor mimicked that of a quaint cafe nestled in the corner of somewhere in Italy (or so I'd think, since I've never been).  It drew me in!  I love how it felt homey yet upscale inside.  We had a reservation and were seated promptly.  Our food took a while to arrive but the taste more than made up for it!  I ordered Nonna's Lasagna.  Oh my!  It was as if I've never had lasagna before!  There were so many layers with meat and cheese that just melt on your tongue.  That good!  I wished my stomach were bigger just so I could have more of that lasagne.  It was a very generously portioned dish.  My husband ordered Mama's Style Chicken.  He loved his dish too!  

Oh and don't get me started on the dessert!  Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake was perfect for my birthday treat - chocolate cake drizzled in chocolate sauce with caramel ice cream.  Scrumptious, to say the least!  They decorated with "happy birthday" and our server sang to me in Italian.  It was the perfect ending to a perfect meal.

The customer service was amazing.  Our server was funny and accommodating.  We had our baby with us and enjoyed a memorable dinner out.  What more could you ask for in Vegas?!  Definitely one for the books!

My sister label this as a glorified Olive Garden and she was completely wrong. She doesn't appreciate authentic Italian food, carbs and all. Food was outstanding, we had chicken parm, spaghetti and the lasagna at our table and we all tried bite of each meal and all were very delicious and tasteful. Service was a little slow to getting our order and then getting the check but he was a great server none the less, very entertaining. I love the family atmosphere they had as well as the touches of family in the menus. We also had a bottle of the moscato which was amazing with our meals. Highly recommend this place for some good cabs before a night out on the strip!

We grabbed dessert at Carlo's, and realized that there were not very many tables to sit and enjoy dessert, so we headed over to the restaurant bar.
Our server was very nice. She was attentive, nice, and pleasant to speak too. Ordered a few drinks, chowed down on our Canoli and chocolate mousse cheesecake, eventually we ordered some food (mac and cheese, calamari, they are standard off any Italian menu, however they were delicious!). The ambiance of the bar was very nice, it was packed and had a live singer (with a VERY nice voice, Thanks to the Fabulous Baker Boys!) it was so romantic, and straight out of a movie- I was so in love (we were on an anniversary trip:).

Overall I thoroughly enjoyed it all, and look forward to visiting Buddy V's when we in town again! :)

What a dining experience. My wife and I ate there last night (not our first time) and from the time we were seated to the time we left everything we great. Generally I'm not one to sit too long. Eat and go is my style but our window seat over looking the Vegas strip, sunset and great food put us in no hurry.
Great evening 
Thank you

Found this place on Yelp. So we went with all the great reviews. There were 4 of us and we all enjoyed everything we ordered! HUGE portions....no room for dessert at the end :(  !!!!! Oh well, next time start with dessert and then go backwards!

The server was very kind person! The rest of the staff that we dealt with were very friendly! I would recommend this place highly. Remember...share a plate that way you can order dessert!!!

Impeccable service.

Great ambience!

Fantastic view of the strip.

BEST. FOOD. EVER. 

EVER!

If I could, I would eat the chicken parm here every night for the rest of my life.

Was really skeptical when my husband told me we were meeting friends here for dinner. So many times famous television chefs have a restaurant and it is not very good...this was not the case with Buddy's!
The service was exceptional. She recommended three different meals: Chicken Parm, Lasagna, and Chicken Rigatoni. We had the Chicken Parm, the Chicken Rigatoni, and I went for the Chicken Marsala, as it is one of my favorites. Each meal was delicious! There was not a speck left on our plates! 
I will definitely return AND recommend it to all,

Brunch Boss

Parking:

Located at the Grand Canal Shoppe closer to the Palazzo side so it is nice stroll from the Venetian Parking structure. Where parking can sometimes be a pain but usually plentiful.

Establishment:

Service was okay it was a tad bit slow but not annoyingly so. *3 stars*

Food (Brunch):

To begin there is an all you can drink for about $15 which is probably worth it if you plan on having more than 1 drink. Bringing your total to about $50 a person. 

The concept of quality over quantity definitely applies here there is probably about 10 dishes of breakfast items and some Italian dishes some of their Italian dishes were just okay though but nothing I regretted trying.

What shines here though is their dessert. They have a glorious display of desserts that will be sure to satisfy your sweet tooth. *4 stars*

Overall:

First brunch in Vegas so nothing to compare to but for the price I thought it was very enjoyable especially after 3 sangrias.
